name: Windborne
description:
Windborne is a connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons (board).

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, if there are less than three pawns on the board, place a disk of your color on an empty cell and a neutral pawn on an empty cell or onto a friendly disk that does not yet have a pawn on it. Otherwise, follow these steps:


Move a pawn zero or more times onto adjacent cells in the same direction. Each of those cells must be empty or occupied by a friendly disk only. (You cannot move onto cells occupied by pawns or enemy disks, but an enemy disk on the pawn's starting cell does not impede its movement.)
Place a disk of your color on a cell that does not yet contain a disk. If the cell contains a pawn, place your disk under it.


You win if, at the start of your turn, there is a group of interconnected disks of your color such that any path that connects more than half of the pawns (i.e. at least two) visits that group. A path need not be a straight line, and may go through any cells regardless of their contents. You lose if, at the start of your turn, your opponent has such a group and you cannot place a disk.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.



NotesAs an alternative, a different number of pawns can be used. A small odd number of pawns is recommended. Even numbers may result in connection races. The optimal number might be directly proportional to the size of the board.

Windborne is Omny with moving targets. In Windborne, a player with a massive group running through the center may still lose if, for example, two pawns end up trapped on top of adjacent enemy stones away from the center. This is less likely in Omny. Note that pawns are most easily trapped in the corners of the board.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Thunderbolt
description:
Prior to his passing, Richard H. Berg was hard at work completing the third volume in his The Ancient World series, Thunderbolt, covering the titanic 2nd Punic War between Rome and Carthage. Mark Herman has teamed up with series developer Alan Ray to finish the game.
Thunderbolt brings The Ancient World system to the mammoth 2nd Punic War. The game covers the action in the Western Mediterranean on updated Italy and Africa maps published in the prior two volumes, plus a connecting full-size map of Spain and western Mauretania, the last map design of Richard’s long and illustrious career.
The Ancient World system uses a chit pull mechanic to drive the action with the better leaders having more opportunities to act. There are no movement allowances; instead attrition and the ability of a leader to continue to conduct operations govern how forces can move. Battles are straightforward, resolved with a couple of die rolls and an extensive list of modifiers to account for cavalry superiority, elite status, and leadership, as well as numbers of troops. The Battle Results Table features an “Unpredictable Result” which can turn the tables on the best laid battle plan. All the trappings around the decisive moment are there as well: Interception, Avoidance, Coordination, Retreat, Pursuit & Butchery, and after battle effects. Sieges are covered in detail, including rules for attrition, assaults, repair and reduction, treachery, and surrender. And what would a Richard Berg game be without random events—Auguries in this system.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Веселі мурахи (Fun Ants)
description:
Ants are one of the most amazing insects on the planet! This is evidenced not only by the ability to lift 50 times its body weight or the presence of the largest brain among other insects, but also by a high level of social communication and self-organization. Thanks to this, insects build anthills of extraordinary complexity, strengthen their power over territories and ecosystems, and during wars with other colonies use sophisticated military tricks that real generals would appreciate.

Players are invited to plunge into the interesting world of ant life and take over the management of an ant colony - build an anthill, organize the collection and extraction of resources, provide an army to protect and spread their influence. Victory will be achieved by striking a balance between the economy and the military, cunning, good tactics and unexpected decisions.

A distinctive feature of the game is the maximum of communication and interaction, dynamism and speed of the games. Each new turn the player gets new opportunities and can play a unique combination of moves and cards that radically affect the course of the entire game.

The goal of the game is victory! The game offers 4 different scenarios. Depending on the choice, players have to fulfill the appropriate conditions for victory: building all levels of the anthill faster than others, capturing the enemy's colony or destroying his anthill.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Environmental, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Mojave Companions: ED-E, Rex & Veronica
description:
ED-E was battle damaged, but a few repairs make it fighting fit and ready for action once more (albeit with new priorities).

Rex is a cyberhound with a past in law enforcement and Caesar’s Legion. He is still a powerful fighter and firm friend.

Journeyman Scribe Veronica comes from an offshoot of the Brotherhood of Steel. Equipped with a custom power fist, she is a strong ally for those who can earn her trust.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Zauberhafte Würfelorte
description:
Zauberhafte Würfelorte is a wooden family game for 2-5 players, ages 8+, made in the Urdonautal in the heart of Bavaria. In a magic contest, you have to roll the dice for the ingredients for all the required potions. Whoever brews the best potions will win the game.

The player whose turn it is takes the 5 colored dice and rolls them up to four times. He may put any dice aside to brew a potion with as many ingredients as possible of one color or a given combination. An extra die, extra rolls or the restart of the turn can be conjured up with spellpower. Spellpower is gained when it takes less than 4 throws to brew a potion. The fewer throws you need, the more spellpower you get. You can also get spellpower in any player's turn if the player rolls at least 3 of the same ingredients in his roll and you are the first to notice this.

Once a player has brewed each of the required potions, the game is over. For each potion that is not brewed, the player gets minus points. The more ingredients a player has used to brew his own potions, the more points he gets.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Peace 1905
description:
By August 1905 the Russo-Japanese War had been raging for 18 months, with over a million soldiers, sailors, and engineers in arms, it had cost the lives of between 100,000 to 200,000 participants and brought death and destruction to civilians. The war had seen the sinking of the Russian Pacific and Baltic fleets, and the great sieges at Port Arthur and Mukden. The world was shaken by the emphatic rise of Imperial Japan as a land and naval power. Russia had been blooded and humiliated.

But Russia was not yet done. Although both sides were financially exhausted it was Russia who continued to funnel troops into the war, while Japan’s manpower reserves were depleted. The war might yet continue, with further loss of life and property, and protracted instability in the Far East. With this would come the risk of further Russian humiliation. Both sides needed a way out. The door to that way out was opened by US President Theodore Roosevelt when he invited delegations of both sides to Portsmouth, New Hampshire - to a peace conference through August 1905. But with the sides so far apart on numerous key issues - the Russian Czar had stipulated no territorial concessions or reparation payments, and the Japanese Emperor wanted exactly those things and much more - what real hope was there that both sides could find a mutually satisfactory resolution?

In history, the answer is found in the Treaty of Portsmouth, a complex and significant diplomatic achievement, for which, for his part in facilitating and assisting, President Roosevelt was the first American to receive the Nobel Peace Prize. In Peace 1905, you - the players - will have Roosevelt’s assistance, but the work of successfully negotiating is down to you. Will you end the war, and bring a peace your governments approve of, or will the conference end in failure, and the war ignite again?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Duke: Lost Forces
description:
A pack of 23 tiles (10 pairs and three solos) from all previous promotional offers or former iterations of our premier Profile System game, The Duke.

Specter (single tile)
Dragon (single tile)
Mountain (single tile)
Lancer
Swashbuckler
Jester
Flag
Dragoon
Assassin
Longbowman
Shield Maiden [not shown]
Duchess
Oracle
Blank (+ sticker sheet)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Volfyirion Guilds: Shattered Times Box
description:
This expansion was part of the Volfyirion Guilds Kickstarter and contains:

12 Command Cards
6 Building Cards
6 Troop Cards
3 Wonder Cards
3 Agent Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Cities of the Damned: Aachen and Cassino
description:
No two conflicts show the breath and scope of urban warfare the Western Allies ran up against in 1944 than the battles for Aachen and Cassino. Both campaigns tell a very similar story about the high price of hubris and the quality of courage. Cities of the Damned (published in ATO #60 magazine) features two challenging solitaire games in which the player must lead his Allied forces to victory in two of the WWII’s most intense battles.

Cassino by Paul Rohrbaugh: In early 1944 the western half of the German “Winter Line” in Italy was anchored by the town of Cassino high up on Monte Cassino, which also featured a centuries old Benedictine Abbey atop the peak. The position utterly dominated the surrounding valleys, so much so Allied troops HAD to take it to continue advancing on Rome.

Facing some of Germany’s best soldiers, the area was only captured 5 months later after four separate assaults, with the vast majority of the city was destroyed by aerial bombardment and vicious street to street fighting. Taking the town and heights resulted in 55,000 Allied casualties, with German losses being far fewer, estimated at around 20,000 killed and wounded. The stubborn defense of Cassino would reveal flaws in Allied tactics and bolster the confidence of the Third Reich to keep fighting.

Aachen by Mike Rinella: Five months later the world would see yet another account of the terrible cost of audacity. Fresh from a string of victories across the length of France, the US Command set its sights capture of the supposedly weakly held German city of Aachen. The Americans confidently made plans to surround the city, isolate it, and accept its surrender.

But being the former capital of the First Reich, and the first true German city to fall into Allied hands, the city’s propaganda value was simply too great: Hitler forbade surrender. He even grudgingly authorized releasing forces from his Ardennes Offensive build up to help the defenders. American troops would have to storm the city and take it by force. Hidden among the picturesque buildings was a fortress of bunkers, gun emplacements, sniper holes and death traps. The GIs advancing into the city would soon be fighting in the nightmare battlefield of Aachen.

The Aachen game uses the popular solitaire system designed by Mike Rinella for the game "Stalingrad: Advance on the Volga, 1942" (Take Aim Designs / Revolution Games).

Contents
Against the Odds (ATO) magazine #60;
Maps - Two full color 17" x 22" mapsheets;
Counters - 176 large 5/8" die-cut pieces;
Rules length - 14 pages;
Charts and tables - 2 pages.
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Zombie Flip
description: In Zombie Flip we are going to control a zombie that will move through a city in search of humans to taste brains. The goal is to get human cards by moving the Zombie to score points at the end of the game.
mechanics: Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Vagrantsong: Encore
description:
Encore is the expansion to the spooky boss-battling campaign game, Vagrantsong, that will take players to new heights, new lows, and everywhere In Between.


Going ‘round the second time with Vagrantsong: Encore, you’ll find:



* A fourth door to open that leads to a new Chapter with 5 new Scenarios called Bridge of Leaves.
* 6 Save Your Soul Scenarios to bring your friends back from having one foot in the grave.
* Short Trip Mode, which gives players the opportunity to explore the Silver Ferryman in Chapter-sized chunks.
* New In Between cards, Skills, and Junk.
* Smoky Bones, special dice that players earn and find to help turn their bad luck around.
* And enough twists and turns to make your head spin.




It’s time to hop aboard the Silver Ferryman one more time with Vagrantsong: Encore.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Trains
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Coverage, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Set-up

name: Vagrantsong: Off the Rails
description:
Vagrantsong: Off the Rails offers players the opportunity to revisit Scenarios from the core game and its expansion, Encore, with new and exciting challenges along the way.
Included in Off the Rails:

A new game mode that increases the difficulty and replayability of over 40 Scenarios.
New Objectives tailored for each Vagrant called Devious Deeds that provide more character customization as Rewards.
Smoky Bones, special dice that players earn and find to help turn their bad luck around.
And a few spooky surprises along the way.


Vagrantsong: Off the Rails requires the core game of Vagrantsong to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Trains
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Set-up

name: Le Clan des Souris
description:
Your aunt, the Tooth Fairy Mouse, has a lot of work to do.
She has entrusted you, her 5 nieces and nephews, with the important mission of collecting the teeth of the child animals in the babeetoof forest.
This is a wonderful forest, and its inhabitants are adorable.
Tonight, you're the heroes! But beware: a handful of villains lurk in the forest: the witch, always on the lookout for a nasty trick, the giant, looking for children to nibble on, or the dragon, who fortunately spends most of his time sleeping.
You'll need to stick together to make your way through the babeetoof forest and find all the teeth your aunt has reserved for you before the sun rises.
And if you happen to come across a villain, find the courage within you to take him on and bring back his trophy!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Memory

name: Who's the Biggest Smarty Pants?
description:
Who's the biggest smarty pants? Try out 200 challenges including number-crunchers, brainteasers, catchphrase conundrums, and word puzzles. Take turns answering a range of brain-busting questions and see who will be victorious in their quest to be crowned the ultimate smarty pants!

—description from the publisher (paraphrased)
categories: Number, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: Precision Archer
description:
Play archery competitions with just a few rolls.
Each Athlete card has a rating for each arrow shot (and the points it hits on the target), from 6 to 10 or missed.

Pair the athletes, and have them challenge on the distance of 3 arrows and whoever gets the highest score wins, and qualifies for the next round.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Heroes of Stalingrad: War Stories #02 – Aleksei Naumov
description:
January 1943, supplies for the encircled German 6th Army were flown to the Pitomnik airfield.

To close this channel, Rokossovsky ordered the 91st Tank Brigade to seize the airfield. The 344th Tank Battalion was sent against the Bezymyannogo Hill and the Novaya Nadezhda Farm, both located on the outskirts of the airfield near Stalingrad. During five hours of intense fighting on January 21, 1943, Naumov and his crew destroyed 5 tanks, 24 armored vehicles, 19 artillery pieces and mortars, 15 machine gun nests, 5 bunkers, and took out up to a hundred German soldiers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Caribbean Cruise Dominoes
description:
Enjoy hours of sun-drenched fun at sea without ever leaving home when you play this Caribbean Cruise Domino Game. A traditional domino set with a twist, the game comes with a set of double-six dominos, special 3D electronic-hub calculator, score pad and instructions.

Passengers on this cruise try to be the first player to get or break 100 points, keeping track of their scores with the unique Life Preserver Hub calculator. Anytime a passenger plays a domino to make the point total a multiple of five, the Life Preserver Hub automatically plays the tropical Caribbean Cruise song and the player score all of the points displayed. The 3-D Life Preserver Hub calculator shows the current point total at all times.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Marvel United: Mister Sinister Promo Deck
description: Deck of 12 cards to play with Mister Sinister as a hero! This was given out as a free promotional item during Gen Con 2023.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: The Carabas
description:
This unique, fast-moving board game captures the excitement and danger of the Carabas, the jewel-studded hunting ground from Jack Vance’s classic sci-fi novel The Dirdir. Up to five players control crews of desperate humans, striving to uncover precious gems and return with them to safety. Meanwhile, the vicious alien Dirdir stalk the landscape, hunting the humans tooth and claw. The more ground a crew covers, the more they attract deadly alien attention.

Move your crews across the colorful map, draw Sequin gems from the cloth bag, and roll special three-sided dice to find out how close the hunters come to you -- or perhaps you can lure them to attack a rival crew along the way.

Beware the Excellences, keenest hunters of all, and the eventual wave of aircars that will shut the whole terrain down! Two to five people can compete in about 15 minutes per player. Whoever escapes alive with the most valuable haul of Sequins wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck

name: Pillage: Skirmish Rules for the Dark Age
description:
Pillage is a game written to be played in a relaxed setting, with friends, over drinks and other treats.
These rules were written to meet a need specific to the JHP (Jeux d'Histoire du Ponant) club, for which we had a project to play the Viking period but where no rules seemed to fit.
They were therefore written for this purpose.

You should know that these are simple rules, in order to be able to quickly play skirmish games on a period going from late antiquity to the Middle Ages, let's say, to be more precise, from 793 (looting of Lindisfarne Abbey) to 1066 (battle of Hastings).

The period is vast, of course, but the relative similarity of the methods used to fight has made it possible to establish here common rules for all warriors of this period.
As you will discover when you read the rules, they are essentially based on the characters' equipment.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Snacks
description:
Snacks is a brain speed game.

Throw the chips, find those snacks in the vending machine and indicate the card and row where they are. If correct, take a snack figure. Whoever gets the most snacks wins!

Includes 2 game modes!
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Game of Drone: Expansion
description:
The expansion pack of Game of Drone can be played as a stand-alone game.

Game Overview: The expansion pack for "Game of Drone" brings a shift from the cooperative gameplay of the base game to a competitive one. This expansion is provided as a PnP, with the base game available for free, while the expansion is offered to Patreon paid subscribers.

In this expansion, two new competitive modes are introduced: Open Field Mode and Hidden Field Mode. In Open Field Mode, players compete by placing cards and moving all players' drones. In Hidden Field Mode, players compete by hiding their movement coordinates and aiming for the highest score.

Through this expansion, Game of Drone offers players new strategic challenges and diverse play styles. Now, players can enjoy a new experience of competing with each other to move the drone to its destination.

The rulebook is available here, but the pages for printing are provided for a fee to Patreon subscribers. Below is the download link for the rulebook.

English RuleBook : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rSJRJTEYP2g_4-Lwiqqn5o6vE24...
Korean RuleBook : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DV3jMkLfivPKUFFq6ia1CSy0HZp...

And here is the link to the Patreon subscribers-only page.

https://www.patreon.com/posts/23-july-game-of-86945903?utm_m...;utm_source=copyLink&utm_campaign=postshare_creator&utm_content=join_link

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Escape From the Arcade
description:
A cooperative game for three or more players. One person acts as the "Game Master", who sets up the puzzles but does not participate in solving them. The object of the game is to solve a set of four puzzles, each of which reveals to the players one of the symbols needed to unlock the combination lock. The players have only one hour to find the solution.

The combination lock has four rotating wheels, each with four different symbols. Before the game starts, the Game Master sets the combination to open the padlock, and chooses the puzzle for each wheel to give the correct answer. Once the game starts, the Game Master has the option of giving the players clues if they are struggling with the puzzles.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Targeted Clues, Variable Set-up

name: Spy Code: Ultimate Operation – Escape Room
description:
Bring the excitement of the Escape Room Challenges into your home with Spy Code Ultimate Operation Escape Room. This interactive family game tests your spy skills by challenging your team to work together to solve 7 exciting tasks in order to set the captured player free from the Timer Strap before time runs out! The game challenges your skill, strategy, luck, dexterity, deduction, and knowledge in various levels of difficulty over and over again.

Spy Code Ultimate Operation Escape Room features seven challenges to test your skill, knowledge, and strategy--Challenge 1: Break Free from the Handcuffs Challenge; 2: Fiddle the Key Out of the Cage Challenge; 3: Solve the 3 Puzzles to Get the Key Challenge; 4: Balance the Ping Pong Ball Challenge; 5: Guide the Marble Through the Maze Challenge; 6: Create the Path for the Marble Challenge; and 7: Find the Key Challenge.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Real-Time

name: Chickadoo
description:
Play this fun game with the whole family and help kids develop their planning and thinking skills. Lay down the correct cards based on the natural order and remember to use your action cards. The first player to discard their cards three times wins The Golden Egg and the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Advance games by FoxMind Group, FoxMind, FoxMind Israel

name: Overboss Duel: Gen. Khan Promo Card
description:
Promo boss card "Gen. Khan" handed out with purchase of Overboss Duel at GenCon 2023.

This Boss card allows the player to "Switch the locations of up to 2 tokens on your side of the board with the same amount of tokens on your opponent's side." upon reveal.

Additionally, it provides the player with the scoring objective of "For whichever token type you have the most of on your side of the board, gain +1 point for each token. (Heroes count as a token type).".
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cobweb
description: Make an unbroken group of your own pieces linking opposite edges of your color. You can capture opponent pieces by moving your own discs onto stacks of exactly the same height.
mechanics: Connections

name: Reneo
description:
Reneo is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.

A crosscut is a 2×2 area containing two diagonally adjacent black stones and two diagonally adjacent white stones.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty point. If this stone is part of a crosscut, swap it with an enemy stone that is part of the same crosscut. As a result, the swapped friendly stone must not be part of a crosscut any more. If the swapped enemy stone is still part of a crosscut, remove that stone.

Passing is not allowed, but, if you have no legal moves available, your turn is skipped.

You win if, after a full move by either player, there is a chain of orthogonally connected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

Reneo bears a significant resemblance to Alek Erickson's Resolve.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: PK
description:
Can you stay calm and focused? Can you handle the pressure?

In a penalty shootout, one mistake is all that stands between victory and defeat.

Who will raise the Champions Cup?

PK is a fast, exciting two player microgame that brings the high tension, excitement and drama of a penalty shootout off the pitch and onto your table.

Each player makes their move at the same time, but will the crowds cheer wildly in jubilation? Or will the valiant goalkeeper crush the dreams of their foe.

PK is a simultaneous action selection card game in which players have ten cards, each with a direction to choose from in order to attempt to either score a goal or stop their opponent.

If the cards played are different then the shooter has scored, if they are the same then the goalkeeper has saved the day. Either way the successful player takes their opponent's card to add to their own hand of options for the next shot.

The player with the most goals after 5 shots each, wins!

Quick, fun and small, PK is a perfect game to play on the move or as a little treat between bigger games.

It's the drama and dreams of champions that fits in your pocket.

GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOAAAAAAAALLLLLLLLLL!!!!!!!!!!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: A game about deciding which cards to use before the game, technically known as 'deck construction', designed basically just for one event.
description:
A deck construction game, with slightly different rules to let you play a game before deciding which cards to take out.

Originally, 100 copies were printed for Bez's emigration party. Most were given away, and the remainder sold out 2 weeks later at Tabletop Scotland 2023.

Cards are mostly multipurpose and can either be used for a spell, or be tucked under your contraptions/creatures to expand them.

Contraptions mainly help you gather resources. Creatures attack castles.

Destroy your opponent's castles to win.

If there is enough demand, there might be a 2nd edition (and so forth).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Lose a Turn

name: A game about making wordy connections.
description:
Players walk around, chanting words from cards. You may not say any other words, but are allowed to show cards, or make simple gestures and of course you can add intonation/pauses.

When you find other players that have words that might combine together, you have made a connection! This connection might be fleeting: you might walk away from each other and break the connection, deciding to find another - better - word. Eventually, you will find other players whose words combine well with yours. By changing the timing of when you say your word, make a phrase/sentence and then give each other a thumbs up and lay the cards on a table to create the next line of the poem.

Once the cards run out, the game is over.

If you want to score, you can give yourselves pts for how many other people you made a connection with in each line, with a x5 bonus if you make anyone laugh or anyone declares that line their favourite.

One deck works for 10-20ish players. Combine decks for more players.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Music, Negotiation, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Player Judge, Real-Time, Singing

name: Mixto con Huevo
description: Mixto Con Huevo is a game of visual speed in which players will have to be the quickest to identify patterns (types of sandwiches) in the centre of the table to win the game. The one who gets all the cards is the winner.
mechanics: Memory

name: Tampoco somos tan amigos
description:
How many times have you felt like dueling with the "friend" who is giving you a hard time in the game? This game opens the door to the most fun and epic battles at your get-togethers.
But, above all, don't arrive late to the explanation and with the table ready, this kind of attitude can cost you dearly... after all, We're Not That Friendly Either.

Get as many tokens as you can, both by getting them and by stealing them. Don't be merciful, the other players will do whatever it takes to get them too, as you will need them to win the game. Be very careful! As soon as you get a tile from another player, you can feel the greed taking hold of you. Will you prove that the end does not justify the means to get them?
mechanics: Take That

name: Nautilus Island: Power Card Promos
description:
Includes: 4 cards and 1 rule card


On your turn, you can move your marker to the same column you occupied on your previous turn.
On your turn, before you move your marker, you can look at the top card of one facedown stack.
If you pick up a Bonus token, you may swap it with a random facedown token from the stack.
On your turn, if you place only one Object card, you can add one more card of the same color to your set.


After setup, deal a random card to each player who places it face up in front of them. The number on each card determines the turn order, with the lowest being the first player, but only for the first round. These powers remain active throughout the whole game.

A copy of Nautilus Island is required to play with these promos.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeons
description:
Here comes Dungeons - the Old School Fantasy Solitaire Game!

Choose your hero, descend into the depths of the earth and face the dangers of the Known World. Dungeons is the Fantasy Old School solitaire game where you are the hero!

You don't need to have a group or a Master to play Dungeons. You will only need a die, a pencil and your hero sheet to venture into the first 6 quests contained in the Dungeons core manual.

Dungeons is learned in no time and you'll be ready to play in no time. The manual is accompanied by the rulebook, the bestiary, magic, treasures, advancements for your hero and much more.

Dungeons comes complete with downloadable atmospheric soundtracks that will make your solitary sessions unique.

Are you ready for the challenge?
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cookie Champion
description:
The best master bakers in the country and their assistants have come together to determine the winner of a world-renowned cookie-baking competition. Who will convince the panel of experts and win over the spectators with their confectionery creations in order to be proclaimed "Cookie Champion"?

Cookie Champion is a medium-weight strategy game of clever card management and area control in which you choose your recipes, gather your ingredients and goods, decide whether to provide decorations, then sell your cookies for much needed cash — or deliver them to the presentation tables for the judges to score. You can also hire staff to help you out or fire them for extra money. Present the best cookies, impress the judges, and bake your way into becoming the champion.

The game accommodates up to five players, while including a challenging solo mode.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Bonbon Party
description:
Grab what tastes good!
It's all happening at the candy party! The funny HABA game requires quick reactions and careful observation. So, be careful and snap up the candy search! Whoever collects the most candy tiles wins the colorful memo game. In a compact gift format, the candy party from HABA is ideal as a souvenir.


HABA invites you to a candy party
fast snapping game from 5 years
with a great wooden toothbrush
entertaining memo fun: everyone plays at the same time
robust game material for 2 to 4 players


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Real-Time

name: Missing in Action
description:
Missing in Action is a solo game that takes place during the Vietnam war.

Shot down behind enemy lines and bleeding bad, the Viet Cong left you for dead. Now, you must cross the vast jungle to return to your base for any hope of survival.

Missing in Action (M.I.A.) uses the revolutionary Gear Card System. The Gear Cards revolving gear controls all the player’s actions. Each gear has Movement, Sneaking, and Attack actions.

You must navigate through the jungles of Vietnam sneaking past Viet Cong troops and the North Vietnamese Army. With limited health, stamina, and ammo, you only have a narrow amount of time, before bleeding out.

Time is of the essence, if you wish to survive.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Florista
description: Players are florists trying to make the most beautiful flower bouquet via rolling and drawing different types of flowers in different colors. 'Florista' can be played solo or with your friends. It has easy rules but deeper scoring.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Sous Scellés: Le Gardien des Caves
description:
In a small town in the center of France, we find in the cellars the lifeless body of Jean-Louis Safarian, the caretaker of the building, which has six inhabitants.

Who could have committed this crime, why, and how?

Le Gardien des Caves ("The Keeper of the Cellars") is an escape room board game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: One Roll: Chronicles
description:
One Roll Chronicles adds a layer of storytelling prompts to the One Roll Quest core rules, making it easier for everyone to keep the action moving toward an epic conclusion. For roleplayers of all levels of experience, One Roll Quest and One Roll Chronicles keep you entertained as you wait for those (traditionally) slow stragglers to arrive for game night.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling

name: Trial by Battle
description:
Trial by Battle is a set of wargames rules for playing games set in the Medieval period of history. They are designed to be easy to learn and to play and are ideal for a quick game. They are ideal for players who are not very familiar with wargames rules or who don’t have hours to play with. Sometimes this type of ruleset is called a “beer and pretzels” game. Neither beer nor pretzels are required to play, but a game is always more enjoyable with good refreshments.

The rules aim to be representative of how medieval armies fought but aren’t an exact simulation. They don’t provide for all the different variations in types of soldiers and armies during the Medieval period. For instance, there is an Archers unit that can represent crossbowmen or longbowmen. The rules provide the framework for an enjoyable Medieval wargame that captures the feel of battles in the Middle Ages.

The rules include six scenarios and some sample army lists to help you get started.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Insider Trader
description:
The object of the Insider Trader is to manipulate the stock market by acquiring, selling and stealing information in order to position yourself in the right place at the right time to outsmart your competitors. The players travel around the outside of the board forcing stock prices to go up or down. In addition to this, players can buy inside information, which they can use to gain an advantage over the other players. The way in which each player controls their movement on the board, will ultimately see them prosper, bankrupting their opponent or face huge, personal financial losses.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Stock Holding

name: A las Chapas: VOL 002
description:
Sequel of A las Chapas, with new cards and categories.


In this game, a card with license plates (3 letters) is drawn, as well as card with a category (movies, people, etc.). Quickly, players must create sentences using these letters and the given category.

The player who creates a valid sentence faster earns a point, and after a given number of rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

Some variants are included.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Storytelling
publishers: El Dragón Azul, Super Noob Games

name: Dirty Dinos
description:
Fill your tub with squeaky clean dinosaurs in this fun colour, counting and observation game with three ways to play!

Spread the cards in the middle of the table, spin the spinner and race to find a dirty dino that matches by colour and type. Once everyone has a tub full of clean dinos, count the number of bubbles... the player with the most wins the game!
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Matching

name: Tribulation
description:
Tribulation is a scenario-driven cooperative tactical card game with a dark, biblically-inspired fantasy setting for 1-2 players. You play as an agent of the Lord holding the forces of evil at bay at the end of the world to give humanity one last chance.

In Tribulation you succeed if you vanquish the forces of evil before they defeat you and your teammate. In a solo game, you control two agents of the Lord. If both are destroyed before you can vanquish your foes, you lose. The primary mechanism of Tribulation is tactical combat via card play and action management. You move your character through 3 zones, play cards from your hand to resolve actions, and rest to regain action points, cards and health at strategic intervals. Tribulation can be played as a one-off battle game or a progressive campaign-style game with an advancing narrative and character progression between battles.

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Little Ghost
description:
"A lonely Little Ghost appears before us, looking for a friend. Who will it be?"

Bluffing card game where players take turns to play one or more cards face-up or face-down to a central discard pile. Face-down cards may be bluffs; face-up cards affect which cards can be played onto them. A challenge, a 10 or a sequence of passes clears the pile and takes the action into a new suit.

First player to empty their hand wins.

Deck of 51 cards; 1-10 in five suits, and a first-player marker.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battlecrest: Griyan – Hero Set
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Components:

Griyan Hero set
Griyan AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlecrest: Mub Zane – Hero Set
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Components:

Mub Zane Hero set
Mub Zane AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

'Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingscraft: Zwergenkönig Borik / Borik der Große Promo Card
description:
Double-sided promo card, included with Zwergendorf.

Front: "Zwergenkönig Borik"
Power: 12, 3×D6
Speed: - (The special ability cannot be ignored using speed.)
Special Ability: "Beer Enjoyment" - Before a battle against "Borik", the active player rolls 1×D6. According to the result of that roll, a different ban is enforced (1 = shoe slot, 2 = armor slot, ..., 6 = upgraded items).

Back: "Borik der Große"
Power: 15, 4×D6
Speed: - (The special ability cannot be ignored using speed.)
Special Ability: "Beer Enjoyment" - Before a battle against "Borik", the active player rolls 1×D6. According to the result of that roll, a different ban is enforced (1 = shoe slot, 2 = armor slot, ..., 6 = upgraded items).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: T-Rex Rumble
description:
T-Rex Rumble is the dinosaur-themed dexterity challenge. To play, a player rolls the die and draws one of the 100 challenge cards in four hilarious categories: Prehistoric Pickup, Dino Drawings, Jurassic Charades, and Tiny Arm Challenges. Then, they strap on the tiny T-Rex arms and use the claws to complete the challenge on the card – no hands allowed. The first team to use their T-Rex arms to secure ten challenge cards avoids extinction and wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Drawing, Real-Time, Stacking and Balancing

name: Murder at Mediluck Medicines
description:
MediLuck Medicines were in the process of developing a new sleeping pill when their formula was leaked online. Nell Phryp, a Private Investigator, had been hired to find the leaker so that they could be brought to justice, but in the course of her investigations, Nell was brutally murdered inside Lab 7G-12.

The evidence that Nell gathered before her death has been sent over to the Police for further analysis, along with new evidence that has come to light during initial Police investigations.

The evidence has been collected for you, it’s your job to piece it all together and work out who it was that killed the victim.

Eliminate as many of the suspects as possible, so that we can find the killer (or killers) and bring them to justice.

33 PIECES OF PHYSICAL EVIDENCE - Inside the case file, you'll find police reports, blueprints, CCTV images, text records, a coroners report, witness statements and more
.SEARCH THROUGH A POLICE INBOX - In addition to the physical evidence supplied inside of the case files, you'll need to access a police officer's inbox online to prove the prime suspect innocent or guilty - but it's not easy...you'll need to be a smart investigator to gain access to the online portal!

A GREAT NIGHT IN - With approximately 3 hours of game play (depending on your skill level) and a difficulty rating of 4.5/5 this "whodunnit" style thriller will provide a fun night in for all who choose to participate. If you can't crack the case without a secret clue, hints and answers are available online.
mechanics: Deduction

name: The INWO Book: Rules, Variants, and more
description:
A complete guide to Illuminati: New World Order (INWO).

Included are:

The World Domination Handbook V1.1, the complete updated rulebook.
Every Card Described: All 412 cards from the Limited Edition with the complete text and in full color.
Illuminated Strategy: Deck-building hints, tips, and twists for every Illuminati group.
Variant and Optional Rules: New ways to take over the world including the "One With Everything" rules for playing with one big set of cards and the notorious Cheating Rules.
Designer Schemes
Stupid INWO tricks and more.


152 pages
categories: Book, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Deck Construction, Variable Player Powers

name: Fly Fight Win: MiG Alley
description:
Fly Fight Win: MiG Alley is a hex-based, miniatures rules set for aerial combat. It emphasizes the importance of speed, altitude, and pilot skill, and minimizes much of the tedium typically associated with air-to-air combat games. It includes statistics for many frontline fighters that saw action during the Korean War and a pilot advancement system for campaign games.

MiG Alley is a standalone rules set. The unique period of early jet fighters and reliance on guns over missiles sets this title apart from other games in the Fly Fight Win series. This series is designed for playability but retains sufficient detail to recreate historical outcomes (with a nod towards the physics of flight). Most scenarios can be played in under 60 minutes.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tawan Cards
description:
Tawan Cards is a Peruvian card game The goal?
Conquer Tawantinsuyu (the Inca Empire) and become the new Inca!
Your soldiers are the Power Cards, aided by Special Cards such as the Apuskipaq and Chakra Runa which have different abilities and powers that will help you to advance and win in the game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: King Duffer
description: The object of the game is to play all 18 championship holes, in the least amount of strokes (shots) as possible. The layer with the lowest stroke total at the end of the 18 holes is declared the winner. On each hole your ball starts from the tee and is shot down the fairway until you put it on the green. Once on the green you begin to putt, to put the ball in the hole.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Groundhopper
description:
Plan your tours to the most emotional places in the world.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach 100 points and win the game. In order to collect points, you will move around the world and perform specific actions. Cards will allow you to move over land taking a bus, car or train. Flight tickets let you travel faster using connected airports. Reaching a required secret or public destination earns you points and lets you leave your flag there. Every time another player is reaching or crossing a destination with your flag on it, this will earn you additional points. Now isn’t that nice? Being the first to visit a desired spot is not the only option to score points: For each continent traveled you will get your passport stamped. A passport page full with stamps gets you extra points. And don’t forget to pass by the Betting Office every now and then: Try your luck and place bets on the outcome of a match, the number of goals, or even the exact final score. Correct bets also get you extra points. But beware: Sudden events might throw off your plans and force you to reschedule your route.

So, plan your trip wisely, collect tickets and points, and be the first Groundhopper to reach 100 points and win this exciting journey around the world!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Meowchelin Stars:  A Game of Cat Chefs & Cuisine
description:
Welcome to Meowchelin Stars, where strategy meets whimsy in a tabletop card game. You will be competing and negotiating with your friends to hire mischievous Meow Chefs and create mouth-watering menus with Delicious Cuisine sets!

As you play the game, 9 Meow Chefs will join your team - use their special abilities to seize Victory in a game with your friends.

Play Coupon cards that feature a double-function for an action or money, as you create your menu cuisine.

Your goal is to collect as many 'Meowchelin Stars' as you can to be the winner at the end of the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Negotiation, Set Collection

name: The Season: Love and Drama in the Regency Era – The Jane Austen Expansion
description:
The Jane Austen Expansion brings the writer's popular heroines and suitors to The Season. Play as the witty Elizabeth Bennet or the beautiful and charming Emma Woodhouse!

As a blooming debutante in the London season, your primary goal is to have the highest reputation points by enhancing your accomplishments, improving your reputation among the social elite, and, most importantly, encouraging proposals and getting married.

You may enhance your accomplishments directly through actions or with choices you make during special events. At the end of the game, each accomplishment point you have translates to one reputation point. Your reputation is improved by socializing and wearing the right outfits at various balls. Debutantes who wear matching dresses and accessories, especially those that match the balls’ themes, receive higher reputation points. You may encourage a suitor to propose by raising a suitor’s affection level to 10 and ensuring you are eligible for that suitor’s dowry and accomplishment requirements.

The lady with the highest amount of reputation points at the end of the game will be the winner of this exciting London season!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Role Playing

name: Shelfie Stacker: Rad Reviewers Promo Pack
description:
The ability on this card is pretty powerful as it allows 2’s to be turned to 6’s. 6-valued dice in the game are wild, allowing you to turn them to any face that you please!

—description from the publisher

Originally made available through the KS campaign for Dreadful Meadows
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Armored Knights: Guderian Crosses the Meuse
description:
The XIX Korps, under the command of Guderian, breaks through the Ardennes Forest and reaches the Meuse River at Sedan. He decides to make a quick attack against the French forces there and gains a bridgehead. French incompetent leadership and old battle doctrine lead to disaster and the Germans exploit the foothold into a major breakthrough.
The game is a major upgrade to the Armored Knights game system. It brings a better combined arms feel to the game and lessens the math skills needed to compute combat factors. Players are going to like the feel of this operational level combat game.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Zoom! Card Game
description: Draw cards to add or multiply points and test probability. Surprise cards send scores forward, backward, or back to zero. The first to 500, without pulling a boom card, wins.
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: COMBO Arena
description:
COMBO is a battle Card Game where you and your opponents have to use element cards to attack each other. When a player is reduced to less than 0 Energy Points that player enter a Ghost State. The player or team that can reduce all their opponents to Ghost State and be the last one standing will be declared the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Player Elimination

name: AlmaTafl
description:
AlmaTafl is an abstract strategy game for 2 players of at least 8 years of age, with an average playing time of 20 minutes, influenced by the Tafl family of games, where one player controls the invaders and one player controls the defenders.
The invading army aims to capture the King, where the defending army aims to lead its King on any escape spot.
The board, as well as the setup of the game are inspired by the star-shaped fortifications and unlike other Tafl games, AlmaTafl is perhaps the only game in the Tafl family of games which features the stacking mechanism and no casualties.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Blood of Ancients
description:
Blood of Ancients is a tabletop miniature wargame for armies of antiquity.
The game is d10 based with virtually no references to charts to make for a game that plays quickly with rules that are easy to learn. There are a few key concepts which are different from other systems. The contested ground and charge rules are designed to illustrate the push and shove of battles in antiquity. It was a time when armies charged at each other, clashing with only a few casualties. But each charge is a test of mettle and discipline until one side breaks and runs, whence the real slaughter begins.

The heart of the game is charge and maneuver. Don’t let an opponent on your flanks! But charge his flank mercilessly when you can. Your cavalry can be a powerful offensive weapon, but shaky in defense. Your troops will last longer in combat when massed together, but ranged weapons are most effective when fired at massed troops, so you’ll need skirmishers in your army as well.

Your commander will play a part as well. His army will function best when troops are within his command. Troops which are out of command are unreliable, but your leader can inspire troops under his command to move, defend or attack with greater determination. The leader’s timely actions may save the day on a key hill or important flank.

This game doesn’t require either a specific scale of miniatures or a particular playing surface. You are encouraged to use what you have on hand. Whether you use stands of 15mm, 10mm, or 6mm figures or individually based 20mm or 28mm figures makes no difference. One stand of 15mm figures or 1 individually based 28mm figure still equals 40 to 50 combatants.

We prefer to use a hex grid (less arguments) on our table surface. Our hex grids are big enough to contain a unit. A unit is composed of 4 to 12 bases or stands of figures. If you don’t have or like hexes, we’ll tell you how to easily convert this to free form measurements.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Q ME UP
description:
Q ME UP is a lively party game where the players become music producers. Guided by a theme determined by the next theme card, queue and play your song for everyone to hear and judge. Other players rate your song by giving it one of the four score records: Platinum, Gold, Silver or Cult Classic.

After four rounds, everyone has their producer playlist ready, and the ratings are summed up. The player who scores the most points, is crowned as the Platinum Producer. If another player has collected more cult classics, they win the game by becoming the esteemed CULT PRODUCER!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Voting

name: Questabell
description:
As magical librarians, protect the sanctity of the Mystical Library. Co-operate through 50 quests to make words and combat the diabolical wizard Jack Q. Vexez and his evil henchmen Fyp and Pyf.

Each level has unique objectives/restrictions and they start from easy (suitable for learning the game, or for challenging children), progressing up to tricky and ultimately diabolical levels, which will challenge even the finest wordsmiths in the land!

Generally working on 2 words at once, players will take turns to place a card at the start or end of one of these lines, aiming to turn a line into a word.

Each level might see restrictions on what letters you can use, remove letters from the deck, force you to use certain letters to beat the level, or even do something totally different!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Multi-Use Cards

name: Fourteen Days in June: the Waterloo Campaign
description:
Fourteen Days in June: the Waterloo Campaign is a two-player wargame played on a hex-grid superimposed upon a map depicting north east France and (what is now) southern Belgium. The game focuses upon the struggle in June 1815 between the French army under Napoleon Bonaparte and the Allied armies led by the Duke of Wellington and von Blücher. The game portrays entire campaign. By doing so, and by means of innovations such as the “initial order system”, the game reflects the range of strategic options available to each side. For example, the French can decide where and when to strike; whilst the Allies can chose to gamble by second-guessing the French line(s) of attack and marshalling their forces to meet this or, as Blücher and Wellington did historically, adopt a more cautious approach and allocate sufficient force to each likely invasion route along the Franco-Belgium border to delay Napoleon for long enough for reinforcements to arrive.
This uncertainty or “fog-of-war” which played such a crucial role in campaigns of the period is simulated further by a mechanic allowing players to conceal the strength of their various forces unless and until combat takes place. Even then, it is possible that not all the units in a force will be disclosed. This doubt as to the enemy’s intentions and strength chimes with historical records of discussions about strategy at the headquarters of each side during the campaign. Many of these discussions were concerned with the more mundane – but, no less crucial - aspects of warfare such as planning routes of march. Such issues, too, are reflected in the game. For instance, Route Blocked Markers are used to reflect the fact that a full corps marching along a minor road would be spread out over several miles. Other friendly units are unable to move through not just the hex occupied by the force counter; but, also “preceding” hexes through which its rearmost elements are still marching. So, when issuing orders for units to concentrate in a specific area, or planning a combined attack, players need to ensure that two (or more) forces do not trip over each other by attempting to occupy the same road-space at the same time. Other realities of warfare before the advent of aeroplanes and radio are also simulated. For instance, the game incorporates simple mechanisms to reflect the risk of forces losing their way if they leave the principal road network and attempt to march across country; and, the delay between a supreme commander issuing an order and it being received and implemented by a junior officer in command of a force maybe 10 miles distant at a time when such communications were carried by horse.

So, will the Emperor rewrite History by defeating Wellington and Blucher before hoisting the French tricolour over Brussels; or, will the Allies prevail once again, leaving Napoleon to rue what might have been? The decision is yours.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement

name: Live 2 G(a/e)ther in Terra Nova
description:
Welcome to the Thibion System, master. I am your host and servant P.E.O.R.S the Proto Earth Overseeing Robotic System, hopefully your travel from Earth has been pleasant and the cryogenic sleep has not been too harsh on you - after all, you will be going into cryogenic sleep a lot during your millenia shift.

My first task is explaining to you [what you already know] that you are the next Master Builder in our non stop efforts to create the new, and well balanced, Earth here in Thibion.
The infrastructure for your work has been already built here in Thibian Serenus Plains. As you can see, all the pipelines for the basic resources have been laid out and are fully operational.

For the next 2,000 years – or more - You will work through me in stints of 200 years to build Earthly features here in Thibion by using the pre-fabricated modules that have since arrived from Earth. I will take your instructions of where to place and develop the new modules and any technological adjustments that you may believe are necessary and execute them while you are back to cryogenic sleep.

The modules arriving from Earth will be of five different types: Plants, Animals, Water, Land and Technology, each in varying sizes. Once your shift is completed, the Galactic Eye will assess your performance.

Live 2 G(a/e)ther in Terra Nova is a light, easy to learn solitaire tile-laying / spatial-puzzle game in which you are trying to create a new world ensuring the right balance between each of the 5 elements for each planetary zone.
Make sure you spread the animals, plants, water and land evenly, and that your technology advances but doesn´t get in the way.

The game was created as an entry to the 2023 Solitaire Print and Play Contest here in BoardGameGeek.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Environmental, Exploration, Print & Play, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: Earth Gambit: Light
description:
Earth Gambit: Light is a social adventure game with extraterrestrials, hidden identities, and tough choices.

In this game, you will play as the Aliens, the Scientists, or the Extinctionists, who each have very different plans for Earth and the course of the Earthlings' science. Advance the science by playing science cards, stall your opponents by playing action cards, and share your research by passing cards to other players, but who can you really trust?

Can you make the right choice if there is no good choice at all?
Time is limited, options even more so. Draw one, play one, pass one, and keep one for the future (if there will be one). Don't think too hard, it's not chess, it’s just the fate of Earth, that's in your hands.

Note: The game has elements of social deduction with hidden identities, but not a social deduction game per se. That's why we call it a Social Adventure game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Panzer Grenadier: Fighting Irish
description:
In September 1939, Eire (the recently-renamed Irish Free State) declared that she would remain neutral in the new war erupting in Europe. This angered the British government, but Ireland had not participated in the Commonwealth of Nations since 1932.

Ireland was not invaded during the Second World War, but both Britain and Germany made plans to do so. Ireland eventually mobilized two divisions and two brigades, deployed along the border with Northern Ireland to resist a British invasion and along the island’s southern coast to fight off an attack by Britain or Germany. The Irish Army - Na Forsai Cosanta - eventually reached a strength of 38,000 and saw no action during World War II, though tens of thousands of Irish men and women volunteered to fight the Nazis in the British armed forces.

Fighting Irish is an expansion for Panzer Grenadier: Invasion that lets you send the Irish into battle anyway, in a small set of scenarios depicting a German airborne assault on the Emerald Isle.
The Irish are tough, but they’re not very well-armed. Fighting Irish includes 24 new pieces depicting Irish troops and leaders in their traditional kelly green.
It’s a good-looking set.
Plus you get scenarios so you can play with them.

-Description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Golen Bay
description:
Campaign live on Gamefound!

https://gamefound.com/en/projects/pedro-andre/golen-bay?ref=...

In Golen Bay you and up to three friends become the leader of Captain Cannon and his crew, lost on a very rich island.

You must work together to seek hidden treasures. Using your characters´ abilities to steal bombs and blow up treasure chests is the only way you can return home, in this fast paced and cooperative thrilling adventure of strategy and teamwork.

—description from the publisher

GOLEN BAY is a pirate-themed board game where players use their characters' abilities to steal bombs and blow up treasure chests. Players compete to be the first to blow up all the treasure chests, making use of each character's unique skills and abilities.
"This is a game proudly created in Portugal and has been in development over the last two years so that all board game fans can finally have GOLEN BAY in their collection!", says the Golen Games team responsible for design, mechanics, and game production

GOLEN BAY is a turn-based pirates-themed tabletop game designed to provide instant gaming fun for 2 or 4 players. Inside the box are 50 cards with impeccably designed actions and characters, the game board, ten tokens, and a dice.

In a scenario with pirates assaulting GOLEN BAY and local inhabitants defending what is theirs, the objective is to make good use of the capabilities of the several cards to advance across the sand, throwing bombs and trying to blow up the chests that hold the opponent's treasures.
Whoever plays well and first manages to get their hands on five treasures is the big winner!

GOLEN BAY is a game for all ages, for the whole family, and stands out for being a fast-paced game, very easy to learn, and which still challenges us to create a strategy to achieve victory. Each session takes between 15 and 30 minutes, on average.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Victory Points as a Resource

name: ROCKOR
description:
A dispute between rock bands to gain more and more fame! To achieve this, bands must form the best repertoires according to rising and falling trends, in a demanding and constantly changing market. This is ROCKOR: a fast, abstract, thematic game with a lot of interaction between players who can gain or lose points almost all the time, even outside of their turns. At the end of the game, the band with the most fame will be the true rock legend!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Collectible Components
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Merchants of Magick: Draught of the Dragons
description:
Draught of the Dragons collects several different smaller expansions into one box adding a ton of variety and intrigue. Draught of the Dragons adds a new phase to the game where players pick an action: Brewing more potions, advertising to a central pool of customers, stealing them from your opponents, or grabbing potion recipes that provide powerful new abilities. It also adds new Order cards and a push your luck mechanic with Order Reservations.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Spaceship Unity: Season 1.2
description:
From the deepest regions of space, the recruits of the Interplanetary Alliance (IPA) from Season 1.1 return for brand new adventures in Spaceship Unity - Season 1.2! This wild and immersive cooperative adventure game turns your surroundings into a fully functional spaceship—which the players must crew. When Season 1.1 ended Episode 5 on the brink of galactic conflict, it seemed that the IPA’s peacemaking efforts might fail. Multiple factions gear up for war and the threat of nanobots continues to spread. As members of the IPA, the crew of the Unity must work together to try and defend the Intergalactic Peace.

Spaceship Unity - Season 1.2 is an expansion and the second part of an epic sci-fi story—the narrative continues immediately after the end of Season 1.1. Just as before, Spaceship Unity is about diving in and having fun as a group, experiencing the story together through frenzied real-time Action Chapters and difficult Challenge Chapters. Players must successfully operate their ship using the everyday objects around them, which are transformed into the systems to control it.

Across six new episodes, players face fresh challenges as they rush towards the grand finale. They will experience even more exciting Action and Challenge Chapters, as well as a brand-new Combat Chapters that are played in real time. Advanced weapon systems are introduced, but enemies have also gained new weaponry and won’t hesitate to use them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Variable Set-up

name: Sherlock Junior: ¿Dónde está Alba?
description:
In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded. During your turn, each player must perform one of the following actions:

A) Reveal information:
Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

B) Discard a card:
Discar a card face down without being able to comment anything about that card until the end of the game, at which point you will have to speak based on what you remember of the cards you discarded.

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

Alba debería haber vuelto a casa después de clase, pero son las ocho de la tarde y no hay rastro de ella.

¿Qué ha ocurrido? ¿Dónde está Alba? ¿Alguien la ha visto?

Vuestro equipo de detectives deberá analizar las pistas para responder a éstas y otras muchas preguntas.

¿Conseguiréis resolver el misterio de su desaparición?

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory

name: Firefight Tactical
description:
Firefight Tactical is an innovative dice-driven tactical WW2 wargame at the squad level. Quick to play and learn, this compact game follows American forces through 12 scenarios in the weeks after the D-Day landings. The scenarios gradually introduce game features as you progress. Starting with small infantry engagements on tight maps, players will work their way to larger scenarios with multiple phases, artillery, and tank-on-tank action.
The scenarios follow American forces from early skirmishes of the Normandy invasion at St. Mere Eglise and Carentan through to St. Lo and Operation Cobra and conclude with Operation Market Garden. The battlefields will vary from desperate battles over a “no man’s land” devoid of cover like Bloody Gulch to claustrophobic urban battles like Cherbourg. Each scenario can be played 2-player against a human opponent or against a customizable solitaire automa.

The Firefight Tactical system was designed to be quick to play and easy to learn, whilst being packed with tactical decision-making. Its compact size also enables play on relatively small playing surfaces, making it an ideal game to travel with. The core infantry rules are straightforward and can be learned from ~10 pages, including many examples and a glossary of actions.
As a result of the dice and random battle maps, the game has intensely high replayability, even within a single scenario, so players will get tons of enjoyment from the "basic" game. Once you are ready for more, though, you can start adding more rules, covering support weapons, weather, armor, and so forth in the heavier scenarios. Firefight Tactical is the perfect game for those looking for a lot of tactical depth and replayability with a small footprint.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Pieces as Map, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The Battle of Khalkhin Gol
description:
The Battle of Khalkhin Gol is a medium level wargame covering the WW2 border clash between Japan and the USSR at the very dawn of this global conflict.

It is a hex & counter game with unique battle mechanism, a lot of strategy and a number of features specific to the harsh conditions of the setting.

Khalkhin Gol is medium level complexity and lasts from 2 to 4 hours. Variable setup and random cards bringing effects to the game offers great replayability.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Verplant & Zugestellt: Promoszenario Messe Essen 2023
description:
This is a promotional scenario for Verplant & Zugestellt handed out to buyers of the game at Essen 2023.

Two game geeks have built a house in the same shape as the fair halls in Essen. There is a lot of furniture to place into several fairly small rooms. Unlike in the base game, there is a sixth room into which they can put excess furniture. Additional points can be scored for each of the many doors that remains accessible from both sides.
mechanics: Drawing, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid

name: YRO
description:
The Sunrise Islands, home of small but fierceful animal folk;
The Wooden Conclave, that reunites all the magical creatures of the Forest;
The Wandering Market, that travels and trades without rest;
The Mining Company, where the inventors create new technologies;
The Floating City, where Magic and Technology find their balance;
The Dragon Knight, sworn protectors of the land of Yro.

From these factions you will recruit members for your guild, to create a powerful party and complete the most rewarding quests!

In Yro you have to recruit adventurers in your guild and place them in a 3x3 grid you build during the game. They all have a Combat Value, that will grant points each turn if higher than the opponents’ one; they can grant you Magic and Technology resource points, that will unlock more powerful abilities Gold that will be useful to recruit more Adventurers and Victory points that will lead you to the final victory.

The combat value of your party will be determined by the combat values of your front row of adventurers, and when you recruit 3 adventurers in a row that share a Faction and/or Profession, they will unlock a powerful bonus effect, so wise positioning will also be essential!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Might & Fury WWII
description:
Embark on an exhilarating journey through World War II with our captivating board game, featuring ICONIC miniatures, intricate 3D battle locations, immersive imagery, and...top-secret folders!

To secure victory, players must skillfully navigate through three pivotal phases:

Launching Campaign: Strategically identify allies and build an entry-level military deck to receive your classified route assignment.

Completing the Route: Collaborate closely with your allies to secure key strategic victories and outmaneuver the advancing enemy forces.

Final Battle: Harness all available military resources to mount a decisive assault, bringing an end to the enemy campaign and seizing ultimate victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Party Game, Wargame, World War II
