mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deduction, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mystery at the Fairytale Ball
description: No costume party can compare to the annual Grimm Fairytale Ball. All of the wealthy elites and influential people of Valley Falls will be there. For years, you’ve imagined what such an event would be like in person, but you have never been rich nor important enough to receive an invitation. Yet, all of that changes when the hostess of the party, Cynthia Grimm, hires you to uncover the identity of a blackmailer who calls themselves the Pied Piper. The Pied Piper has threatened to reveal family secrets that would destroy Miss Grimm if their demands aren’t met. These secrets have the potential to harm not only Miss Grimm but all of the charities she is a part of. Your client believes the Piper will be at the ball and has given you open access to the guests in attendance. This time you have no intention of paying the Piper. Instead, you plan to beat them at their own game! So, grab a costume, investigate all of the fairy tale characters that have shown up for the evening, and see if you can solve the Mystery at the Fairytale Ball.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Oceans: Legends of the Deep Kickstarter Promos
description:
6 New Legend cards, Including Leviathan and Poseidon
7 New Deep cards, Including Dragon Turtle and Boobrie
9 New Scenario Cards, Including Mega Predators and Toxic Reef

Included with any pledge over $1 in the Legends of the Deep Kickstarter Campaign.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Doozie Card Game
description:
It's every player for themselves! You can't look at your cards, but with a little luck, and a little strategy, you'll win...unless another player pulls a Doozie.

Part Rack-O, part Phase 10, with other many other ingredients thrown in, too. Some luck, some strategy. Easy for anyone to learn, including children from around 8 years old. An expansion pack adds some Uno-esque elements, ways to force other players to swap a card with you, and a few other more dastardly actions. And, you can choose which of these cards to include when you play, making the game a little different each time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: For the Evil Quest
description:
For the Evil Quest is an expansion for the game For The Quest. In it we will have new monsters, heroes, scenarios and spells. After succumbing to the Spells of the Book of Nokron, the mysterious Binder has pillaged his own Archive Tower and now aims to steal knowledge from the Elven Library in the Eternal Forest to complete macabre rituals in his Frozen Castle in the Barbarian Lands! The Heroes must stop him before he can corrupt all of Farlands!

For The Evil Quest! Campaign compatible with For the Quest to beat up the Binder!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion – The Founders of the Lost Cabal
description: A Jaws of the Lion promo scenario received via backing The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast's 10th Year Extravaganza Kickstarter.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Gloomhaven: Second Edition – Cabin in the Corpsewood
description: A promo scenario for the 2nd edition of Gloomhaven related to Good Time Society. The scenario was made freely available during Gloomhaven Grand Festival on BackerKit on June 27, 2023 via the project update “Great streams and the second edition faction narrative”.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Stadt Land: Das inoffizielle Spiel für Potterheads
description:
The classic game in a new format as a fun card game: With this exciting City, Country, Potterhead edition, you'll always bring a big dose of fun to the round! You can test your Hogwarts knowledge and prove your creativity in over 60 categories. With its cool design and exciting themes, the card game will convince every Potter fan, big or small. From simple to tricky categories - there's something here for every wizard's apprentice.
Scene, spell or school subject? Dive into the world of wizards and test yourself and your friends - which of you is the biggest Potter fan and finds an answer matching the letter and category the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required, that's the only way you'll manage to win. Are you ready to dive into the world of Harry Potter and his friends? Then get to the cards, get set, go!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Tiny Tina: Gen Con Edition
description:
Tiny Tina Vault Hunter

This is the adult Tina, modeled after Borderlands 3.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Box of Badasses
description: 18 Vault Hunters, new Loot and Bounty opportunities with unique opponents.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Black Stories Probekarten
description:
In Black Stories the players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A card game just right for any party.

One player, the Chief, takes one of the cards and reads it secretly. The front of the card has the mystery, the back the solution. Then the player reads the front of the card to the other players and shows them the illustration. The other players are the detectives. Singly and together, they try to solve the mystery by asking the Chief questions. But the Chief can only answer Yes, No, Close, or Not Relevant.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bloque a bloque
description:
Design, build and sell the highest quality buildings.

In this game you compete against the rest of the players by building buildings phase by phase with a simple and fun card tower system.

Will you be the best builder?

With two actions in turns you must choose to build, sell, buy, reserve or get more cards with a limit of 4 cards in hand.
The cards have a value in coins to use to pay for actions or to buy cards from your opponents and they also have a graphic duality that expands the possibilities of each card.
The player who gets the most points wins, either with the tallest building or with several shorter buildings.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Industry / Manufacturing, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Ladder Climbing, Layering, Multi-Use Cards, Pattern Building, Trading

name: CATAN: Sternenfahrer – Das Duell: Glücksspielplanet Promo
description: CATAN: Sternenfahrer – Das Duell - Glücksspielplanet Promo contains one additional card for the base game, where you explore space, discover planets, and found colonies — all while warding off pirates.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cross of Iron
description: WW2 Eastern front individualized skirmish rules with Steiner mini-campaign.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Baltic Sea (Östersjön) (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails)
description:
Get ready for a great adventure on sea and land! Take the ferry from Travemünde to Trelleborg, then a quick visit to Denmark via the Öresund Bridge or the Helsingborg-Helsingør ferry. Then take the train to Gothenburg, cruise sail on the Göta canal and then hop on the train to Stockholm, where the ferry to Finland awaits!

Oh no, the clock is ticking, you had made plans to make it to Riga too... Well, maybe you can build a port in
Karlskrona instead. Or take new tickets? Fortune favors the bold!

This map follows the main rules of Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails, but makes an effort to make train routes and tickets more valuable, harbors easier to build and ship routes not as overpowered as otherwise. But mostly, it just adds a fun version of some iconic routes of northern Europe!

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: An Object Lesson to the Kaiser
description:
An Object Lesson to the Kaiser is a campaign system and tactical rules for pre-dreadnought naval warfare.

The mini campaign is covering the potential clash between Imperial Germany and the United States of America over Venezuela, and the Kaiser’s desire to find his “place in the sun”.

Also included is a brief history of the run-up to the campaign (and how it was averted), the latest edition of LFG’s Broadside and Salvo fast play pre-dreadnought rules and a complete set of ship data for the rules allowing the campaign to be fought out over a weekend or a few club nights.

-Description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Detective box: Season 1
description: Detective Box is a game that lets you experience a realistic and immersive murder mystery at home. You play as a detective who has to solve a complex case by examining clues, interrogating suspects, and following leads. The game is divided into three episodes, each one delivered in a box that contains various elements of the investigation, such as police reports, evidence, testimonies, etc. You also have access to an app that helps you navigate the case and interact with the characters. The goal of the game is to find out who killed the victim, why, and how, by using your logic, deduction, and intuition. Detective Box is a game for one to four players, and each episode takes about three hours to complete. The game is suitable for anyone who loves crime stories, puzzles, and mysteries
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Galenus: The Best Doctor Is Also a Philosopher
description:
A ten card promo pack for the board game Galenus.
Contains:
Rules
2 double sided overlay cards for the Black Bile skill track
1 double sided "Pneumatists" sect card
3 double sided regio cards and 2 Journey cards that have a player number scaled starting scenario "Anno 166 e 167"
1 Double sided player number scaled region card "Memento Mori"
1 Double sided player number scaled region card "Bacchanalia"

-description from designer
categories: Ancient, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Medical
mechanics: Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Winterhaven Woods: Fresh Snow
description:
Snow drifts slowly through bare branches and a still silence settles upon the Winterhaven Woods.

Winterhaven Woods: Fresh Snow is a pick and pass card game in which 3 to 6 players compete to create beautiful sections of woodlands before the North Winds bring heavy snowfall.

Over three rounds, players strategically select cards to add to their woodlands. Trees are planted to create woods, woods protect creatures seeking shelter, and predators hunt creatures roaming the meadows before cozying up in the den.

Players must balance selecting a variety of cards to achieve the most successful strategies and have the highest scoring section of woodlands by the end of the game.

Winterhaven Woods: Fresh Snow is a reimplementation of Winterhaven Woods (KS edition) that incorporates player feedback from the original. Highlights include, significant development on points, player counts, and card counts for consistency at varying player counts, removing steal cards and take that mechanics from the base game, and adding player mats and round markers to assist with organization and gameplay.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection

name: Vagrantsong: Iconic Maco Joe Promo Cards
description:
Celebrate character moments in our games with our Iconic Line, these large-scale, high-quality miniatures. Iconic Maco Joe is a 92.80mm tall “miniature” that includes 3 Junk Cards that are exclusive to the Iconic Maco Joe box: the Dented Lunchbox, The Bloody Bag, and the Ticket Puncher!

-description from kickstarter campaign
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Det Dårlige Selskab: udvidelse #4 – Ekstra Dansk
description: An expansion for Det dårlige selskab. New cards, a few new optional rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hark!
description:
You are the Exiled Prince.

Catching your breath, halfway up the neverending stairs of Umbar.

Your sword is broken yet your heart still beats under your breastplate. So many steps beneath you. So many yet to climb...

Hark! is a short, printable, randomly-generated, replayable, solo fantasy adventure. The goal of the game is to climb 100 stairs before running out of one of the three main resources: Blood, Sweat, or Tears.

Over the course of the game, a player will roll dice to determine what they will encounter on a given turn, with each turn represented by the player climbing stairs.

Can you survive the long, treacherous path to the top of the stairway and face the dreaded "FINAL CHALLENGE"? Only those that persevere will live to tell the tale.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Arrowstorm: Battle Games in Medieval Britain
description:
CAN YOU WEATHER THE ARROWSTORM?

In this gridded-layout miniature wargame, you take the role of a medieval king, bishop, lord, or commander leading your army on the battlefield. You must choose where and how to focus your troops' actions and control the battle’s impetus. The battle is partly fought on the tabletop like other miniature wargames but is also fought just as hard on the Tactics Chart, providing an additional mind-game against your opponent.

Command your units to move and fight in the areas of the battlefield you wish, but leave the actual process of fighting to your unit commanders. This is represented by the random factor of dice and each of your units’ abstract but often-decreasing Battle Rating. Because of this, your focus is kept where it should be – out-thinking your opponent by using superior tactics and exploiting their weaknesses on the battlefield.

Arrowstorm is not intended as a heavy simulation of medieval warfare but as an enjoyable, simple, and fast-playing battle game. You’ll find that much of the action is stylized and streamlined. Don’t think of “turns” in the usual wargaming way – in each turn your units may fight or move several times, countered by your opponent after every action, creating a very fluid game but at the same time making cohesive planning difficult to achieve.

Please note that Arrowstorm shares the same basic rules with my Age of Penda book. Period-specific troop types, army lists, special rules, and minor rules differences exist.

THE ‘YOU COMMAND’ SERIES
‘You Command’ is a series of light miniature wargames by Origins Award winner Daniel Mersey (Lion Rampant, Dragon Rampant, Battle Ravens, and many more games). When you play a ‘You Command’ game, your goal is to defeat your opponent by out-thinking them tactically using the innovative Tactics Chart, and then by out-fighting their model army on the tabletop battlefield.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Wrong Answers Only
description:
Wrong Answers Only is the ultimate game of wit, creativity, and deception…

In this hilarious and competitive card game, you are challenged to make convincing arguments for incorrect answers to a wide variety of trivia questions in under 30 seconds.

Each round players win points for giving the most persuasive argument and the game ends when the a player reaches eight points.

From historical landmarks to pop culture icons, Wrong Answers Only tests your ability to think on your feet and come up with the most persuasive and absurd explanations worthy of winning the admiration of your peers.

-description from designer
mechanics: Acting, Storytelling

name: Blood Bowl: Vampire Blood Bowl Team – The Drakfang Thirsters
description:
A powerful and haughty Blood Bowl team that brings their own snacks to the pitch.

Noble Vampires often partake in games of Blood Bowl alongside their human Thralls to showcase their immortal superiority and indulge in a little bloodlust. Due to their wealthy status, these Nobles are adorned in the highest quality gear. Meanwhile, their Thralls are dishevelled and diminutive, wearing little more than basic equipment and blouses – and their gaunt and malnourished appearances may or may not have something to do with Thralls becoming a mid-match snack for the Vampires when they get thirsty.

Vampires who choose to play Blood Bowl among the underclasses are undeniably powerful, however, their teams can become undone when they occasionally give in to their Bloodlust and feed off their Thralls mid-game! But, if they can keep their hunger in check, their speed and strength make them a match for any other team out on the astrogranite.

This multipart kit allows you to assemble The Drakfang Thirsters, a Vampire team for use in games of Blood Bowl. The team comprises eight Thrall Linemen, two Vampire Runners, two Vampire Blitzers, and two Vampire Throwers. You'll find alternate heads for each of your Vampire players, and an alternate arm for your Thrower, to help customise your team. In addition, there are two double-sided Blood Bowl coins, two turn and re-roll markers, four balls, and a transfer sheet.

Rules for using Vampire teams in your games of Blood Bowl can be found in Spike! Journal 16, which is sold separately.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battle of Monongahela Game
description: The "Battle of Monogahela" is a low to moderate complexity tactical game set during the 18th century. It chronicles the British Army's march into Fort Duquesne in 1755. Can the French military hold its ground? The stage is set...
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: Café: Lviv and Lisboa Promo Cards
description:
Two promo cards for the game of café

In the rulebook they are named "plan cards". There are 48 unique plan cards in the game. These promo cards are 2 extra of these plan cards
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – Black Rose Wars Rebirth Crossover
description:
Landolfo II, Prince of Capula (crossover from Black Rose Wars Rebirth) is considered a special Creature and comes with his unique encounter. Due to his nature, you might have to face him at the peak of his power, accompanied by powerful vampires, or at his weakest. You will have to choose whether to run for your life or destroy his incarnation, severing his link to the magic of the Black Rose.

Expansion contains:


1 miniature
1 ID card
6 Path cards
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Would Be Aces
description:
Welcome to Would Be Aces, a solitaire wargame where you command a flight of P-47 Thunderbolts on missions to destroy various enemy ground forces. As your pilots fly their planes across the Western European landscape they will encounter enemy ground forces, enemy aircraft, obstacles, good fortune and crippling bad luck at every turn as you try to reach the objective.

The main mechanic of the game centres around the confidence level of the pilot, with a push your luck mechanic as they progress towards their objective plus the amazing resilience and toughness of one of the greatest aircraft of WW2 - the P47 Thunderbolt.

The game takes no longer than 1 hour to setup and play and has a low complexity streamlined design.

This is a print and play game with the PDFs containing all the rules, scenarios, maps, player aids and counters required to play. You'll need to print them out, mount the map and counters to card. We have kept the maps and counters to a few sheets (of either Letter or A4 size) so it is very inexpensive and quick to print out and get to the table.

The game comes complete with:
Rulebook
Tables Book
Sortie Record Sheet
Plane Sheets
Map Sheets
Counter Sheets

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Marvel Studios: The Infinity Saga – Capture: The Ultimate Battle Game
description:
From Marvel: Avengers The Infinity Saga comes Capture: The Ultimate Battle Game, a game for 2-5 players, aimed at ages 8+ and takes approx 20-30min to complete.

To claim victory, use Marvel's most powerful heroes and formidable villains to CAPTURE the Infinity Stones and avoid other players' brutal tactics!

Strategic, frenetic and highly interactive, CAPTURE features 30 Marvel heroes and villains and features official character art (ie actors' likenesses) from the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

HOW TO PLAY HEADLINES:
Players are each dealt 8 cards and on their turn can do as many actions as they choose. There are 4 action categories:


Play a pair of the same coloured cards to CAPTURE an available stone (on the board)
Play 3 of the same coloured cards to attempt to CAPTURE that coloured stone from another player
Play a pair of GAUNTLET cards to CAPTURE up to 2 available stones
Play a VILLAIN card on another player. All 6 Villains have a different impact and can be defended by a different HERO.


Once players have completed their actions they can then choose to discard additional cards, drawing back up 8 cards to finish their turn. But watch out for rare CHILDREN OF THANOS cards when replenishing! If players pick up one of these, they must immediately spin the game board and observe the impact- which could result in placing a stone back on the board!

Capture features basic set collection mechanics, many risk-reward trade offs, a slight vindictive edge and has received plentiful positive feedback in our 4 years of playtesting with the Australian gaming community!

—description from the designer
categories: Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Factory Inс.: A Smartphone Inc. Game
description:
In Factory Inc., you start the game as the director of a new electronics factory. Your goal is to make your factory prosper by hunting for new contracts, launching product lines, and make space for more and more equipment on your factory floor.

An Inc. series game in the vein of Smartphone Inc., Factory Inс. reinvents action draft and polyomino tile-laying mechanisms, using them with an innovative route-building mechanic in a thematic mix. Unique combinations of contracts, player characters, and optimization cards add a huge replay ability factor to this game.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: 三国群英录 (Heroes of the Three Kingdoms)
description:
In "Heroes of the Three Kingdoms," you'll step into the chaotic era of the late Eastern Han Dynasty. Four dominant factions - Wei, Shu, Wu, and Independent forces - each led by three valiant generals. Your mission is to select a faction, form your team, devise strategies, conquer territories, recruit soldiers, and compete for victory. Each general possesses distinctive skills that can be utilized by expending morale. With cunning tactics, strategic planning, and unwavering courage, can you elevate your faction, unite the Three Kingdoms, and emerge as the ultimate hero?

In the game, there are four factions: Wei, Shu, Wu, and Independent. Each faction can select three generals to form its team and then draw a target card.

During each round, players have the option to move, recruit (strengthening their generals), or attack (targeting enemy generals or territories). Each general possesses unique skills that can be activated by expending morale. Additionally, players can employ strategy cards to change the course of the game; each faction features its own special card effects.

Gameplay:

1. Action Phase:
Players can perform the following actions in any sequence:

General Action (A): Each general can execute one action.
General Skills (B): Each general can utilize multiple skills.
Strategy Card (C): Players are allowed to play multiple strategy cards.
2. Card Drawing Stage:
Players draw two strategy cards and may then discard until they have six cards in hand. If the hand contains fewer than six cards after drawing, no discarding is necessary. Alternatively, players can opt to skip the entire card drawing stage, neither drawing nor discarding cards.

End of the Game:
The game concludes when a player's merit reaches the maximum limit, initiating the final settlement phase.

Each player's total merit equals the merit displayed in the merit column plus the achievements from the target card. The player with the highest total merit emerges victorious, winning the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Force Commitment, Race, Variable Player Powers

name: Cold War Commander 2
description:
Cold War Commander is an exciting set of fast play wargame rules that allows you to recreate combined arms operations covering the Cold War and post-Cold War era.

Players each take command of a Battlegroup, which can be anything from a company right up to a division. These rules provide a good balance between playability and historical accuracy, allowing players to successfully use real-world tactics in a game system that is easy to use and fast to play. The rules are suitable for solo, two-player and multi-player games, at home, at the club, or at a tournament.

Cold War Commander covers the period from the end of the Second World War through until the early 1990’s.


Suitable for any scale miniatures, from 2mm right up to 28mm
Simple command system that emphasises the fog of war
Effective mechanism for casualty resolution
Rules for infantry, tanks, artillery, recce, aircraft and engineers
Flexible figure ratio meaning one base represents a platoon
Minimal setup time, simply assemble your forces and play
Contains 3 army lists in the book and extensive lists online
Includes 15 scenarios suitable for any nation and theatre
Suitable for solo, two player or multi-player games
Everything you need to play in one book


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zombis Cazadores de Bocadillos
description:
We play as a hungry Zombie, who must get the most juiced brains. To do this, players must exchange cards in a chaotic game without turns in which the fastest one will be the winner.

Each player starts with a hand of cards of different values, which they must change with the other players until all their cards are of the same value. By doing so they will earn points equal to the value of the card. After several rounds, the player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Number, Party Game, Real-time, Zombies
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Negotiation, Real-Time

name: The Old King's Crown: Wild Kingdom
description: The Wild Kingdom expansion adds new map tiles, cards, and four modules that enable experienced players to modify and randomize future game plays. "Night" Kingdom Map Tiles allow random map setups and "Wild Kingdom" cards dramatically increase options. The Travelling Town Module expands synergies and combos. The Aeronauts Module allows you to recruit Aeronaut faction cards and add their unique abilities to your deck. The Whispering Tower Module adds new boons to buy and a neutral mythical card to the game. The Legendary Creatures Module unlocks a new mythical card for each faction bringing new strength and power to your deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Last Glow
description:
Aboard the last lighthouse, save the last inhabitants of Myiemord from deadly nightmares. Brave the dangers of perpetual storms to recover Dream Soothers, the only remedy for preserving life on Myiemord.

The Last Glow is a survival game where you take on the role of the crew of the last flying lighthouse, made up of 5 members.

Gameplay: Each turn, carry out the actions of your crew members, move the lighthouse, light the storms, flush out and capture the dream baits before sending them to the planet. If you manage to send six before your lighthouse is destroyed, you win. 
But beware: every turn, new storms are born, while others intensify and even explode, damaging your lighthouse.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Worker Placement

name: Famfrenzia
description:
Famfrenzia is a card-based game for 4-12 players that is easy to learn and quick to play. The game has no player turns and comes with a companion web app. Inside the box you find 120 character cards, 29 action cards, and 20 announcement cards. The character cards represent 17 families from around the world and each character card shows details of the character such as name, country, generation, location, points, and two possessions that the character owns.

The objective of the game is to build sets that earn you bonus points. Set types include families, social events (based on possessions), generation sets, duos, and murder mysteries.

The game is played in rounds. Each round has 4-5 stages:

Each player gets 2 character cards from the deck.
The game master auctions two character cards and one action card.
Players have 2 minutes to negotiate and exchange cards.
At the end of each round, players can use one of their action cards.
At the beginning of every other round, the game master reveals one announcement card and ask the players to carry out its instructions.


Players use the companion app to add/remove character cards, search/filter for cards they may need, see their completed sets and missing cards from other sets, bid auction amounts and keep track of their digital money, and see updated victory points. The game ends when the deck runs out of cards and the player with the most victory points wins.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Trading

name: Endless Dungeon: Crystal Search
description:
You must locate the crystal if you want to have any chance of getting out of the station alive! Strategically use you heroes' powers to be the first player to find the crystal, eliminate your opponents, and make it out in one piece.

Crystal Search is a deduction and strategy game for 2 to 4 players. In order to win, you must survive your opponents' attacks during the FIGHT phase - then be the first player to find the crystal in the SEARCH phase.

This card game is available as a part of the Endless Dungeon Day One Edition video game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deduction, Drawing, Take That

name: Vindication: Quackalope Promo Cards
description:
These two promo cards for Vindication were created to support Quackalope:


Quacka-wrait - Pet Spirit
Medallion of the Raven - Relic
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mariner
description:
There are six key colours, Blue. Yellow,Purple,Green, Red, Orange. These colours are repeated on the flags crossing the playing board, the six ship tokens and the six sets of questions and answer cards, There is also a category under the Jolly Roger flag. These are held by the Jolly Roger, a volunteer crew member who must be present at every game, The JOLLY ROGER issues each player a ship token and the matching set of question cards which they will be reading aloud. The Jolly Roger keeps the Black and White Jolly Roger questions for himself and any spare boxes left over as follows:

6 Players 1 box each
5 Players 1 box each +1 spare to Jolly Roger
4 Players 1 box each +2 spare to Jolly Roger
3 Players 2 boxes each
2 Players 3 boxes each

All Boxes of cards must stay on the table at all times during play and the cards remain inside the boxes except when one is selected.
The Jolly Roger will read the questions from any category he holds plus te Jolly Roger questions.
There are 200 questions per category and one hundred Jolly Roger questions.

A MARINER OF THE MONTH CERTIFICATE WILL BE DISPLAYED
SHOWING THE OVERALL WINNER FROM EACH CALENDAR MONTH
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: Panzer Grenadier: Grossdeutschland at Kursk
description:
For their June 1943 offensive at Kursk, the German high command bet a lot of its chips on the Grossdeutschland Panzer Grenadier Division. It had more tanks than any of the Regular Army panzer divisions, plus additional weapons from machine guns to Tiger heavy tanks, and additional assault guns and other battalions. Add to that enormous combat experience and unit cohesion (thanks to special perks for Grossdeutschland soldiers – who, for example, could not be sent to a different unit after a hospital stay, or seized by military police to join an “emergency” unit). On top of all that, the 200 Panther tanks provided for the Kursk operation all went to this one division.

Grossdeutschland at Kursk is a Panzer Grenadier Campaign Study, with 11 new scenarios based on the actions of the German Grossdeutschland Division during the Kursk campaign. There are two chapters, each with a battle game to link the scenarios together. You’ll need Kursk: Burning Tigers, Broken Axis, and Eastern Front Artillery to play all of the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Pletrix: Rainbow
description:
Pletrix: Rainbow is a box of expansions from the Kickstarter campaign. It includes:

Rock Die - Turns the rolled shape into stone. The shape cannot be drawn that turn.

Forbidden Die - Prohibits the use of the color rolled. All dice matching the color cannot be used that turn.

Twister Die - Grants new special abilities based on the die roll.

Vision Die - Adds an additional dice mitigation element into the game.

Additional Settings - More game sheets with new panel shapes and rules. Including: Rainbow, Pipeline, Mega, Retro, MegaRainbow, Seventy and a Solo Mode for all expansion settings.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Die fliegenden Holzschuhe
description:
Die fliegenden Holzschuhe (German; "The flying Clogs"), is a tactical level coop wargame for 1 to 3 players set in the second world war. You are in command of the catapult tender ship "Bussard" (German; "Buzzard") and her three BV-138 float planes. Your tasks involve, but are not limited to:

sea rescue
reconnaissance and counter-reconnaissance
troop transport and evacuation
mine searching and laying
bombing runs
submarine hunting


The game is played on a hex map with each hex representing 200km. Each round, representing roughly an hour, you will move your aircraft around the map in search for radio signals or other suspicious hints to find your objective of the day.

But don't take these tasks easy. Enemy long range reconnaissance aircraft, escort vessels, and bad weather will show you that this work above the hostile arctic ocean is only for the most foolhardy or foolish men.

If you encounter enemy forces, the game will require you to make a check to evade enemy fire. After that it is on you to decide to either counter attack, or get the hell off. Every time you fail to evade, a random system on your aircraft will be damaged, and after a second hit be destroyed. This includes your precious equipment, like radar, radio, and bomb guidance systems, added weaponry, and any passengers you picked up on your sortie.

This game can either be played in single scenarios, as a historically linked campaign, or a randomly linked campaign. Campaigns offer a ascending difficulty, as well as upgrades for your vehicles and crewmen.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Steampunk
description: In a realm where steam-powered inventions reign supreme and visionary tinkerers are prized for their craft, mechanical prowess and creative ideas are the currency of progress. Here, the ever-turning gears of industry spur enterprising minds to bring new ideas to bustling Workshops. Groundbreaking discoveries are made through meticulous tinkering in these creative hubs. Eureka Moments, true sparks of genius, ignite the appreciation of the renowned Inventors Guild, driving artisan crafters to reach new heights and create inventions that will leave a lasting impression. Your mission: curry favor with the Guild and claim your place among the most celebrated inventors of the steampunk era.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Loans, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Selection Order Bid, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction, Victory Points as a Resource, Voting, Zone of Control

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Basara
description:
Basara includes expansion content for settlements facing Smog Singers as their Node 2 Quarry monsters. Smog Singers are included in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Install guide
Character card
Pattern card
Pattern gear card
Settlement Event card

Basara comes with 2 miniatures. A painters scale model kneeling, perfect for hobbyists and a players scale model for gamers looking for a fun survivor stand-in.

Basara is packaged in a box that includes:

1 x Painters scale, hard plastic Basara miniature
1 x Players scale, hard plastic Basara miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 50mm base and elaborate scenic insert
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and insert
Large matte art print

Starving, Basara approached the pit. A rich, toothsome aroma lingered but nothing remained. Disappointed she plucked the red weed pushing up between the crystals at her feet. She nibbled experimentally as she hurried to catch up to the others. Numbing and invigorating spice burned her mouth, glittering smoke sizzled from her lips. When she stepped into the lanterns light, the others were blinded by kaleidoscopic refractions of rainbow-hued sweat pouring down her face. From that moment, her instrument had a new sound.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Infamy Avenged
description:
The Japanese had turned the Truk atoll into a fortress complete with airfields that could support hundreds of fighters and bombers. Seeking to protect the upcoming invasions of Eniwetok and Marshall Islands, the USN targeted Truk in Feb. 1944 to eliminate any threats posed to the American offensives, as well as potentially luring the Japanese fleet into a decisive action at sea. Task Force 58 launched a devastating attack, profoundly shocking the Japanese by the scale and destructiveness of the raid.

(Mini game with ATO #59 - Blind Faith)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Belt Trade
description:
Belt Trade is a 2-6 player game. The main aim of the game is to gain as many credits as possible by bidding on and trading goods.

Each player is a space caravanner attempting to gain the most credits by bidding on trading goods between earth and the asteroid belt. Player's will use the items they gain during one phase to count points. Then they will use those very items to bid a trade for the next phase of items! Your opponent's can disrupt your plans by bidding higher than you on items you sought after or by playing cards that prevent you from picking up certain items. Being vigilant in keeping track of what items have already been traded and obtained. Not doing so could lead to your opponents gaining more credits than you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Trading, Trick-taking

name: Night Night
description:
Night Night is a fun bedtime game with 8 ways to play. Created for babies (yes, babies!), toddlers and up!

Create a bedtime routine, tell stories, count sheep and play games to develop language, imagination, observation, memory and more! Includes familiar bedtime objects, friendly characters, fun locations and sleepy yawns all beautifully illustrated by Parker Jacobs (Yo Gabba Gabba!) giving you new ways to bond with your children.

Night Night is part of the Small Fries Games range designed to grow with your family. The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

8 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players. Suitable for ages 0 to 4+. (5 are co-operative, 3 competitive.) The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made in the UK. (FSC card, single use plastic free and Carbon Balanced with the World Land Trust.)

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Memory
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Take That

name: Scary Farm-Opoly Knott's Scary Farm
description:
Knott's Scary Farm themed Monopoly game.

"Stake a claim on mazes and scare zones to bury your opponent in a fog-filled nightmare."

"Haunting characters and some of your favorite scare zones makes up this special version of the classic board game! Bring the chills and thrills to your home! Perfect for collectors and players alike."
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Pentathlon moderne
description:
The modern pentathlon sport was invented by baron Pierre de Coubertin at beginning of XXth century, as a new olympic contest. The boardgame "Pentathlon Moderne" allows two to four players disput the five disciplines (fencing, swimming, riding, pistol shooting and running) of this sport on a boardgame. The aim of the game is to win more gold medals than your opponents.

Each player directs 5 athlete pawns and makes them progress on the different tracks by playing cards. The initial hand of cards is ten. When a player plays three of a kind, for example three "horse riding" cards, he must roll the dice to move his pawn forward on the equestrian course. You can also play a penalty card which cancels a set of threes placed by an opponent, or a bonus card which allows you to roll the dice twice on your turn. You can also simply discard a card and draw a new one.

Each time a discipline finishes, a gold, silver and bronze medal is distributed to the top three finishers.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Take That
publishers: Capiépa Éditeur: Jeux Éducatifs, Parker Brothers

name: Escape Room: The Game 4
description:
Race against the clock: you have 60 minutes to enter the correct keys on the Chrono decoder to escape. It will count down remaining time, and emit intense sounds to let you know you’re almost out of time. Can you escape?

4 exciting escape rooms with varying levels of difficulty. Intro "El Sotano" (The Basement), "El Tren del Salvaje Oeste" (Wild West Express), "Ladrones de Tumbas" (Tomb Robbers), "El Gran Robo" (The Switch)

Compilation of three adventures and an intro in Spanish, in other languages ​​they have been published in other formats. Until now the boxes had been numbered 2 and 3, this should be 4 but it doesn't say so.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending
publishers: Diset S. A., Identity Games International B.V.

name: Resident Evil: The Board Game – Gold Tyrant
description:
This is an exclusive expansion that includes a T-002 Tyrant model in gold plastic and boss behavior cards in a foil finish.

The Gold Tyrant can be used in the Battle Game mode and was created as acknowledgement of the Resident Evil board game community to reflect the Resident Evil video game legacy.

This expansion includes:

T-002 Gold Tyrant Monster Mini (40mm base)
Foil T-002 Gold Tyrant Behaviour Cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Puffin Rush: An Arctic Animal Adventure
description:
Help your hungry puffins make their way across the snowy Arctic to find a fish and get it home to their burrow. What other Arctic animals will you uncover along the way and will they help or hinder you?

Start from 1 of 4 sides of a 6x6 grid of snow tiles. On each turn you may move orthogonally to a new tile, whether revealed or not, taking the action for that specific tile. Find the fish and make it back to your puffin specific burrow before anyone else does and claim victory (and a tasty meal)!

It might be trickier than you think!

The whole area is covered in snow and who knows who you will bump into! Could it be a helpful reindeer or a friendly snowy owl? Try to avoid those hungry Arctic Foxes and the Grumpy Polar Bear!! And let's hope you don't run into a Blizzard!

This is a fast-paced game of chance, but who will win?!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Campaign Trail: The Endorser
description:
Originally available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

The Endorser

Starting Resources: $60M 6 voters
Advantage: You start with 5 "Endorsement" cards. Play these at any time (max of 1 per turn) to activate them in the state in which our pawn is located. This does not count as your normal play.
Disadvantage: Your number of voters for a default Campaign action is 5 voters (this may be modified by other effects in the game).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Astro Knights: Tactical Visor Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Tactical Visor
Tech
Cost: 3
Ability: Attack with any player's Weapon. Increase its damage by 1. (Place that Weapon in that player's discard pile.) Then, you may destroy that Weapon.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ascension Tactics: Miniatures Deckbuilding Game – Voidkin T'valemos Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Voidkin T'valemos
Cost: 7 Runes
Type: Void Hero
Ambush: Command one of your exhausted Champions for free.
Effect: Command one of your exhausted Champions for free. It has +6 Strength, +1 bonus Speed, and "Slay: Defeat an enemy Champion on the battlefield."
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fly Swatter
description:
Atrapamoscas (Flyswatter) is a skill based single card game for 1 or more players. Each player makes 3 attempts, in which players throw up the card and try catch it. They get points equal to the number of flies they are touching (10 in total) multiplied by the number of fireflies (3) that remain untouched.

The Red card version is the standard layout. The Blue card is of lower difficulty. The Pink card is more unpredictable.


Designed for the BGG 2023 1-card print and play design contest.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Adventures of Robin Hood: Variant for Experienced Players
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Variant for experienced players (Use these rules from Chapter 2 on)

1. Brave Enemies: If a player is prompted to place 6 purple cubes and 1 white cube into the bag when preparing a chapter, add 6 additional purple cubes to the bag. You will do this once for the whole group, regardless of the number of players

2. Wild Guards: Place a red cube on seal 4. If a seal is placed here, it will be activated and then placed back into the bag with all the previously drawn seals. Exception: The seals that show the octagonal symbol of the carriages will not be returned to the bag and will stay in the board.

3. Short On Time: When preparing a chapter, always put one less hourglass than is indicated in the book on the Bad End. Exception: Do not use this rule for the adventures "A Touch Decision" and "The Oath of the 13".
mechanics: Unspecified

name: SunFire
description:
The setting for the game: SunFire: Factions Against Fate is set in a vibrant medieval world powered by mana. Throughout the world there are a subset of people who can harness the power of mana in fantastical ways. These people have organized themselves into powerful factions that operate in cities across the continent. The game is set in one such city - Solamar - where six factions existed peacefully, until recently. The survival of Solamar has been challenged by an existential threat, the SunFire. Appearing without warning, the SunFire is a powerful beam of energy from the heavens that strikes down at Solamar and areas surrounding the city, leaving a scorched wasteland in its wake. The populace turned to the factions and their ability to manipulate mana for salvation. Initially, the factions worked collaboratively, designing a powerful arcane device to create a temporary magical shield over Solamar, protecting it from the SunFire. Ozonestones, glowing rocks mysteriously left in the wake of the SunFire, are consumed to fuel the device. Now, amidst increasingly urgent pleas from the people of Solamar to continue to fuel the device, tensions among the factions have been stoked. Their collaboration has turned to rivalry as each Faction believes they are the key to the city's salvation. Factions vie for the support of the people, while keeping Solamar protected from the SunFire.

The gameplay: Each player chooses a faction to lead and must ensure that the city is protected by the SunFire while earning the admiration of the people of the city. Players must guide scouts outside of the city to collect ozonestones and utilize them as currency to recruit new followers, build settlements, and construct buildings. Ultimately, each player seeks to accumulate 13 or more Control Points, which represent their influence over the population, to win the game. Each game is played in a series of rounds made up of five phases: exploration - explore outside of the city and collect ozonestones, donation - determine how many resources will be donated to defense of the city versus kept to enrich the faction, construction - what how new followers and structures to purchase, SunFire - feel the wrath of the SunFire and determine if the city is protected, and rewards - actions are rewarded with additional Control Points.

Players must devote ozonestones to both the competitive - enriching their faction - and cooperative - protecting the city - aspects of the game. Too much devotion to the city and the other greedier players will accumulate Control points quicker, too much greed and the citizens of the city will punish the player's faction.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: Side Quest: 7th Sea – Puzzle Duel
description:
Get ready for an epic duel filled with riddles. Puzzle Duel Promo is a set of cards for two players with various puzzles to solve. Both competitors play cards from their hands on their opponents and force them to crack the riddle! The person who does it faster wins the round! Do it a few times and defeat your opponent with a short duel game set in the 7th Sea World!

—description from the pubilsher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Smart10: Kysymykset 5
description: 200 new general knowledge questions with 2000 answers.
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: Smart10: Terveys
description: 100 new questions with 1000 answers. The questions are health-themed, with topics such as biology, psychology, diseases, treatments and medical achievements.
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: Grumpy Granny
description:
Grumpy Granny is not your average board game. It's a unique, action-packed game designed for 1 to 5 players. Your mission is to rack up those precious points by playing cards strategically while ensuring Granny doesn't lose her cool. With each card you play, you could either conquer the game or end up facing Granny's wrath!

Objective: Collect, Strategize, and Beat Granny!

Your mission? Outsmart Granny and collect the most points while playing your cards strategically. The cards in your hand hold the key to your success, but watch out for Granny's unpredictable moods!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Lose a Turn, Memory

name: La Mèn'che
description:
Mèn’che is an historically popular card game in the Namur and Bastogne area [in Belgium]. In order to breathe new life, a new game that casts the traditional version in a new light, evoking the rich fauna and flora of the Ardennes, has been designed.

The game components are 32 playing cards, 1 memo card and 16 tokens. The cards have a strength level (from 1 to 13) and they carry some points (from 0 to 4). Cards 9 to 13 are named the triyonfes and are unique : Mite (red), Coûne (blue), Canète (green), Mac Mahon (black) and Zè (red). 

The aim of the game is to be the first team to get rid of all their tokens (starting with 3, 4 or 5, depending on the desired length of the game) after playing several rounds.

A round is composed of dealing the cards, announcing the color of the mèn’che (trump card), announcing who has the triyonfes in their hands, playing the tricks and counting the points of each team at the end of the round. Depending on which teams announced the color of the mèn’che, the wining team discards a token or give it to the opposite team.

The game is made for 4 players but variants for 2 or 3 players are also explained in the rules.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Clownfish Cove Board Game
description:
Work together to help all the clownfish swim through the ocean to get to the fish school before Principal Shark arrives and locks them out! The clownfish are ready to make their way to school by crossing the ocean while avoiding sticky seaweed and collecting helpful treasure. But they better be quick! Principal Shark is on is way, and if he gets to the school first, he’ll lock all the doors and make the clownfish late for class.

In Clownfish Cove kids race through the ocean, trying to collect the seaweed and treasures that will help them along the way, while outswimming Principal Shark. Players will move across the board using their numbered cards to collect their seaweed and treasure tokens on their way to the school. Work as a team to move all the clownfish from their home to the fish school.

Clownfish Cove uses a bright and colorful underwater setting that makes swimming to school fun and imaginative. This cooperative game is a perfect introduction to basic counting, strategic thinking, and teamwork. Minimal reading makes this game perfect for kids ages 4 and up!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Реликвиум: Полководцы (Reliquium: Generals)
description:
Generals is an addition to the strategy board game Relic that opens up new possibilities for players. The add-on uses a modular principle - new mechanics can be added to the base game independently of each other.


Control a new class of troops - generals, whose strength depends on the achievements of the faction.
Forge alliances and declare wars using diplomacy cards, benefiting from faction relationships.
Make decisions based on event cards that change the course of the game.
Choose the path to achieve victory, the size of the empire still plays an important role, but is not decisive.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rory's Story Cubes Paw Patrol
description:
Roll the dice and create unique tales with Rory's Story Cubes! In this new version of the game, immerse yourself in the world of Paw Patrol and include your favorite characters in your stories.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Astro Knights: Atomic Gauntlet Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign.

Atomic Gauntlet
Weapon
Cost: 7
Attack: Deal 6 damage.
Ability: Each ally may draw up to two cards and then discard that many cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Aeon's End: Legacy of Gravehold – Reset Pack
description: The Reset Pack provides all of the cards, mats, sticker sheets, and tokens that players will need to reset the game so that they can play through the campaign again. One Reset Pack will be needed each time the game is reset.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: B-17 The 8th Air Force
description:
Purchase the game from the wargame vault: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/461829/B17-The-8th-Air-...
Europe is at war, the United States strongly enters Europe through England. Thousands of men enter as volunteers and several join the Air Force, serving in the B-17 Bombers.
B-17 The 8th Air Force is a game in which we will live the experience with a squadron of B-17, and in which the objective of each mission historically formulated in this game will be bombed.
This is a single player Roll And Write game with a minimum duration of 10 minutes.

To play it is recommended to have:
-The bomber sheet, the objective sheet
(It is recommended that the sheets have a polypropylene protector)
-An erasable marker.
-Various Dice D4-D6-D8

Objetive:

-Complete 1 game without 50%(8) of the bombers being shot down.

-Launch the bombs on the target.

-Finish the 25 mission campaign with the same group of bombers.

Within each game it can be terminated under the following conditions:

-If the group bombs the target and returns (Win)

-If 8 bombers are shot down the player (Loses)

-If you complete 20 cloud points (Lose)

-In each mission there are a number of points that determine defeat or triumph for the player.

-description from designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Obix Frutaventura
description:
Obix Frutaventura is a casual card game in witch curious creatures will compete to get the most fruits before they run out. But be careful, there are many dangers lurking around.

Accumulate points by collecting your favorite fruits and leaving the ones you don't like for others. But don't be too ambitious, because with every step you take away from home, predators are closer to you.

At the beginning of each turn, it is up to you to continue looking for more fruits or go home and secure the one you already got. Keep in mind that if the predators find you, you will lose all the fruit you have so far when you flee back home, so you will not be able to continue searching for the rest of the day.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Wings for the Baron: Deluxe Edition
description:
The Great War has been going on for nearly two years, and the Western Front has become a series of fruitless attacks and counterattacks. Germany must control the air to break the stalemate and win the war. The army turns to the aeroplane manufacturers to build the best planes to drive the Allies from the sky. Wings for the Baron gives you control of one of six companies, competing for lucrative contracts and the prestige of producing the best designs. Can you steer your business to produce the best fighters, bombers, and/or reconnaissance planes? Can you manage rising inflation, outwit your opponents through subterfuge and espionage, and lead your company to success?

Wings for the Baron is a 1 to 6 player game of economic and technological development in the German aeroplane industry during World War 1. The Standard Game focuses on German fighter development, and the Advanced Game adds development of bombers and recon planes. Experienced players can play the Standard Game in about 45 minutes and the Advanced Game in about an hour, making Wings for the Baron perfect for repeat play. The Deluxe GMT Edition adds to the gameplay of this beloved game by adding components and rules for a new sixth company (Siemens-Schuckert), as well as all-new art by artist Tim Allen and deluxe components.

The Standard Game of Wings for the Baron revolves around each company’s fighter efficiency as compared with the other German companies. The company with the most efficient fighters attempts to claim contracts first, while companies with less efficient fighters act later in the turn. If all the contracts are awarded and some companies have not rolled yet, they have to wait until the next turn (Hint…they need to improve the efficiency of their fighter so they roll earlier in the phase!). Companies earn money by using their factories to fulfill contracts. Each fulfilled contract earns a million papiermarks.

Wings’ Advanced Game adds two aeroplane types (recon and bombers), multiplying players’ choices. Recon and bombers enable the company to earn even more papiermarks (assuming they have factories that were not building fighters). Recon and bomber contracts, unlike fighter contracts, are unlimited—you can build all three types to earn papiermarks!

Each turn, a company has five actions they can perform: Build additional factories, conduct Espionage to learn the technologies from another company, increase your plane’s efficiency with new Design technology, conduct Research to find new technologies, or take your papiermarks to a neutral country and convert to gold by performing a Bank action. But there’s a catch: you can only perform a limited number of actions each turn! You will have to carefully combine these actions with your chosen Events, which can impact rival companies or benefit your own. Events range from obtaining a Talented Engineer for your company (which helps your Design rolls) to improving one of your designs by using technology obtained from captured Allied aeroplanes.

As the war rages on, the specter of Inflation lingers every turn. Inflation is unpredictable, and you may lose none, 25%, or 50% of your papiermarks every turn! Savvy owners will know when to use their actions to convert their papiermarks to Gold and when to risk Inflation. Inflation never causes you to lose your carefully stashed Gold! Additionally, the effects of the war are felt through the resolution of a War Status card which impacts Allied and German Morale, available contracts, and Allied plane technologies.

The game ends when one or both sides’ morale markers reach zero or when Inflation reaches Hyper-Inflation. Each company then determines their total wealth (papiermarks, Gold, plus such markers they got during play). The company with the most money is the winner!

Wings for the Baron also includes solitaire and 2-player variants designed by Ken Keller which lets you (and a friend) pit yourself against two (or three or four!) other Non-Player Companies (NPCs) in the Advanced Game. This solitaire variant is a tremendous challenge and uses simple procedures to run the NPCs. No flowcharts or complicated procedures necessary!

Components:
One Rulebook
One Playbook
126 Cards
Six Double-sided Player Boards
One Mounted Double-sided Game Track
Three Countersheets
Eight Dice
Six Wooden Cubes
One Solo Player Aid

-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Industry / Manufacturing, World War I
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Snille & Skrivkramp
description:
Snille & Skrivkramp is a Swedish board game about academic intrigues. It is a satirical strategy game. Players control a university with a bunch of professors and PhD's, vying for positions and publishing the most prestigious articles before their opponents to win.

Each players use action cards to play their 6 persons on the same 3 action spaces, Education (giving money), Socializing (giving more action cards), and Research (giving "writing time", used to publish articles which score victory points). All persons are played in stacks, and most of the actions cards revolves around placing and manipulating positions on these stacks. All resource gains are dependent on how many and which persons are on a certain action space. You will always give your opponents some resources, and enabling their future turns, so the main challenge of the game is to navigate this with strategy and timing.

Some small examples of the satirical part of the theme:
Among the cards to play are "defamation campaign", "Sauna with the head of department" or "new coffee machine".
Among articles to write are "article about the pointlessness of everything", "incomprehensible article that seems intelligent", or "AI-generated article".

The game plays until someone has published a fixed number of articles (decided before start of play, allowing for different lengths of the game). Then everyone plays a single round, and then the player with most victory points on their articles win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Masters of Crime: Mosquito
description:
Masters of Crime: Mosquito takes you to Latin America on the hunt for a legendary treasure, but the powerful secret organization "Mosquito" is one step ahead of you and wants the treasure for itself.

To play Masters of Crime: Mosquito, you'll use traditional apps like Google Maps or Wikipedia to gather information, while also collecting evidence, investigating crime scenes, and interrogating suspects.
mechanics: Connections, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: The Necronomicon Gamebook: Kadath
description:
The Necronomicon Gamebook - Kadath represents an extension of the Dreamlands chapters in Dagon and Carcosa, and broadens the gaming experience, but can also be read individually.

The Necronomicon Gamebook - Kadath will take you to the dark heart of the Dreamlands, where the truce between the nightmare priests is about to shatter.

Nyarlathotep, the Crawling Chaos, wants to awaken his lord, Azathoth the Daemon Sultan that bubbles at the center of all infinity.

Our reality exists only in the broken mind of this primal entity, consumed by its own power. Awakening the Greatest God could mean the end of everything.

However, Azathoth is not the only sleeping abomination upon which the fate of all existence hangs. Cthulhu, a blasphemous deity who waits dreaming in the lost underwater city of R'lyeh, does not accept the end of his oniric sovereignty.

And here you come in, attracted by an ancestral call during the ritual that every century opens a bridge towards the Dreamlands, you will go beyond the boundaries of time and space to move the needle of the Armageddon.

Description
80 pages B/W
116 playable sections
2 literary adaptations
25 different endings
Many horrible ways to die!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Horror, Novel-based, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Hushed Whispers Game Supplement
description:
This 15 card Game Supplement for the Dark Gothic Deck Building Game is themed around the secrets of Shadowbrook and its Town Elders, including new Event, Minion, Ally, and Gear cards for the Main Deck, as well as a set of new Shocking Discovery cards to add to the existing deck. This set also features the new Gold card cost game mechanic.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: スペースバッカニア (Space Buccaneer)
description:
Space Buccaneer is a space pirate-style deck heist board game that focuses on attack elements and comebacks.

Players become space pirates and fight to protect Mary, a girl who has been converted into a weapon.

In order to protect Mary, players will raid merchant ships and battleships on the voyage to collect loot and take it from other pirate ships to strengthen their ships.

In the end, use the spoils you collect along the way to survive the intense firefight between space pirates and get Mary.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Pirates, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Set Collection

name: Avatar: The Last Airbender – Fire Nation Rising: Cabbage Merchant Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign.

Ability:

+ 1 damage to Cabbage Merchant to -1 damage from any Starting Hero.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: ソクラテスラ 拡張版 (Sokuratesura shi no presentation)
description:
ソクラテスラ～キメラティック偉人バトル～拡張版 (Sokuratesura shi no presentation) (Socratesura - Battle Of The Chimeric Greats - Extended Death Edition) is a stand-alone expansion to ソクラテスラ (SocraTesla). This game introduces more legendary figures with which to build your chimera, and adds right-hand weapons too, making your fighters even more powerful. The player's hand size is increased to 8 cards, making it easier to summon the heroes.

Combining the two games allows 12 players in one game.
- user description
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Crimen en Casa: Sincharro Case
description:
The first case from Crimen en Casa. A series of detective games where you need to help solving the crime.

In this case Jorge was found dead in his office in the city of Sincharro. With the help of the evidence found, a city map, the local newspaper, witness statements, social profiles, digital trails and more. Follow the evidence, check the alibis and find the culprit.

Can you solve the murder mystery?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Deduction, Events

name: Do Not Go Gentle
description:
Global warming killed five billion people. They were the lucky ones. We who still live struggle daily against marauders, thieves and worse. After years of wandering and losing people, we found a small, defensible spot on the outskirts of a city. We are starting to settle, fortify, and rebuild. Each week, the vicious mobs come to take what little we have left. But we will not go gentle into that good night. We will rage against the dying of the light.

Do Not Go Gentle is a solitaire post-apocalyptic game of worker placement, base building, hand management, scavenging, and survival.

The game is played over six rounds. Your goal is to survive with at least one building left standing and one worker left alive at the end of six rounds. The game is played on a 9 x 9 map. You start the game with three basic building tiles: a basic farm, basic workshop, and basic weapons shop. Each round, you place survivors on building tiles to produce benefits to your compound (food, barricades, weapons, meds, and repairs ). At the end of each round, a vicious mob of marauders will attack the compound. You must strategically place your barricades, assign your survivors, and distribute your weapons to protect and defend against the ravenous marauders. Can you survive six rounds of increasingly more devastating attacks?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: The Battle of Doumyouji and Konda
description:
This battle occurred the day before the battle for Osaka Castle, where the Toyotomi clan fell in the 'Osaka Summer Battle (1615)'.

It is a reenactment of the battle in which Goto Matabei and Sanada Nobushige (Yukimura) and others attempted to intercept and gain the upper hand against Tokugawa Shogunate forces invading the Kawachi Plain from the Yamato and Kishu areas at Domyoji and Komoda, located south of the Yamato River in southern Osaka.

The game is made in government postcard size (100 mm x 148 mm) and was distributed as a special offer when purchasing products from online shops in Japan.

The game map and pieces to be used are printed inside the postcard size, the pieces can be cut out and played, and the rulebook can be viewed via QR code or web address.

The Battle of Yao and Wakae, which occurred on the same day as this battle, was also published simultaneously as a postcard game, and the two games can be linked together (the maps are not actually connected, but the game is played on two sides at the same time).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: The Battle of Yao and Wakae
description:
This battle occurred the day before the battle for Osaka Castle, where the Toyotomi clan fell in the 'Osaka Summer Battle (1615)'.

It is a reenactment of the battle in which Chousogabe Moritika and Kimura Shigenari and others attempted to intercept and gain the upper hand against Tokugawa Shogunate forces invading the Kawachi Plain from the Yamato and Kishu areas at Yao and Wakae, located north of the Yamato River in southern Osaka.

The game is made in government postcard size (100 mm x 148 mm) and was distributed as a special offer when purchasing products from online shops in Japan.

The game map and pieces to be used are printed inside the postcard size, the pieces can be cut out and played, and the rulebook can be viewed via QR code or web address.

The Battle of Domyouji and Konda, which occurred on the same day as this battle, was also published simultaneously as a postcard game, and the two games can be linked together (the maps are not actually connected, but the game is played on two sides at the same time).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Coinx Duel
description:
Dedication, focus, patience and speed are needed when venturing into a Coinx Duel!

Keep your eyes open, as the eyes staring back at you from the mission board are always watching. Make sure to finish the logic puzzle in the fastest way possible, to beat your opponent and jump to the next mission. The fastest Coinx Dueler wins the round!

Coinx Duel is a 2-player abstract strategy game to be enjoyed with friends and family members of all ages!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Gaivotas
description:
In Gaivotas you are just that: a seagull (Gaivota in Portuguese) trying to catch the biggest and best selection of fish.

Each round a series of fish cards are revealed on the table and players secretly choose which fish they want to catch, revealing their choice simultaneously.
If only one player has chosen a fish card, he takes the card, but if more than one player has chosen the same fish card, the seagulls flap in the air and catch nothing, getting only what's left on the fisherman's boat or even leave empty-handed.
Each fish card collected must be placed at one end of the player's line of cards, and the fish cards only worth points if the players manage to put together a school (fish of the same type next to each other).
When the deck of fish is finished, the player who has collected the most shoals is the winner.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Monopoly: The Witcher
description:
MONOPOLY: The Witcher lets players journey the Continent to buy, sell, and trade dangerous monsters from the popular video game franchise, such as Bruxa, Crone, Leshen, and more! Work magic around the board with custom show object tokens, including a Flaming Book, Lute, and Crystal Skull. Upgrade properties with Houses and Manors while managing Bounty and Law of Surprise situations. Be the last player with custom crown currency to win!

What's Included:
1 The Witcher Monopoly Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens (Crystal Skull, Flaming Book, Kaer Morhen, Lute, Roach on Roof, Swallow)
Custom Witcher Banknotes
28 Title Deed Cards (locations are monsters)
16 Chance Cards renamed Law of Surprise
16 Community Chest Cards renamed Bounty
32 Houses
12 Hotels renamed Manors
Dice
Rules
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Acting, Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Movement Points, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Moonrakers: Dark Matter
description:
A 35-card Moonrakers expansion that introduces a powerful and dangerous substance to the game—Dark Matter. The crowdfunding-exclusive Collector's Edition includes black foil cards.

The origin of Dark Matter is as unknown as the depth of its darkness. Often fabled as 'the most valuable substance in the galaxy,' its rarity is only matched by the danger inherent in its use.

Able to augment both organic life and machine, Dark Matter slowly takes control of its hosts—leaving only a shell of what previously existed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Divine Harem
description:
Arise as a Divine God of Lust and build the Ultimate Harem, in this competitive card game, inspired by harem style anime shows and visual novel games. Divine Harem is a 2-4+ player strategic card game for lustful people, full of sexy anime girls, just waiting to join your harem. It's simple to pick up and play and yet strategic enough to ensure multiple interesting games between friends.

The goal of the Divine Harem game is to build a complete Harem Pyramid, which is made up of three Harem Girls, two Harem Toys and one Harem Pet. The first player to complete their pyramid wins the game.

During a turn, players can perform 2 actions of the following:

Draw a Card from the Deck
Place a Card in your Harem
Play a Harem Power Card


(players can perform two different actions or two actions the same, as they see fit. E.g. playing two power cards)
Beware: When you place a card into your Harem, other players can attack your card, with cards from their own hand to try and prevent you from placing it into your Harem.
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Fire in the Library: Tool Cards Promo
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign as part of the Weird Giraffe Games Promo Pack 2023.

Includes 7 cards.

Add these cards to the tool cards from the base game and proceed as usual.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Thread the Needle
description:
This is a must follow trick taker that uses a Tarot deck and features bidding and point capturing.

The game uses traditional French Tarot card play with a few special abilities added and a new, easier scoring method.

The game is played over the course of 4-5 hands which consists of 15 cards per player. Players will be predicting what scoring level they finish in a hand based on the number of points they capture.
mechanics: Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Gamble Rabbit
description:
Gamble Rabbit is the game to either obtain the most money through 6 rounds of regular play, or obtain 3 carrot tokens at any time and win instantly.

One round consists of a “money phase” (first half) and a “gambling phase” (second half).
During the “money phase”, players take actions to increase their amount of money.
In the “gambling phase”, players place bets against each other and receive rewards or penalties based on their bets.
The game ends after 6 rounds. However, if one of the players owns 3 carrot tokens, it will be a special victory and that player wins. In this case, the game ends even before 6 rounds.
