Kursk: Burning Tigers. This is also a large, complete Panzer Grenadier game with 40 scenarios from the “northern flank” of the June 1943 Battle of Kursk; you’ll need this game for some German pieces.

Elsenborn Ridge. This is another large, complete Panzer Grenadier game with 40 scenarios from the “northern flank” of the Battle of the Bulge; you’ll need this game for some German pieces.

1940: Swallows of Death. This is an expansion for 1940: The Fall of France, a book with pieces for Moroccan troops fighting for France and 30 more historical scenarios.

1942: The Defense of France. This is a downloadable expansion for 1940: The Fall of France, with 88 pieces that you’ll have to assemble yourself (just like the pieces that come with this expansion), and ten more scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Les conquérants
description:
Viking, Japanese, Roman, and Egyptian armies set out to conquer the land! They gain ground by building fortresses. They must use strategy to bypass or hinder rivals they meet along the way and to return quickly to their castles.

Les conquérants is designed to help children aged 7 to 14 develop their planning skills and mental flexibility. The game encourages them to plan their movements and those of others, while adjusting to each turn. The various ways in which the game can be made more complex make it a great value, even for adults!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Pocket Air War: Definitive Edition
description:
Pocket Air War is a fast game of aerial combat in WWII you can play anywhere you want.

Each plane comes with a specific Dashboard. It is the core tool for playing a plane because you can find all the needed information on it. You can also use it to measure distances during Movement and Combat.

The Definitive edition includes all the planes to re-enact the following Operations Theatres:

Battle of Britain
Strategic bombing campaign in Europe
North Africa
Mediterranean
Italy
North Sea
Eastern Front
Early and late Pacific
Korean War


It also includes the new detailed damage model, solo play, crew skills and several other improvements.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Events, Measurement Movement, Movement Points, Movement Template, Moving Multiple Units, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Set-up

name: Ziggurat
description:
The ziggurat has been abandoned for centuries. It is old and crumbling. Vines crawl up its sides. The winds and rains have washed away its vibrant colors. The village that surrounds the structure has dwindled. People have moved away — but something stirs within its depths. Something awakens...

According to legend, a dragon once lived in it but that was hundreds of years ago. Now it's a place where weeds grow.
People have been seeing fire spirits on the ziggurat's levels. The elders are asking for volunteers to investigate. Finally, it's your chance to be a hero! You hope to find a dragon.

Ziggurat is a co-operative legacy game, with the story of the ziggurat unfolding over six chapters and with you making decisions during play that affect all of your games to come. As the story progresses, you will make permanent changes to the game, adding new rules, materials, and pieces to the board. Work together to complete the challenges that each chapter brings. The result is a co-operative adventure that you can play again and again!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Gardens of Uranus
description:
Available as a standalone game or as an integration to the Martian Gardeners Trilogy, making it the 4th game of the family.

Our friendly Martian Gardeners now want to plant flowers in Uranus. Help them achieve their secret gardening goals.

MATERIAL


3 boards representing gardens in Uranus with scoring tracks.
60 flowers in 5 different colors (12 each): Blue, red, yellow, green, purple.
A tube or box.
A deck of 36 mission minicards.
3 ‘trees’.
5 discs
6 black Martians in 3 types (2 each)
4 white Martians in 2 types (2 each)


GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

Players take turns planting flowers with their Martians or scoring their mission cards and getting more missions. A mission consists of a special arrangement of flowers on the board. At the end, unused flowers score negative points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Pattern Building

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Relics of the Past: Challenge Scenario
description: Relics of the Past is a special challenge scenario for Arkham Horror: The Card Game designed to be played with Monterey Jack. This scenario can be played as either a standalone scenario or as a side-story inserted into any campaign. In order to play this scenario, a copy of the Arkham Horror: The Card Game Core Set and The Forgotten Age Campaign Expansion are required.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 1795: The Thermidorians
description:
Those that had brought about the fall of Robespierre in Thermidor were dubbed 'The Thermidorians'. All agreed that the so-called 'Terror' had to be winded down but this in turn prompted the Royalists and Sans-culottes from re-emerging out of the the shadows. The Thermidorians want to ensure the survival of the Republic but they do not want to restore the monarchy, nor are they willing to preserve popular democracy. The Thermidorian faction starts this expansion with a slight advantage, but it is going to have to walk the sharp line in between the 'right' (Conservatives) and the 'left' (Radicals) in order to emerge victorious...otherwise, the 'Dry guillotine' awaits!

This first expansion is played with the 1793:Patriots & Traitors base game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Ownership, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Cartouche: Promo Pack
description: This pack contains 7 new achievements for Cartouche! Shuffle these new cards into the achievement deck during setup.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: D-Day Dice: Sillies
description:
A similar set of cards to the Funnies set.

Sillies is named after the comic strips presented in newspapers during the first half of the 20th century, Sillies is a set of Legendary Units inspired by the lighter side of life, including comic book characters, movies and boardgames culture.

Each of these 12 Legendary Units offers a unique RWB table that replaces the standard one and a set of 5 strongly-themed legendary cards. Additionally the set includes 4 War Stories.

These will help players beat the Bunker with a smile.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rewind: Tricks in My Mind
description: Tricks in My Mind is an expansion for Rewind. In this new way to play, players play a must-follow, no trump, low-luck trick-taking game. In the first round, the winner of each trick gets points, but the players not winning the trick get to make bets for the second round. In the second round, players play the same hand of cards again (just like in Rewind), but this time the goal is to make the first round bets come true. High score wins.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Seers Catalog
description:
The latest edition of the Seers Catalog has everything you need for stopping werewolves. Can you limit yourself to the essentials in time to save the village?

Seers Catalog is an almost-shedding card game in which each player tries to get rid of almost all of the cards in their hand. Each round, players have a unique set of artifacts that give them asymmetric abilities to help manage their hand of cards. When one player runs out of cards, the round is scored: Each card is worth -1, but if you have five or fewer cards in your hand, the lowest value on those cards is worth positive points! However, once you have five or fewer cards, you can no longer voluntarily pass, so holding on to a high-value card near the end of the round hoping for a big payout can result in total failure.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Variable Player Powers

name: Ojo, Mano, Pata, ¡Monstruos!
description:
There are so many monsters here! Let's sort them by the number of eyes, hands and legs they have. Who will be the fastest to do it?
In Ojo, Mano, Pata, ¡Monstruos! (Eye, Hand, Leg, Monsters!) You will work on your observation, attention and mental arithmetic in the most... monstrously fun way!

Components
20 x Double-sided Monster cards, with the monster's image on one side and the number of eyes, hands and legs on the other.
20 x Challenge cards, showing the body parts that you have to add up. There are 3 difficulty levels indicated with stars on the cards.

Goal of the game
Get the most stars from Challenge cards by being the fastest to properly guess the correct total number of body parts.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Trail Markers
description:
Trail Markers is a 1-2 player game that task you with finishing your hike before the elements stop you.

Each game you will pick one of four trails, and a set of equipment to help you along the way.

Each round you will roll the dice, pick a die from those rolled, and use its value to either move along the trail to complete your goal or assign it to your camp to gain access to abilities from your chosen equipment.

You need to be careful when picking dice, because if there are any dice of a lower value than what you choose, they become "exhausted." This gives you fewer dice to use in future rounds.

Manage your time, equipment, and dice to finish your hike in the given time, and receive the best possible score!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Set-up

name: Sunshine Farmer
description:
Roll the dice, plant the fruits, and cleverly manage the numbers to get the sudoku-style bonus!

Game Play
Players take turns to be the active player and roll the five dice. In clockwise order, each player chooses one of the five dice and writes down the number on an empty square of the matching color on their field board.

Special rules In 2-player games:
The sequence of choosing dice is as follows: Player A plants one die, followed by Player B planting two dice.
Player A then selects the fourth die, and there will be one remaining die.

After all players have chosen one die, there will be 1 or 2 dice remaining.


In a 2- or 4-player game, all players simultaneously plant this remaining die.
In a 3-player game, each player selects one of the two remaining dice to plant.


The game ends when all rounds are completed. Each player scores points from the following:


Points from the four colored fields. ("Fruit Field Score" table at the top of the board)
Points from the "Sunshine Blessings" areas. (Total value in the area)
Points from the "Carefully Planted Seed." (15 points per column/row with 6 distinct numbers)


The player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Music Party
description:
Join us for a musical party!
This is a music-themed party card game suitable for 2-6 players which is perfect for families to play together and also great for teachers to engage students in a fun experience! There are five distinct interactive games at the party for you to enjoy.


In the lively "Note Rush," see who can quickly play all their cards first by following the music notes with lightning-fast reactions.
In the cooperative "Mic Challenge," work together with your teammate to complete challenges before the opposing team.
Then, there's the music rhythm test of "Sing Along with the Beat," where accurately singing the right beats and keeping up with the speed is no easy task.
Test your melody memory in the "Goldfish Brain Showdown," where you might just forget the lyrics while singing.
Finally, there's the puzzle-based scoring game of "Pinyin Five by Five," where you'll strategize to score as high as possible within the square formed by 25 cards!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Music, Party Game, Racing, Real-time
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Singing, Speed Matching, Team-Based Game

name: LiftOff! 2
description:
LIFTOFF! 2.0 is the definitive, epic space-race to the moon board game, which updates the successful (1989) Liftoff! The Race to the Moon board game and its computer game, Buzz Aldrin's Race Into Space (1994). LIFTOFF! 2.0 is packed with additional content based on actual and proposed technologies that make this the most highly researched and complete simulation of man’s journey into space. Relive the Apollo 11 landing on the Moon!

Up to 4 players compete to be the first nation to land a man on the moon, and successfully return them home again.

During the activity turn all players receive their current income, an event card which may help or hinder, and can buy new hardware (rockets / satellites / capsules etc), try and develop the reliability of systems they already have (by buying dice and adding the total to the current safety), hire astronauts, and secretly plan future missions.

The launch phase sees players carrying out their missions in turn (as being first to achieve certain mission goals such as 'first man in space' is rewarded). The relevant hardware must be purchased, including a rocket powerful enough to lift the weight of the other items involved. The mission is carried out by following a series of steps, and rolling percentiles against the safety rating of specific items each turn - e.g. liftoff roll against rocket, orbital burn roll against space capsule, space walk roll against space suit etc.
If a player fails a safety roll, the advanced game contains several possible failure outcomes (requiring one or more further rolls) ranging from a bulb failure to a catastrophic explosion, which will reset the safety factor of your equipment!

Once missions are completed, players’ incomes are adjusted depending on successes / failures, and the next year begins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: D-Day Dice: Press Corps
description:
Journalists were on the frontlines during WW2, and this mini expansion is a homage to all the men and women who risked their lives to bring the news to the public. Without daredevils like Robert Cappa, Ernie Pyle and Martha Gellhorn, our knowledge of this conflict would be much, much poorer.
In addition to offering exciting original content, the cards included in this pack will allow players who don't have access to D-Day Dice: Overlord to fully enjoy the campaigns presented in To Do or Die.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 6: Gorgoden & Tormurack
description:
Mold and squish new terrifying monster miniatures out of Spell Clay by adding this set of evil spellbooks to your Necromolds board game collection!


Transform smashed monsters into gems to empower your golem army using the unique reclamation ability of Gorgoden!
Keep your friends and enemies close by snaring them in the barged chains of Tormurack—a living dungeon of no escape!
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Château Aventure: La Suite
description:
"Château Aventure" is a cooperative game in which you will experience extraordinary adventures in various worlds. It uses Jared A. Sorensen's Parsely system to mimic the play of a text-adventure computer game and features several of his original adventures.

This new release proposes 6 new scenarios :

Les Vengeurs Masqués
Île Aventure
Robot Aventure
Super World
Princess Aventure
Frigo Go Go
categories: Adventure, Book, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Shinobi: The Ninja Scroll
description:
Shinobi: The Ninja Scroll is an escape room-style puzzle game in which you will unravel mysteries, interpret clues, and decipher codes to join the ranks of ninja warriors. Can you stop the spread of chaos and restore peace to the land?

--description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Roll A Coaster Park
description:
You are managing a new coaster park. Build paths, rides and stalls and attract guests to your park. Each ticket sold is more money for construction, or hold on to your cash to grab victory.

Over 20 rounds roll two dice for everyone to use. One dice determines the type of action, and the other determines the size or effectiveness, and each player can decide which dice to assign where.

Several types of buildings are available:
Stalls allow more guests into your park and increase ticket prices.
Gentle Rides, Thrill Rides and Rollercoasters make space for guests to stay in your park, each with their own polyomino shape.
Corporate buildings give access to special abilities.

At the end of the game, whoever has the most money available wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fire in the Blue
description:
Fire in the Blue transports you to the strategic crucible of the Mediterranean, where iconic battles raged between the Axis and Allied forces. Witness the critical role of aircraft and submarines in scouting and unleashing devastating attacks. Experience the awesome hail of anti-aircraft fire and the fury of carrier-launched fighters as air formations engage in epic clashes.

Will you...


Secure vital supply lines for the British and defend Malta from invasion?
Cut off crucial resources and cripple the Allied war effort as the Axis?
Master the Art of Combat, balance your air formations, employing fighters and bombers for strategic strikes and aerial supremacy.
Command powerful fleets, employing cunning tactics and careful maneuvering to outwit your opponent?


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Minimap Resolution, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Однажды в Чикаго 1930: Новые времена (Once upon a time in Chicago 1930: New times)
description:
New Times is an additional case to the detective game Once upon a Time in Chicago 1930. This case is based on a new game principle: two teams investigate it in parallel, competing with each other. You can also play with one team in the "brainstorming" mode.

Новые времена - это дополнительное дело к детективной игре Однажды в Чикаго 1930. Это дело основано на новом игровом принципе: две команды расследуют его параллельно, соревнуясь друг с другом. Можно играть и одной командой в режиме "мозгового штурма".
mechanics: Deduction

name: Symptomatic
description:
Symptomatic is a light, card-based game about serious diseases. From Chicken Pox to the Bubonic Plague, getting sick has never been so fun.

Manage your cards and combine various symptoms to infect others with deadly diseases, while utilizing cures to protect yourself. However, be careful, as cures can have consequences too! The goal is to be the healthiest player in the group when the first player dies. The diseases in game are based on real life ailments, and require specific symptoms to infect another player. Assemble your hand to give a set of symptoms to your opponent, and watch out for the sets your opponents give you! Use both your real world pathology knowledge and your in-game strategy to dish out more diseases than you take.

Symptomatic, much like real life, requires critical thinking, strategy, and a bit of luck to stay healthy as everyone else suffers. Featuring plenty of brightly colored original art and goofy puns, Symptomatic is the mix of disease, decisions and dad jokes you never knew you needed. 

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: STAVKA: HQ Operations on the Eastern Front
description:
STAVKA is a 2-player wargame, played on a very high-level (only 40 hexes) map of the East Front. It focuses heavily on Reserve Management.

The game uses dice to represent Infantry armies and counters for Tank armies, Air assets, Cavalry corps and Security Divisions. Its major innovation is the absence of a movement phase - advance after combat is the only way the frontline moves. Demonstrating a functioning frontline is mandatory in the game; failing to do so at the end of a turn leads to your opponent's victory!

Playable in a single evening.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Peek-A-Hoot
description:
It's time to collect the loot and wake the hoot! Take turns checking in with the owl to see how he's feeling while racing around the forest gathering tokens that match your cards. Move your mouse around the board until you reach a stump. Then gently press down on the owl's head to see what you do next. If the owl is feeling happy, then you continue your turn toward your loot. But if he wakes up grumpy, you cannot move forward, and your turn is over. Don't forget about that fast track — avoid the owl if you can! When the first player returns to the starting space with all their loot, they win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Jubilee Hero Pack
description:
Orphaned as a teenager, Jubilation Lee survived on her own by taking up residence in her favorite shopping mall. After her mutant power to generate explosive energy manifested, she found a new home with the X-Men. Now, she uses her powers as the colorful hero, Jubilee —and she’s bursting her way into your games of Marvel Champions: The Card Game! With her unique emphasis on spending resources of different types, Jubilee is a flashy hero that can brighten up your battles.
This pack also includes a bonus modular encounter set featuring the assassin (and death trap enthusiast) Arcade!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: House Hounds
description:
Tighten your tool belt and get ready to build your team of construction workers to restore a variety of fixer-upper houses. The market is hot and the houses sell fast so the race is on to snatch them up first.

Some houses take more work than others, but the payoff is greater. Occasionally, you may run into an unexpected problem that requires an extra day on the job.

The person who builds the most value in their real estate portfolio, wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Trading

name: Watch It!!
description: Go back to the 90s when each home had only one television (TV). Family members compete to watch their favorite shows. When dad wants to watch a sports program but Grandma will watch documentaries. As for Grandpa, he wants to watch the news, but his son also wants to watch cartoons. The war for the TV remote to watch your favorite shows has begun!
mechanics: Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection

name: Trippy Trivia
description: Get ready to dive into this fast-paced, family trivia game with a twist; instead of shouting out the answers, you’ll use your colorful Mushroom Grabber to pick up the answers before other players! But be careful… some questions will trip you up along the way! From pop culture to history, movies to music, these 250 questions will test your knowledge and memory.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Neo-Morphosis: Infestation – Ella Ridley Expansion
description:
An Kickstarter exclusive playable character which comes with the following that can be used with Neo-Morphosis Infestation:

1 detailed plastic Ella Ridley miniature
1 ID card

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Leanin' Tower of Pizza!
description:
Leanin' Tower of Pizza - The savory game of pizza stackin'! Spin the wheel and find out which pizza to stack next, and if it will be face up, or face down. How high can you stack them?!
This free 3D print-and-play game consists of 8 of each type of pizza (cheese, sausage, pepperoni), stacking pan, and a unique pizza storage wheel with built-in spinner. The game fits perfectly inside a 3D filament refill box and a PDF file is included with the box cover art and game instructions to complete your own game.
An optional “Tippy Toppings” mini expansion has also been added to the game. Includes 5 unique toppings that are added to the stack anytime the spinner stops in the same zone 3 times in a row. Add bacon, pineapple, jalapeno, mushrooms or anchovies to your pillar of pizza!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stacking and Balancing

name: Cheech And Chong-Opoly
description:
Introducing Cheech & Chong-Opoly, the hysterically high-stakes cannabis board game that will have you and your buds in stitches! Designed for players aged 18 and above, this game is your ticket to a trippy journey from Pot Luck Farm to The Courthouse.

Roll the dice and navigate the board to acquire legendary properties like the Big Bambu Dispensary, Pedro's Farm, and the Hempire Dispensary. Manage your stash wisely, as you collect extra cash from the Welfare Office or face the Munchies Tax that could leave you feeling the financial burn.

But watch out for Sgt. Stedenko – one false move, and you might find yourself in the joint, man! Cheech & Chong-Opoly promises a blend of humor, strategy, and good vibes as you compete to build the ultimate cannabis empire. So, lock up your Labradors, gather your best buds (pun totally intended), and get ready to roll, laugh, and toke your way to victory in Cheech & Chong-Opoly – where the game is as elevated as your spirits!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Last Command
description:
The Last Command is a detail-oriented space combat strategy game, lovingly crafted to simulate the relationship between a starship and its crew. Whether playing as the Federation Remnant or the Sunder, victory hinges on maximizing the potential of your crew and ship systems with gameplay utilizing dual deckbuilding, worker placement and resource management!

Ready your crew and Man all stations!
At the heart of The Last Command is an intuitive dual deckbuilding system that has players constructing a powerful ship system deck and a second deck consisting of crew members that can maximize those systems potential and provide the energy to power them. Multiple system cards can be played into a ship location, but the topmost card has the potential of unlocking powerful end of turn bonus abilities if crew with matching expertise are present in that system.

Become A Legendary Fleet Captain!
Cards played to your ship remain in play until you attempt to draw from their respective deck and that deck is empty. To achieve victory, captains must learn when to push their system’s limits and when to recall them. If a captain is able to reduce the hull strength of his opponent’s ship to zero, then the battle has been won and glory and honor is theirs!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Tags, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Until the Bitter End: Tanks – Eastern Front
description:
Welcome to Until the Bitter End - Tanks: Eastern Front, a World War II wargame. This is the forth game in the Until the Bitter End series and the second that focuses, solely, on tank (and other armoured fighting vehicles) battles. This is a print and play game for solitaire and two-players. This is a standalone game in my series of WW2 print and play games. You don't need to have played or own the first games - all of the digital PDF files are included (you simply print it out, provide yourself with a regular six sided dice and a pencil).

—description from the publisher
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Arena of Blood
description:
In Arena of Blood, you are the proud owner of a gladiator school, with a stable of gladiators, all with different fighting techniques and abilities. Careful use of your fighters is crucial. Each gladiator has strengths and weaknesses.
In Arena of Blood the classes of gladiator affect the combat sequence. Your gladiator has abilities, but when you get hit, you must choose which ability to forfeit. Crowd favor also plays a part in strategy.

Pit your gladiators against your rivals in the Arena of Blood! Matches are quick. Play a whole tournament in an evening.


No Need To Measure * No Movement Values *


To play Arena of Blood you’ll need:


this rule book
several 6-sided dice
an ordinary deck of playing cards
a place to play
miniatures of your favorite gladiators


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: MARETTA: Extra Carnivore Pack
description:
This is a Maretta Boardgame Expansion.

It add:
1 Meeple (expanding the game to Six Players)
1 Raft / Mine Cart
1 new Blue Steamship
14 new resource cards, which changes a little the mechanic and the equilibrium of the game.

2 game twists added to the game.
You can download them clicking on the QR code on the box back or visiting the CREARDO Website.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Racing
mechanics: Race, Set Collection

name: Memoria de Chasqui
description:
The Chasquis were young people who traveled extensive roads of the Inca state to carry messages from one post to the other. They were people trusted by the Inca and were well prepared for this task.

Memoria de Chasqui challenges you to travel through paths trying not to forget a word of the messages you have been given.

HOW TO PLAY?
Each player follows their own path, carrying different messages and overcoming adversity. The winner will be the one who arrives at the Inca first and remembers exactly every message that was given to him during his journey.

WHAT IS IT FOR?
Helps stimulate memory and concentration. It immerses you in the fantastic world of chasquis while you have fun playing.
mechanics: Memory

name: Mini Rogue: Mountain of Torments
description:
Nightmares and horrors await behind these doors.
You will face many disturbing challenges: each step may be your last.


Delving cards test your risk-taking tendencies in between areas.
Torments grant you a small bonus in order to smother the evergrowing madness flooding you. Contain it or you'll face your tormentor!
Cursed Jewelry give you access to extra abilities that you can refresh at a cost.
Scrolls are very powerful tools, but you cannot control which one will come to you.


Finally, the new Character, Rooms and final Boss will bring even more hype and replayability to your games!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Merchants of Sky Islands
description:
空島の商人 (Sorashima no Shonin) (Merchants of Sky Islands) is a tile placement game from Japan.

The Sky Islands float on the sea-filled planet Aquarius. The trade between the Sky Islands flourished by operating vehicles that used flying stones that generated anti-gravitational energy. This game is a story of the great trading era on the Sky Islands.

When tiles are placed, resources can be obtained through trade with neighbouring islands. Using the resources you gain, you can build trading posts, harbours, and towers to strengthen your power. Players compete for the majority of empty islands, and the player who earns the most victory points wins.

海一面の惑星「アクエリアス」に浮かぶ空島。
反重力エネルギーを生み出す飛行石を使った乗り物を操り、空島と空島の交易は栄えた。
このゲームはそんな空島における大交易時代のお話。

タイルを配置すると、隣接する島との交易により資源を得ることができます。
得た資源を使って、商館を建てたり、港を建てたり、塔を建てたりして勢力を強めていきます。
空島のマジョリティを競い、最も多くの勝利点を稼いだプレイヤーが勝ちとなります。
--description by publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Bitcoin: the mining game
description:
Thematic game about Bitcoin mining, in american style. The game can be played in two modes: as a simple party game or as a standard boardgame. Both modes can be played from 2 to 10 players, but for 6 or more players the party game mode is probably the best choice.

Players are miners that start to mine Bitcoin at home, by betting energy and selling Bitcoin to get more energy. When played as a party game, the game requires very little room for the game board and just few components: players can sit around the board, or even few meters away, since the main mechanics are just bidding energy to get Bitcoin cards and sellig cards to get energy. A complete game is played in 4 eras, where each era represents one 4 years cycle (Bitcoin's halvings). Players can agreed to play just 1, 2 or 3 eras.

The party game and standard game modes shares the same mechanics, the only difference is that when the game is played as party game the Bitcoin cards are used just as victory points, that is: the text printed on the cards is ignored. On the opposite, when played as a standard boardgame, an Action phase is added to end of each game turn. During this Action phase players can play the cards they collected to get benefits and trigger special effects. This adds more strategy to the game experience, and reduce luck dependances.

The standard boardgame leads each player to become aware of his approach to Bitcoin. Depending by the cards and the strategy, each player can decide to use Bitcoin just as an economic asset, or to improve it as software developer, or to mine more Bitcoins improving his rigs, or even as a human science expert, exploiting the social and psychological aspectes of Bitcoin. Specializing in just one aspect it's not easy, therefore usually each players will build a mixed profile with all these skills.

Because investing time it's often better than investing money.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Income, Market, Player Judge, Push Your Luck, Random Production, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Le Chemin de la Maison
description:
Help Pirouette the squirrel to go back home!

Plan Pirouette's moves by placing your card at the right moment on the Forest board... When all the little strategists around the table have laid down 5 cards, reveal them and move Pirouette !

—description from the publisher

You win if Pirouette gets back home. If the deck of cards is empty, the team loses.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Programmed Movement

name: ROVE: Expansion Collection 2
description:
A collection of expansions for ROVE: Results-Oriented Versatile Explorer:

ROVE: Fascinating Flora
ROVE: Reconfigured
ROVE: Tourist Traps
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Moratia Card Quest Game
description:
In Moratia Card Quest Game, play as adventurers going on quests to build their own legends and maybe even save the world! Gather your equipment, go on quests, and triumph over your enemies! Will you be Moratia’s next legendary hero?

At its core, Moratia Card Quest Game is an inventory management style game. To succeed you must balance your utilization and possession of three point types: Quest Points to open Quests, Power to beat Quests, and Renown to win the game. Each card you gain has various benefits or can be discarded for its Quest Point value to open new Quests. So it’s up to you to decide how to best utilize the Spoils you gain along your journey to legendary status.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing, Take That

name: RAF Bomber Command: Lancaster
description:
RAF Bomber Command: Lancaster (Expansion 4) is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire wargame expansion using a tables-based game engine simulating the British RAF Bomber Command nighttime bombing campaign against Germany during 1943-1945.

As the pilot of an RAF Avro Lancaster heavy bomber, your ultimate goal is to survive a 30-mission tour of duty. You and your crew will be assigned with taking part in nightly area bombing raids against various German cities from 1943 to 1945 in an attempt to break the will of the German people. But it won’t certainly be a cake walk, as Luftwaffe night fighters will be hunting your bomber streams, not to mention navigation challenges over open water and deadly FLAK you will encounter over the target cities.


One D6, one D12, and two D10 dice are required to play.
5 minute game setup and breakdown times.
A medium size table is recommended for game setup.
Total play time to complete a full 30-mission tour of duty takes approximately 10-15 hours, with a typical mission averaging 20 minutes.
Adjustable starting difficulty based on player's skill level.


With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with detailed damage modeling, fuel management, numerous crewmen skills, mission weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, RAF Bomber Command: Lancaster (Expansion 4) offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you up to the challenge of surviving a 30-mission tour of duty?

—description from the publisher

The game is available as Print and Play on Wargame Vault.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Operation Meteor
description:
Operation Meteor is a solitaire game of planetary assault in which you take command of the human colonial forces fighting to free Earth from the machines.

A century in the future, a rogue Artificial Intelligence has taken over the Earth and is bent on exterminating humanity. Yet the Lunar Colonies remain free, and now they've launched an invasion from space to liberate the homeworld. Can you stop the robot apocalypse before mankind becomes extinct?
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Rivals of the Mirrored City
description:
The Mirrored City of Shadespire is a nightmare plane of illusion and madness, an ever-changing labyrinth of endless stairs, cramped streets, and soaring archways. Many roving warbands enter this damned place to claim the treasure, secrets, and glory that await within – but few escape victorious, or even alive...

It’s time to return to Shadespire in this new expansion for Warhammer Underworlds! Four classic warbands return to the game, complete with updated fighter cards and a new, complete Rivals deck for each. Unleash the chilling power of the Briar Queen, flood your foes with Spiteclaw's Swarm, crush enemies with the might of Mollog, and employ the madcap tricks of Zarbag and his gitz – all to lay low your rivals, and claim victory.

—description from the publihser
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: This Quar's War: Clash of Rhyfles
description:
It seems the Quar have always been at war. When the first wandering clans of insect gatherers built their low, mud-walled buildings, it was as much to keep out other Quar as the wild animals. As they first learned to make tools to get food, they quickly learned to make tools to defend themselves. The mud walls quickly became fortified citadels, and then city-states. In five thousand years of civilization, the only constants of their culture have been the changing of the seasons and the threat of war.

Quar are just like you and me - perfectly normal creatures, bereft of magic or supernatural powers or other-worldly technologies. They do eat bugs, though, and lots of them. Most quar, when they’re not fighting each other over slights real or imagined, are farmers, or traders, or merchants. Mostly they live simple, happy lives full of hard work, ale and the occasional overeating of mothcakes.

But there are other quar - ambitious, striving quar - for which a mere warm bed and full belly are not enough. These are the ones that scheme, that connive, and their machinations bring whole nations and kingdoms into conflict. Constant conflict, brutal conflict, for the history of Alwyd is written in blood.

The Long War is entering a new phase. Gather your weapons, choose your side, and prepare to begin your chapter in the history of this grand conflict.

This is a two-player game that features 24 hard plastic Quar (12 Crusaders and 12 Coftyrans), 24 hard plastic dual-use bases, 10 activation cards, 6 D6 dice, and a 48 page rulebook. There is also a selection of cut-out terrain on the box sides to help bring your battlefield to life!
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Le Franc Tireur #16: PTO Revisited
description:
The issue is similar to Le Franc Tireur, #12 and is focused on the Pacific Theater. 4 articles from issue #12 have been updated and are included in this issue. 14 of the 15 scenarios feature the Japanese vs various opponents, the 15th is French vs Chinese. The period covered is 1941-1946.

The magazine includes 12 maps, which are sold separately for US customers. The maps are double-sided with one side being regular jungle (within the hex) and the reverse side being dense jungle (inherent terrain, including the hexsides). The boards included are 32, 33, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39, 47, 62, 67, 75.

Contents:
• 80 page magazine
• 12 double sided maps
• 7 sheets of overlays (approximately 50 overlays)
• 15 scenarios

Magazine Contents
– Editor’s Foreword
– 10 questions to Olli
– Tiger Meet 2022 : The Last Bid + Men of Steel
– Tiger Meet 2023
– The Forgotten Blitzkrieg
– Japanese Tank Division 1942
– ASL humor
– A Mediocre Dragon
– "Bambrush ?"
– PTO Basics *
– LFT maps artwork
– LC Charts
– Japanese MMC Chart
– Defending in Japanese scenarios
– Sons of Beaches *
– Seaborne Assaults *
– Sims Ridge *
– Bibliography

The four * articles are updated LFT 12 articles.

Scenarios
• LFT 327 - Thai Beaches (Thai vs Japanese)
• LFT 328 - Punjabi Tenacity (Punjabi vs Japanese)
• LFT 329 – Gaining Time at Baliuaq (Japanese vs US)
• LFT 330 – Qunauan Point (Japanese vs Filipino)
• LFT 331 - Rescuing the Pocket (Filipino vs Japanese)
• LFT 332 - Point of Departure (Filipino vs Japanese)
• LFT 333 – Goodenough? (Japanese vs New Zealand)
• LFT 334 – Cpl Anzac (Japanese vs New Zealand)
• LFT 335 – Infuriatingly Invisible (Japanese vs New Zealand)
• LFT 336 – Fourteen Paddles (Japanese vs New Zealand)
• LFT 337 – Not So Ichi-Go (Chinese vs Japan)
• LFT 338 – RJ-177 (Japanese vs USMC)
• LFT 339 – Zig Zag Pass (Japanese vs US)
• LFT 340 – Spring Cleaning (Japanese & Vietminh vs French)
• LFT 341 – Harvesting Opium (French vs Chinese)

The following boards are required to play all the scenarios: LFT1, LFT2, 9, 23, 35, 36, 37, 38, 43, 62, 67, 72, 76, 88, HZ1 (Hazardous Movement).

Portions of this description are from the publisher's website.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Dark Trickey
description:
A fun, fast paced game of Trick-Taking and saving all humanity from cosmic horrors!

Based on the familiar mechanism of trick taking, Dark Trickery turns the genre in strange, cyclopian angles by making the game play cooperative.

Players work toward a common goal of closing the 5 gates through which the Great Old Ones seek to enter our reality to devour our world and all mankind.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Trick-taking

name: Elemental Dragons: Gather your Treasure
description:
In the mythical realm of Elemental Dragons, players embark on a journey to harness the powers of the four elemental suits: earth, water, fire, and air. The goal? To amass a hoard of precious dragon gems, the coveted currency of this world. But beware, for amidst the riches lie hidden dangers in the form of dragon eggs, which bring negative scores to those unfortunate enough to acquire them.
In Elemental Dragons, players engage in a battle of wits, employing elemental powers to outmaneuver their opponents. Each round, players compete to win tricks by playing cards of higher value and utilizing the unique abilities of the powerful dragon cards.
At the outset, a dominant suit is randomly determined. Then, the first player to play a card sets the lesser dominant suit if their played card does not belong to the dominant suit. Thus, the order of precedence emerges: dominant suit, followed by the lesser suit, with the remaining two suits only useful in this round for their powers. The dragon's powers will enable you to change the dominant suit, steal gems from the trick, and poison the trick with eggs among other things. Each player plays a card either to try to win the trick, or to play a useful power for them, or both. Then there is a second round of card exchange, offering players the opportunity to exchange their initial card for another, only if the new card can win the trick. Players also can choose to "downgrade" their card for an egg card, poisoning that trick for the winner by nullifying gems from the final score.
This mechanic injects an element of bluff and double-bluff into the gameplay, as players must carefully consider when to reveal their most potent cards and when to conceal their true intentions.
As the game unfolds, players must carefully balance their pursuit of dragon gems with the risk of acquiring detrimental dragon eggs. Enter the world of Elemental Dragons and unleash the power of the elements in this thrilling trick-taking adventure.

—description from the publisher (translated)

En el reino mítico de los Dragones Elementales, los jugadores emprenden un viaje para aprovechar los poderes de los cuatro palos elementales: tierra, agua, fuego y aire. ¿El objetivo? Acumular un tesoro de preciosas gemas de dragón, la codiciada moneda de este mundo. Pero cuidado, porque entre las riquezas yacen peligros ocultos en forma de huevos de dragón, que otorgan puntuación negativa a aquellos desafortunados que los adquieren.
En Dragones Elementales los jugadores participan en una batalla de ingenio, empleando poderes elementales para superar a sus oponentes. En cada ronda, los jugadores compiten para ganar bazas jugando cartas de mayor valor y utilizando las habilidades únicas de las poderosas cartas de dragón.
Al principio, se determina aleatoriamente un palo dominante. Luego, el primer jugador en jugar una carta establece el palo subdominante si su carta jugada no pertenece al palo dominante. Así, surge el orden de precedencia: palo dominante, seguido por el subdominante, con los dos palos restantes solo útiles en esta ronda por sus poderes. Los poderes de los dragones te permitirán cambiar el palo dominante, robar gemas de la baza y envenenarla con huevos, entre otras cosas. Cada jugador juega una carta ya sea para intentar ganar la baza, o para jugar un poder útil, o ambos. Luego hay una segunda ronda de intercambio de cartas, que ofrece a los jugadores la oportunidad de cambiar su carta inicial por otra, sólo si la nueva carta puede ganar la baza. Los jugadores también pueden optar por "rebajar" su carta por una carta de huevo, envenenando esa baza para el ganador al anular gemas de la puntuación final.
Este mecanismo introduce un elemento de engaño y doble engaño en el juego, ya que los jugadores deben considerar cuidadosamente cuándo revelar sus cartas más potentes y cuándo ocultar sus verdaderas intenciones.
A medida que el juego avanza, los jugadores deben equilibrar cuidadosamente su búsqueda de gemas de dragón con el riesgo de adquirir perjudiciales huevos de dragón. ¡Entra al mundo de los Dragones Elementales y libera el poder de los elementos en esta emocionante aventura de captura de bazas!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Battle Bake
description:
Welcome to Pawris, the bustling city of entertainment. Here, the greatest bakers gather at Le Délice bakery where the flames of fierce competition fuel the ovens. As one of the bakers, you'll be competing in the culinary arts by baking and selling the most delicious desserts; the best bakers will not only be able to fuse together the finest ingredients to perfection, but also strategize against their competition and sabotage their work.

Start each turn by rejuvenating your pantry with new ingredients. Players will then use action points to prepare, bake, present, and sell their delicious desserts. Amid the baking chaos, players will have the opportunity to sabotage other players or improve their own position through the power of effect cards. Each character also has a unique set of abilities which will influence their strategy during the game.

The skilled bakers have a selection of recipes they can bake, these recipes are categorized in four different tiers of difficulty. The more difficult the recipe, the greater the bonus a baker will attain. The baker with the best strategy and a bit of luck will be the one who claims the title Virtuoso!

So, whisk up, knead down, and bake your way to glory!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Free Ride USA
description:
During the 1950s, the network of railway lines in USA was modernized because of new diesel locomotives. This allowed people to travel to the major cities to visit beautiful old and new structures worth to see.

In Free Ride USA, you are taking charge of rebuilding the railway lines and carry passengers to the cities. Your railway lines and state-owned railway lines are free of charge, while you must pay fellow players to convert their lines into state-owned railway lines.

Choose travel routes from an open display of city cards and gain additional coins for the long east-west connections. Visit as many different cities of America as possible to gain the most victory points.

Free Ride USA also offers a difficult solo challenge!
mechanics: Connections, Contracts, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Amos: Němčina v kostce
description: Amos: Němčina v kostce is a distinct entry in the Amos game series, focusing on the German language. This particular version involves rolling dice that are marked with letters from the German alphabet, distributed based on their typical frequency of usage. Players aim to form words from the letters displayed after a roll, organizing them either separately or interconnected like a crossword puzzle. Each letter is assigned a point value, and the game's objective is to gather the highest score by creating the most valuable words possible.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Spelling

name: Amos: Angličtina v kostce
description: Amos: Angličtina v kostce is a distinct entry in the Amos game series, focusing on the English language. This particular version involves rolling dice that are marked with letters from the English alphabet, distributed based on their typical frequency of usage. Players aim to form words from the letters displayed after a roll, organizing them either separately or interconnected like a crossword puzzle. Each letter is assigned a point value, and the game's objective is to gather the highest score by creating the most valuable words possible.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Spelling

name: Amos: Matematika v kostce
description: Amos: Matematika v kostce is a distinct entry in the Amos game series, focusing on basic mathematics. This particular version involves rolling dice that are marked with digits and basic operations' symbols like addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, lower and greater. Players aim to form equations from the numbers and symbols displayed after a roll. Each correct equation is assigned a point value, and the game's objective is to gather the highest score by solving the most equations possible.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Altar: One Must Prevail
description:
Experience the thrilling world of Altar like never before with this groundbreaking expansion.

One must prevail revolutionizes gameplay by introducing a solo mode, allowing you to embark on an epic adventure all on your own.

No longer bound by the constraints of multiplayer, you can now delve into the realms of Altar at your own pace and immerse yourself in a captivating solo experience.

But that’s not all. Alongside the introduction of solo play, One must prevail brings forth a new deity – the enigmatic and unpredictable God of Chaos. This deity’s abilities will test your strategic thinking and adaptability like never before.

Prepare to navigate the twists and turns of chaos itself as you harness its immense power to shape the fate of Altar.

Are you ready to face the challenges of Altar alone and confront the chaos that awaits? Prepare to embark on an unforgettable solo adventure. One must prevail beckons you, with boundless possibilities and the thrill of unruly unpredictability.

Will you find order in the chaos or succumb to its whims? The choice is yours. Will you prove yourself worthy?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities

name: Coaster Cutters
description:
Almost everyone has experienced the irritating feeling of waiting in a never-ending amusement park line. Coaster Cutters scraps the traditional first-come, first-serve line advancement system. All riders battle to solve riddles and dodge obstacles to ride the rollercoaster first.

Riders advance through the line by solving riddles. 2 teams face off against one another. Both teams alternate solving a riddle per turn in 1 minute. If a team answers the riddle correctly, they can advance farther with the ability to roll two dice. If the team answers incorrectly, they advance at a slower pace by rolling only one of the dice. Either team is subject to encounter a setback by landing on an obstacle!

Gather your crew for a thrilling adventure as you navigate through challenging obstacles in an effort to ride the rollercoaster before the other riders. Test your thinking skills along with luck and see who will emerge victorious in this fun-filled game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn

name: Lure: Deepwaters
description: Lure: Deep Waters adds 15 new, harder-to-catch fish and a new d4 die per player to roll more precisely.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling

name: Force of Virtue
description:
Force of Virtue is a fast paced skirmish wargame set in Rome during the rise of the Borgias. Grow and shape your warband as you lead them in daring raids across the ruined landscape of the Eternal City.

Use cards to choose your troops equipment, training strategies and lay hidden traps for your opponent. Command your troops with the virtues of prudence, audacity, speed and fortitude and grow your warband as you triumph.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Forest Dash
description:
Embark on this fast-paced squirrel challenge to collect precious acorns before winter arrives. In Forest Dash, 2 to 6 players can compete by determining their choices by rolling the dice to obtain the best resources among those available and obtaining precious points for the final victory. Face exciting challenges, balancing risk and strategy in the best way possible to prevail over your opponents. Forest Dash is the perfect game for the whole family!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hawaiki islands
description:
Step into Hawaiki, where the greatness of your town is in your hands. Travel the archipelago, get resources and build towns to be the largest in Polynesia. Only one will go down in history.

Hawaiki is an introductory eurogame with different levels of strategy where we have to get resources from the market to build cabins over the islands and make offerings to the goddess of the sea, who will watch over our movements.

Increase your reputation by choosing the best place on each island, creating communication between them, dominating their resources, making offerings and trading with other players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Market, Worker Placement

name: La Casa de Papel: Escape Game 3
description:
The Ultimate Heist!
Third part of the Escape Room type game from the Netflix series La Casa de Papel. The big end! After robbing the Spanish banknote printer, steal the gold reserves of the National Bank of Spain and liberate Rio. Again the teacher will guide you to escape from the Bank of Spain with 90 Tons of Gold.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
mechanics: Deduction

name: Bałagany
description:
Welcome to the world of Messy! There is complete chaos in your house, garage and garden. Everything is lying where it shouldn't be - toys are in the kitchen, sheet music is in the bathroom, and someone has scattered keys and cards all over the house. Will you be able to restore order while spinning fascinating stories? Take up the challenge!

Everyone will find something for themselves in the "Bałagany" game, we have prepared 4 variants of great fun for you. In each variant, we play searching for various objects or animals in the house, garden and garage. You can play the cooperative, competitive or storytelling variant. Additionally, you can come up with your own rules and gameplay variants. You are only limited by your imagination!
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Keyframes
description:
You are a talented group of animators looking for a job, and you have reached the last test in the recruiting process of the prestigious Cheesetoon Network studio. However, if you want to get the single vacancy in the company, you will have to compete to determine who is able to create the perfect frames in the best animation sequences.
In Keyframes, you will have 3 rounds to prove that you deserve the vacancy. To achieve this, each one will have a hand of frames (cards) and another 5 frames will be placed in the center of the table. In each turn you must play a card from your hand, which you will reveal simultaneously to determine the turn order of the next phase. In this second phase, we will build sequences by selecting one of the available frames, among which will be those used from the players' hand to determine the turn order. But pay attention! You can only have 2 projects open at the same time on your work table, and the sequence you add must be correlative with the ones you have, moreover, you can only add it if it is the prior or subsequent frame form the one you were working on previously. If it is not possible to add it following this rule, you must close your current project to start a new one, which will penalize you in the final scoring. If you are able to make more and better sequences than your rivals, the job will be yours!
Keyframes is a game created by the acclaimed Shei S. and Isra C., creators of titles such as The Red Cathedral, The White Castle, Shinkansen: Zero-Kei,1987 Channel Tunnel, Ramen... among a good handful of other great games, and illustrated by the amazing animation artist Cristina Achaui. Keyframes is a “filler” with very simple rules, which combines turn order bidding with a restrictive set collection which will force you, each turn, to calculate the best time to play which card, and which card to add to your sequences.

A game of Keyframes takes about 15 minutes to play, and can be played with 2 or 3 people individually, or 4 with a special 2 vs. 2 team system.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Selection Order Bid, Set Collection

name: Black Rose Wars: Magician Pack
description: An expansion for Black Rose Wars and Black Rose Wars: Rebirth. This expansion contains a new school of magic: Totentanz, a new type of Avatar with a brand new mechanic: The Invaders, 2 new avatars, 3 new evocations, 3 new Forgotten spells and 1 new mage.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Gnome Blood: Bowl Team – The Glimdwarrow Groundhogs
description:
Gnomes are something of an enigma in the world of Blood Bowl, with many fans having dismissed their existence almost entirely. While their tactics, and woodland creatures, are somewhat unorthodox, Gnomes are quite fond of the game. While individual players are hardly paragons of athleticism, their mastery of magical illusions and the befriending of forest beasts gives them certain advantages not enjoyed by less gloriously bearded teams.

This multipart plastic kit builds the Glimdwarrow Groundhogs, a Gnome team for use in games of Blood Bowl. The team comprises eight Gnome Linemen, two Woodland Foxes, two Gnome Illusionists, and two Gnome Beastmasters. You'll find four head options that can be used with any of the four different Lineman bodies, as well as two alternative heads for each of the other positions. The Beastmasters have a choice of staff toppers, as well as either goose or badger friends. In addition, there are two double-sided Blood Bowl coins, two turn and re-roll markers, four balls, and a transfer sheet.

This kit comprises 102 plastic components, and is supplied with 14x Citadel 32mm Round Bases and 1x Gnome Team Transfer Sheet. These miniatures are supplied unpainted and require assembly.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Gnome Team – Pitch & Dugout
description:
The Gnome Team Pitch and Dugouts set includes a double-sided pitch depicting a magical forest in the day and at night, complete with rules for playing on it, and a pair of team dugouts.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Spies of Liberty
description:
As a new agent of the Culper Spy Ring your first mission s a search upon which many lives depend. Agent 711 has urgently requested that you locate three military facts believed to be a aboard a ship. But which vessel should you search in this crowded harbour? What of the news that several ships will set sail in just one hour? If you are late will our cause be lost?

Your fellow agents have hidden information in a local tavern that will guide you to a special ship. Do search for sets of numbers and sets of words that always appear in groups of three. Pay attention to related clues that indicate how the sets should be put in order.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Deduction, Party Game, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Targeted Clues

name: Flickering Stars
description:
In Flickering Stars, you’ll control a fleet of ships, flicking them around your tabletop in different scenarios that test your command, courage, and coordination.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Flicking, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Dance of War
description:
After being decisively defeat at the Battle of Gazala, the 8th Army, now led by Claude Auchinleck,retreated eastwards into Egypt. Hopes to hold the Axis forces under Erwin Rommel at Mersa Matruh(26th to 28th June) were quickly dashed and the dispirited Allied forces pulled back to the El Alamein line. Rommel’s forces were buoyed by their rapid advance and fuelled by large quantities of captured Allied supplies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: The Inheritance
description:
Camila Ferrer is in a fierce stuggle to keep Pastisseria Sant Jordi, the family bakery, from being sold. Her grandmother iaia Rosa has hidden the secret to the Catalan bakery's success in an online vault. Help Camila beat her cousin Arturo to the secret, retain the famous pastisseria and make her iaia proud.

Solve all nine puzzle and break into the online vault before it's too late.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Targeted Clues

name: Saboteur: Thwart Promo Card
description:
How to use the 2024 card (Thwart):
Take one Broken Tool card that is in front of another player and place it in front of a player of your choice.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest – Loot Tile Promo Pack
description: Expand your copy of Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest with this set of 7 new double-sided loot tiles (plus 7 versions of these tiles for solo play)!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Move Like Me
description:
How are your Hammer Hands? Lemme see you Floss. No idea what that means? Great! Move Like Me is a group game sure to get everyone moving and laughing.

It’s like the telephone game, but with movement, and it can be even more fun when it goes wrong!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting

name: Rolling Realms: Dice Throne Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Dice Throne.

To play this realm you use dice to fill squares, matching the conditions on the rows. When filling a row, you gain a reward. Can you fill the most difficult rows and gain the biggest rewards?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: はらぺこバハムート　(The Hungry Bahamut)
description:
In this small box, two player card game, you and your opponent fight to reduce each other's life points to 0.
Draw one of the 16 cards, and play up to two of them on your turn - try to outlast your opponent!

—user summary

自分の番ですることは「カードを1枚引いて、2枚までプレイする」それだけ！上手にカードを駆使して相手のライフを先にゼロにした方の勝ち！ シンプルながらも奥の深い戦略的な駆け引きと頭脳戦が楽しめる2人用ゲームです。

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: F1 Roll & Race
description:
F1 Roll & Race is a game for F1 racing fans, in roll & write format.
Move around each of the circuits taking advantage of the asymmetric abilities of each car. Upgrade your car, suffer and repair breakdowns, collect fuel before your rivals and use it to increase your speed every turn.
You can play each track independently or play them all as a championship, moving up or down the rankings according to the results of each game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TAKEトリックの翁 (TAKE Trick Old Man)
description:
A long time ago, there were many old bamboo cutters, who mixed with the fields and mountains to harvest bamboo.As a result, bamboo resources across the country were depleted! ! Let's aim for a high score by getting the right amount of bamboo, including substitute bamboo, in harmony with other old men. May follow trick TAKE where the intentions of the old men intersect! The game is set in a dystopia where the nation's bamboo resources have been depleted and old bamboo cutters monitor each other's cutting amounts. In recent years, there have been reports of a mysterious phenomenon in which certain nodes of bamboo glow, and there are growing calls for more careful use.

In this trick-taking game each player is one of the many bamboo cutter men.that go into the fields and mountains and collect bamboo with other old men through trick-taking.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Legend of the Eight Isles
description:
Choose to play together as the Legends and save the world or take on the mantle of the Foe and destroy them.

The Legends
Take a Legend card and use your weapons, skills and abilities to work together to accomplish objectives and complete tasks.

The Foe
Use your barracks full of fighters to stop the Legends from completing their objective. Eliminate them to gain bonuses and conquer the world.

The Battleboard and Encounter Cards
Each battle take place on the Battleboard. the Encounter Cards explain how to setup the terrain and objectives.

Once the Battleboard is set, the players take turns moving and using actions to complete the objectives or eliminate all of the Legends.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Template, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Morderstwo Tomasa Blackwooda
description:
Morderstwo Tomasa Blackwooda ("Murder of Tomas Blackwood") is a detective game in which players play the role of a detectives trying to solve, on the basis of the available case files, the murder mystery of Tomas Blackwood, known as Rocket Man, the eccentric chief engineer of CosmoZ, a leading company in the space industry, which in recent years has transformed the industry and allowed Americans to return to orbit in American manned spacecraft.

The case files contains the following materials (65 pages of documentation / 40 documents in total):

10 photographs (victim, security guard at victim's apartment building and 8 suspects),
8 profiles of the suspects,
8 testimony transcripts,
8 evidence protocols,
1 autopsy report,
1 photo of the victim from the crime scene,
1 transcript of 911 call,
3 screenshots from Twitter,
3 screenshots of various websites,
2 newspaper clippings,
1 phone billings,
1 email from a lawyer for one of the suspects,
1 cryptocurrency wallet statement.


The aim of the game is to identify the murderer from among the 8 suspects (for this you receive 50 points), to indicate a motive (10 points) and the exact time of the victim's death (5 points). On top of this, an additional 14 questions about the overall events and the people involved are scored (2.5 points each).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Mini Rogue: Beyond the Portal
description:
This expansion contains all the characters from the base game, the Council, and from the Depths of Damnation, the Old Gods, Mountain of Torments, and Forgotten Guardians expansions, all re-illustrated by artist Nicolas Roblin and each character slightly changed from their original. They may have different starting stats, and they will have one of their skills reworked! They come from an outer world, after all.

Beyond the Portal also includes two new characters: The Occultist and her soul syphon, and the Tinkerer and his skill to disarm traps!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mini Rogue: Forgotten Guardians
description: Adds the "Druidess," a new character who can shapeshift into a powerful bear, and "The Corrupted," a new boss eager to devour you.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Perpend
description:
Perpend is a connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place one or two friendly stones on empty points. If you place two, they must be orthogonally adjacent to each other. Next, place enemy stones on all secluded empty points. A point is secluded if there is no free path along the lines of the board between that point and the edge of the board.

At the end of your turn, for any two diagonally adjacent stones of your color there must be another stone of your color adjacent to both, and there must be no 2×3 patterns of two empty points, two black stones a knight's jump away from each other and two white stones a knight's jump away from each other. Passing is not allowed, but, if you have no legal moves available, your turn is skipped.

You win if there is a chain of orthogonally connected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Nakatta
description:
Nakatta is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.

Hard corners and naked attachments are illegal 2×2 patterns. A hard corner is made up of two diagonally adjacent stones of the same color, one stone of the
opposite color, and one empty point. A naked attachment is made up of two orthogonally adjacent empty points, one black stone, and one white stone.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty point without forming any hard corners or naked attachments. Passing is not allowed, but, if you have no legal moves available, your turn is skipped.

You win if there is a chain of orthogonally (horizontally or vertically) interconnected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: 変幻トリック (Protean Trick)
description: 変幻トリック ("Protean Trick")is a trick-taking game that features constantly changing trump suit and rank (strongest card). The way you play your hand is may follow, and you score points by predicting how many tricks you will win in one round.
mechanics: Trick-taking
publishers: クードゥーラパン (Queue de Lapin)

name: Hex Effects
description:
Hex Effects is a "take that" style card game featuring Hexes (that you need to rid of) and Remedies (that treat Hexes but may cause you to have more). It is an easy-to-pickup game with original artwork by Pillbox Games. It's based on the game Side Effects.

Start by dealing four Hex cards to each player, face up, in a space in front of them referred to as their "Shadow". The first player to treat all the Hexes in their Shadow wins the game.

The rest of the Hex cards are shuffled in with the larger deck. Then, deal four cards to each player (concealed in hand). Start your turn by drawing two cards. You can make two actions on your turn. If you have in your hand a Remedy card that treats one of your hexes, you can place it on top of that Hex. You're now closer to winning — but watch out! Every Remedy contains a list of side effects (other Hexes) that you are now vulnerable to receiving from other players on their turns.

Play continues until one person has treated all the Hexes in their Shadow.
mechanics: Race, Take That

name: Black Rose Wars: Christmas School
description:
This is a new Christmas themes magic school for Black Rose Wars and Black Rose Wars Rebirth. It was released 2022 from Ludus Magnus Studio for print and play.
It also contains a new Christmas themed evocation and many spells to cause havoc among your enemies.
In contrast to all other schools released so far, the Christmas school has no flip spells. So every Spell has only one way to play it.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Minefield
description:
Minefield is a two-player game played on a square board of any size, initially empty. The top and bottom board edges are colored black. The left and right edges are colored white.

The two players, Black and White, take turns placing their own stones onto unoccupied points, one stone per turn starting with Black. Passing is not allowed, but if you don't have an available placement, your turn is skipped.

Your placement must not create a hard corner or a switch.

A hard corner is comprised of two stones of one color and one stone of the other color contained in a 2x2 area. The two same-colored stones are diagonally across from one another. One point within the area is unoccupied.

A switch is comprised of two stones of each color contained in a 2x3 or 2x4 area. A switch area has four corner points. Two stones of one color occupy diagonally opposite corner points. The two stones of the other color also occupy diagonally opposite corner points. The non-corner points are unoccupied.

You win by forming an orthogonally (horizontally and/or vertically) interconnected path of stones of your color connecting the two board edges of your color.



Design notesMark Steere designed Minefield in May 2024. Luis Bolaños Mures made a material contribution to it. Minefield is an SPO OOSCG (single placement only, orthogonal only square connection game) with a local mechanism. You only have to consider the points in the locality of the placement being evaluated for legality. You don’t have to take the whole board into consideration. Luis and Mark have advanced the state of the art in this tiny class, both independently and in collaboration.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: HUANG: The Dragon Dynasty
description: The Dragon Dynasty is a fifth player expansion. The fifth player uses the same set-up and play rules as the other players.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Blood Bowl: Gnome Treeman
description:
Gnomes frankly have a tough time winning a game of Blood Bowl – but bringing along a Treeman is a great way to close the height gap. And the strength gap. And the skill gap. These mighty arboreal players give the Gnomes half a shot against most serious teams.

This kit builds a plastic Altern Forest Treeman, ideal for giving your Gnome team vital strength and resilience.
