You'll find cosmetic options to mix them up, so you can feel free to hire two with no worries about them looking the same. The Treeman's features are full of character, making a fitting addition to your whimsical team of tricksters.

This plastic model is supplied in 17 components, including a 40mm Blood Bowl Base. The rules you need to use them in your games of Blood Bowl are supplied with the miniature, and can also be found in Spike! Journal Issue 17, which is available separately.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Ferryman
description:
Welcome aboard the SS Royal Line, a luxurious ferry setting sail between the shores of Immingham, England, and Gothenburg, Sweden. The story begins with a grisly discovery - a Swedish gentleman by the name of Johan Dahlberg, known to many as a distinguished passenger of the SS Royal Line, lies lifeless in his private booth, a victim of a brutal homicide. As you arrive, one of the first people at the scene, you are taken aback by the sheer brutality of the crime. The aftermath leaves you gasping in disbelief, and you can’t help but need a moment to yourself before continuing the investigation.

When your initial shock settles, the fact that the assailant committed the act in the midst of a ferry journey brings to mind the mythic tales of Charon, the boatman from Greek mythology who ferries the souls of the dead across the river Styx to the afterlife. With this thought resting in the back of your head, you dive into your detective work. The ferry has been sealed by the police to keep all passengers and crew members onboard during the investigation, including the perpetrator. However, they can’t keep people onboard forever. You need to figure out who committed the crime, and time is running out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Evil Dead 2: 1% – A Groovy Game of Strategic Chance
description:
Grab your boomstick and head to the cabin for a groovy game of Evil Dead 2 1%!

1% is a fast and fun card game of strategy and probability, with a touch of misdirection.

If you can outlast your opponents, you’ll be rewarded with a choice: Do you roll the dice and try to win? Or do you take the pages from the cursed Necronomicon to increase your chances of a win next time?

If there is a next time, that is! Take too long, and another player could snatch victory away from you.

Ash has battled the deadites, he’s fought his own hand, but can he roll two 0s?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Borodino 2025
description:
Borodino 2025 covers final stage of the NATO-Russia war fought in the hypothetical, alternative-history universe of the 2025 series of the World War 3 games.

There are five scenarios of the different size and time, including fights between NATO and Russian foces, but also elements of the civil war in Russia and fights between different Russian fractions.

Game contains Polish, British, French and American units as well as Russian ones (pro government, rebels, communists and nationalists).
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Spider-Foes Affiliation Pack
description:
Players can begin assembling their own team of sinister Spider-Foes with Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Spider-Foes Affiliation Pack, which brings together the Green Goblin originally found in CP21, the Doctor Octopus originally found in the Marvel: Crisis Protocol Core Set, along with the Kraven the Hunter and the Lizard originally found in CP58 in one convenient package to give players the characters that will form the foundation of their Spider-Foes rosters. These characters are accompanied by stat cards for all four characters, ensuring players have everything they need to use their Spider-Foes in Marvel: Crisis Protocol.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Fame and Fable
description:
Fame and Fable is a fantasy-themed competitive board game for ONE to FOUR players. Use your actions to buy ally and item cards from the market and play these to defeat monsters, complete contracts or disrupt other players. Gain fame through your exploits to move your player token around the game track, picking up bonus tokens as you travel. The player with the highest fame at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Bichos Bajo la Lluvia
description:
In the tiny world of insects, a rainy day can unleash maximum chaos.
Run to protect yourself and compete to get the most bugs in the shelters while the rain ends!


En el diminuto mundo de los insectos, un día lluvioso puede desatar el caos máximo.
¡Corre a protegerte y compite por lograr el mayor número de bichos en los refugios mientras la lluvia acaba!
mechanics: Action/Event, Measurement Movement, Take That

name: Tristerra: La Grande Baldoria
description:
Dario Massa's board game, (for 3-7 players), will immerse you in an epic challenge to conquer the title of Duke of Tristerra. You will have to wander through the lands of the kingdom, showing off in the eyes of its inhabitants.

Every corner of the duchy is full of challenges (80 to be exact), each more extravagant than the last, ready to test and evaluate your talent and composure in surprising ways.

You will be called to face a variety of tests, from the most unusual to the most challenging, discovering one after another the extravagant characters who populate this incredible world. Gather followers along your journey and prepare for the ultimate confrontation: challenging the game's powerful Bosses. Only by overcoming every obstacle and beating your opponents to the punch will you finally be able to reach your goal and reclaim the coveted throne.

36 Characters
80 Challenges
5 Bosses to face
very high replayability, thanks to the different options for each challenge
The manual is printed in full color and thread bound.

The game system of Tristerra: La Grande Baldoria stands out for its versatility, adapting to both the world of board games and that of role-playing games, with a fluid integration of game design elements. Thanks to a skilful synergy between game mechanics and narrative, both games use the same Deck of Cards, offering an engaging and satisfying experience for both tabletop players and role-playing game lovers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Idrolandia
description:
Idrolandia is a strategic tile placement competitive game in which 1 to 4 players will take on the role of young technicians who will have to build the water network of their municipality.
Starting from a spring positioned in the center of the game board, players will try to build a water network and bring drinking water to the greatest number of homes and public structures, earning efficiency points.
By gradually positioning the tiles on the board, players will be able to both expand their own water network and slow down the construction of their opponents' networks.
However, they will also be able to exploit other players' connections to their advantage to supply drinking water to the furthest homes!
In addition to the connection tiles, the players will have to connect some special buildings to their network, activating them with their workers: these buildings will allow them to have advantages during the game or gain efficiency points at the end of the game. However, they will also always have to pay attention to the maintenance of their network: the pipes can break and will have to be repaired before the end of the match!

Idrolandia was published in 2020 for educational purpose by ERICA Cooperative Society for EGATO6 public authorithy and was distributed free of charge in primary schools to raise awareness among students on public water management, how precious it is and how important it is not to waste it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Gwenom & Scarlet Spider
description:
Two alternate versions of prominent characters make their Marvel: Crisis Protocol debut in the Gwenom & Scarlet Spider character pack!

On Earth-616 Gwen Stacy is dead. But on Earth-65, it is Peter Parker who has died and Gwen Stacy who lives life as a masked hero. Accepting a bond with the Venom symbiote and the power that if offers, she sets off on a quest to right the wrongs of her home universe.

Gwenom is joined by Ben Reilly, a clone of Peter Parker made to be a weapon. Known as the Scarlet Spider, he is determined to prove that he is a hero in his own right. On the tabletop, these characters enhance the Web Warriors affiliation with their inherent web-swinging skills and three Team Tactic cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Antsy
description:
Players develop their colony by laying tunnels, chambers, and harmful tiles. First to finish wins.

Players take turns selecting and laying new tunnel tiles or play a harmful tile on a player’s colony, or removing a harmful tile from their own. Over time each player will develop a Colony of tunnels and chambers full of eggs, larva, food, and more. Each tile placed will have some kind of impact on the players Colony during the game. The game will end when one player finishes off their Colony by placing all 7 chambers and closing off all open tunnels.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Maze, Territory Building
mechanics: Connections, Events, Hand Management, Map Addition, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Neighbor Scope, Network and Route Building, Pieces as Map, Rondel, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Nine Tiles Extreme Bello! Minions
description:
Nine Tiles Extreme Bello! Minions is a powered-up version of the Nine Tiles series that has sold over 250,000 copies! It has the same fun speed puzzle board game that anyone can enjoy right away, but has added more challenging play. Match the minions or greeting words according to the picture on the card! Even though I'm just arranging the tiles, I can't seem to find the one I want. Now, who can complete it the fastest? This is a highly recommended game for having fun with friends and at home, as well as for educational purposes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Speed Matching

name: Emerald Skulls
description:
In the grimy depths of Kulbak Prison, where the greatest Dragul warriors are confined, inmates gather around Nargash the goblin and his bone-carved dice. Best to keep your wits about you. A game of Emerald Skulls is about to begin…

Emerald Skulls is a push-your-luck, dice gambling game. Attempt to fill the skull board with dice and place speedy, real-time wagers on the outcomes of your opponents’ rolls.

On your turn as the tumbler, roll dice and use tricks to place them on the five ascending tiers of the skull. But be warned - once you place dice, you can no longer put them on lower tiers for the rest of your turn!

During your opponents’ turns as tumbler, you are a gambler. Swiftly place bets and counter-bets on the results of the tumbler’s rolls. You may wager twice per round, but can only bet while the dice are in the tumbler’s hands. So think fast and bet smart - the quicker your wager, the bigger your payout!

When the pot of gears runs out, the player with the most claims the victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Dexterity, Betting and Bluffing, Bids As Wagers, Dice Rolling, Predictive Bid, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Real-Time, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Valdivia
description:
Valdivia is a roll & write / print & play game in which you will have to rebuild the city of Valdivia, south of Chile, after the largest earthquake in human history.

You will manage resources to rebuild the city while providing shelter and food to the people trapped in the flood that subsequently covered the area.

You will manage resources to rebuild the city while providing shelter and food to people trapped in the flood that subsequently covered the area.

To play Valdivia you'll need 3d6, a pencil and an eraser.
The game is divided into 4 rounds, each with 3 phases. In phase 1, you collect money using dice. In phase 2, you invest that money in resources and, in phase 3, you gain or erase - depending on your actions and decisions - damage points.

You will rebuild the city with workers and investments, build emergency structures for the people using wood, send them food in boats while the streets are underwater, and fix the flood by gathering resources between rounds to overcome the crisis and reconnect the city with the region once again.

Depending on your investments of money and resources, the number of rebuilt sites in the city, the level of needs met in the community, whether or not you fix the flood, and the amount of damage the city has suffered, you will earn points and, at the same time, by the end of the game, you will get a total score that you will compare with a score board.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadow Moon Syndicates
description:
What was once a small rag-tag mining colony, Shadow Moon has grown to become the greatest trading hub of the outer sector. But beneath the thin veneer of legitimacy, lies a plague of desperate, corrupt, and highly motivated criminal syndicates. Here, success is for the sinful, and fortunes are won through daring heists and ruthless raids. Rub shoulders with the street thugs, corporate operatives, and two-faced humanitarians as you build your syndicate from the underbelly of society, to establish your influence over Shadow Moon.

In Shadow Moon Syndicates, 2-5 players take on the role of a syndicate crime boss. Over 4 rounds, players will utilize their hand of cards to nefariously influence regions of the Shadow Moon, carry out high-stakes criminal operations, and assemble their specialists for the game’s finale. How players manage their cards is the key to placing influence in the most effective way to gain lucrative credits, complete missions, and overcome their rivals for ascendancy. The player who accumulates the most credits by the game's end is deemed the winner.

Will you be the one to rise above the rest, turning sin into success, to become the Sovereign of Shadow Moon?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Molecule
description:
An abstract twist on the connect-4 concept / genre. Make the longest molecular connection of your player-color and prevent your rivals from overcoming your high score. Swap, turn and move tiles to gain advantage over your opponents, bearing in mind what they can do after your turn is over.

Play over 6 or 9 rounds to achieve the longest molecule chain, perceive what is on the board and what is yet to come and expand your mind with its witty and really fast paced gameplay that will make you want a rematch every time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Dune Imperium: Uprising – The Beast's Spoils Promo Card
description:
This promo card was given out at Dune Imperium: Prerelease Tournaments

Type: Imperator Card
Cost: 3 persuasion
Agent symbol: Blue
Agent Ability: Gain rewards for your face-up battle Icons:
Kris knive (green): Trash a card, muad'dib (yellow): 1 spice and/or Ornithopter (blue): 1 troop

Reveal ability: Increase combat strength by 3.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Graduate in Necromancy
description:
You just finished your Bachelor’s studies in Necromancy, and you kind of like this type of magic. You are thinking Yes, I can raise dead, but they only last a couple of hours or so…that is not enough to make a dent in the World. And so, you venture forth to become an even more knowledgeable and skilled necromancer. In this solo print-and-play 10–15 minute card game, you have to complete a Master’s degree in Necromancy in two semesters by completing courses and raising dead study buddies. However, completing courses drains your sanity. Will you succeed? Or will you become an insane fiend haunting the university’s corridors?

To graduate in necromancy, you have to a) collect at least 45 credits from the completed courses, b) finish your thesis, and c) avoid insanity in the process of the academic year consisting of two semesters. Each turn you draw a card from the current semester deck. If it is a course card (which is mostly the case) you decide whether you:


sign into a new necromancy course but you lose some sanity,
discard the card to raise dead to get a bonus from an already completed course,
discard the card to push forward your thesis a bit,
put the card on the "Maybe later" pile that gets shuffled later into the second-semester deck.


In terms of categorizing this card game: It is a light-weight engine-building game since your completed courses allow you to sign in to courses with higher requirements but bigger rewards; it is a push-your-luck game since you can strategize but you also don't know what is coming next in the deck; there are deck-building elements involved in the creation of the "Maybe later" pile that gets shuffled into the second-semester deck; finally, Graduate in Necromancy is highly replayable - the two semester decks are different every playthrough.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Atrapamoscas y Mosquitos!
description:
Atrapamoscas y Mosquitos is a skill based single card game for 1 or more players. Each player makes 3 attempts, in which players throw up the card and try catch it. They get points equal to the number of flies they are touching (10 in total) multiplied by the number of fireflies (3) that remain untouched.

But be aware! A mosquito bites you if you touch its sting but not its body. If you do, you don't win any points!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sea of Legends: Captains Pack
description: Bob Kehl is one of the foremost modern pirate artists, and now 8 of his most memorable captains have been beautifully sculpted to become Sea of Legends captains! These new captains use the same abilities as the captains from the base game and Rise of the Ancients expansion, finally allowing more than one player to use each ability in a game. This add-on includes 8 incredible captains and everything you need to play them in a game of Sea of Legends.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Pokémon TCG: Scarlet & Violet – Obsidian Flames
description:
Type-shifted Tera Pokémon ex Mix Things Up!
In addition to looking fantastic with their crystalline appearance, some Tera Pokémon ex have another feature that makes them stand out—they have an Energy type other than what you might expect for that Pokémon (like a Fire-type Eiscue). The Energy type and Weakness of these type-shifted Tera Pokémon ex match their new type, but their attack costs reflect the Pokémon's original type. Otherwise, they follow the same rules as standard Tera Pokémon ex.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Summer Snowfourt
description:
It’s summertime and a great blizzard has rolled in. The neighborhood kids are becoming restless now that the zipline over the pool is all frozen up, so you know war is imminent. Be the first to finish your snow fort in order to survive the onslaught. But be careful, you never know when a heatwave will melt your work!

Summer Snowfourt is a climbing, deck-shedder and connection game for 2 players.

Players try to form 4-in-a-row on the board in their own player color, or shed out their deck to win.

Take turns playing stronger and stronger combinations while dropping tokens into the columns matching your played combination types. Unlike many climber-shedders, you are allowed to play combinations of different types on each other (e.g., sets on singles).

As columns fill up, their combination types become blocked from play, and any previously filled columns are emptied.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Pattern Building

name: UND1C1: National Teams
description:
10 National Teams:
Italy, Germany, France, England, Netherlands, Spain, Portugal, Belgium, Brazil, Argentina.

Originally released as Add-on during the Kickstarter campaign, it's currently available on their official site.
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: UND1C1: Superhero Players 1/4
description:
Twelve powered-up players from Team White, Team Black, Team Red and Team Gold.

Superhero list:

Team Black: Castillo | Millantas | Valley
Team White: Tomkeen | Tulipano | Agatti
Team Red: Bolletti | Sowah | Benefici
Team Gold: Vakk | Paraiso | McGrey

It's the 1st issue of 4 programmed Limited Edition expansions (for a total of 48 players)
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Warhammer Underworlds: White Dwarf Exclusive Grombrindal Card
description: The 500th issue of White Dwarf magazine included this Warhammer Underworlds Fighter Card for Grombrindal, the White Dwarf. A special miniature of Grombrindal was released in conjunction with the 500th issue of the magazine. The magazine also included a special scenario for playing with Grombrindal in Warhammer Underworlds.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Skirmish Wars: Blitz
description:
Skirmish Wars: Blitz is the first expansion for the lightweight, tactical wargame based on the wildly popular turn-based strategy game series Advance Wars, originally released on the Game Boy Advance by Nintendo. Skirmish Wars is a print-and-play game that uses a modular, customizable map system for endless replayability, and simple mechanics to streamline gameplay.

While the objectives of a given game of Skirmish Wars will vary from scenario to scenario, The classic objective is to win by capturing your enemy's HQ or failing that, by eliminating all of his units. To do so, a player must manage and secure new sources of limited funds, think quickly to out-maneuver, out-produce, or out-gun his opponent, and be ready to counter enemy strategies and units with their own.

Skirmish Wars: Blitz introduces several new units including aircraft (all based on their counterparts from the original Video Game series) and eight new COs. It also introduces new rules for repairing units, rules for units with limited fuel (like air units), and finally a fifth side that may be played.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Student Bodies: Promo Set
description: This 6-card set adds new & interesting wrinkles to your Student Bodies game. Included are: 1 rules card, 1 Hallway set-up card, 1 Lab set-up card, 2 Exit set-up cards and an Item card. The new rules and set-up cards provide additional terrain conditions such as: Blood Slick Hazards, Impassable Areas and Fortifications! While the "Tool Belt" Item card allows you to equip an extra weapon.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Take That

name: Crossbows and Catapults: Trojan Battleset
description:
Box description:

"Crossbows and Catapults... The action advendture game where skill and imagination win the battle."

"In the Dark Ages, enemy kingdoms battled using the powerful crossbow and the mighty catapult...

"The battlefield is now being readied for the clash between the Vikings and the Barbarians. You are the commander of the Vikings and you opponent is the commander of the Barbarians. Both commanders have great arsenals of weapons and brave warriors, but the one who possesses the greater skill and better strategy will conquer!"

TROJAN BATTLESET CONTENTS:
2 towers
2 courtyards
24 wallblocks
16 warriors (8 vikings, 8 barbarians)
32 projectiles (15 standard and 1 king carom each)
2 crossbows
2 catapults
1 trojan horse
1 battle shield
Label sheets
Rulebook

This rare Crossbows and Catapults set (not to be confused with the smaller and more common "Trojan Horse and Battle Shield" expansion) brings the additional power of two mighty weapons to the battlefield.

The set follows the rules of Crossbows and Catapults, but adds the Trojan Horse and Battle Shield to the players' arsenals.

To play, each player is given a set of castle parts, plastic warrior figures, flags, projectiles and the seige engines that fire them. Before play, each player sets up their defenses to best withstand the oppenent's onslaught. They then take turns launching projectile caroms at the opposing defenses.

Opponents agree before play on any of the four official winning conditions. Alternatively players make up their own rules, or simply blast away at eachother's defenses until the enemy's force is annihilated.

The Trojan Horse (Vikings) and Battle Shield (Barbarians) are weapons used to propel caroms at the opposing forces, similar to the standard catapult and crossbow respectively. But they also serve as tempting targets for the enemy. When struck, internal mechanisms spectacularly expel warrior figures or caroms.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Action Games and Toys Ltd, Action GT

name: Auriferous
description:
A few locals found a cavern that has proven to be Auriferous (containing or bearing gold)! You and some of your friends decide to try your luck at striking it rich. However, you don’t have the knowledge or tools… yet! Upgrade your equipment and before you know it, you’ll be striking gold!

Auriferous is an easy to learn dice game for 2-4 players. Start off by just rolling five dice. Each turn, you'll be able to use those dice to upgrade your tools. Each tool allows you to alter your rolls and mitigate any bad luck. They might even let you find gold or steal it from other players!

If you can strike the most gold from the mine, you'll win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Table Battles: Age of Alexander
description:
By any measure, Alexander III of Macedon was an exemplary military commander. If we believe his propagandists, he was always vastly outnumbered, yet he and his elite army were never defeated, always winning a decisive victory. "It is a sobering thought," says Table Battles designer Tom Russell, "that by the time he was my age, Alexander had conquered the Persian empire, made his incursion into India, founded city after glorious city, and had been dead for four years."

Table Battles: The Age of Alexander recreates that famous Macedonian's major battles, as well as two battles of the Diadochi. In almost all of these battles, the Macedonian Player has no room for error - the routing of a single Formation is often enough to lose the game. The opposing side has more leeway and more sticks, but generally comes up short in the quality department. Careful, nuanced play from both sides is require to stay competitive and to win the day. Most of these are larger engagements, with lots of cards and reactions for each side.

The seven battles in this set are:

Chaeronea (2 August 338 BCE)
Granicus (May 334 BCE)
Issus (5 November 333 BCE)
Gaugamela (1 October 331BCE)
The Hydaspes (May 326BCE)
Gabiene (316BCE)
Ipsus (301BCE)
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Three-Player Crokinole
description:
Three-Player Crokinole is a specially designed Crokinole board that works only with three. This game cannot be played on a standard board and thus is considered to be a different game.

The three-player board has markings that divide the board into three areas (vs four for a standard board), and repositions the pegs around the center to make these three positions optimal for shooting. Three players play independently (no partners), and when shooting either other player's disk must be hit for your shot to be legal. Scoring is done on a differences basis as in the original game, except often two people will score per turn as a result.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: ADIGMA (Second Edition)
description:
Adigma is a party game which involves simultaneous riddle and puzzle solving. Riddles come in a wide variety: identifying a photograph, deciphering secret messages, memorizing images, and many more.
It's an addictive game for friends and family with some luck factor based on a dynamically built board with some 'surprise' spaces.

This second edition contains more riddle cards.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Cross Chess
description: Australian Chess variant played on a chequered board in the shape of a cross. Each side has 16 pieces but four pawns are larger than the other four. This designates them as either King's pawns or Queen's pawns. Bishops only play on black squares. Almost all other rules are standard chess rules and objectives.
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Iron Cross: WWII Wargaming in Miniature
description: Iron Cross is a World War II miniatures game that uses a dynamic activation system allowing players to always be involved in gameplay and constantly faced with tactical decisions. Playable in any scale, forces represent formations from company to battalion size. The rules contain scenarios and orders of battle for German, Commonwealth, US and Soviet forces from 1944 to 1945 in the European theatre of operations.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: DiverCity
description:
You and your scientist crew are battling against industrial fishermen, oil companies and resorts trying to exploit the resources from a newly discovered coral reef located in an archipelago of 7 islands. In this cooperative adventure, you will have to work together and help each other with your unique abilities to be able to save the coral reef from destruction!

To do so, you need to show the government that the life's diversity in the coral reef is unique enough to justify changing the area into an aquatic national park!

On their turn, players will have 4 actions to help discover new species. They can either dive and explore, exchange information, go on an island to close a hotel, switch their coral tiles for new ones or get the help from friends and animals in the reef. The game is mostly played by moving your character, placing new tiles, discovering new species and giving the right information to your partners at the right moment.

With a good plan and a lot of cooperation, players have the possibility of saving enough species from extinction, thus showing the government that the area is worth saving! If too many species fall and disapear, your team of scientists will have failed their mission and the coral reef will be destroyed forever ...

Will you be fast enough in your discoveries or will the coral reef be forgotten before you achieve your goal?
mechanics: Unspecified

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Character Promo Pack
description: Character Promo Pack featuring four oversized Characters: Lobo, Supergirl, Green Lantern (Jessica Cruz), and Solomon Grundy.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Kırmızı Balon
description:
You and your hot air ballon have entered the "RED BALLOON" contest, where the best traveller in Turkey will be decided. To win you need to travel to the most destinations within 51 days.

On your turn you will draw 1 card from the deck on each trip day and choose a city from the opened cards. Some tickets have 2 city names, but you can only visit 1 city on the day of the trip.

Extra points are awarded for visting each region two, four, or six times.

Remember, your goal in the game is to travel to the most geographical regions in Turkey and earn the highest score.
Through careful planning and strategic choices, you can make your name as Turkey’s greatest hot air balloon adventurer.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bingo, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Shadow Over Westongrove Manor
description:
The family patriarch and rich businessman Anthony Westongrove had invited his children to the grand family manor to celebrate his 70th birthday yesterday.

All of the family members arrived at the manor on Friday afternoon, and an extravagant feast was served at 7:00 pm. It promised to be a wonderful evening …

But the birthday celebration came to an unpleasant end when Anthony was rushed to the hospital during the night after falling very ill. Concerned, the entire family stayed at Westongrove Manor and waited for the patriarch to make his return. Today, on Saturday afternoon, Anthony was finally released from the hospital. His unconsciousness turned out to be caused by poisoning. It would appear that one of the guests was after his blood.

Anthony wishes to resolve the matter within the family, which is why everyone who was present has come together again this evening. The question is: What happened yesterday night? Who tried to kill Westongrove?

What is a murder mystery game?

You and your guests slip into the roles of the main suspects of an exciting murder case. The objective of the game is to convict the perpetrator – one of the people sitting with you at the table. This can only be achieved if the players discuss the course of events amongst themselves and compare their experiences of what happened. But be careful: Each character (including you!) has their own dark secrets which they’d be better off keeping to themselves.

You all gather in the wake of the crime and attempt to piece together your memories, with the aim of identifying the perpetrator. In each round, you recall more and more about the circumstances of the crime, as each round deals with a different period of time from the evening the crime was committed. At the end, everyone votes on who should be handed over to the police as the suspect.

Culinario Mortale is a highly interactive game. There are only a few rules, and no pre-prepared dialogue. The focus is on working through the puzzles and discussing the events together.

Alongside a well-structured game manual, each game contains game booklets for between five and eight characters (the number of players for each game can be found on the packaging and here on our website). In the game booklets, each guest will find their personal clues and a description of their role. Each game booklet also includes a brief overview of how the game works. As such, all players can jump right in. The support code included with your Culinario Mortale game will allow you to download the role descriptions in advance from our website in PDF format, and easily send them to your guests via email.

GAME CONTENT:
1 Game Manual, 8 Game Booklets, 1 Incident Booklet (includes of prologue, incidents, solution), 8 name badges, 1 support code

— description from the publisher.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Dungeon Degenerates: Goblins Have More Fun
description:
It's true, Goblins Have More Fun! Goblins are sneakier, stupider, more cunning, lazier, crazier, smaller, more out for a good time, more ready for a fight & more basic. We dare you to add an additional thirteen new Monsters to your already brimming Monster Decks!

13 New Cards for use with DUNGEON DEGENERATES: HAND OF DOOM!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Degenerates: Breaking the Law
description:
The Wurstreich is crawling with agents of the law who are just as corrupt & distorted (if not moreso) than your anti-hero adventurers & the monsters trying to gain a foothold. We dare you to add an additional thirteen new Monsters to your already brimming Monster Decks!

13 New Cards for use with DUNGEON DEGENERATES: HAND OF DOOM!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dust Tactics: Heavy Panzer Walker – "Königs-Luther / Sturm-König"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

New heavy walkers for Dust Tactics bring the big guns!

In response to the introduction of the Heavy Assault Walker by the Allies, Axis engineers – refusing to be outdone – introduced their Heavy Panzer Walker. With its dual 17.3 cm FpK, the Königs-Luther features raw firepower so terrifying that many enemy tank commanders simply refuse to fight it without support from their mightiest walkers. The Sturm-König provides different tactical advantages and excels at defending troops with Advanced Reactive Fire from its 12.8 cm FlakVierling.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Dust Tactics: Heavy Assault Walker – "Punisher / Fireball"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

New heavy walkers for Dust Tactics bring the big guns!

Allied forces gain new strength with the Heavy Assault Walker. Support your troops with the Punisher, the heaviest walker the Allies have produced. Its twin 155mm howitzers can pummel even the mightiest walkers. Adhering to the Allies' traditional strengths, the Fireball packs versatility and lethal close range attacks. Its deadly Napalm Thrower launches can consume nearly any enemy in a single fiery blast.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: 18EUS
description:
18EUS (Eastern United States) is an 18xx game that features elective personal loans. Players may either take loans to fund lucrative investments or invest in the Bank of New York if they do not have loans. The Bank grows stronger, and loans are worse, when more loans are taken and when someone invests in the Bank.

It also features a highly randomized setup with powerful private companies auctioned over three rounds, incremental capitalization with up to 100% company ownership, and a novel force-buy mechanism.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Investment, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Victory Points as a Resource

name: 2038: Tycoons of the Asteroid Belt Expansion Set
description: This long lost expansion is now seeing moonlight. This Print and Play expansion includes: 2 new Corporations: Onsite Refining and Mining Robotics (with rules altering certificate holding limits), alternative private companies setup, 2 new hexes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Trains
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Stock Holding

name: Great War at Sea: Russo-Japanese War
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Japan entered the modern age in 1868, with a new young emperor determined to make his island nation a world power. After decades of steady progress, Japan began its own practice of colonialism, defeating China in 1894. As the Japanese began to infiltrate the semi-independent Kingdom of Korea, they ran into Russian agents doing the same. Despite Japanese offers to negotiate, elements within the Russian Empire were set on war.

Great War at Sea: Russo-Japanese War covers the naval aspects of the resulting conflict, which opened with a Japanese surprise attack on the Russian Pacific Fleet’s base at Port Arthur in northern China. There are 50 scenarios, including the climactic Battle of Tsushima, as well as hypothetical actions ranging from an early dispute resulting from the 1895 "Triple Intervention" to a showdown in 1906 with greatly reinforced Russian and Japanese fleets.

The Russian fleet is a mixed bag of modern battleships and ancient ironclads better suited for a museum. The Pacific Fleet that begins the game in the Far East has modern ships stationed at Port Arthur and a cruiser squadron in Vladivostok. Between them lies Korea, occupied by Japan. The Russian strategic situation is difficult.

The Japanese have a better fleet; though not as large, their armored cruisers outclass their Russian counterparts and their torpedo boats are more numerous and more effective. They are also better-led after the death of the Russian Admiral Makarov.

The map covers the Japanese home islands and the seas around them. As with other games in the series, it’s divided into zones 32 miles across. Fleets attempt to locate one another on this map. When contact is made, play moves to a tactical map where ships maneuver and fight.

The previous edition of this game (Great War at Sea: 1904-1905) won the Origins Award for Best Historical Game due to play balance and simplicity. Without aircraft, play is even faster than in other games in the series. The strategic situation is challenging to both players, and competitive balance is keen without sacrificing the historical accuracy of the game as a simulation. Unlike most wars, the Russo-Japanese naval war took place between opponents reasonably matched in terms of vessels and numbers (albeit not in training), and that makes for a tense and exciting game.

Russo-Japanese War includes:
• One 34 x 22-inch operational map
• One 22 x 22-inch tactical map
• 210 playing pieces
• A game booklet including 50 scenarios
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Merchants Cove: Master Craft
description:
Welcome back ashore! Merchants Cove: Master Craft is a big-box expansion for the critically acclaimed Merchants Cove.

Contained in this treasure trove of content is a new expansion (The Faction Festival), new modular content (new Rogues, Townsfolk), as well as four new expert Merchants.

In addition to the new Merchants, the Faction Festival also expands the game in a substantial way. A new board is connected to the bottom of the main board adding tracks for each of the Factions, and brand new mechanisms for each Faction to use. The Wizards will enchant your goods to make them worth more - while the Rogues will help you frame the other players, letting you get rid of corruption by pinning it on your opponents.

That’s not all! Enjoy a new Faction Hall (The Paladins), new Adventurers (Paladins), new Townsfolk, Rogues, and more.

-description from publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Nautical
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Layering, Rondel, Track Movement, Turn Order: Time Track
publishers: Fabrika Igr, Final Frontier Games, Galakta

name: Spinespur
description:
From Publisher's Website*


Spinespur is a world where evil reigns supreme and even the angels have stains on their wings. Spinespur is filled with the typical chainsaws, zombies, and werewolves as well as more obscure or innovative nightmares all its own. It’s a Modern Survival Horror game with elements of fantasy alongside elements of science fiction.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Justice Like Lightning Promo Cards
description:
The Thunderbolts are heroes… but truly villains… with a shot at redemption! Collect these 3 Dice Masters cards to make Baron Zemo, Villainous Pact, and Ant-Man part of your next team. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


Villainous Pact (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League)
Ant-Man: Tiny Regret
Baron Zemo: Citizen V


Villainous Pact can be used with any Basic Action Dice, Ant-Man and Baron Zemo use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Maglev Metro: London & Paris
description:
Maglev Metro: London & Paris features two new expansion maps for Maglev Metro:

In London, one of the world's oldest subway system is finally getting a much needed upgrade thanks to magnetic levitation technology! In order to reinvigorate London's transportation system, all stations are unlocked; pick up any passenger even on your first turn!


Players start with extra passengers to activate more areas on their player board.
London is divided into districts, and you'll need access to build track to various parts of the city.
The new Unlock Districts extension modifies your player board so instead of unlocking passenger colors, players unlock districts.


And then there's Paris, well known for its mass transit strikes and your new Maglev Metro enterprise there is no exception. There are strikes scheduled constantly throughout the city at various stations!


Union bosses strike at a different station every few turns, shutting down all business at affected stations: trains zip right on past the stations and passengers cannot be picked up or dropped off until they reopen.
They're so brazen they've published a strike schedule! At least this helps you plan ahead of time.
Defy the picket lines as a strike breaker, which costs you VPs in order to save you time.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Network and Route Building

name: Fora de Ordem
description:
Choose one of the cards from your hand to make your guess about the order of items in a category. If you don't know, you can follow other players' guesses.

But be careful! For each item, whoever gets the guess wrong last gets the bomb if someone makes a mistake after you, phew! You are saved.

After six rounds, whoever has accumulated the fewest bombs is the winner!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management

name: TTMC: Format de Voyage, vol. 2
description:
TTMC: Format de Voyage vol 2 is a mix of party and trivia games. Self-assess your knowledge from 1 to 10 on a variety of uncommon, interesting and random themes, this time with questions about trave!

Be the first to reach the final card by answering the questions you chose. Each team will self-assess itself from 1 to 10 on a multitude of topics. Each grade has a more or less complex question: the higher the grade, the more difficult the question. If you answer it right, the team will go up the number of boxes corresponding to their self-rated score. For example, if you answer correctly question 6, you will advance 6 boxes.

It's funny, accessible to everyone and there is plenty to play with: 130 cards and 860 questions, with the added value of original cards to spice up the game. It can be played as a standalone game or an expansion of the original TTMC.

The goal of the game is to be the first to get to the end of the board by answering the questions asked.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Materia Prima: The Alchemists Seal Expansion
description:
The all-dominant race for the Philosopher‘s Stone causes some alchemists to use dirty tricks. With the expansion, alchemists can block hexes with Seal Stones, occupy element mines, and build a resource monopoly. The Expansion also adds new alchemists, homunculi and equipment cards to the base game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: FIRED UP!: Eternal Moments
description:
"Bruno is out of the game, after this stunning blow from Alexia, leaving only two fighters standing!", the speaker shouted with excitement. Under the blazing sunlight, there was Alexia, mocking, taunting Marow as he was standing wounded and silent. This was the grand finale everyone was waiting for. You could feel how fired up the crowd was, shouting for more. Marow`s artifact burst into scarlet energy as we cheered for him, breaking his silence into a violent battle cry rushing towards Alexia. A clash we will never forget unfolded before our very eyes! All these moments, carved into our minds for an eternity to come. This is the battle of eternal moments!

In FIRED UP! Eternal Moments you take on the role of a spectator in an arena where combatants from all over the lands gather, with the sole purpose of creating unforgettable moments for all to see. As the spectator, you can influence Fighters with your energy and excitement, in order to alter the outcome of the battle to your liking.

The goal of the game is to leave the event as fired up as possible. Therefore the winner of the game will be the player who will manage to gather the most Fired up Points.
The game is played over several Rounds. Each Round consists of the following 3 Main Phases:

a) Planning Phase: All players may simultaneously place face down in front of them 1 or 2 Moment Cards. These Cards represent specific situations that the player, as a spectator, anticipates and wishes to experience in this Round.

b) Influence Phase: Players roll the dice and choose which Fighter and in which way they want to influence. The goal of each player is to increase the odds of what he/she has bet during the Planning Phase. The players can influence the target opponent of each Fighter, the Speed of a Fighter, his/her Defend or Attack Power and his/her Morale.

c) Battle Phase: During this phase, battles between Fighters take place, rolling the respective attack and defence dice. In the duration of this phase, players may reveal their successful Moment Cards and receive the corresponding Fired Up Points.

The game ends when there is one or none Fighter left in the arena!

"FIRED UP! Eternal Moments" took the 1st place in the 6th annual Greek Board Game Designing Contest (2015) under the name "Nauthriva".

The publisher of this game, "Purple Games", closed due to personal reasons and all the rights of Fired Up returned to the designers.
If you are a publisher and interested in this game contact "Theofilos Koutroubis" in bgg or in the following e-mail: theofiloskoutroubis@yahoo.gr
A lot of love and effort was put in this game and we hope that it finds another warm home. Thank you for your understanding :)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Curtiss P40 Warhawk
description:
The Curtiss P-40 Warhawk was an American fighter and ground attack aircraft used by the air forces of 28 nations during WW2, serving as an air superiority fighter, bomber escort and fighter bomber. The P-40 performed surprisingly well as an air superiority fighter, at times suffering severe losses, but also taking a very heavy toll on enemy aircraft.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory Special Pack is a ready-to-play large size model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards, as well as specific rules and components necessary to use the airplane.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: BattleCON: Eliza Promo
description: Level 99 Games' official mascot character, Eliza has four fanciful genre cards which she can use when her attacks connect to add various effects to her attack pair. However, Eliza must be careful -- if she gets hit, her opponent can force her to discard a genre card, rendering it temporarily unusable. Eliza is a very tactical trickster style character, with a surprising amount of versatility and control over the battlefield.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Bloqueo
description:
In Bloqueo, a turn always consists of three steps:


Move a game figure at least two spaces,
Place one of your octagons, and
Put two blocking pieces on this octagon.


Turn after turn, more and more spaces are occupied with octagonal pieces. In the best case, you connect these spaces into groups – provided that the spaces are orthogonally adjacent. If you even manage to have a high tower as part of a large group, you can definitely score many points.

These towers may grow up to four levels; at the scoring, they serve as a multiplier. The color of the octagon on top determines who scores for this tower.

It can be difficult at times to decide which game figure to move, which of your octagons to protect, and which tower to conquer, but these decisions make the game interesting and demanding.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Cestou necestou
description:
NOTE: this edition contains both Near and Far and Amber Mines expansion.


Four wanderers search for the Last Ruin, a city that legends say contains an artifact that will grant the greatest desires of the heart. A lost love, redemption, acceptance, a family rejoined-- these are the fires that fuel the wanderers' journeys, but can they overcome their own greed and inner demons on the way?

In Near and Far, you and up to three friends explore many different maps in a search for the Last Ruin, recruiting adventurers, hunting for treasure, and competing to be the most storied traveler. You must collect food and equipment at town for long journeys to mysterious locales, making sure not to forget enough weapons to fight off bandits, living statues, and rusty robots! Sometimes in your travels you'll run into something unique and one of your friends will read what happens to you from a book of stories, giving you a choice of how to react, creating a new and memorable tale each time you play.

Near and Far is a sequel to Above and Below and includes a book of encounters. This time players read over ten game sessions to reach the end of the story. Each chapter is played on a completely new map with unique art and adventures.

Answer the call of the ruins and begin your journey.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Drinking Quest: Six Pack
description:
This new boxed set includes the main quests of all six games, remasters every single card and is packaged in a premium set. it also includes over 25 completely new cards, some replacing older cards that needed updating.

THE Ultimate Drinking Quest Collection!

Like a typical Role Playing Game you have a character sheet, roll for saving throws, fight monsters and find treasure BUT when your character dies in the game you have to chug your drink in real life! It adds a real level of tension and excitement to the battles. Everything matters.

The battles are a series of one-on-one fights to the death. You either kill the monster earning coins and XP or your character dies and you must chug your drink! The cards act as the GM (So everyone can drink) and the heroes go through four themed quests in each game - each getting progressively difficult and more likely to drink. However as this is a light RPG and a light Drinking Game there is a one chug per quest maximum which prevents Drinking Quest from being a "Pass out in 10 minutes" kind of drinking game. Over the course of 2 or 3 hours, a typical game averages 2 or 3 chugs.

Whoever gets the most XP wins! Whoever loses had to chug the most so it's sort of like everybody wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Spruance Leader: Carrier Expansion
description:
The Carrier Expansion adds Carriers, Carrier Wings, and Carrier Squadrons to the game. Use Carrier Squadrons to attack Soviet Ships and Subs on the Tactical Display, or attack Targets a distance from the Carrier. Soviet Bandits and Air Defenses can reduce your Squadron strength during the mission.

This expansion includes:
8 Carriers (64 cards)
4 Carrier Commanders (24 cards)
13 Carrier Air Wings (13 cards)
1 Counter Sheet
3 Campaigns
Carrier Expansion Rulebook
Carrier Combat Card
Summary Sheet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Deck Construction, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Catacombs: Black Box
description: The Black Box expands Catacombs 3E with a new double-sided 3E compatible playmat featuring the Athenoch Mortuary on one side and the Notholag Dungeon on the other. It provides a full set of alternate monsters cards for the base Catacombs game plus every Catacombs 3E expansion published so far including: Cavern of Soloth, Resurrection, Wyverns of Wylemuir, and Keystones & Keeps. There is a new set of monsters for the Vermin family and the new Mushroom familiar for the heroes. In terms of rules, this expansion introduces the snowball ranged shot, group rush shot, move to rune "shot" and the transmogrify shot modifier. The box artwork is an homage to the cover of Catacombs First Edition, released over 10 years ago.
mechanics: Flicking

name: Silent Death Tech: Warhounds
description:
From the back cover:

Escorts do the grunt work..
" Yeee-Haw!" came the scream across the headset.
" Pipe down; Mike, some of us are trying to concentrate!"
Will yelled back as he squeezed off another salvo of
missiles toward the fleeing Imperial Nighthawks. "We have 'em on the run. Don't let 'em get away." "They're trying to use that moon for cover."
" Mike take your wing left to cut them off" "Will, it..."

A flash of blue light lit the canopy as the Talon exploded. Will glanced at the moon. Rising from its horizon came the imposing silhouette of a Mega-fortress.

Escort vessels-corvettes, frigates, and destroyers-are the true workhorses of all interstellar navies. This supplement adds the escort vessel class of ships to the deadly universe of Silent Death. Escorts do the grunt work of the navy, serving as long-range patrol craft, picket ships, convoy and fleet escorts, fighter tenders, assault transports, blockade runners and more. This book contains all the info you'll need to incorporate these ships into your Silent Death games. Warhounds includes:

• Rules for escort class vehicles, escort class scenarios, an escort campaign
• Ship design rules for Warhounds
• New weapons for escort class ships .
• Ship displays for: Aosho, Constellation, Fletcher, Megafortress, Narwhal, Stingray, Narwhal Ill, Longboat, Ushas, Kali, Nebula II, Pteradon, Cetshwayo
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Tiny Towns: Fortune – Pirate's Den
description:
The pirate parrots have come to Tiny Towns! Add this new card to your Tiny Towns games to celebrate the release of AEG's new title Dead Reckoning on Kickstarter!

The pirate parrots seek to expand their control of Tiny Towns. They play the green building, and become more valuable the larger their area of buildings becomes. Not only that, they give you coins which help when playing with the Fortune expansion. Those parrots can't help but chase the shiny gold!

Card text: 2 (plus) if adjacent to a Green House. When constructed gain 1 coin for each Green House you have in play (including this one)

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 278th Squadron "The Same 4 Cats": SM79 Damned Hunchback
description:
278th Squadron “The Same 4 Cats” SM79 Damned Hunchback is a solitaire campaign card wargame. The player is a pilot of the Italian famed Squadriglia 278, the so called “The Same 4 Cats” (I Soliti 4 Gatti), which flew the Italian SM79 torpedo bomber during World War 2, scoring several torpedo hits despite the technical difficulties. Through 10 mission the player must score hits, fix its plane and survive and receive the most important Italian Medal: the Gold medal to the Military Valour!

—description from the rulebook

63 colorful cards, a A3 game mat and English rules wait for you in this narrative card war game!

The game components are several cards which must be divided into decks to be set up on the map; the cards are the core mechanic of the game.

The player puts on the map the Damage Card (for the SM79, or for a more challenging experience, for the SM84) and the Experience Card at Value 0 or without value on the top.

The decks to set up are: Campaign deck, Resolution deck, Target Ship deck and Mission deck.

Campaign deck (yellow back): it is composed by the Mission cards; the player draws a card per Mission from this deck where it is shown the Mission to be accomplished by the pilot. It shows the geographical area, the number of Target Ship to draw and the type of Cards to add to the Mission deck. If the player manages to hit the Target Ship, it can receive a Reward (cards with white back), as per Reward Chart.

Resolution deck (red back): it is composed by Hit and Missed cards and it is formed by a number of these cards depending on the Resolution Draw Chart. It is the engine of the game: it is used for AA draws, Torpedo draws and Damage draws.

Target Ship deck (green back): it is composed by all the target ships available in the game and these are historical ships hit by the Italian SM 79; every card shows the type of ship and the number and type of Cards to add to the Mission Deck; some of them indicates a Special Decoration that the player can earn in case of successful attack to that Target Ship.

Mission Deck (blue back): it is formed by a certain number and type of Event Cards plus the ones indicated on the Mission cards, on the Target Ship cards and on the Experience Chart. The player must draw a maximum of 7 Event Cards, indicating the distance from the Target Ship, a card per turn and resolve it, following the instructions indicated. Then it can decide to continue the Mission or abort it or try a Torpedo Resolution Draw, trying to torpedo the Target Ship chosen!

The Campaign is composed by 10 Missions; during the Set up, the player shuffles the Mission Cards and put them face down in the Campaign Deck Area. At the start of each turn, the player draws the first Mission Card and put it in the Mission row, starting from the first (number 1).

The player reads the Mission Card drawn where it is shown the Mission to be accomplished. It shows the geographical area, the number of Target Ship to draw and the type of Event Cards to add to the Mission deck. The player must choose a single Target Ship and put it on the map, in the dedicated area.

The player prepares then the Mission Deck. It takes from these following Event Cards (blue back): 1 Sun Card, 1 Clouds Card, 1 Waves Card, 2 Fly Cards, 2 AA Card

Then the player adds the Event Cards indicated in the current Mission Card, the Event Card(s) indicated in the Experience Chart and the Event Card(s) indicated on the Target Ship Card. All together they form the Mission Deck, which must be shuffled and put on the map, face down.

The player must draw an Event Card from the Mission Deck per turn and resolve it, following the instructions indicated. Then it can decide to continue the Mission, drawing another Event Card from the Mission Deck or abort the Mission or try a Torpedo Resolution Draw, trying to torpedo the Target Ship, if within the Distance. The player can draw a maximum of 7 Event Cards, which indicate the distance from the Target Ship.

The player should try to hit the Target Ship with its Torpedo.... it is not so easy!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Bonsai Games, Lumaca Games, Quarterdeck International

name: Black Rose Wars: Promo Forgotten Evocation
description: To celebrate the return of the (Essen) convention after last year's stop, you will find Cthuly attached to the (Ashes) magazine! This "tender" mascot of the event, vaguely inspired by ancient and forgotten myths, is a new Promo Forgotten Evocation. Comes with his Forgotten Spell and Evocation card, and a fantastic resin miniature! Of course, Cthuly can also be used in both BRW and Rebirth!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: La Bataille de Hanau
description:
This is complete refit of the 1989 game. New map and counters, all done by Charles Kibler. It simulates the abortive attempt on 30 and 31 October 1813 by the Austro-Bavarians under de Wrede to prevent Napoleon's escape from Germany after the defeat at Leipzig, by blocking him near Frankfurt.

The game uses the now robust latest version of the rules, which employs roster sheets and oblong counters to simulate formation changes between line and column. The battle is fought at regimental level at a scale of 250m per hex, and in 30-minute game turns. Losses are recorded on roster sheets, and the rules, in english (the French version will be available on the Pratzen website), are of medium complexity.

This new edition also includes the second day battle set up and units, when de Wrede tried to attack the French after the Emperor left.

Game System:
scale = 250 m/hex;
time = 30 min/GT;
strength = 300 men/SP (Regimental Size).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City – Side Gig
description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Side Gig Expansion adds Fixers and Engrams to your games of Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City.

Each of the 7 Fixers keeps to their own district. While they're not directly hirable like Edgerunners, players may establish connections with them, gaining their unique ability and perks.

The Engram Module is a plug 'n' play system that adds 2 such Relics into the Opportunity deck of your games. Engrams are powerful objects and work differently from a standard Opportunity when obtaining them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CD Projekt RED, CMON Global Limited

name: BANG! Dynamite Box
description:
Whether you're a sheriff, a bandit or a brawler of the worst kind, in the Wild West you can only believe in two things: gunpowder and dynamite!
This explosive BANG! box includes 8 legendary expansions, for a disrupting gaming experience!
What does this official BANG! collectors box contain?


BANG! (base game)
BANG! The Great Train Robbery – Expansion
BANG! Dodge City – Expansion
BANG! Gold Rush – Expansion
BANG! Armed & Dangerous – Expansion (including Bloody Mary)
BANG! Expansion Pack:
BANG! Wild West Show – Expansion
BANG! The Valley of Shadows – Expansion
BANG! High Noon + A fistful of cards – Expansion

The Stick of Dynamite – To be used in a game variant
34 Wooden Bullets
8 premium Dual Layer Boards
Extra Content Slot
Extra Cards: Annie Versary (from BANG! 10th Anniversary), Emiliano (from BANG! 20th Anniversary), and special characters and cards from BANG! The Bullet!: Uncle Will, Johnny Kisch, Claus "The Saint", "New Identity", and "Handcuffs"
A single book for the rules (40 pages, 12.5×18 cm two-sided full-colour glossy stapled)



(please note there is also a product called "BANG! Dynamite Box: Storage Box and Accessories" which does NOT contain the games, but contains the premium Boards, the Wooden Bullets, and the Stick of Dynamite.)

—description from the publisher

The box, besides being filled with goodies, has a sleeve added that provides the coloured BANG! on its front and a description of the contents on its back.

All cards are 56×87 mm.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Deep Madness: Ward Phillips Investigator
description:
Expansion includes:

Investigator Figure
Investigator Card
Activation Card
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Edge: Dawnfall – Darkness
description: The Edge: Dawnfall – Darkness expansion adds new material to The Edge: Dawnfall base game, specifically 15 miniatures, 12 artifact miniatures, 80 faction cards, and 57 faction tokens.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dust Tactics: Heavy Rangers Command Squad – "Corps Officers"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

As the battles of Dust Tactics intensify, NCO Command Squads inspire their allies to tremendous feats with their new special abilities. Marching to the front lines in their protective battle suits, the Allied Corps Officers withstand enemy small arms fire as they call in artillery strikes, repair walkers and send them back into battle, or boost soldiers with powerful, untested chemicals. These powerful squads provide clear direction for other troops and offer players tremendous army-building flexibility.

Dust Tactics: "Corps Officers" - Heavy Rangers Command Squad includes a unit card and three distinct miniatures.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Shadows of Malice: Promo 2016 Card Set
description: A set of ten playable cards which can be incorporated into their respective decks. There are six new treasure cards (Black Tesseract, Blue Tesseract, Colorless Tesseract, Green Tesseract, Red Tesseract, Yellow Tesseract), four fate cards (Crumble to Dust - instant, Curse of Umbral - lasting, Essence Shift - invoked, Mirrorlight - invoked), rules reference card and also a title card.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: How Game Are You? Couples Intimacy Edition
description:
'How Game Are You' is a series of games designed to broach difficult conversations but in a fun and inclusive way. Players learn, have fun, converse and connect with each other.

This first game is targeted at Couples seeking more emotional and physical intimacy. It is tasteful, above the line and fun.

Cards are categorised as:

Pledge cards to read before the game and ensure presence
Q and A (Question and you Answer)
Would You Rather? (Answer or act out, or lose places)
True or False? (Trivia style)
Trust And Touch (Blindfold guessing)
Name If Game (Picture cards to name what it is)
Perform or Pamper (Personal Challenge cards selected at the end of the game)


150 of the main cards are ranked 1, 2 or 3 chili's to identify the difficulty and lower or higher places forward on the board. There's an additional 25 x 4 chili cards in a sealed tuckbox. These contain images to guess and name, but are product photo's or illustrations so sexual in nature but tasteful and not graphic.

Players can be one couple or two couples playing against each other. The cards are placed into 3 decks depending on the chili rating (chilli in UK spelling) and people choose an easier 1 chilli to start the game, then work up eventually to the tougher conversations and topics. Questions are asked and based on your answers, you move your marker the respective moves on the board to hopefully be first to the finish/ Win!!

The WINNER then selects a 'Perform or Pamper' card for themself and for the losing player, and all of this while receiving a 1 minute shoulder massage from the Loser. Each card has an activity they must complete within 14 days OR they have to give extra special attention to the other person, in whatever 'reasonable' way they want.

Each game is designed to last 30 - 60 minutes depending on how much extra conversation ensues about the cards. The cards should give about 5 unique games, but many answers are unique, so it can be played multiple times.

The game content has been professionally reviewed by a psychologist for suitability.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Middara: Casual Zeke Resin Kit
description:
Middara: Casual Zeke Resin Kit comes with a single model, an art print, a 5x6 Card, and two Standard Euro sized Cards.

The model kit is unpainted and must be assembled using your own glue and supplies. The cards that come with the figure are additional game content that can be used in the Crawl Mode or shuffled into their corresponding decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Deep Madness: John Murdock Investigator
description:
Expansion includes:

Investigator Figure
Investigator Card
Activation Card
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: First Blood in the Crimea: Battle of the Alma
description: Two player grand-tactical game using the alternating-actions system introduced in Wagram. That system places the emphasis on players’ mastery of overall operations rather than on the minutiae of tactics. In effect, players role-play each side’s supreme commander, making the decisions those two men would make rather than the whole command chain, as is often the case many complex tactical-level games. [adapted from official description]
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Cartzzle: Le baiser
description:
Le Baiser is a new opus from the Cartzzle game range. Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: BattleTech Field Manual: Draconis Combine
description:
From the back of the book:

Of all the armies of the Inner Sphere, none is as universally feared and respected as that of House Kurita's Draconis Combine. With fighting skills learned in the finest academies and tempered by the ancient code of bushido, the MechWarriors of the DCMS know no equals. Their loyalty and skill are legendary, and their tenacity has won them hundreds of battles across known space. This classified field manual, seized from the Combine's Internal Security Force, reveals the inner workings of the Draconis Combine military, from district regular units to the elite Sword of Light regiments. This document is an invaluable resource for both allies and enemies of the Combine.

Battletech Field Manual: Draconis Combine contains extensive information about all aspects of House Kurita's military. Every BattleMech regiment of the DCMS is described in detail, including their history, officers and tactics, special rules reflecting the unique abilities of each regiment are included as an optional expansion to BattleTech play. Among the many other features of the book are new weapons, equipment, and BattleMechs unique to the Draconis Combine.

User comment:

The most detailed and expansive sourcebook for matters relating to House Kurita and the Draconis Combine since the House Kurita sourcebook ten years earlier, this BattleTech expansion features much more by way of rules and game material than it's predecessor, and provides detail on every major 'Mech unit in serice with the Combine at the time. This sourcebook is currently out of print.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Hulkbuster
description:
Iron Man’s Hulkbuster armor is one of Tony Stark’s crowning achievements, a machine created to attempt the impossible: contain a raging Hulk. It is among the most substantial armored suits devised by Tony Stark. While lacking the versatility and agility of other armors, this heavy-duty protection has maximum force augmentation designed to allow the wearer to survive prolonged melee combat with a force as strong as an out-of-control Hulk. Its hardened carbon-composite plating and integrated anchoring system enable the wearer to withstand several punches from an enraged Hulk while the magno-hydraulic pseudo-musculature can lift 175 tons.

This is a a full expansion set a miniature that come with card, rules and specific powers.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: Wolf Clan Sourcebook
description:
From the back of the book:

"In 2784, General Aleksandr Kerensky led his loyal followers out of the Inner Sphere and into exile, far away from the strife and chaos of the Succession Wars.

In 2815, his son Nicholas founded the Clans.

In 3049, the Clans returned to the Inner Sphere, determined to avenge their forefathers and restore the glory of the long-vanished Star League.

This sourcebook gives a complete history and cultural description of Clan Wolf, one of the most prominent Clans and the one that bears the name of Kerensky himself. Included is a post-Tukayyid roster of the Wolf touman and personal profiles of important Wolf leaders."

User comment:

In addition to the background detail on the clan and it's personalities, this book introduced four new BattleMechs: the Linebacker, the Naga, the Phantom and the Pouncer. These 'Mechs would later be preprinted in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 3055.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Lobotomy: Guardian Expansion
description:
This expansion introduces the Faceless monster (originally called Silent Angels), and includes four miniatures and rules.

The Guardian Expansion is a Kickstarter exclusive, and was available individually, as well as part of the "Monster Bundle I".
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Millennium Blades: Chucky Smooth Promo
description:
Promo card given out from the 2017 Dice Tower Indiegogo campaign.

Ongoing: Whenever you clash, roll three 6 sided dice to determine your clash value (instead of revealing a card from the top of the Store and adding your Top card). Whenever you win, gain () equal to your roll. Whenever you lose a clash, flip this.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simulation, Trading

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Twisted Loyalties
