Designed by Mal Wright, the game system incorporates Mal's thorough research of published sources including interviews with veterans from both sides of the conflict, and illustrates the operational realities of the Battle of the Atlantic.

Both the map game booklets and tactical rules emphasize simplicity and fast play. Accompanied by sidebars and historical background, they are an excellent introduction for a gamer new to naval warfare, or one who wants to deepen his understanding of this critical naval campaign.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Touhou Shisouroku: Touhou Koumakyou-hen
description:
A fusion of Dominion and Touhou Project. An unusual event is occuring in Gensokyo, a paradise where humans, youkai, ghosts, aliens and gods dwell in.

As a collaboration with Dominion, the game uses the same mechanic as Dominion. Each player construct their own deck from a common pool of available cards, and the person with the most victory point wins at the end.

Consists of 485 cards, with illustrations by 28 illustrators.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dust Tactics: SSU Specialists – "Nabludatyel / Jnetzi"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Many of the soldiers of the SSU are experts with rifles and specialize in harassing enemies from concealed locations. Unlike the Axis and Allies, the SSU prefers to field these snipers in pairs rather than in tandem with a spotter. The SSU Observer Team allows SSU commanders to use the Artillery Strike ability to activate indirect fire weapons. Containing both the SSU Sniper Team and the SSU Observer Team, the SSU Specialists expansion makes a potent addition to your army.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Across the Dead Earth
description:
Across the Dead Earth is a forthcoming Post-Apocalyptic skirmish wargame from Dead Earth Games. Three generations on from The Last War, pockets of humanity roam the ghost towns and ruins of humanity, looting and fighting for profit, glory, dominance and their very lives Across the Dead Earth.

Assemble your Gang of deadly warriors and embark on campaigns to win loot, territory or simply glory, as you upgrade your Gang and their equipment from game to game, building a persistent and truly personalised Gang, honed to your style of play.

The game is fought with 28mm miniatures representing the players Gangs. Each turn, the players act with one Gang member at a time, then the other player acts with one Gang member and so on. Each character can make two actions per turn, except leaders who have three. These actions include moving, shooting, entering into melee, hiding, or Waiting and Watching, which allows the character to act out of turn sequence if an enemy moves within their line of sight.

Campaigns are made up of three basic game types: Loot, in which the object is to find and lay claim to Loot (with which to upgrade characters and weapons in between games), Territory games, in which the Gangs fight over specific Objectives, and Grudge matches, in which the sole aim is the elimination of the other team.

Gear, skills and injuries are persistent throughout campaigns, which are Won by controlling a number of territories on a map, each representing an area in which a battle is fought for control
categories: Adventure, Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Variable Phase Order

name: Alien Uprising: Zothren Invasion
description:
Alien Uprising: Zothren Invasion, a standalone game in the Alien Uprising family, is played in two phases. During the first phase, the players go through a card-drafting process to build robots which will be used to fight off an alien invasion. Each robot will have six body parts, each with various weapons and armor. Once the robots are fully constructed, the Zothren Invasion begins.

Players work in a voluntary co-op fashion to defend earth from the Zothren. If all of the robots are destroyed by the Zothren, humanity is lost. However, if the requisite number of aliens are successfully defeated, then the player who controls the robot that has the accumulated the most Zothren losses is the victor.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Middara: Tomoe Resin Kit
description:
Middara: Tomoe is a cross promotion with the Axis Mundi and their wandering miko, Tomoe! Tomoe is a character from their miniatures game Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices.

The Tomoe kit comes with a beautiful resin miniature (that will require assembly), an Initiative Card, a Discipline Card, an Equipment Card, and an Adventurer Card.

The model kit is unpainted and must be assembled using your own glue and supplies. The cards that come with the figure are additional game content that can be used in the Crawl Mode or shuffled into their corresponding decks.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Battles of Montecuccoli: Volume II – 1643 Nonantola
description:
During the "First Castro War" (AKA Barberini’s War, 1642-1645) the Pope Urbano VII stole the Castro and Castiglione domains from Odoardo Farnese, giving them to his nepfhews Taddeo and Antonio.
Odoardo Farnese with 3000 horse soldiers invades the Romagna pushing back the enemy to the Trasimeno lake regaining the control on Forlì and Faenza but after a short truce, the Pope call again his family to the arms putting Nonantola under Siege with 12.000 men.

Meanwhile, on a request by Francesco d’Este, the Duke of Modena, the Austrian Emperor call back from Germany the best Army commander of the Austrian armies: Raimondo Montecuccoli giving him the permission to combat against the Pope’s army an his allies.

With only 4.000 soldiers and a battery of modified light guns, Montecuccoli force a passage on the Panaro river, moving his army on the Nonantola side of the river then, with an incredible elan, charged the papaline carring the havoc on the enemy army that, after few hours, flee in rout.

In the 1644 spring, the Pope sued for peace.

After Montecuccoli on the Raab, "The Battles of Montecuccoli: Volume II - 1643 Nonantola" is the second of a series dedicated to the battles of one of the greatest commanders of the XVII Century, Raimondo Montecuccoli.

This wargame is set during the "First Castro War". The battle took place few miles away from Bologna near the fortified town of Nonantola, where a big Pope’s army was defeated by a Modenese one.

The Army led by Raimondo Montecuccoli, was recalled to Italy on a direct request from the Duke of Modena to the Austrian Emperor.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Munchkin Something Fishy
description:
School is in session!

Either the dungeon has flooded or you took a very wrong turn somewhere because you don't remember The Flaming Hellscape being this damp. No time to look back, however, as there are all sorts of fun new monsters to fight and odd new weapons to do it with. Are you the king of the sea, or will you take a dive? There's only one way to find out — check out Munchkin Something Fishy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Somewhere Under The Rainbow
description:
In Somewhere Under The Rainbow, you take on the role of one of the tiny winged critters of Glistening Grove. As a loyal resident of this land, it is your sworn duty to partake in the mysterious process of creating colorful rainbows, using a rare and secret ingredient: the crystalline poop of a Unicorn!

Armed with an enchanted plunger, you will fly your way through piles of multicolored Unicorn Poop and gather precious pieces of feces to build stunning rainbows. At the same time, you’ll need to prepare as many delicious dishes for the Unicorn as possible, to make sure the supply doesn’t run out.

Gameplay: On your turn, you can decide to either "Gather Unicorn Poop" or "Visit the Village". When you Visit the Village, you must perform at least one of the following three actions in whatever order you like:


Rainbow Maker: Trade Poop Tokens for Glitter Cubes by depositing at least 2 tokens of the same color into the tube of the Rainbow Maker. The more tokens you deposit at once, the more Glitter Cubes you receive in return.
Market: Use the Glitter Cubes to buy Ingredients at the Market.
Food: Earn Tasty Points by combining any two Ingredients to create a Food of a specific color to feed the Unicorn.


A rainbow is created once all six different colors of Poop Tokens have been deposited into the tube of the Rainbow Maker. The game ends when four rainbows have been created.

Poop Tokens used to make rainbows throughout the game can score you valuable bonus Tasty Points at the end. The more tokens of one color that were used, the more bonus Tasty Points go to the player who has earned the highest number of Tasty Points from Food of that color during the course of the game.

Goal: The player with the highest total number of Tasty Points wins the game, and is officially named the best Rainbow Maker in Glistening Grove!

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Carcassonne: Bonusplättchen Spiel 2021
description:
This single-tile mini-expansion can be added to any Carcassonne game. The design, however, matches that of the New Edition of Carcassonne (2014).

This promo was given out (for free) when making a purchase at the Hans im Glück booth at Spiel 2021, Essen.

No specific rules are included with the tile. The tile is simply mixed with the other landscape tiles. When a player draws the tile, he or she should place the tile according to the usual rules.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – Dark Nights Metal: Pack #1
description:
From the darkest corners of the multiverse comes the Batman Who Laughs, hell-bent on destroying every version of Earth in existence. It’s up to the Justice League to stop this vile version of our own Dark Knight and all its fearsome, horrific minions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Oopsie
description:
Oopsie is a team game that uses a Tarot deck and is a must follow trick taker that features bidding, point capturing and select cards with special powers. If you can’t follow then you must trump and if possible you must over trump.

The game is played over the course of 2-8 hands which consists of 14 cards per player. Players will be working with a partner and predicting what position they finish in a hand based on the number of points they capture.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Predictive Bid, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Pocket Pennant Run
description: Pocket Pennant Run is the only full-fledged baseball simulation that fits in the palm of your hand! Using just a few simple charts and an intuitive multi-point player rating system, teams and players from yesterday and today come to life, performing just like their real-life counterparts. Pocket Pennant Run is simple enough to be learned in minutes, yet steeped in enough strategy and realism to appease even the most experienced tabletop gamers - it’s tabletop baseball like it oughta be!
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Century: Golden Deals
description:
Century: Golden Deals is an expansion for Century: Spice Road, whether you're playing that game on its own or combined with one of the other Century titles.

Golden Deals consists of clear cards with effects on them, giving you something new to acquire and allowing you to modify the cards in play.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Adventure Realms: The Last Fantasy
description:
In this expansion, you aren't just racing through the dungeon anymore, you are also dealing with corruption. If you aren't participating in the dungeon, you are seen to the rest of the world as corrupt. Now, you'll be losing resources between turns if you are corrupted, however, you'll gain benefits for being a certain amount of corrupt. Who knew being bad can be so good?

You'll also have Leader cards to choose from in the beginning of the game. These will give the players a special ability as well as a player specified quest they can complete. This gives players more of a focus at the start of the game.

There are also a ton of new Adventure and Hero cards that may activate when you reach a certain amount of corruption.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Race, Worker Placement

name: The Reich Strikes Back: Bulge Breakthrough
description:
The map covers from St Vith to Namur and Dinant.
The game is composed of 10 turns and starts on December 16th, 1944 and ends on January 3rd, 1945.

This game uses the similar chit-assisting system as the former game of Mr. Idemoto, The Recapture of Kiev.
This game is more difficult than the average Game Journal games.

1 full map
198 counters
Play aid sheet for each player
12 pages rulebook
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Centrifugal Offensive: The Japanese Campaign in the Pacific, 1941-42
description:
Centrifugal Offensive: The Japanese Campaign in the Pacific, 1941-42 is a solitaire, strategic level wargame of the initial Imperial Japanese campaigns in the Pacific War, 1941 to 1942. The player commands the Japanese forces, with the Allies are controlled by the game system. The player's objective is to accomplish campaign objectives ahead of the original schedule, thereby forestalling the inevitable US-led Allied offensive. A critical factor in the game is victory fever. The more the Japanese are winning, the greater the chance they will have to attain additional objectives to win the game. Another factor is the game ends before the Allied counteroffensive in the Solomons, so there are no Allied amphibious operations. Most ground units in the game represent divisions, brigades and regiments. Aircraft units represent one to three air groups or regiments (three to nine squadrons). Distances between each space on the map vary depending on location and strategic importance, with the distance varying from 1,000 to a few hundred kilometers. Each turn represents one month of operations.

—description from the publisher

Published in "World At War" magazine, issue #75
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Construction BOOM!
description:
Construction BOOM! is a strategic two-player tile-laying game made at the Institute of Digital Games (University of Malta). It is a playable satire of the unrestrained residential construction in Malta, and a criticism of the "BOOMING" real-estate business on our little island.

In the game, you take on the role of construction tycoons in Malta, strategizing and sabotaging to complete your building contract and rake in the cash.

The standard game of Construction BOOM! has four rounds. The contractor needs to have placed a certain amount of one type of material on the board by the end of the round. They're penalized when they fail. The saboteur will try and make those penalties accumulate by, for example, placing roofs in inconvenient places or by overloading buildings. The tile types, materials, and weights govern the placement rules.

A round finishes when neither player has any more cards to play or when there are two consecutive passes. At the end of the round if the contractor makes their contract they get points, if not, they lose points — which is great news for the saboteur!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Contracts, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Project EOS Rise
description:
Project EOS Rise is a one- to four-player cooperative space adventure game that mashes up Worker Placement, Push Your Luck, and Dice Placement game mechanics. You and your crew will travel the universe, hunting down Fast Radio Bursts (FRBs) that will advance your progress towards finding the Paradise Planet. Once the Paradise Planet is located, the crew will put everything on the line in a desperate attempt to reach it and win the game.

Project EOS Rise features a “Roll For Location” game system that ensures each playthrough generates a unique universe with unique challenges. As well, a light RPG system allows the crew to explore and discover multiple paths to victory.

Whatever path you take, the four characters - Pilot, Combat Specialist, Engineer & Medical Director - can advance their skills strategically to best benefit your mission. Do you spend credits to expand the EOS and open new actions like mining, scanning, or crafting? Do you become a smuggler and deliver interesting cargo to distant galaxies to gain intel and advance your progress? Do you attack Alien ships using the combined strength and skills of the crew?

Whatever path you choose "Time is of the essence" because each year exploring brings the star marker on the Extinction track one step close to game over. Also keeping the Starship EOS in working condition is paramount because, if the Command room is destroyed, your mission is aborted. In either case, the game is lost.

Step into the command chair and pilot humanity's first intergalactic starship!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Negotiation, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Tåg till Rydsgård (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: Tåg till Rydsgård, Skåne is a fan-made expansion for the Days of Wonder board game Ticket to Ride. It is a partially almost entirely correct reproduction of existing, or previously existing, train lines in the southern-most part of Sweden (Scania and its closest neighbours).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Network and Route Building

name: Galaxy Postman
description:
In A.D. 2986 people are no longer inhabiting earth which was completely destroyed by climate change. Mankind was forced to look for alternative planets as settlements and eventually spread out over dozens of smaller micro-planets. The Galaxy Post was founded for the exchange of material things between the planets such as orders, letters and of course bills. And now you're taking on your first shift as a Galaxy Postman today!
Make it count!

Galaxy Postman is a pick up OR deliver game for 1-4 players with a playing time of 60 to 90 minutes.

The Game:
In Galaxy Postman players are going to deliver important packages, beam aliens back to the mothership, score checkpoints and receive messages from a friendly android called S.A.M. while upgrading their shuttle to better suit their needs!

Every round each player selects dice from their dice pool to activate cockpit tiles on their shuttle board. The Postman will move their shuttle through an ever expanding galaxy full of dangers. Doing so they must always monitor energy and system errors to ensure that their shuttle doesn't get damaged.

Who will become the employee of the month?!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Velikié Louki 1942-43
description:
Velikié Louki 1942-43 is a simulation of the Battle of Velikiye Luki, also named Velikiye Luki offensive operation during the Winter Campaign of 1942–1943.
Playing Time : 180 minutes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Flock Together
description:
Flock Together is a beautifully immersive cooperative experience for 1-5 players. During the game, each player takes on the role of a unique chicken with asymmetric abilities and works together to drive off the invading predators before the third season ends.

Every turn, players choose their own strategy to progress their cause by selecting two of their eight available actions. Along the way, players will also have to manage leveling up, predator loot drops, traveling grubs, and adverse weather conditions. However, players must plan carefully, because as the seasons change, every predator that is still alive grows stronger and gains new abilities.

With eleven asymmetric characters to play and ten unique predators to defeat, Flock Together offers immense replayability that can be enjoyed with quick turns and an experience that lasts 25 minutes per player.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: La Morada Maldita y Los Tesoros de Pirita
description:
Maximiliano Mucharoca carefully carved the cursed purple jewel, but in the meantime, Pirita hid all those fragments as part of her treasure and now it is cursed!

Help her find her fragments and play with her in this this expansion to La Morada Maldita, with two new game modes game modes and new challenge cards, events and curses.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Battlestations: How Much for Your Planet?
description:
From back cover:
The 4th Expansion for the Unique RPG/Boardgame of Starship Adventure: Battlestations TM

The Galaxy is at your feet! (wheels, flippers, jets, or whatever motility appendages you deploy).

This book details over 50 planets with challenges and opportunities abounding.

A Galactic Map
8 New Species (Blootian Bubbloids, Chronosian Timehoppers, Double-acting Diploids, Friendly Kerbites, Tiny Minutians, Pyreltian Phasoids, Tentacled Vomegs and Mighty Whaleoids)
New Special Abilities (Fume Runner, Rammer, Weapons Officer, Smuggler and more!)
22 New Missions

A complete campaign system for operating as Free Traders.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Set a Watch: The Few & Cursed Promos
description:
Additional 4 Unhallowed cards and 1 Location card based on The Few & Cursed graphic novel for use in Set a Watch.

Included as part of The Few and Cursed: Deluxe Expansion and as a stretch goal for the Set a Watch: Swords of the Coin Kickstarter.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Omweso
description:
OMWESO is part of the Mancala Family and this version from Cheatwell Games is said to be the variant coming from Uganda.

From the box:

"Originating from the time of the Ancient Pharaoahs, Omweso is a game that spread with trade along the Nile and became established as an important cultural pastime in the Kingdoms of Uganda. Played on a carved wooden board with seeds from the Emkipi Tree, the game was ritually used in the coronation ceremony of each new Kabaka. Enjoyed throughout the Kabaka's palace, it was played by the King with his principal wives and chiefs."

As in other versions of this game the essential strategy of Omweso is to capture your opponent's marbles without leaving yourself open to capture. All of the marbles are kept in play during course of the game, being captured and recaptured across the board.

Like Bao the game is played on a board with 32 pits with each player having an inner and outer row of 8 pits each.

A move consists of collecting all the marbles from a pit and placing them one by one in subsequent pits in an anti-clockwise direction (or optionally in a clockwise direction if from a player's four left hand pits). If the last marble is dropped into a pit containing marbles, all of these are collected up and play continues. This continues until the last marble of the move is dropped into an empty pit.

Marbles present in both the inner and outer rows are vulnerable to capture, and, in order to capture a player must drop the last marble of a move into any occupied pit opposite vulnerable marbles. Captured marbles come across the board and play continues.

The game is won when the opponent is left with empty pits or pits containing only single marbles.
mechanics: Mancala

name: UltraQuest: Gold, Ruhm! und Ehre! – Der Oger Character Expansion
description:
"Der Oger" is another Character, which can used in the Party.
This Expansion contains the rules for "Der Oger" as well as his character sheets, two Oger-Egg Token and envelope, which acts as hideout.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Las Ligas de la Ñ
description:
Las Ligas de la Ñ is a strategy board game for two players based on the Spanish literature. The game symbolizes a battle between two leagues, with the objective of beating the opponent’s leader.

The game is played in an 8x8 board. The pieces are represented through cards, having each one its own powers. There are different powers, such as elimination, change of side, change of square, use of objects (Cruz del diablo, Miserere, Grial), mobility, loss of power or theft of objects. The leader can only be defeated with the elimination power. Every piece is moved one square orthogonally.

The player one is the Black League and the player two is the Red League. Black League starts. Players take turns to choose and place over the board the twelve initial pieces. Finally, before starting the game, players must reveal who their leader is.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Novel-based
mechanics: Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Temple of Shadows Promo Cards
description:
Two promo cards for Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress:

Takobake House Sigil (Promo Card 342)
Amulet of Heinghal (Promo Card 343; Artifact)

Available when purchasing Shadows of Brimstone: Temple of Shadows direct from Flying Frog, either online, as part of the Kickstarter, or at conventions.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Dominion Faction Pack: The Cardassian Union
description: The Dominion Faction Pack: The Cardassian Union is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Dominion faction: a Galor class, 2 Keldon class and a Klingon Bird-of-Prey class. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 28 cards. The ships and cards are focused on the Cardassian elements of the Dominion. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Iwari: Floating Lands + The Glaciers
description: Iwari: Floating Lands / The Glaciers features a double-sided map for Iwari.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Lobotomy: B.A. Dolly
description:
This expansion introduces the B.A. Dolly character, and includes a miniature, four skill cards, and ten memory cards.

The B.A. Dolly character was a Kickstarter Exclusive.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Treasure Hunters of Charlemagne: A Four Against Darkness Adventure
description:
AD 790. The Roman Empire is a distant memory. Europe is gripped by endless warfare. In these desperate times arises King Charles of the Franks. Wishing to unite the lands, and so end the senseless slaughter, the King sent secret agents to find supernatural artefacts, like the fabled spear of destiny.

Many of these agents never return, perishing at the hands of weird, unknown beasts and unspeakable perils.

Historians would record that mighty battles forged the realm of King Charles, later known as Charlemagne. The truth instead is that brave parties of adventurers, the intrepid secret agents of the King, are the ones who secured the new empire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Skies of Fire
description:
The Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance boxed set includes everything you need to play exciting games of aerial combat between aircraft from the Astra Militarum and the T'au Air Caste.

The set includes the following Citadel multipart plastic miniatures, each supplied with an Aeronautica Imperialis base:

3x Imperial Navy Lightning Fighters (can be assembled as Lightning Fighters or Lightning Strike Fighters)
2x Astra Militarum Valkyrie Gunships (can be assembled as Valkyrie Gunships or Vendetta Gunships)
2x T'au Barracuda Fighters (can be assembled as AX-5-2, AX-5-3, or AX-5-4 Fighters)
2x T'au Tiger Shark Bombers (can be assembled as AX-1-0-2, AX-1-0-3, or AX 1-0-4 Bombers)

The set also includes a 36-page rulebook featuring the following information:

The full Aeronautica Imperialis game rules, including how to build your force using Squadron Lists, how to perform Ace Manoeuvres, field different classes of aircraft and unleash ground defences. Learn how to manoeuvre your aircraft, adjust their altitude and change speed while avoiding the risks of crashing and breaking up (if you exceed your maximum speed). There are even rules for special manoeuvres including landing, taxiing, and taking-off.
The Dogfight scenario, as well as optional rules for fighting at night or in bad weather conditions
Squadron Lists, providing details of all of the aircraft in the box as well as their weapon options and special rules
A reference page showing the 8 different manoeuvres aircraft can take, as well as a 2-page quick reference containing the key game rules


A 4-pages booklet with three starter scenarios (Ambus, Breakthrough, The Straggler)

1x double-sided card Area of Engagement game board (depicting two aerial war zones)
1x double-sided card token sheet (70 tokens to help you keep track of all the action)
8x Six-sided dice (white with black pips)
1x Transfer sheet (for the Imperial Navy, Astra Militarum, and T'au aircraft included in the set)
2x Quick reference cards (containing the key game rules)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Conqueror Worm Expansion
description:
Hellboy: The Board Game – Conqueror Worm adds gameplay elements from the "Conqueror Worm" storyline in the Hellboy comic series to Hellboy: The Board Game.

The Conqueror Worm was part of the original Hellboy: The Board Game Kickstarter but has never been released as a separate expansion before. This is the first time it's been made available in a standalone box, with its own packaging.

This expansion consists of:

2 hero miniature (Lobster Johnson & Roger)
2 agent card
4 Starting cards
1 boss (The Conqueror Worm)
2 case file decks
15 Nazi enemies (3 of each Riflemen, Officers, Machine Gunners, Specialists & Knife Fighters)
10 encounter cards
9 requisition / starting cards
4 double sided game tiles
2 scenery tokens
1 Rules card: New Scenery
6 additional enemy cards
13 additional deck of doom cards
2 additional boss behaviour cards
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling
publishers: CrowD Games, Dark Horse Books, Mantic Games

name: Magic: The Gathering Universes Beyond — Warhammer 40,000 Commander Deck: Forces of the Imperium
description:
Forces of the Imperium is one of four preconstructed Commander decks from Magic: The Gathering's "Universes Beyond" crossover with Warhammer 40,000, along with Necron Dynasties, Tyranid Swarm, and The Ruinous Powers. Each of the decks ties into one of the factions from the Warhammer 40,000 universe and is available in both a standard and a collector's edition; Forces of the Imperium is a white, blue, and black deck based on the Imperium and led by Inquisitor Greyfax and Marneus Calgar.

The deck contains 100 cards, 1 foil-etched display commander, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 life tracker, and 1 deck box. The contents of the Collector's Edition are the same, except that all cards (including the tokens and the display commander) have a unique premium "Surge Foil" treatment.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: G.I. JOE Mission Critical: Vehicle Pack #1
description:
Eight new Vehicle cards bring fore firepower in the fight against Cobra.

Includes: HAL, PAC/RAT, Toss n'Cross, Skystriker XP-14F, Killer Whale, APC, AWE Striker, and Slugger.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Franchise King
description:
Franchise King is a fast paced dice and card game about managing resources to start up businesses. Be the first to start up a business and gain the reward of having extra resources, not the first on to start up a business, no problem, you still get the revenue it generates and that is what wins the game.

Sample Turn:
Place a franchise card from your hand into the unfunded businesses area in front of you.

Roll your resource dice.

Assign your matching dice to the resource dice pictured on your unfunded business cards.

The required resource dice slots for one of your unfunded franchises have been fulfilled, that business is moved to the funded businesses row above the unfunded row.

The franchise is the first of its kind to be funded so you not only earn the revenue that the franchise generates but also a bonus resource die for the duration of the game!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: burncycle: Crossover Equipment Pack
description:
A pack of six (two each of three unique cards) equipment cards with adorable references to other Chip Theory franchises!

The cards are: Spiderbot 0.5, Source Well, and Ancient Chariot.

These equipment cards are all single use cards.

Available as part of the burncycle: New Recruits Gamefound campaign.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ascended Kings
description:
Ascended Kings is a battle royal tabletop game for 2 – 4 players that introduces new, original and innovative gameplay mechanics. This is free-for-all combat to the death and beyond, meaning there is no player elimination. You begin as one of the Ascended Kings, when your character falls in combat, you return as an entity known as a Revenant. Every time a Revenant is slain, that Revenant continues to return, providing each player the opportunity to win regardless of the number of times they return from death. Each player begins with a dormant bloodstone, an item that the Kings are desperately attempting to repower. The objective of the game is to obtain all 4 of these bloodstones by slaying your rivals. The fires of immolation are ever advancing forward, forcing players further into combat.

Once a player has reunited all 4 of the bloodstones the Omega Stone will appear, a symbol of ultimate power. The holder of the 4 bloodstones will attempt to claim Omega in order to win the game while their opponents seek to strip the bloodstones from them in order to claim Omega for themselves!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Swords and Bagpipes: Know Your Enemy
description:
The Know Your Enemy deck is a mini-expansion for Swords and Bagpipes board game.

With cards in the Know Your Enemy deck you will be able to guess — who is planning to betray Scotland in the coming battle. If you guessed correctly — you get a reward. But, if you’ve wrongly accused a player, you will pay for that!
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Mamute Jogos, Moroz Dev Studio, Rightgames RBG SIA

name: Helvetia Cup: the Vampires
description:
The Vampires team has won the HELVETIA Cup many times before. Strongly hierarchical and deceptively strong, the Vampires are not that tough, but they should be approached with caution.
Their motto: "One for all and all for me!"
In this box, you’ll find the necessary to play the Vampires Team: 9 pre-painted miniatures, Player Cards, POWER Cards, …
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails – True Colors Promo Pack
description:
The second Promo Pack of 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails consists of a set of three new event cards.

The new event cards are:
True Colors (green)
Into Thin Air (yellow)
Open Book (red)
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Goliath Gang Cards
description:
Necromunda: Underhive contains a number of Tactics cards, which can be used to represent the myriad tricks and schemes employed by the gangs. Expand your games of Necromunda: Underhive – whichever gang you play – with this set of 26 extra cards. Included:


8 Goliath Tactics cards, which are for the exclusive use of the Goliath gang;
12 Gang Tactics cards, which can be used by any gang in Necromunda: Underhive;
6 blank Fighter cards – perfect for the Champions and Leaders in your gang deck, these have been stamped with the House Goliath crest.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bataille Empire: Wargaming Rules Revolution and Empire
description:
Bataille Empire is a set of rules for miniatures that allows you to fight battles from the French Revolutionary Wars and First Empire 1792-1815. Each player commands an army of twenty or so units.

The system allows you to play with miniatures of any scale 6, 10, 15, 20, 25 ou 28 mm.

The rules are compatible with all basing systems and therefore allow you to use your existing armies.

The rulebook for Bataille Empire also includes all the army lists (130) by period and campaign !

In the innovative Sequence of play, players play alternatively, activating formation depending on orders given, with the possibility of carrying reactions during the opponent turn such as formation change, counter-charge, opportunity fire. This results in a lot of interactions during the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Isla a la vista
description:
In the Caribbean islands you hear many stories of pirates and hidden treasures...

One day, you have the opportunity to see, for a few seconds, what could be the map of an important booty. You will have to remember the details of the map well or you will end up on the wrong island!

In this memory game the players will use the spyglass to see and discard the different elements of the islands until they find the same ones that were on the island. At the same time they will roll the dice to avoid the attacks of the pirates that they find along the way.

When the players think they have find through the spyglass all the elements that they think they were on the island, the game will end. If they manage to to get right all the elements then the players will win, but if they miss an element they will end in a different island and lose the game.

A memory cooperative game for little adventurers, with game variants from 3 years old.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Gauntlet Fighter Expansion Pack
description:
The Gauntlet Fighter is a massive presence in any battle whether serving as a flagship, hard-hitting gunship, or troop dropship for Mandalorian super commandos. Collar mounted swivel wings allow the craft to rotate in place, threatening numerous angles at once. Used by many factions from Pre Vizla’s Deathwatch during the Clone Wars to Clan Wren’s resistance fighters of the Galactic Civil War, this intimidating craft has flown in countless battles across galactic history.

X-Wing 2nd ed.: Gauntlet Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add a Gauntlet Fighter to your squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in a classic Mandalorian color scheme, multiple maneuver dials (for each faction), and tokens. Additionally, fourteen ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic assault ship into battle and eighteen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Variable Set-up
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Warfighter Shadow War: Expansion #21 – Bin Laden
description:
Each Shadow War Mission Pack is a real-world location. Shadow War Mission Packs put you in command of SpecOps teams running missions in real-world countries in the facilities you see on the news. Contained within each pack are Mission Locations, Objectives and Hostiles relevant to each unique location.

This expansion offers 112 cards including:


58 Hostiles
4 Night Events
8 On the Grounds
8 Night Missions
8 Night Objectives
24 Night Locations
2 Objective Hostiles


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Orient 1791 / L'Austerlitz 1808
description: An additional French flagged, Ocean class frigate for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'F' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: El Foc de la Gleva
description:
El Foc de la Gleva (The Clash at La Gleva) is a small and simple postcard game published as a freebie by SNAFU Design. It’s a 2-player game recreating a small clash during the Third Carlist War in Catalonia, around the city of Vic, in March 23rd, 1873.

With a mechanics similar to the "Storm over..." series, the Liberal player must clear the road from Vic to the barracks of Conanglell, while the Carlist player must pass at least two units to the city of Vic. Otherwise, victory is checked tallying Victory Points for occupied areas.

During six turns, players alternate activations of units in an area for movement or for combat, until all units have been activated or both players pass. Then a new turn begins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling

name: Molehill Meadows
description:
In Molehill Meadows you play as Mika the Mole, an intrepid adventurer with an affinity for shiny things, a hunger for juicy worms and an innate desire to dig. And dig you will by using polyomino shapes to strategically tunnel paths across flower filled fields, ever expanding your molehill home whilst being careful not to compromise existing pathways.

Throughout your journey you will forage for worms, unearth hidden treasures, complete randomly chosen objectives and skillfully connect different sections of the map to earn valuable points. Not only will the delicious worms you collect along the way fill your belly but they also gain you unique powers, such as crafting your own customised tunnels, digging multiple times in a turn and even bending tunnel placement rules in your favour, with many satisfying combos waiting to be pulled off.

With simultaneous play and a player count that’s only limited by the number of game sheets you have, Molehill Meadows will be tunnelling it's way into your heart in no time.

So pop on Mika’s extra strong glasses and embark on this delightful ever-changing journey through Molehill Meadows and prove your skills in crafting the ultimate tunnel network!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Contracts, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dinosaur Island:  Dice Tower – Mandi and Suzanne Promo Card
description:
This specialist card was part of a three card set given to backers of the 2018 Dice Tower Kickstarter Campaign. The Dice Tower and CoolStuffInc has since started selling the cards individually. Each of the cards are new Specialists (which grant special player powers) which can be purchased by players in the market in Phase 2.

Card text reads:

"Every dinosaur you create (besides starter DNA) is worth 1 extra VP at the end of the game."
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Dinosaur Island:  Dice Tower – Tom and Eric Promo Card
description:
This specialist card was part of a three card set given to backers of the 2018 Dice Tower Kickstarter Campaign. The Dice Tower and CoolStuffInc has since started selling the cards individually. Each of the cards are new Specialists (which grant special player powers) which can be purchased by players in the market in Phase 2.

Card text reads:

"Hooligans are placed last in Phase 4"
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Big Jim: Il Giro D'Italia
description:
Bicycle race game from Mattel Italy. Features dice that include results with fatigue, punctures and energy.

Has 2 2-sided boards for 4 different race courses
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Judkins shogi
description: This modern variant of Shogi was designed by Paul Judkins of the UK sometime around 1998. It is played on a 6x6 board and uses the king, rook, bishop, gold, silver, horse, and pawn from the standard Shogi game. The promotion zone for each player consists of the final two ranks. Drops are permitted.
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Wings of Fire
description:
"Wings of Fire is a simple, simultaneous movement rules set that will allow you to recreate almost any WWII era air combat that actually occurred or even could have! Easy to learn, the rules are written so that once the game has been played once or twice, little leafing through them will be needed. Interaction among the players is stressed, with everyone participating. Including stats for 198 different aircraft models. So strap on your Mae West, grab your flying goggles, and scramble to play the game!"

2 teams of 2 or more players construct an air combat engagement using PBVs from the 198 different aircraft stats provided for miniatures. Players simultaneously plot movement and altitude within the performance parameters of the aircraft and take alternating turns executing the movement plot ( braking as needed) then followed by firing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dust Tactics: Horten HO-347 – "Fledermaus III / Fledermaus IV"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Dust Tactics: Horten HO-347 comes with one miniature that can be configured in either of two jet variations that have placed the Axis on the brink of a long-awaited resurgence of air superiority in the fierce battles of Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare. The introduction of VK engines has permitted the Axis' newest aircraft to fly faster and climb higher than anyone believed to be possible just a few years ago. The latest generation engines even allow for near-stationary flight and vertical take-off and landing (VTOL).

The HO-347 Fledermaus III is both a fighter and a very effective ground-attack plane. Its light cannons can destroy other flying units in mere seconds. Its larger 75mm gun is perfect for attacking tanks or walkers at their weakest point – their thinner top armor.

The fighter/bomber variant of the new Horten, the HO-347 Fledermaus IV carries numerous bombs under its fuselage. Despite their relatively small size, these bombs can be devastating when dropped directly on a target during a screaming low altitude run.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Temple of the Flying Blades
description:
Your task: Take control of the temple. Like the Chinese tradition of wǔxíng, about which the Onmyōji have taught your dojo, you arrive to discover that there are five competing elements: Two over whom you have mastery; two who know your vulnerabilities. Nevertheless, you know you must prevail at The Temple of the Flying Blades!

The Temple of the Flying Blades is a ninja-fighting game for 5 players. It includes a variant for 4 players.

The Temple of the Flying Blades is a step-up from The House of the Flying Blades. It is a game on its own, but players owning The House of the Flying Blades can 'upgrade' to The Temple of the Flying Blades by purchasing the additional components.

MATERIAL

- The temple board (a 6×9 board that transforms the 9x9 house into a 15x9 temple).
- At least 28 additional black ninja counters and at least 28 additional green ninja counters. So there are 5 dojos with at least 28 ninjas each in total.
- 32 'special attack' cards (from the base game).

As a variant, you can play without the cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Thinktanku
description:
Thinktanku is the hilarious party game where players design, create, and brainstorm titles and descriptions for apps, movies, products, restaurants, and websites! The CEO reads the card aloud and asks the other players to create a description or title based on the drawn card.

Players have 1 minute to write their answers. The CEO chooses their favorite response after 1 minute. The winning player is awarded a point. The first player to reach the set number of winning points wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Voting

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Dredd
description:
Result of a genetic experiment that even the Science Division doesn’t want to be associated with, Martian Dredd is a menace to the whole invasion effort! Lethally efficient, and armed and garbed as a representative of justice, this insane Martian recognizes no loyalty to anyone, and wishes only to punish the guilty and uphold the law – whatever that means!

This set contains 4 pre-assembled plastic figures including:

Martian Dredd
2 Dead US Troopers
1 Dead Martian
Clear plastic helmet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: The Lord of the Ice Garden: Vuko Tiles Promo
description: Some promo tiles for the base game with special actions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Novel-based
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tanks: Comet Tank Expansion
description: Based on the Cromwell design, the Comet saw a number of upgrades. A powerful anti-tank gun and extra armour did little to slow the new heavy cruiser down. They reached the front lines late in the war where they helped the Allied forces across the Rhine and into the heart of Germany.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Novas Vira Militia
description:
This expansion is composed of:

1 Agent Jack Falco, 1 Agent Natalya El, 1 Sonic alteration device with operator, 1 Weapons team of Novas Vira, 4 Novas Vira militiamen
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Eco-Marketing
description:
Eco-Marketing is an educational game in which kids and adults can learn what to do with their so called "rubbish". Most of what we use at home can be reused to make new items, can be sold as recycling material, or even have more than one use. And just a few things are left to be thrown in the black plastic bag.

In your turn, you will be able to decide what to throw in the black plastic bag to get an Eco-point, sell recycling materials and collect money to enter the bet for the first player, and/or make new products, reusing things like plastic wraps, magazines, plastic bags, bottles, eggshells, inner-tires and bottles, that will give you not only points, but also bonuses to get new resources in your next turns.


NOTE: Although instructions are in Spanish, the game can be played in any language, in any country, because cards, coins and board only have a few words, no long texts.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Frost Man Promo Cards
description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Frost Man is a new character that is compatible with all other Pixel Tactics games.

This was a reward for backing Game Boy Geek - Season 5 (2017) on Kickstarter.
Two copies of the card were included - one with a red back; the other with a blue back while the fronts are identical
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Mythos
description:
Welcome to Mythos, a H.P. Lovecraft inspired 1920’s horror skirmish game.

In Providence U.S.A a City like many other, the stage is set for what could be the first battle for the very survival of every last man, woman and child of Humanity. A war is coming, though not like the one that ended but a few years ago. An ancient being stirs in the deep, something so powerful that if it were to awaken, it would wipe out Humanity in the blink of an eye.

​The Sea Queen has been given the task and sent forth her best, they have made their way to land and now walk amongst you attempting to blend in as they scout this world above the water.

Other creatures born in the wild have been drawn to the area, the woods and forests are their realm and they are fiercely protective of them. They strengthen their numbers with sacrificial magic and awaken the old things of the forest best left sleeping.

Guardians from a long past age have been shipped by chance or fate to the town, their chittering growing in volume as they begin to awaken from their hibernation.

Cultists find key points of power for summoning. Their decades long work finally paying dividends as they close on the secret to moving beyond human form and finding the path of enlightenment that will see them become gods.

And finally, the defenders of Humanity, long since forgotten but still ever vigilant. The prophets have spoken, the signs of something dark and powerful are plain to see and they will not stand idly by but will fight to their dying breath against the coming darkness.

This skirmish game will see two or more players take to the table top to play one of the core game types, or one of the story solo/campaign games of Mythos.
Each faction member is unique, coming not only with their own stats, Mythos abilities and traits but also a second side to their nature. Some will reveal this as insanity takes hold, others will be triggered by certain effects and interactions. Each turn players will alternate their activation's using up all the action points of each character. ‘Live combat’ will see that not every fight goes your way even if you started it, blasting your foes with ranged or arcane attacks may see them dodge away, taking that valuable item with them as they do.

Balancing your Mythos use will be key, as each point spent also takes away a point of sanity and once you go insane there’s no coming back but it’s not always a bad thing.

So, are you up for the challenge, to take the fight to your faction’s enemies, to put the objective before all else and push past your sanity threshold until all you see is red and insanity takes you?
​
Yes, then welcome to Mythos!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Shambling Undead Pitch & Dugout Set
description:
From the publisher:

A double-sided card pitch designed to look like a graveyard, with accompanying team dugouts. Each side is littered with broken statuary and gravestones, and features a large team logo at its centre. One side is set during daylight hours, while its flipside represents a night-time game, with complete with eerie lights and ghostly spirits. There are even rules included that represent a nocturnal game played amid this spooky environment!

Key Features
An alternate design of Blood Bowl pitch and dugouts with a Shambling Undead theme.

A double-sided graveyard pitch, representing night or day.

Includes special rules for playing on the graveyard at night…
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): 2018 Blood Bowl Almanac
description:
Guest edited by the infamous Hall of Famer, Lord Borak the Despoiler, the 2018 Blood Bowl Almanac compiles the first three issues of Spike! Journal. The rules, team rosters and history of the Doom Lords, Naggaroth Nightmares and Nurgle’s Rotters are detailed in full, along with the Star Players at their disposal.

But that’s not all – the 2018 Blood Bowl Almanac also includes a heap of other Blood Bowl rules that were, until now, only available in White Dwarf. If you missed out on the team pitch and special ball rules, now is your chance to get your hands on them, along with rules for fielding three legendary Star Players – Joseph Bugman, the White Dwarf and the Black Gobbo! Finally, the almanac also includes an updated Blood Bowl FAQ to ensure that you’re fully up to date with the latest rules clarifications.

Key Features
A compilation of the first three issues of the Spike! Journal.

Rosters, history and Star Players for the Doom Lords, Naggaroth Nightmares and Nurgle’s Rotters.

Updated FAQs and special pitch and ball rules previously only found in White Dwarf.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: メルティランド (Meltyland)
description:
メルティランド (Meltyland) is a land of ice where where polar bears and penguins live together in harmony.

The players are hungry polar bears who have just found flocks of their favorite preys on ice. However, the mass of ice is melting and everything will sink into the sea if everyone gets on the same ice.

The game consists of 3 rounds, and the players go hunting 4 times on each round.

On each round, 5 prey (ice) cards are placed in a row. Each player places a polar bear token on their lock-on card behind their screen to secretly indicate which preys they are aiming at. When everyone is ready, they remove the screens and reveal where they are going to place their tokens with the shout “Three, two, one, Zappaaaan!!” and move the tokens onto the prey cards.

Except for the 1st hunting, the prey (ice) card with the most tokens on it melts and sinks after hunting. The players can also use penguin (hindrance) tokens to make other prey cards sink more easily so that the one they want does not sink.

After the 4th hunting is over, each player gets VPs equal to the value on the remaining two prey cards multiplied by the number of their polar bear tokens on them. At the end of the 3rd round, the player with the highest VPs (polar bears that ate a lot of preys) wins.

After the 4th hunting is over, each player gets VPs equal to the number written on the remaining two prey cards multiplied by the number of polar bear tokens.

At the end of the 3rd round, the player with the highest VPs (the polar bear that has eaten the most preys) wins.
user summary

舞台は、シロクマとペンギンが仲良く暮らす氷の国「Meltyland（メルティランド）」。
お腹を空かせたシロクマ（プレイヤー）たちは、氷の上で油断している大好物のエモノの群れを見つけました。
でも氷は今にも溶けそうで、みんなが同じ氷にのるとエモノごと海に沈んでしまいそうです。

ゲームは全3ラウンドからなり、プレイヤーたちは各ラウンドで4回の“狩り”を行います。

ラウンドごとに、点数となるエモノカード（氷）が場に5枚並べられるので、各プレイヤーはシロクマチップを使ってどのエモノを狙うかを秘密裏に指定します。
全員の準備が整ったら、「せーの、ざっぱ〜ん!!」のかけ声とともにチップを互いに公開し、エモノカードの上にチップを移し替えます。

（1回目を除く）狩りが終わるたび、のっているチップが最も多いエモノカード（氷）は溶けて沈んでしまいます。
プレイヤーたちは、自分の狙ったエモノカードが沈まないように、ペンギン（お邪魔）チップを使って、他のエモノカードがより沈みやすくなるよう仕向けることもできます。

4回目の狩りが終わり、最終的に残った2枚のエモノカードに書かれた点数×のっているシロクマチップの枚数が、プレイヤーの点数となります。
3ラウンド目が終わった時点で、最も多くの点数を獲得したプレイヤー（エモノをたくさん食べたシロクマ）が勝利します。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): General's Handbook 2019
description:
An essential tool for all warlords, this book is packed full of new and exciting ways to play Warhammer Age of Sigmar, Second Edition. It is replete with resources for planning and waging epic conflicts, creating varied and interactive battlefields, and amassing deadly and characterful armies.

This edition contains;

New Open War rule set
Expanded Hidden Agendas
A new narrative gaming toolbox, including rules for street fighting, launching raids and ambushes, including mercenary units in your army, and more
Name generators for a range of factions
Updated Pitched Battle rules and new Meeting Engagement rules
An overview of tournament gaming
Updated allegiance abilities


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Sombra de Lobos
description:
CONTENIDO: lata de bolsillo, instrucciones y 28 cartas.

An adaptation of the French game Les Loups-Garous de Thiercelieux, similar to Mafia.

A small and distant village got struck by a terrible curse, converting some of its villagers to werewolves.

During the night, while everybody is asleep, the hungry werewolves go out hunting for unaware villagers.
During the day, villagers execute their suspects in an attempt to get free of their desperation. Although, this involves the risk of eliminating one of their own, an innocent villager. The clever werewolves, hidden among the villagers during the day, influence the nominations of whom to eliminate.

Nights and days repeat, and the story (hence game) ends either when villagers eliminated all of the werewolves, or werewolves devoured all villagers.

Among the villagers there are different characters with special powers to fight the werewolves.

This version has also an alpha werewolf.
An optional 3rd team can be played, represented by the werewolves enchanter.

This adaptation has the following characters (cards):

VILLAGERS TEAM:
Villagers: 13 cards.
Fortune Teller: 1 card.
Witch: 1 card.
Judge (Sheriff): 1 card.
Crazy guy (Village idiot): 1 card.
Executioner: 1 card.
Hunter: 1 card.

WEREWOLVES TEAM:
Werewolf: 5 cards.
Alpha werewolf: 1 card.

ENCHANTED TEAM:
Werewolves enchanter: 1 card.

Plus:
Contains 2 blank extra cards so you can create your own characters or use as replacements.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Chaos
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


Codex Chaos contains history, background and rules for the forces of Chaos in the Warhammer 40,000 miniatures game. It includes rules for Chaos Space Marines, Chaos Daemons, and Chaos Cultists.

-user summary
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Clash of Carriers: The Battle of the Philippine Sea
description:
The Battle of Midway was fought between seven carriers. Compare this to the Battle of the Philippine Sea which featured a total of 24 carriers on both sides! It was simply the largest carrier battle of all time which will never be surpassed.

Clash of Carriers, by designer Mark Stille, portrays this epic battle. The historical result saw the Japanese carrier force shattered, never to recover for the rest of the war. While this showdown is almost always treated as a one-sided affair, in this game players will have every opportunity to better the historical outcome or maybe even even reverse history.

The Japanese player can use the superior range of his carrier- and land-based aircraft in coordinated waves to hit the US Navy while his fleet maneuvers out of US aircraft range. Historically, despite poor aircraft coordination, many Japanese aircraft broke through the US fighter screen to attack US carriers. What could better coordination accomplish?

The American player can opt for an offensive strategy with a number of task groups to try and inflict even more massive losses on the Japanese naval force instead of settling for defeating the Japanese air strikes. US submarines inflicted losses and tracked Japanese fleet movements -- can they do so again, or will Japanese counter-measures foil historical results?

Against the Odds #58 (January 2023)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Moku Tower: The Endless Column
description:
Moku Tower: The Endless Column is a new edition from the original Moku Tower. Moku Tower: The Endless Column inherits the tradition of Moku Tower collection. It embraces the concept of Japanese home decoration and transforms wood art into an artistic and interactive tabletop game. This new version is inspired by both Romanian and Japanese Culture. While the Woodas rock are inspired by the traditional Japanese rock garden, the Endless Column are inspired by the Romanian infinite column. By combining both the rock and the column together, it has become a masterpiece featuring the beauty of both the East and West.

The game combines balance, patience, reaction and a bit of luck together. It is a wonderful tabletop game and, at the same time, a beautiful decoration for your home. Look at the amazing art work: Do you feel like being in Japan?

For The Endless Column, building a tall tower is not enough. You need a solid one! And as always, beware of incoming attacks! I mean real physical attack! Are you ready to get your Endless Column and build your own endless tower now? Let’s go!

Regarding the general gameplay, in each round there will be 3 active players with different roles: Dark Stacker, Pale Stacker and Invader. The Stackers need to compete to be the FIRST to COMPLETE the mission they got from the card(s) in order to score marks. At the same time, the Invader will roll the dice and attack the Stackers based on what they get on the dice. There will be some fun physical movement like firing the dice to attack the tower! Each player take turn to compete and the game goes on until the first player scores 20 marks.

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Race, Score-and-Reset Game, Stacking and Balancing, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering Universes Beyond — Warhammer 40,000 Commander Deck: The Ruinous Powers
description:
The Ruinous Powers is one of four preconstructed Commander decks from Magic: The Gathering's "Universes Beyond" crossover with Warhammer 40,000, along with Forces of the Imperium, Necron Dynasties, and Tyranid Swarm. Each of the decks ties into one of the factions from the Warhammer 40,000 universe and is available in both a standard and a collector's edition; The Ruinous Powers is a blue, black, and red deck based on the forces of Chaos and led by Abaddon the Despoiler and Be'lakor, the Dark Master.

The deck contains 100 cards, 1 foil-etched display commander, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 life tracker, and 1 deck box. The contents of the Collector's Edition are the same, except that all cards (including the tokens and the display commander) have a unique premium "Surge Foil" treatment.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Drop Drive: Strange Signals
description:
What’s that signal?!

Expand your cosmic journey with the "Strange Signals" expansion for Drop Drive. Explore eight unique anomaly packs that redefine gameplay, from an ancient Dropgate network to the completely improbable Whales of Deep Thoughts. Whether you're a seasoned commander or a fresh cadet straight out of space school, you will navigate uncharted challenges and rewrite the rules of space. Embrace the mysteries of the cosmos and lead your crew to galactic victory in this extraordinary expansion!

...it's time to drop deeper into infinite space!

Strange Signals is an epic expansion for Drop Drive, featuring 8 immersive anomaly packs that will create unusual and exciting story lines. Anomaly packs represent game-altering events, each including premium game content and unique components. Some anomalies are nods to well-loved sci-fi tropes, while others are machinations of our own design. Many of the anomalies in this expansion were created in collaboration with our amazing Kickstarter community!

Prepare to bend infinite space... and explore new dimensions! This expansion includes:


Dropgate
Belter’s Bazaar
The Last Element
Zest Planet
The Whale of Deep Thoughts
Pirate Port
Maelstrom
Furious Furballs
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Events, Market, Rondel, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Chucky
description:
Chucky wants to be your friend, but being Chucky's friend sometimes comes with...challenges.

In Chucky, each player will gather evidence about the mysterious murders that have been going on. This evidence gives them skills and abilities to roll the dice and maybe handle an encounter with Chucky himself at the end of each round! After three rounds, the player who does the best at overcoming these challenges wins — because Chucky will have slaughtered everyone else.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: An Age Contrived: Ad Infinitum
description:
Ad Infinitum is an expansion for An Age Contrived. It introduces 3 modules to add new variability to the core game, as well as cosmetic trophy pieces to celebrate your victories.


Advancement Tokens grant benefits at the start of the game to certain players, based on their performance in the previous game and whether they are new to An Age Contrived. They add an extra challenge for skilled players and a small boost for new players.



Achievement Tokens are mixed in with those from the base game, increasing the number from 6 to 12. All 5 of the Achievements are randomized with this module in play, rather than only the top 2.



Infinitum Benefit Tokens give players new benefit options when completing Monuments, adding to the decision space of how to build and run your engine.


We refer to this expansion as a "repeated play pack", as your benefits in one game will be influenced by your performance in the last game. It can accommodate any combination of players entering, exiting, or re-entering your group.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Variable Set-up

name: Atlas Lost: Rise of the New Sovereigns – Campaign Expansion: The Lost Nation
description:
Campaign Expansion: The Lost Nation is an expansion that allows you to enjoy 3 unique campaigns. Each campaign consists of 5 games, where you'll compete for victory. Each game within a campaign is called an "episode" and revolves around the various artefacts from the past, bringing you closer to the cause that led to the collapse of this world. The 5 expansion modules that appear in the campaign can be freely combined and played with the base game of Atlas Lost. Now, let's embark on a journey to the glorious past!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Ginza Retro Café
description:
Ginza Retro Café (銀座ロマン喫茶) is a dice-heavy game about being waitresses in a classic Japanese café, working together to serve customers while competing for individual popularity.

Half the game is dice management - roll and manipulate your dice to spend them to serve specific dishes, or use them to buy coins that improve your dice-manipulating abilities.

The other half is the constant tug-of-war between cooperation and competition, as each customer orders 2-3 dishes and stays for 2 rounds. If all of a customer's orders are served in time, everyone gain points based on the dishes they each served and regain the action(s) used to serve them; but if a customer leaves before then, the served dishes are lost!

Can you cooperate to provide ideal customer service while competing to become the most popular waitress?
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: スナップファイターズ (Snap Fighters)
description:
A monster-bashing cooperative dice dexterity game by Kuro.
Each round, a number of monster boards are set up on the table. Players each have a character with regular and special attack dice. Players will take turns to either flick or throw their attacks so that they land on the monster boards.

Depending on the player's or monster's abilities, each monster will also get a special ability, or weak spot cards attached to them, and if the dice land here, special thing happen.

The game is over when all players are defeated. The score is counted in amount of damage to the city; the less, the better.

User summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Everrain: Abyssal Tides
description:
Description from the Back of the Box;

This expansion adds two new types of Special Crew, the Mercenaries and the Quartermasters, along with some of the most depraved and wretched types of foes ever seen, the Herald of Agony and the Writthing Myriad. As well as this, this box contains new and unique Sea Event, Expedition and Denizen cards. From the depths of terror come the abyssal tides, and all shall be drowned their wake...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: The Everrain: Torrent of Rebellion
description:
Description from the Back of the Box;

This expansion adds two new types of Special Crew with their host of talents, the Boatswains and Occultists, as well as truly unique enemy in the Marauder Cutthroats, Marauder Brigands, and Marauder Captain. The loyalties of these rouges are as changeable as the sea winds, and they would be willing to join your crew...for the right price. As well as this, this box contains new an unique Sea Event, Expedition and Denizen cards. A torrent of rebellion this way comes...

The Torrent of Rebellion expansion introduces a whole host of defectors to the game. For starters, the Occultist Crew can now be hired! Once fledgling members of the Old One's cults, these brave souls broke away from the dark oath they were on and brought with them dark and terrible knowledge.

The enemies introduced in this expansion, the Marauders, are very different from those revealed thus far, because in some cases they can actually be hired as Crew on your vessel! Marauder Crew function quite differently form regular Crew; they are ill tempered, prone to insubordination and would just as soon stab you in the back given half a chance. But they are powerful, quick and excellent in combat. Hiring one of these dogs is a risk, but is it one you're willing to take?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Ex Libris: Expanded Archives
description:
Welcome to one of our town’s best kept secrets - the Expanded Archives! The contents of this room are meant only for the eyes of the Grand Librarians. Residing within the walls and shelves are strange, oft-forgotten powerful Artifacts that are difficult to master but will impress any Official Inspector!

In addition to powerful Artifacts, you’ll have the opportunity to hire trusty Special Assistants to send out into the village to find the most impressive tomes.

Introduces new Artifact cards that can be shelved with your books for powerful effects and scoring potential.

Adds new Special Assistants and a new way to use them! The Job Faire module allows players to bid to gain Special Assistants, allowing them to have multiple different ones during each game!

Includes:

5th player content
Artifactorium module - 2 new locations, plus all of the artifact cards
3 new Special Assistant Meeples, with their cards
Job Faire module - 2 new locations, plus cards for the 1st edition Special Assistants (with updated / balanced text), allowing the Special Assistants to be auctioned off during the game.
Updated Diviner's Hut location (revised text)


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: NetEpic
description:
NetEpic is a 6 mm tabletop wargame of science fiction combat, set in the Games Workshop Warhammer
40,000 universe. Two or more players each command an army and battle for supremacy.

The game is a collaborative open source continuation of the spirit of 2nd edition Space Marine by the NetEpic Discussion Group that have released several versions, the current version of the rules being 5.0. Rule are freely downloadable from the Epicentre https://netepicgold.weebly.com
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wasteland Heavies/Warlord
description:
The retail release of the Blasted Wastes OtherWorld Expansion became a "Deluxe OtherWorld Expansion" after the Kickstarter with the addition of 6xGhost Warriors, 3xLarge Sand Crabs, and a set of 2xWasteland Scavenger Heavies and 1xWasteland Warlord. These had to be added to pledges as Add-Ons. The Ghost Warriors in particular were a Stretch Goal that was not unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign. The Sand Crabs and the set of Wasteland Heavies/Warlord were wholly new and did not exist during the Kickstarter or Pledge Manager.

The Kickstarter Add-On comes as three identical sprues, each with a body, two heads and four upper limbs. It's up to the owner to assemble them as either a Warlord or a Heavy.
categories: Adventure, American West, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Botany: Perilous Perfumes
description:
