categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Rio Grande War
description:
"Rio Grande War" is a two-player wargame on a hypothetical war between the United States and the Empire of Mexico following the American Civil War. The assumption is that France's Napoleon III decided to back up Maximilian with the French army to maintain his power in Mexico, and the US responded with an invasion. At stake: the fate of North America!

One side commands the Imperial forces (Maximilian and his French allies), and the other the Allies (US and Mexican Republic). The central game mechanism is Action Points (AP). AP are a quantification of each sides command and logistical capabilities. Players expend AP to recruit units and conduct various military operations. Each hex on the map represents 45 miles. Each game turn (GT) represents one to two months. Combat units represent divisions, brigades, regiments, and groups of partisans/bandits. Infantry and cavalry units include attached artillery, pioneer and logistic support. Leaders represent an inspirational to competent commander plus whatever troops they bring to the field.
Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

S&T #334 Mar-Apr 2022
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: Infinity Defiance: Outcast
description:
First Infinity Defiance expansion!

The characters of the Defiance, on who’s shoulders rest the fate of the Human Sphere. Named heroes even before they jumped to the far side of the ​Acheron ​wormhole. Are now considered outlawed.

Marked as infected, and compromised by the insidious Shasvastii and their dangerous Specular Killers. However, even when branded as traitors the crew of the Defiance will do their best to survive.

With the help of Ensign Katherine Cho of O-12, who does not believe the official propaganda of her superiors. Also with mercenary operator Raoul Spector, who has previously worked with Katherine while undercover.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Japan/Venezuela/Tasmania
description:
A single pack of 2 large sheets. Venezuela and Tasmania will be on the fronts, and Japan on the backs of both.

Japan (3–5 players)
This map features Sea Routes and Fishing Areas, both with limited access favoring players in last or second-to-last turn order position! Only with the Fishing action can players deliver fish from these Fishing Areas, which gradually deplete over the course of the game.

Venezuela (4–5 players)
The country suffers from high inflation and corruption. Building costs increase continually while goods are extremely scarce. You can, however, issue unlimited shares to support your enterprise (if you have the income to support it)!

Tasmania (3–4 players)
60% of the island is natural parks. Building in forests costs you cash and income! There is also an additional Tax phase where players must pay a fee for each of their links.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – He-Man and Battle Cat
description:
He-Man on Battle Cat is compatible with the up and coming Masters of the Universe: Fields of Eternia Board Game. This 32mm scale miniature is a one-piece resin model (no Glue required) and comes with an in-game rule card in English. Model comes unpainted.

Product was limited to 2000 units only/
Item is available in Europe only.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Team-Based Game

name: Santa Monica: Fox Games Promo Card
description:
A special card representing the Polish publisher's office available when ordering the Polish edition directly from Fox Games.

Card has no text but does include icons and values at the bottom right.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shadows of Brimstone: DiceFest 2021 Promo Cards
description:
There is a set of the two promo cards P589 & P590 for Shadows of Brimstone.
It exists of 2 gear cards:

Promo-589 - Darkness card: "Descent into madness"
Promo-590 - Mine artifact: "Divine scroll of protection"

It were available as a Dice Fest 2021 Promo card and at the Black Friday Sale 2021 at the Flying Frog webstore for orders over 100$
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Reload: Rumble
description:
Adds the necessary components to increase the player count to 5 and 6 players. This expansion also introduces several new game mode including 2v2v2 Team Royale and Elimination, as well as the rules to expand the existing game modes for 5 and 6 players.
4 new characters in this expansion: Butcher, Betty Boom, Emmet, and Sora.

73 Tokens
10 Customs Action Dice
4 Character Reference cards
4 Characters miniatures
4 Fame Track sets
2 Action Reference cards
1 Map book
1 Rule book
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Heimdall & Skurge
description:
Two mighty Asgardians join the ranks of the gods in Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Heimdall & Skurge.

Heimdall is the all-seeing Asgardian in charge of defending the Bifrost, the Rainbow Bridge. Chosen by Odin himself, he is Asgard's first line of defense against any incursion. Joining him is Skurge, a legendary Asgardian warrior known as the Executioner. Once his mind is set to a task, Skurge's will is as steel as the head of his axe. This pack brings these characters to life with highly-detailed, beautifully-sculpted miniatures perfect for fighting alongside their fellow Asgardians. In addition to their innate abilities, two Team Tactic cards give them even more options for unleashing their power in battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: 18Mag: Expansion
description:
The 18Mag Expansion Kit comes with four modules. You may use one or more or all of the new modules for a new game experience.

Module 1: Supporter Cards
Six new cards which are drafted at the beginning of the game and which grant the owners special powers.

Module 2: New Minor Companies
Three new player companies which offer alternate starting points. These are drafted like the other companies. For a challenging and longer game, they can simply added to the existing set, allowing one more company for each player. The starting hexes for these three companies are F19, F23, and C8.

Module 3: New Major Company
The company „Compagnie Internationale des Wagons-Lits“ (CIWL) is added to the game. It consists of a 40% director share and three more 20% shares. It adds a Ft30/Ft50 bonus to a company that runs a train from one red off-board location to another.

Module 4: All or nothing
A rules variant where you can no longer select how much the major companies pay out. It's simply all or nothing, which makes the decisions on which shares to buy or sell more tricky.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Brigada Pulga
description:
The annual “BRIGADA PULGA” competition, which seeks to find the strongest, most agile and fearless, has the fleas eager to meet this year's winning team. After months of training, the representatives of each team must manage to cross as many members as possible to the other side of the city, avoiding a series of obstacles mounted on a dog.

Bet on a dog, the indicated number of flea tiles and secretly play one of your challenge cards to form the path to follow. Reveal and overcome the challenges to be able to reach the other end of the city with your fleas. Whoever crosses with the highest number will be the winning team.

—description from the publisher (translated)

La competencia anual “Brigada Pulga”, que busca encontrar a las más fuertes, ágiles e intrépidas, tiene a las pulgas ansiosas por conocer al equipo ganador de este año. Después de meses de entrenamientos, las representantes de cada equipo, deben lograr cruzar al mayor número de miembros hasta el otro lado de la ciudad, evitando una serie de obstáculos montadas sobre un perro.

Apuesta sobre un perro, el número indicado de fichas de pulgas y juega, en secreto, una de tus cartas de desafíos para formar el camino a recorrer. Revela y supera los desafíos para poder llegar con tus pulgas hasta el otro extremo de la ciudad. Quien cruce con mayor número, será el equipo vencedor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Slide/Push, Stacking and Balancing
publishers: Caracol Juegos de Mesa, Enpeudejoc Edicions

name: Machines To The Sky
description:
The end of the world is near. Governments, scientists, corporations, and other world leaders hastily attempt to build an Ark on which humanity can endure the death of the Earth, migrating out into space.

In Machines To The Sky, players manage production engines involving technology, materials, and personnel to contribute to the construction of the Ark Project and preserve the future of the human race! By bidding on critical technologies, you must build and move projects to optimize your resource production, scoring in either your personal projects or your contributions to the Ark.

In the end, your goal is to manage the development of groundbreaking technologies so that you can earn the most space on the Ark and carry your name into the stars, the dying Earth fading behind you.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Hand Management, Investment, Market

name: Algomancy
description:
In Algomancy, you are an Algomancer vying for control over an AI simulation. By manipulating the source code of the world you are able to cast spells, summon armies, and augment game objects to modify their capabilities. Players use these Algomantic powers in a conquest to vanquish the opposition and become the last one standing.

Algomancy is an expandable cube-style drafting card game with CCG-like player interaction and a variety of game modes.

The dynamic draft mode allows players to draft their hands from a communal deck during the game so they can adapt their strategy on the fly and works best for 2-5 players.

Pre-draft or cube draft allows players to draft a constructed deck through a traditional drafting method before the game begins, and works best for 6-10 players. Players can either play a series of 1v1 games or larger group games in a free-for-all or team structure.

Constructed is where players build decks of cards from the card pool to challenge other players who have done the same. This works for any number of players.

Team constructed allows a team of players to create a group deck, which that team will draft from during the course of the game. This works best for 6 players (3v3).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Neighbor Scope, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Galactic Renaissance Expansion: 5th Player
description: Components to add a fifth player to Galactic Renaissance.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Small Railroad Empires: Scenario Pack 2
description:
Expansion for Small Railroad Empires featuring Scenario Maps of: Australia, Canada, France and Italy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Deadzone: Rebs Faction Starter
description: The free-thinkers, anarchists and dissidents of the Corporation will always find a home with the Rebellion. They do not stand alone, either; the galaxy is large and full of life, and most races have reasons to hold a grudge against the GCPS. Coordinating their efforts from hidden bases deep in unoccupied space, Rebs raid isolated outposts to build stocks of munitions and technology, hoping one day to have the strength to stand up wholesale against the oppressive rule of the Council of Seven.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Roland C.II
description:
From the publisher:

The LFG Roland C.II, usually known as the Walfisch (Whale), was an advanced German reconnaissance aircraft of World War I. Because of its great speed, when it was first introduced, it could be intercepted only from above. It was also used in a fighter escort role and had a crew of two, pilot and observer/gunner. It was flown by a number of famous German aces, including The Red Baron, Manfred Von Richthofen. Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Alien vs Predator: Weyland Yutani Commandos Expansion
description:
From the publisher:

The best what Company has to offer - at your disposal.

Box contains:
5x 32mm scaled miniatures
5x plastic bases
5x ping token
5x stat cards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dead Cells: The Rogue-Lite Board Game
description:
PLEDGE MANAGER IS NOW OPEN https://gamefound.com/en/projects/scorpion-masque/dead-cells...

Dead Cells: The Rogue-Lite Board Game is a dungeon-crawler that offers a cooperative rogue-lite experience inspired by the Metroidvania genre, playable with 1-4 players, and with a gameplay of around 45 minutes. Explore the ever-changing island of Dead Cells in this ruthless dungeon crawler. Explore. Kill. Die. Mutate. Repeat.

Choose one of the four Beheaded (Woah, hold on... Isn't it supposed to be only one of these guys? Is this one of those stupid time-loop plots?) As you resurrect with very little clue of what’s going on, you will...

• Explore Biomes. Choose your path wisely within a sprawling, ever-changing castle! Will you upgrade one of the character powers with a scroll? Or will you choose a chest to equip a new weapon? Will you find the hidden runes that will open new paths and access new biomes? This won’t be a walk in the park, though. Because the island is infested with the abominations born from the Malaise, be ready to…

• Kill Enemies. Each character class has unique power sets and a deck of action cards. For each enemy encounter, you will only need to pick one action card to cover all three phases of a fight. Loot equipment, gold, scrolls, and Cells from the corpses of your enemies and get stronger, but beware... Your health pool is limited and sooner or later you will...

• Die. Wandering through enemy-infested dungeons isn't the safest activity, even for your beheaded heroes. There will eventually be one monster too many, or you could step on a fatal trap and lose all your scrolls, equipment, and accumulated gold. But this is far from the end for you! Even in death you will be able to keep your precious Cells to…

• Mutate. The Collector will let you spend your Cells to buy permanent mutations that will give you more power... forever! Choose cards to buy from three different decks: Brutality, Survival, or Tactics. Get action cards to enhance your card deck. Find blueprints to grow your loot deck. Increase your health pool. Unlock additional item slots, and much more… Unless you prefer to throw your Cells into this mysterious well... It seems like a pretty stupid thing to do with your hard-earned Cells, but hey, you do you, bud... Death is no excuse to take a nap, so...

• Repeat. Death is not the end either! You’ve already lost your head, remember!? As the day starts again in a new loop, use your new permanent mutations to exact revenge on whatever killed you last time. Go further and deeper into the island and kill the bosses to access new starting biomes. Previously-played biomes keep changing as stronger monstrosities spawn in them, along with powerful new items. (Damn! Will this game ever end?)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Eagle and Crescent
description:
(English)

Eagle and Crescent is a 2 player card driven wargame set in 16th century Hungary. One player controls the Habsburg Empire, the other the Ottoman Turks as they vie for the control of Hungary in the titanic struggle known as Fifteen Years' War (1591-1606). Players move around with their generals, besiege forts and try to keep Transylvania and Wallachia on their side.

The game now has a fully playable VASSAL module! You can download it from https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DXyiUPG5PjOcV3QG_qUuJjzitWj....

All components of the game are downloadable in English, including a map, units and counters, standing generals, army sheets, 56 strategy cards and the rules.

(magyar)

A Sas és félhold egy kétszemélyes háborús játék (wargame), amely a 16. századi Magyarországon játszódik. Az egyik játékos a Habsburg, a másik a török seregeket irányítja a kor legnagyobb küzdelmében, a tizenöt éves háborúban (1591-1606). A játékosok a hadvezéreikkel manővereznek, várakat ostromolnak, miközben Erdélyt és Havasalföldet is meg kell tartaniuk a saját oldalukon.

A játék összes kelléke letölthető magyarul is: a térkép, az egységek és egyéb jelzők, a talpon álló hadvezérek, a sereglapok, az 56 stratégia kártya és a szabályok is.

A játék angol nyelvű VASSAL modulja letölthető erről a címről: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DXyiUPG5PjOcV3QG_qUuJjzitWj....
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Skud Pai Sho
description:
Skud Pai Sho is inspired by Avatar: The Last Airbender and existing fan-made Pai Sho rules.

In Skud Pai Sho, players place and move Flower Tiles on the board with the goal of arranging various flower tiles into a Harmony Ring - a chain of harmonies that encompasses the center of the board. Harmonies are formed when certain flower tiles are lined up with each other on the board. Along the way, players use Accent Tiles to block their opponent's efforts or help themselves achieve their goal.

On a turn, a player either Plants by placing a new Flower tile onto the board in an open Gate or Arranges by moving a Flower tile already on the board. If a new Harmony between the player's Flower tiles is formed when a player Arranges, the player gets a Harmony Bonus and may be able to Plant a new Flower tile or play an Accent tile that affects the board in a special way.

A player wins when he or she forms a Harmony Ring, which is a chain of harmonies that encompasses the center of the board.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Network and Route Building

name: Critical Mass: Plasma Drill promo card
description:
Promotional card for 'Critical Mass' originally available through Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Piercing weapon which gives all of your weapons 'piercing' the turn after it deals damage.

Card text: This weapon cannot be blocked. If this weapon deals damage, next turn your weapon gains piercing.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Chicken Crimes: Salvate Gallo
description: A new adventure in Chicken City: The Detective Gallo is missing. What was he investigating? Who kidnapped him and how? The detectives will be called upon to answer these questions and investigate with the help of three exceptional detectives to solve this mystery. A game of investigation and intuition.
mechanics: Deduction

name: Blobs
description:
Blobs is a limited edition card game with 70 cards, each with its own unique effect and illustration. It is a short card game with a lot of interaction.

In Blobs the players are scientists working at the lab. Each scientist tries to create the best blobs and score the most victory points this way. However this is not without danger. Things can go wrong. Some blobs may be aggressive and may score negative victory points. Sometimes blobs do not survive and end up as chemical waste. But who knows? Perhaps even then any scientist can bring them back to life.

Players are taking turns in clockwise order until the end of the game is reached. During a turn a player performs actions from blobs in his/her room and plays a blob from his/her hand. Other players may optionally play a blob in response. A player executes the following four phases in his/her turn:

Phase 1: Start actions
Phase 2: Play a blob
Phase 3: End actions
Phase 4: Replenish hand

The game ends after the turn in which the active player has eight or more blobs in his/her room at end of turn. The player with the most victory points in his or her room is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering Universes Beyond – Doctor Who
description:
In this crossover expansion, Magic: The Gathering visits the Doctor Who universe, with a set of four preconstructed Commander decks themed around the various iterations of the Doctor, their companions, and their adventures together through time and space.

The "Blast from the Past" deck features the first eight Doctors and their companions, and is built around the Historic mechanic, with lots of legendary creatures, artifacts, and Sagas. The "Timey-Wimey" deck features Doctors Nine, Ten, and Eleven (and the War Doctor), and is built around the new Time Travel mechanic, which allows you to manipulate time counters on your battlefield and on suspended cards. The "Paradox Power" deck features Doctors Twelve and Thirteen (and the Fugitive Doctor), and is built around the new Paradox mechanic, which rewards you for casting spells from anywhere other than your hand. And finally, the "Masters of Evil" showcases the greatest villains of the series, featuring the new Villainous Choice mechanic to force your foes to choose their own demise.

Each deck also includes a 10-card oversized planar deck for use with the Planechase format, so you can fly your TARDIS from planet to planet, changing the rules of the game depending on where you land.

The set is also available in collector booster packs, which can contain any of the non-oversized cards from the four decks—including special foil, extended art, and/or alt-art versions that can't be found anywhere else.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Solitaire Pro Football
description: A pro football board game simulation specifically designed for the solitaire player. Teams came on roster sheets. Not a quick-play game, the solo player plays against an artificial intelligence player, which makes decisions based on probabilities and situations.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Catacombs: Venomous Spider promo
description:
This promo card was included in online purchases at Elzra.com during late 2017 and early 2018.

This is an alternate stat card for the Venomous Spider monster. Whenever you would choose a Spider as part of dungeon setup, you can choose this card instead. Useful in Catacombs 3e only.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: The Twelve Doctors: The Talons of Weng-Chiang
description:
The Talons of Weng-Chiang is an unauthorised, non-profit, and non-collectable expansion for the The Twelve Doctors: Doctor Who Card Game.

Much as including the Gelth, Vervoids, the Doctor's Daughter, a Cybermat, or the The Flood interests the designer(s), there has to be a limit to the card pool - unless you declare the game a Living Card Game (which this regeneration is not).

While the game remains unofficial, and without a publisher, this expansion will be the last.

The expansion consists of the following cards:

Zero Room play-area card (new gadget for the Doctor)
Bad Wolf play-area card (new gadget for the Doctor)
2x Alternate Master regeneration cards (for variant deck construction)

name: Great War at Sea: Bay of Bengal
description:
From the late 18th to the middle of the 20th century, the Indian subcontinent was perhaps the most valuable overseas possession of the British Empire, commonly referred to as “the brightest jewel in the Crown.” Defense of the critical trade routes connecting this jewel to the other reaches of the Empire and Great Britain herself fell primarily to the ships of the Royal Navy Indies and China station squadrons. While the surrounding waters of the Indian Ocean were essentially a “British Lake” by the early 20th century, during the Great War German raiders still made several daring forays into the Bay of Bengal and Arabian Sea, successfully interdicting vital commerce and tying down Allied naval resources.

Bay of Bengal is a 64-page supplement for the Great War at Sea series that examines situations of naval combat arising in and around the northeastern part of the Indian Ocean, as the British attempt to defend the trade routes and ports of their colonial prize from enemies historical and hypothetical. Nine battle and twenty-one operational scenarios examine situations ranging from the adventures of the famous German raider Emden to pre-dreadnought era battles against rival colonial powers, and on to possible later conflicts with the Japanese feared by some members of the British government.

This supplement contains no pieces or maps, but requires ownership of Mediterranean, Cruiser Warfare, Jutland and Pacific Crossroads as well as the operational map from Second World War at Sea Eastern Fleet to play most of the scenarios, while Plan Gold and Sea of Troubles are needed to enjoy them all.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Dust Warfare: Campaign Book Icarus
description:
Game description from the publisher:

While the battle for Zverograd continues to rage, the Allies seek to gain a firmer foothold and strengthen their presence in the area by launching a daring series of raids upon Zverograd’s Axis-controlled airfield. Campaign Book: Icarus is a supplement for Dust Warfare that introduces a host of new aerial rules, plus much more. New special abilities like Air Superiority give jets the edge in dogfighting, while new platoon upgrades and a variant battle-builder take the war to new heights!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Dr. Victor Ramos & Atlas Guest Boss Promo
description:
Victor Ramos is non-canonical. He is a guest character from the wargame "Malifaux" by Wyrd Miniatures. Ramos is the head of the Arcanist faction.

Ramos is a sorcerer and inventor who uses mechanical constructs of his own design as part of his combat style.

Originally available to backers of the Devastation of Indines Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: ABXY
description:
ABXY is a competitive 2-player simultaneous action selection game. Players use hand-picked teams of extraordinary creatures to battle until one player has no one left.

Learn the game in 3 minutes, play a match in 5-15 minutes.

Players begin a standard match with a team of creature cards and 4 button cards representing A, B, X, and Y actions. A single creature card is the active combatant for each player while all others sit on the side awaiting use.

All creatures in the game possess types, a weight, a passive ability, and a special action tied to one of the four button cards.

Each round, players secretly and simultaneously select a first and second action card. Players reveal and resolve their first action and then reveal and resolve their second. When directly contested actions occur, the lighter weight creature acts first.

By default, the A action deals damage, the B action prevents damage and then deals damage back to the attacker, the X action switches out a player's active combatant for a different one, and the Y action prevents future blocking or takes control of an opponent's attempt to switch. A creature's special action entirely replaces the default effect of one action button.

Types have no innate effect on gameplay (so players don't need to remember special rules based on types) but are sometimes referenced in passive abilities or special actions.

The most important effect in the game is damage. Rather than dealing with health totals, chits, dials, or dice, a creature is either damaged or it isn't. When a creature becomes damaged, it is flipped over to its damaged side. If a creature that is already damaged becomes damaged again, it is defeated.

When a player's last creature has been defeated, so has that player.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: San Juan Nepomuceno 1766 / San Francisco de Asis 1767
description:
Description from the publisher:

The San Juan Nepomuceno was a Spanish ship of the line built in 1765 in Guarnizo in Cantabria, on design of Francisco Gautier, along with other similar ships. She was used for many years for many different missions, many of them in the Caribbean. In 1793 she fought against Revolutionary France, especially in the occupation of Toulon. In the Battle of Trafalgar, she achieved glory under commander Don Cosme Damian Churruca and provided an incredible example of Spanish heroism, fighting British ships after the loss of over 400 officers and crewmen. Ultimately, she was captured and renamed by the Royal Navy.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Nepomuceno class “San Francisco de Asis 1767.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fireteam Zero: Recon Event Pack
description:
Add 30 all new event cards to your games! Keep your squad guessing with these dangerous and delightful arcane happenings. Compatible with all sets and add-ons!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Solitaire: Devil's Playground
description:
Dungeon Solitaire: Devil's Playground is a collection of fantasy card games and expansion rules for Dungeon Solitaire: Labyrinth of Souls. Fight monstrous diabolisms, overcome obstacles, and endure misfortunes as you delve into the darkest dungeon in a quest to defeat three powerful demons. Along the way you will collect treasure and unique magic items, encounter strange locales, and acquire three divine graces. But beware, the dungeon is deep and even if you survive all immediate dangers, a fate worse than death awaits those who linger too long. You may face starvation and insanity, terrible curses and demonic possession, forever haunted, in the darkness of the pit.

In each turn you play cards to discover and resolve an encounter. If an encounter is passed you can delve deeper ... and deeper. But beware, at some point you will have to turn around and play as many turn to get out of the dungeon as you did getting in. Manage your resources, evaluate your risk, and play your cards right and you just might get out alive. Fail to do so, and you are surely doomed.

Includes the 'Devil's Playground' stand-alone game and a two-player cooperative mode, multiple expansion rules for the 'Dungeon Solitaire: Labyrinth of Souls' tarot card game, four variants of Dungeon War, and guidelines for fortune telling using the 'Devil's Playground' card deck.

-description from designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Guan Dan
description:
Guan Dan (掼蛋), or "Throwing Eggs", is a 4-player, fixed-partnership climbing card game. It is played with two standard decks and each player starts with a hand of 27 cards; these are typically held in a jagged 2-dimensional array with each rank grouped together--vertically--and then arranged in ascending rank order--horizontally.

The game is related to Zheng Shangyou and other climbing games. Its main distinguishing feature is its scoring system: Each team's score is expressed as a card rank, starting at 2 and progressing up to Ace. This is similar to the trump promotion system in Chinese trick-taking games like Da Bai Fen. In Guan Dan, however, instead of determining trump, the highest card rank score determines the rank that beats an Ace, and two cards of that rank (the Hearts) become wild cards. The first team to win a hand 1-2 or 1-3, when their score has reached Ace, wins.

Like many climbing games, Guan Dan's playable combinations include Singles, Pairs, Triples, Full Houses, and Straights. There are also Plates and Tubes, which are consecutive pairs or consecutive triples, respectively. Finally, there are a variety of bombs ranging from 4-of-a-kinds to 10-of-a-kinds as well as straight flushes and the 4-Joker bomb. Given each player's hand size, the variety of combinations available, and the inclusion of wild cards (which can be used to form bombs), the options presented to players at the outset of a given hand are particularly numerous.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #18 – Australia #1
description:
Warfighter WWII Pacific - Expansion #18 Australian Gear! Hostiles! - - This expansion adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

Cards included are:

11x Australia Soldier Cards (4x PS, 4x NPS, 3x SqS)
1x Location Cards
9x Weapon Cards
3x Equipment Cards
4x Skill Cards
3x Australia Service Record Cards
13x Australia Hostile - Elite Cards
12x Australia Hostile - Frontline Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Godtear: Rhodri Ironheart, Thane of the Forsaken Holds & Household Guard
description:
"Proud, stoic, and resolute, the Thane of the Forsaken Holds stands as a guardian against all who would seek to visit ruin upon the land of his ancestors, or its people. Accompanied by his Household Guard, his iron skin hide turns aside all but the mightiest of blows or most deadly of blades."

This set includes Rhodri, 4 Household Guard, Rhodri's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: The 600: A campaign for Armageddon War
description:
The 600 is a persistent campaign for Armageddon War.
Persistent?
Yes, persistent in the sense that the outcome of one skirmish affects the following battles.
If you win a battle, your next engagement will be different than if you lost the battle.

Additionally, you must not only defeat the enemy in each encounter, but also preserve your force to fight in the next. This is the prime difference between a one-off scenario and this campaign. You will, however, have help as you strive to hold your mechanized battalion together. Between each scenario in the campaign you will have the opportunity to refit your force. The cost to do so will be the Glory Points (GP) that you have earned.

Glory Points earned during the scenario may be spent to refit and upgrade your forces. Note that even though you may lose a scenario, you can still use your accumulated Glory Points to refit your forces.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: The Necronomicon Gamebook: Carcosa
description:
With The Necronomicon Gamebook, an interactive literary adventure, you will experience firsthand the horrors told by the great masters of supernatural narrative.

After the success of the 1st volume, Dagon, the second and last chapter of this saga will draw you into the grim fantasies of Ambrose Bierce, Robert W. Chambers and Howard P. Lovecraft.

Armed with a die and a pencil, you will traverse haunted places and come up against dark ancestral forces. To try and ward them off, you will use the powerful artefacts and ancient spells of The Necronomicon – if you don't lose your mind first…
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Horror, Novel-based, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Rumini: Hajónapló
description:
Rumini - Hajónapló (The Logbook) is a quick and thrilling card game which brings to life the adventures of Rumini and his friends from the popular storybook series.
The game includes 32 scene cards, featuring some of the main characters from the book. But only 8 of these cards are used in each game; these are selected by the players using a secret drafting method, so nobody knows exactly which cards will be part of the set.

Players are dealt character cards of lower or higher value. Each round, a scene card is flipped over. Players can play a card to the corresponding scenes in which the specific character appears. But choosing the right moment is crucial because character cards become more valuable in the later rounds! The question is whether there will be another matching scene coming up later! Otherwise, players risk penalty points for cards remaining in their hand at the end of the game.

The winner will be the player with the highest score – ultimately the one who is most successful in playing the right cards at right moment.

In the year of its release, the game was awarded the Game of the Nation 2021 (Ország Játéka) joint professional prize in family & party category, as well as the JEM Board Game Award (JEM Társasjáték Díj) in national development category by most popular Hungarian board gaming magazine JEM.


Gyors és izgalmas kártyajáték, melyben Rumini és barátai kalandjai elevenednek meg. 32 jelenetkártyát tartalmaz a játék, ezek mindegyikén néhány Rumini karakter szerepel. Minden partiban 8 jelenetkártya kerül játékba, melyet a játékosok közösen, de egymás előtt titkosan választanak ki, így senki se tudhatja pontosan, milyen jelenetekre kell számítani.

A játékosok a karakterkártyákat tartanak a kezükben, alacsonyabb vagy magasabb pontszámmal. Ezeket a kártyákat kell a megfelelő jelenetekhez kijátszani – de nem mindegy, mikor! Mert ugyanaz a kártya a későbbi fordulókban egyre többet ér, de vajon lesz-e még olyan jelenet, amelyhez kijátszható? Ha nem, akkor a játék végén büntetőpont jár.

Az nyer, aki a lehető legjobb pillanatban veti be a megfelelő kártyákat, és ezzel a legmagasabb pontszámot éri el.

Megjelenésének évében máris kétszeres díjnyertes lett a Rumini - Hajónapló: családi- és partijáték kategóriában megosztva elhozta az Ország Játéka 2021-es szakmai díját, valamint a hazai fejlesztésű játékok között a JEM Társasjáték Díjat a népszerű magyar társasjátékos magazin szavazata alapján.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Narcopolis
description:
Narcopolis is an immersive and competitive Board Game. The Game is play in the South of United States during the years 2000.

The Goal? Become the new boss of the town. To become the new Boss, you have to be the one with the higher rate of reputation at the end of the Game. The Game finish either when someone arrive to 20 points of reputation or after 10 turns.

There are 3 types of winning reputation:
1/ Doing some Jobs (missions)
2/ Play some influence Cards (Fight Club, Mob, Hired a Hitman…)
3/ Finance electoral campaign

To do that you have to earn money. There are 3 types of Winning it:

1/ Develope Business
2/ Play some influence Cards (Fight Club, Mob, Hired a Hitman…)
3/ The Humiliation (Sales reputation’s points)

Each turn every player have to play 2 obligatory actions (take money and move) and can do 5 more actions (play or buy influence card, do or exchange job, develope new Business, conquer a new area by fighting or just Build up new Business, Buy or sale reputation point).

To take territories to an enemy you have to play a dice fight which include a bluffing part. Even when you are unlucky you can be victorious.

Every table turn the first player revel a new event card which change, during a tour, a norm of the game.

It's a tactic Game with bluff and you have to be diplomatic and play dirty. Players light on the interactions and the fun around the table.

-description from writer
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Mafia, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Men of Hawkshold Reinforcements
description:
Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Men of Hawkshold faction.
It includes new types of cards (Knights and Pikemen) besides more of the already existing ones.
mechanics: Variable Phase Order

name: Héroes de la Libertad: Batalla Vuelta de Obligado
description:
Description from the publisher (Translated):

SOBERANÍA. La Vuelta de Obligado ("SOVEREIGNTY: The Vuelta de Obligado") is a cooperative game where players will seek to successfully recreate the battle of the Vuelta de Obligado, in which the Argentine people defended their sovereignty, facing the powerful Anglo French fleets that invaded the Paraná River.
Players using dice and cards should try to hurt the boats by getting as few wounds as possible. The enemy is the board. Each turn of the game players can attack a ship and pick up cards.

Description from the publisher:

"SOBERANÍA. La Vuelta de Obligado" es un juego cooperativo, donde los jugadores buscarán recrear exitosamente la batalla de la Vuelta de Obligado, en la que el pueblo argentino defendió se soberanía, enfrentando a las poderosas flotas Anglo Francesas que invadían el río Paraná.
Los jugadores mediante dados y cartas deberán tratar de herir a los barcos recibiendo la menos cantidad de heridas posibles. El enemigo es el tablero. Cada turno de juego los jugadores podrán atacar a un barco y levantar cartas.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting

name: Star Munchkin: Landing Party
description:
Energize!

Life on the ship is boring. Going down to the planet is where it's at. Add these 30 cards to your Star Munchkin game for a real landing party. But watch out for uninvited guests!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: The Horror Game Show
description:
In Horror Game Show, the player puts on the role of a producer on a new reality TV show. They have their own team of competitors who they train, equip, advertise and so on.
But they also have somebody else up their sleeve. The Hunters – psychopathic murderers, empty of any feeling or emotion, human monsters. But they are monsters who are bigger stars than any other celebrity.
The aim of the player is of course quite obvious – make the most money and gain the most fame and prestige. Oh, and remember – do not let the competition outsmart you!
The fight to stay on screen and be loved by the crowds is neither easy nor simple. And it’s not a fair fight by any means.
Intrigues, betrayals, temporary alliances and broken deals. The producers will do anything to reach their goal.

How the gameplay looks:
When creating their teams, players also build their own deck of Action Cards. Action cards allow you to move characters on the board, build a pool of "fans" or use special actions (buying new contracts, weapons, using special abilities of characters, etc.). Action cards also determine the order (initiative) in which players can move.
The game is divided into 12 rounds. In each of them, players draw 4 cards and, by playing it alternately, make their moves according to the initiative and the actions assigned to them. They can also use Intrigue Cards - which make the game more difficult for other players. At the start of each new game round, an Event card is drawn that describes "what's new" happened in the program and what circumstances need to be resolved - but this is also possible during the round (players can also initiate their own events themselves).
Characters moving on the board can fight each other. Fight is done by using and influencing a pool of dice (re-rolls, changes to results due to character and / or weapon abilities, etc.). Players earn points for eliminating characters and completing contracts. They can also earn special bonuses for special achievements (most participant eliminations, top performer, last survivor, etc.)

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Maze, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Contracts, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Re-rolling and Locking, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Set-up

name: Barbershop
description:
Barbershop (or Strohmann Jass) is a two player game based on the traditional game Coiffeur Jass.

From the rules:

Introduction
This is the third game in an ongoing exploration of Strawman Variations--developing two player versions of trick-taking games by adding strawmen (one or more piles of cards, usually with the top card exposed, that form part of a player’s hand).

Object
Seventeen tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the object is to capture the most points. There is a small bonus for winning the last trick.

The Cards
A pack of 36 Swiss-suited cards is used consisting of A K O U B 9 8 7 6 in four suits (acorns, bells, flowers, and shields). If you only have a pack with French suits, you can use A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 in clubs, diamonds, hearts, and spades.

The rank of the cards (and their point value) within each suit is, from highest to lowest:
Ace(11), King(4), Ober(3), Under(2), Banner(10), 9(0), 8(0), 7(0), 6(0).

However, when there is a trump suit, the rank (and point value) in that suit becomes:
Under(20), 9(14), Ace(11), King(4), Ober(3), Banner(10), 8(0), 7(0), 6(0).

With a bonus of 5 points for winning the last trick, there is a total of 157 points to capture each round.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Legendary Units – Board Game Geeks & Grognards
description:
A Board Game Geek exclusive set of 15 cards to play with D-Day Dice.

This set includes 2 Legendary Units for D-Day Dice: Board Game Geeks & Grognards, including new Specialists and items, plus two award cards.
This set complements the D-Day Dice (Second edition): Patriots & Smugglers mini set, and like it is themed for fun with tongue wedged firmly in cheek.

Fancy playing as an Armchair General or Rules Lawyer? ...you can now!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Royal Guard Expansion
description:
From publisher:
Strongest and most feriocius of them all are known to guard Queen herself.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Botany: Tantalizing Trees
description:
Trees, Trees, and more Trees! Create your dream arboretum with this expansion for Botany. Arm yourself with information to gain an edge over your fellow Botanists.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Investment

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Trust in the Force
description:
With its sixty new cards (including two copies each of five new objective sets), Trust in the Force pushes the Alliances cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game closer to its climactic conclusion. The Galactic Empire's AT-ATs and AT-STs trample across the galaxy. The Jedi have fallen. Alderaan has been destroyed. And the defenders of freedom hide themselves on distant planets, biding their time until they can mount a critical counterattack. Even as it brings new war machines and Jedi Masters to your games, Trust in the Force adds to the cycle's focus on decks with multiple affiliations.

—description from the publisher

Contains objective sets 280-284.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Asmodee, Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Bonnie and Clyde, Love and Death
description:
Bonnie & Clyde, Love and Death is first and foremost a solo game that can also be played as a duo, where the goal is to find the romantic end that the couple dreamed of.

Along this road trip, you will have to choose the right actions to survive, stick up banks or stores, but also keep an eye on the gas tank and the state of your vehicle, and, of course, outrun the cops, who will only get better and better at tracking you down.

At the beginning of the game, you choose from four levels of difficulty and set out on the first country road.

Each turn represents a day divided into three phases: Morning, Afternoon, and Night.

During the game, you have to manage your resource and situation gauges. Some of them can lead to your death, such as not having any food or ammunition during a shootout; others can lead to defeat, such as having a love gauge at zero, which would lead to the separation of the couple. It is therefore important to fulfill the victory conditions before triggering any defeat condition.

In easy mode, the goal is to finish your run with a shoutout in a farmhouse, with two bank loot and your love gauge raised to the maximum before the police — or someone — kill Bonnie or Clyde.
mechanics: Relative Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Huzzah!
description:
Huzzah! comprises two games in the new Rebel Yell Lite System.

1) Rosey and the Woodpecker, the battle of Iuka, MS, September 19, 1862
2) Old Burn at Newbern, the battle of Newbern, NC, March 14, 1862

Game components:
2 11x17 maps depicting the environs of Iuka and Newbern at between 150-200 yards per hex
A 25 page battle manual (rules of play) with Designers Notes, Index & Glossary, and Bibliography.
A 15 page scenario booklet with historical commentary that places each game in a strategic context. It also includes Hints on Play to step first time players through a range of possible strategies
260+ double-sided, mounted, and cut counters. Nothing to assemble or punch out! Each combat unit beautifully renders period state or national flags
2 Chart and Tables reference cards summarizing the most important elements of the game
Game unit manifest and Orders of Battle

Important: the players must supply their own game dice (2 ten-sided and at least 3 six-sided dice are recommended)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Orléans: Estátua
description:
Estátua (Statue) is a level I promo Place Tile for Orléans.
You may place every new Follower gained in Phase 5 into your Market instead of your bag.

This was included as a part of Orléans: Promo Ortskarten N°2.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Religious, Travel
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Pocket Innovation
description:
Pocket Innovation is a card layering civilization game using 40 cards.

Each card represents innovative inventions and discoveries.
Players lay these cards to develop their own civilization.
You need to lay cards clever or you will fall behind in the flow of innovations!
You win if you have most victory points at the end of a game.

You can also play solo.
In solo, you play against Napoleon, a mighty imaginary player.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Layering, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Primogenita
description:
La Primogenita is a wargame at Brigade level about the East African Campaign in 1941. It covers the Allied invasion into Italian Eritrea in the north where the most intense fighting took place, especially around the town of Cheren. The Allies invaded Eritrea with two Indian Divisions and some Free French units. The defending Italians consisted mostly of colonial Brigades, recruited among Ethiopians and Eritreans. They also had two metropolitan Divisions in reserve among which several elite battalions from the ”Grenadiers of Savoy” Division were sent north to Eritrea. These battalions (Alpini and Bersaglieri), together with loyal Eritrean colonial troops held both Allied Divisions at bay for eight weeks at Cheren before the survivors were finally forced to retreat towards the Eritrean capital Asmara. The battle of Cheren is seen as an hour of glory in the Italian army. The game introduces a dynamic Order chit system. You decide in advance during each Order Segment a set of Orders, each one with a certain priority value, and so does your opponent. The Priority value decides which Order will be executed. You will have to choose wisely depending on what forces you have at hand, when you wish things to happen, and what you suspect your opponent will choose.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Turn Order: Progressive, Zone of Control

name: Drinks & Daggers: Expansion – Allies
description:
Allies, the first expansion for Drinks & Daggers adds 4 heroes and 1 boss deck to the Drinks & Daggers co-operative card game. This cooperative, "drinking" card game brings the world and characters of the podcast Greetings Adventurers (previously Drunks & Dragons) to the table top.

Heroes: Yazdir, Zird, Bucky, Frank
Boss: Finnekan
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Andor Junior: Die Fährtenleserin Fennah / Der Fährtenleser Fenn
description:
As a tracker, you know your way around Andor. A raven is always at your side as a loyal companion. It supports you in your fight against other creatures and helps you finding things with its keen eyes.

Als Fährtenleser kennst Du Dich besonders gut in Andor aus. An Deiner Seite hast Du einen Raben als treuen Gefährten. Der Rabe unterstützt Dich im Kampf gegen Kreaturen und hilft Dir mit seinen scharfen Augen beim Suchen.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Runemasters
description:
Runemasters is a co-operative tower-defense game in which 1-4 players work together as Runemasters whose sworn duty is to protect the Temple of Mankind against the forces of evil.

Each turn, new monsters (cards) spawn on the board and advance towards the temple. On their turn, Runemasters roll four unique dice and combine their results in various ways to attack enemies, move around the temple, prevent monsters from advancing, use their individual powers, or trigger powerful one-time effects.

Evil forces are relentless and will keep coming until dawn arrives. Werewolves, warriors, skeleton archers, trolls — all have their unique abilities, and you need to adapt constantly to new threats if you want to have a chance to survive until dawn. Runemasters have their own abilities, too, some particularly efficient at eliminating enemies while others focus on healing and protecting their teammates.

The game ends in victory if Runemasters successfully protect the temple until dawn (a special card placed among the final four cards of the deck) or in defeat if the Runemasters are killed or the temple destroyed.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, Events, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Insularo
description:
Uninhabited islands with plenty of nesting sites next to rich fishing grounds: What more could a gannet's heart desire? But watch out: Other gannets have also discovered the paradise of Insularo. Who will manage to occupy the best nesting sites and conquer the most islands for themselves? Whoever has the most points at the end wins the exciting game!

Each player receives 12 identical cards, each of which may only be played once. The cards are used to build nests, fly or plant bushes
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Arcadia Quest: Princess Pearl
description:
Defense: 2
Health: 3
Ability: Exhaust hero to un-exhaust a hero in line of sight.

Promotional figure first offered at GenCon 2017 from CMON.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – "Pig From Hell" Promo Card
description:
Monster

Traits:
Animal
Demon
Mythic
Veteran

Check to Defeat:
Combat 6 THEN Combat 6 THEN Combat 6

Powers:
The difficulty of checks to defeat the Pig from Hell is increased by three times the scenario's adventure deck number.

All damage dealt by the Pig from Hell is Fire damage.

If defeated, you may draw a random non-Basic armor from the box.

"Don't go back to Munchmeat Farm."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dominare: Promo Cards
description:
A set of 4 promotional Agent cards for Dominare.

Sophus Thaelin (Artisan/Knave)
Archbishop Salvatore (Clergy)
Marianna Kylene (Noble/Royal)
Susannah (Plebian/Royal)

Included inside AEG's version of Patronize
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Political, Renaissance, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dust Tactics: Schwer-Sturmgrenadiere Command Squad – "Heavy Kommandotrupp"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

As the battles of Dust Tactics intensify, NCO Command Squads inspire their allies to tremendous feats with their new special abilities. Marching to the front lines in their protective battle suits, the Axis Heavy Kommandotrupp withstand enemy small arms fire as they call in artillery strikes, repair walkers and send them back into battle, or boost soldiers with powerful, untested chemicals. These powerful squads provide clear direction for other troops and offer players tremendous army-building flexibility.

Dust Tactics: "Heavy Kommandotrupp" - Schwer-Sturmgrenadiere Command Squad includes a unit card and three distinct miniatures.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Grimm Forest: Genie & Magic Lamp promo cards
description:
These are two new Fable cards which can interact with each other.

Genie:
"End of Gather Phase: If you are in a Location with another player you may immediatly build a Floor or Walls for half the cost. If the Magic Lamp is in the discard pile, you may instead build a Floor or Walls for free."

Magic Lamp:
"When Revealed: Draw the top three cards of the Fable deck. Choose 1 to play immediatly and discard the other two. If the Genie is in the discard pile, draw the other two cards instead."

German edition:
Grimms Wälder: Flaschengeist & Wunderlampe
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Druid City Games, Lucky Duck Games, Mirakulus

name: The World Game of Economics
description: In The World Game of Economics each player is in control of a country's economy. This is one of the most important responsibilities facing a nation's leader. Everyone wants full employment, low inflation, economic growth and a high quality of life. As a player of the game, your challenge is to achieve these goals. The game may be played as a game, or it can be used to study current economic events. It is primarily designed for fun and requires no understanding of economics. The special training which economists have will not help them win. However, there is an economic principle behind each aspect of the game. Players who wish to learn more about economics may refer to the "Dictionary of Economic Terms" at the end of the rules.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Asian Fleet
description:
The game posits a destablisation of relations between Japan and its neighbours leading to conflict. The A1-size map spans from the southern tip of the Sakhalin Islands to the northern tip of Luzon. The game focuses on air and naval combat, with units representing individual ships and squadrons of aircraft. The USA, Japan, China, Taiwan, the two Koreas and Russia are represented in this game.

The game comes with three introductory scenarios:
- The Hunt for Chinese Han Class
- They met at Tsushima
- Battle over Kadena

And 6 full scenarios：
- Sink the Dokto
- Oil Field Waters
- Target Nodong
- Invasion Taiwan
- Fire in the Far East
- Two Against Japan
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 8
description:
A collection of 12 ASL scenarios designed for tournament play. Originally intended for the Florida ASL tournament; issues now premier at the annual ASLOK tournament in Cleveland Ohio.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader


Contents:
Designer notes and articles. (24 pages)
12 scenarios SP85 - SP96

SP85 - The McCown Encounter
Habiemont, Belgium, 18 December 1944

SP86 - Bridge at Stavelot
Stavelot, Belgium, 18 December 1944

SP87 - Fangs of the Tiger
Skvoritsy, Russia, 21 January 1944

SP88 - Race for the Sarvis
Szabadbattyan, Hungary, 18 January 1945

SP89 - Assaulting Tes
Tes, Hungary, 21 March 1945

SP90 - Skirting the Mace
Near Moissy, France, 20 August 1944

SP91 - Show a Little Guts!
Eniwetok, The Marshall Islands, 19 February 1944

SP92 - Seelow Seesaw
Seelow Heights, Germany, 16 April 1945

SP93 - Oder Bound
East of Reppen, Germany, 27 January 1945

SP94 - Out of Order
Drvar, Bosnia, Yugoslavia, 25 May 1944

SP95 - Burn Gurkha Burn!
Prome, Burma, 31 March 1942

SP96 - Husum Hotfoot
Near Husum, Germany 8 April 1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: BattleTech Field Manual: Capellan Confederation
description:
From the back of the book:

Ravaged during the Succession Wars and poorly governed by paranoid Chancellors, the Capellan Confederation has languished at the mercy of its more powerful neighbours for centuries. However, the time of Xin Sheng has arrived. A new birth. The devious and brilliant Sun-Tzu Liao leads his people into a glorious era of national pride and prosperity. Through subterfuge and warfare, he is driven to reclaim everything the Confederation has lost.

BattleTech Field Manual: Capellan Confederation provides an in-depth look at the rising power of House Liao, including profiles on every Confederation regiment and the regiments of the newly conquered St. Ives Compact. Special rules reflecting the unique abilities of each regiment are included, along with new equipment and 'Mechs exclusive to the Capellan Confederation.

User comment:

This sequel to the earlier House Liao (The Capellan Confederation) follows the same format as the other BattleTech Field Manuals in that it focuses largely on the military structure of the Capellan Confederation before introducing a scattering of new equipment, 'Mechs, vehicles, a Warship and some Battle Armour.

While this sourcebook is out of print, it has been released in an electronic format by the new license holder, Catalyst Game Labs, making it much easier to get hold of than some of the other Field Manuals.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: ATS TT: LZ X-Ray
description:
LZ X-RAY is a labor of love of designer Jason Brown and we know that YOU too will love the way the system seamlessly moves forward in time, from the French Indochina War to the latter part of the conflict, aka the "Vietnam War". The place is a remote swath of empty terrain in the Chu Pong Massif foothills. There's one problem...almost an entire NVA Battalion is streaming out of the foothills toward you and your men. It's November 1965 all over again and YOU are under fire on a 'Hot LZ' and there is only one way in and one way out...by air. New counters join the system in the form of multiple helicopter models, the 'Thumper Gunner', M60 machine-guns, and more.

With ATS LZ X-RAY you'll be brought in....and hopefully back out again in a series of scenarios that depict the action from initial landing to Hot LZ and then some. Moore, Plumley, and all the valiant soldiers depicted in the book and movie "We Were Soldiers Once" are there and back in action again, facing a determined enemy with one goal: overrun the LZ and the men of the 7th Air Cav. You'll find all the termite mounds you can handle, NVA Regulars, historical leader counters, and Hueys...Hueys...Hueys...in various models. All with DETAILED COLOR MILITARY ART used for the die-cut counters.

LZ X-RAY provides all the combat counters you need to play, just bring your own ATS marker counters, ATS rulebook and standard play aids.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: High Seas Fleet: The First World War at Sea
description:
Subtitle: "Data Annexes: Ships & Aircraft August 1914 - November 1918".

(from Clash of Arms:)

This annex booklet provides the statistics for all the ships, aricraft, and weapons used in the scearios in High Seas Fleet.

We've also tried to cover most of the other major and minor naval weapons used in the Great War, so that the players will be able to create their own scenarios using the information here.
In addition to the data tables in Annexes A through F, Annex J lists all the formulas used to calculate a ships damaged points, armor rating, and other game-related values. Players can use this Annex to add other ships to the system.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Dust Tactics: SSU Hero Pack – "Nikolaï / Yakov / Red Yana"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The SSU, like the other factions, goes to battle under the leadership of inspiring and skilled commanders. Heroes like Nikolaï, Yakov, and Red Yana give the SSU forces an edge in combat. Red Yana has an extraordinary Fighting Spirit, and Nikolaï is a superb Pilot. Meanwhile, Yakov is a Legendary Tactician who can adeptly command any strike force. With the SSU Hero Pack, your army has access to new skills and strategies to win any battle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Road to St. Die: France, October 1944
description:
The Road to St Die is a company/battalion level simulation of those battles in October 1944.

Players control the various German and American forces which took part. The American player must coordinate their three divisions to penetrate the front lines of the Germans and drive towards St. Die. The German player must coordinate their forces to slow the American drive and maintain the integrity of their front line, while preserving their forces and preventing the American from achieving their geographical objectives.

The system is an evolution of the "Korps" system with variable turn order and more tactical differentiation to deal with late war units and equipment.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Flames of War: Market Garden – The Allied Invasion of Holland, September-November 1944
description:
Publisher Blurb with updates by user:

This book is a supplement for the World War II miniatures game Flames of War. It covers the battles for Oosterbeek, Arnhem, Eindhoven and Nijmegen during Operation Market Garden, September 1944. This is compilation of A Bridge Too Far and Hell's Highway books. The original printed material was 160 pages in length across the two books. However the Market Garden compilations total reaches 340 pages. The Allied book featured 12 new forces and 11 old favorites, and the Axis book added 14 new armies as well as including the five original German lists.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Bridj Promo Guest Character
description:
Bridj is non-canonical. She is a guest character from "Big City". Bridj calls upon her allies to make coordinated team attacks.

Originally available to backers of the Devastation of Indines Kickstarter Campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Golem Arcana: Durani Empire – Gilded Band
description:
The ostentatious golems of The Gilded Band cause many to underestimate them - a mistake few survive. For beneath the gold plating is a devious and battle-hardened elite unit. Regimental commander Ramaka uses misleading showmanship to his advantage on the battlefield, as well as in the court of his sponsor, Princess Dasra.

All Gilded Band Golems share the unique Passive Ability of ignoring enemy Critical or Lucky dice rolls.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Incredible Courage 100 Days:  Quatre Bras
description:
This is a great game, with plenty of detail, of the critical Battle of Quatre Bras fought between Marshall Ney and the Duke of Wellington on 16 June 1815. The battle is an excellent example of a Meeting Engagement, which will provide you the ability to easily alter the flow of the battle, and its tempo. The French II Corps, reinforced with the Light Cavalry of the Imperial Guard, is ordered to take the crossroads and send some troops to the east to help Napoleon, who is fighting the Prussians. This game will smoothly connect to the Ligny battlefield maps when the Ligny game is released. This game contains the Order of Battle charts, and supporting charts, for the entire 4 game set.

Scenarios include:

The Battle of Quatre Bras - for those of you who want to play the entire event.
15 June 1815 - for those who want a really small scenario that plays quickly. The French Lancers of the Imperial Guard attempt to outmaneuver the small Dutch/Nassau force holding just north of Frasnes and take the crossroads in a quick battle.
Counter-Attack at Thyle - for those who want a really small scenario that plays quickly. The French must take the town of Thyle and the British must hold it. Counter density is very low.
Hooves of Destruction - where the French Cuirassiers and Lancers of Pire's 2nd Cavalry Division manage to catch a British Battalion unprepared for a cavalry charge and the unthinkable happens.
The Guard Attacks - the British Guard has popped out of the Bois de Bossu and is hitting the French to push them south. Their over-zealous pursuit puts them in a bad position when the French cavalry again begins some fine charges.


Key Features

(8) 11" x 17" game maps of the Quatre Bras area
(8) Full Color Order of Battle Charts
Numerous charts and tables
Variable combat strengths
Reduction by Levels of Order
Restructured rules and Quatre Bras Rules Supplement with National Doctrinal Rules
Approximately 1400 Die Cut Unit Counters and Markers
Infantry and Cavalry units at the company and squadron level and artillery at the section level
Battalion level infantry and Regiment level cavalry units
(5) Scenarios that allow play on smaller parts of the battle or the entire affair
Highly detailed without overbearing rules
Excellent Solitaire Play


(from Grognard sim's website)
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Malifaux: Masters of the Path – Yan Lo Box Set
description: Yan Lo revolves around powerful models called Ancestors, bringing them back and making them fight for him. Due to the cost of ancestors his crew tends to be rather elite, but he buffs himself through the power of Chi as the game continues and can become a true nightmare to deal with by game's end.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: FML! The Game
description:
FML! The Game is a modern, humorous take on The Game of LIFE. No longer are the days of going to school, working for the same company, and having 2.4 children with your heterosexual spouse. In FML! The Game, your life can go any direction: will you be a transgender hooker or a divorcee doctor with 9 kids? Every new game is a new experience!

To play, you first choose your gender, hop in your car, and start on either the college or burnout track. From there, simply roll the die and perform the action of whatever space you land on. If you land on a space that contains the FML! logo, draw an FML card. These are wild cards have instructions from paying money to singing a song.

After retirement, all players tell their "FML Life Story" - a hyperspeed explanation of why your life was the most unforgettable. How did you make your millions? Who did you father? Any interesting injuries or lawsuits? When everyone has finished, vote on the winner.
mechanics: Role Playing

name: Helvetia Cup: the Ogres
description:
Grisa is a mountainous land!
The Ogres are friendly. They have a very strong team spirit but their strength and love of others are often a problem for the opposing team. In fact seeing Ogres gobble up a piece of their opponent is not a rare sight. Before winning, the opponent needs to stay in one piece! "
In this box, you’ll find the necessary to play the Ogres Team :
o 9 pre-painted miniatures, Player Cards, POWER Cards, …

This is an expansion box. It needs the standard HELVETIA Cup box to be played!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Le Temps des As II
description:
Dogfights with new aircrafts, raids with Zeppelins, sinking ships with torpedoes and landing on aircraft-carrier : Le Temps des As II - Age of Aces II is a follow-up to Le Temps des As - Age of Aces, a tactical game about aerial warfare in the 1916-1918 period. Take control of this fast and furious game system with minimal use of markers and no pre-plotting. The game can be played with solo scenarios or with 2 or more players.

Le Temps des As II - Age of Aces II is a stand-alone game that can be combined with Le Temps des As - Age of Aces published in Vae Victis magazine issue #117.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Brewmaster's Top Shelf Ale
description: This additional drink card came as a Kickstarter reward for The Red Dragon Inn 4 and The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove. Artwork by Loot Corps.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Krefeld
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Forch
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: BoxiTale: Knights of Nature
description:
BoxiTale brings stories to life on smartphones or tablets, allowing children to craft their innovative skills on a gameboard. Utilizing the BoxiTale app while building the game, players design, build and solve challenges presented to them within the story.

Boxitale is a table top game that uses a smartphone/ tablet to stream an animated series taking place in a secret land called “El Animal” where Alen, Drama and the kids (players) are part of a group called ‘knights of nature’.

The group meets regularly in their hiding place at the treehouse, but something strange happens. A book starts to move on the book shelf, and they find themselves in the mystical land, “El- Animal”, where evil forces take control of the animal powers.

The kids use various crafted technics and a lot of imagination and creativity to solve the challenges and save “El Animal".
mechanics: Storytelling

name: BATTALIA NCBC: Velik-an
description:
Suddenly a harsh voice crashed over the mountains: "I will spare the pity life of every minor creature in this land who obeys me! I could even like some of you, if they stay calm in my herd and supply me well. The rest of you should try me and suffer my anger!" Very large and gorgeous miniature of the Giant: Velik-an, who demands tributes from the players every day in order to leave them be... But not everyone is obliged to pay his price, you can always try to fight him until the giant's total defeat or temporary repel.


NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basically competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replayability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Sfacteria, 425 a.C.
description:
This is a game that simulates the battles of Pilo and Sfacteria during the Peloponnesian War.

It is a new edition of Sphactérie (425 av. J.-C.) published in Vae Victis 95.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Baden
