description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Zürich
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Girl Genius: The Works – Kickstarter Funvelope Promo Cards
description:
A set of four cards that were included in the Kickstarter exclusive Funvelope.

Includes:
Colette Voltaire: (4) Choose two cards with exactly one detail in common, and pop them both.
Doctor Lucky: (7) Replace this card with this card.
Queen Albia: (8) Choose one card from every player's Score Pile and shuffle them into the deck.
Doctor Rothfuss: (5) Swap up to three cards in your Score Pile with cards in another player's Score Pile.
mechanics: Modular Board

name: Star Wars Customizable Card Game: The Empire Strikes Back
description:
The Force is with You! This ready-to-play version of the Star Wars Customizable Card Game, moves the story forward to The Empire Strikes Back and introduces new characters and locations from this great adventure. Now your characters can battle it out on the icy planet of Hoth as the brave Rebels face the fearsome AT-ATs marching menacingly towards Echo Base! This special two-player game contains two ready-to-play 60-card decks created to give you a satisfying and balanced game. Choose to play either the Light Side or the Dark Side and fight to deplete your opponent’s Life Force. The detailed rules booklet incorporates explanations of all the new features and characters. And finally, the two decks contain seven new and unique cards exclusive to this set that cannot be purchased separately, plus a 15-card Expansion Set with a random selection of cards (white-bordered) from the original Premiere set of 320. Continue your personal adventure into the Star Wars Customizable Card Game and remember never underestimate the power of the Force! 

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Unfair: ABDW Kickstarter Sneak Peek Cards
description:
This pack of 13 playable sneak peek cards from future expansions for Unfair, plus 1 promo card, was available to backers of the ABDW expansion. These are Kickstarter temporary exclusives marked with an asterisk symbol in the bottom right hand corner. The included thank you card had instructions for use:

Cards with an asterisk symbol for their theme pack are promotional cards. You can add up to 1 copy of any promo cards you wish to use in your game, unless that card is already in the chosen packs.


Database Hacker
VR Pod
Secret Base
Lockers & Coat Check
Street Performer
_____ Kingdom
Nautilus Adventure
Penguins
Difference Engine
Aether Lamp
Time Traveller
Z-Day
Zombie Horde
Gen Con


With the release of the Unfair CHKO expansion, 4 of these cards have now officially expired:


Database Hacker (Hacker Theme)
VR Pod (Hacker Theme)
Nautilus Adventure (Ocean Theme)
Penguins (Ocean Theme)
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Good Games Publishing

name: Blood & Plunder: No Peace Beyond the Line
description:
Blood & Plunder: No Peace Beyond the Line

This 248-page book is a supplement to the original Blood & Plunder rule book.

It contains plenty of new content:

units,
ships, and
additional rules.


Please note that this book is not a standalone rule book, only an expansion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Aventuria: Diener des Namenlosen Heldenset
description:
The heroes are recruited for a dangerous mission in Khezzara, the capital of the orcs. Their mission: to rob the treasury of the Aikar Brazoragh. Their client: a cunning figure who pretends to be an agent of the KGIA, but in reality serves completely different masters.

This hero set includes the Heroes' Deck of the Consecrated One of the Nameless Zardok of Marternpfuhl, special Nameless cards for adventures with a group of servants of the Nameless One, and the Heist adventure "Thieves in Khezzara", which is especially suitable for rogue adventurers.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

description: 1888 is an 18xx game. Players operate their railroads in Jefferson and New Suffolk, two fictional states within the United States. “Event Cards” are a nice way to add historical flavor to a game, but a deck of random events being flipped over each round is not what we’re after. The train deck is stacked with event cards that are intended to entice players into changing their train buying habits. Additional “McGuffins” include two-sided train cards with a more powerful train on the reverse, and unconventionally, priority deal established at the beginning of each stock round. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Master of Wills: Bloodcrown Fringe War Neutral Pack
description:
The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Utilize this new tech will allow Bloodcrown to tighten their rule over the city even further.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Academy: The Lost Forest
description:
The forest spirit calls you, young adventurers! Don your best armor, and have a brush with the forces of nature!

The first expansion for Dungeon Academy adds 3 new dice, 4 new heroes and 8 new loot cards to the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time

name: Hitodama
description:
You and your fellow spirits should keep the commandments of the seasons. You should work as a team and reforest the forests with sacred seeds and bring in abundance.

Hitodama is a fantasy-themed strategy game with a watercolor style. It tells the story of guardians of the forest and their actions to take care of it. In each game, the board is changing, favoring, or disfavoring the cardinal points activating effects of the activated areas. The resources distributed on the board are obtained by the system of worker placement. During your turn, choose between playing cards you have in your hand or interacting with other players. Get your own resources to get your victory points, but you must not forget that the players must work as a team to advance through the seasons.

Hitodama is ideal for players looking for a challenge, but it also works great for novice players. The story is beautifully told with art that makes it unique.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
description:
¡LARGA VIDA AL REY!

Godzilla, Mothra, Rodan y King Ghidorah se han reunido bajo el cielo tormentoso de Boston para librar su última batalla. Con la ayuda del ORCA, los científicos de la organización Monarch pueden controlar a estas poderosas criaturas... pero, ¡cuidado! ¡Los titanes son imprevisibles!

Basado en la aclamada película de Warner Bros y Legendary Pictures, GODZILLA: REY DE LOS MONSTRUOS es un juego trepidante y repleto de giros inesperados.

Cada jugador maneja a un científico de Monarch con habilidades únicas. En la FASE CIENTÍFICA cada jugador hace avanzar una de las cuatro tecnologías posibles (ORCA, Destructor de oxígeno, Comunicaciones y Arqueología). En la FASE MONSTRUOSA cada jugador desata el poder de uno de los cuatro titanes. Las batallas son rápidas y violentas, con tiradas de dados, contraataques y empujones.

Los jugadores tienen dos objetivos secretos. En su OBJETIVO CIENTÍFICO aparecen dos tecnologías para ser desarrolladas. En su OBJETIVO MONSTRUOSO aparecen dos titanes que deben ser destruidos. El primer científico en cumplir ambos objetivos GANA EL JUEGO y es nombrado líder de Monarch. Sin embargo, las cosas no van a ser tan fáciles como puede parecer en un principio: los jugadores pueden adquirir cartas de evento con diversos efectos, capaces de dar la vuelta a la partida en un momento.

¿Estás preparado para unirte a la lucha y enfrentarte al REY DE LOS MONSTRUOS?


LONG LIVE THE KING!

Godzilla, Mothra, Rodan and King Ghidorah have gathered under the stormy sky of Boston to fight their last battle. With the help of the ORCA, the scientists from Monarch can control these powerful creatures ... but, beware! Titans are unpredictable!

Based on Warner Bros and Legendary Pictures monster hit, GODZILLA: KING OF THE MONSTERS is a fast-paced game packed with unexpected twists.

Each player controls a Monarch scientist with unique abilities. In the SCIENTIFIC PHASE each player advances one of the four possible technologies (ORCA, Oxygen Destroyer, Communications and Archeology). In the MONSTER PHASE each player unleashes the power of one of the four titans. The battles are violent and fast, with dice rolls, counterattacks, and shoves.

Players have two secret objectives. The SCIENTIFIC OBJECTIVE, shows two technologies to be developed. The MONSTER OBJECTIVE shows two Titans to be destroyed. The first scientist to accomplish both objectives WINS THE GAME and is named the leader of the Monarch. However, things are not going to be as easy as they may seem: players can acquire event cards with various effects, capable of turning the game around in no time.

Are you ready to join the fight and face the KING OF MONSTERS?

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Track Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Coup: Promo Bufão & Burocrata
description:
The buffoon or "Bobo da Corte" is a promo card used to replace the Ambassador card.

A player who claims the role of the Jester can cause Disorder by taking a card from the Court deck and a target card (another player of his choice). The player can secretly change one of his cards between one of the two cards received. The player returns a card to the Court deck and a card to his target (the player he had chosen).

The target may also claim that the player does not have the role of the Jester and thus prevent him from having a stolen card and that the Jester himself collects a card from the Court deck.

If the target has a Captain's card, the Captain can claim the Jester in order to block the card's theft.

"The Bureaucrat" is a promo card used to replace the Duke (Duke) card.
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Fortify
description:
It’s a hot summer and you see a new family just moved in across the street and you know what that means, boxes! You round up your friends and a giant bag of water balloons. You quickly split into teams, start stacking boxes, and fill your water balloons because everyone knows its time to Fortify!

Use the variety of boxes (Cards) to create a closed wall around your Base. The larger you make it the more friends can fit inside. The more friends you have the faster you can build or the more water balloons (Dice) you can toss at your opponent’s fort. Roll well and land your water balloons on boxes, rival friends, and ultimately their base to claim the day and the pride of the neighborhood!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Mord bei Tisch: Las Vegas
description:
Tiffany is about to marry into one of the most prestigious families in the US. But this weekend she wants to celebrate her bachelorette party in Las Vegas. With everything that goes with it: luxury hotel, party bus, strippers, casino and plenty of alcohol.

When the party party returns to the hotel suite after a wild night, the unthinkable happens: one of Tiffany's friends is found murdered in her private swimming pool.

The question that remains is: Can you solve the criminal case together?

Mord bei Tisch is a criminal dinner game in which 6-8 players can participate to find out who among them is the murderer of the found victim. In addition to that, every player gets a personal task to fulfil during the evening, which can include finding certain information via asking, hiding certain information during the game, convince other players to join them in certain acts or act in a very specific way during the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Acting

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Frozen Shores Chariots
description:
The Free Folk Ride Into Battle

Those that live south of the Wall think that the Wildings living beyond it are nothing but primitive savages, not capable of utilizing any kind of advanced engineering in combat. That is, however, very much not the case. While their Frozen Shore Chariots aren’t the most sturdy of constructs, they work well enough to usher those bold enough to ride them into battle. More than capable of bashing their way through enemy ranks due to sheer mass and speed alone, these engines of war are a formidable foe to face.

The Frozen Shore Chariot Box Set gives Free Folk Players in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game a new warmachine for their army. Like cavalry models, this unit can make a free Maneuver Action at the start of its activation, letting it get into position for one of its deadly charges. They hit like an avalanche, getting extra power and taking out concentrated enemy units with ease.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Berlin Connection
description:
Berlin Connection is a fast network-/portfolio-building train game with the objective of having the most valuable stock portfolio at the end of the game. Players must start new railroads, they may expand existing railroads and they are able to trade stocks in the railroads.


There are 6 colors of wooden locomotives, each color representing a railroad. Players are dealt random hands of 5-10 (depending on number of players) locomotives, which are essentially a stock portfolio; the rest of each color are placed in a pool. On your turn, you can start a railroad or increase the value of a single railroad by placing 1-5 locomotives from the remaining pool of that company or you can trade one locomotive in your portfolio for one or two locomotives from the remaining pool in a railroad.
The game board is a map of Germany, with cities worth anywhere from 1-8 points. Connecting to a city adds to a company's value. The game holds 3-6 players for about 30 minutes.
The game ends when there is a railroad in every purple city or when it is agreed that this is not possible. Players' scores are determined by the value of each railroad at the end of the game, multiplied by the number of stocks the player has for that railroad.

Berlin Connection uses the components found in Queen Games’ Paris Connection game. The Berlin Connection game comes with 2 11x17 maps of Germany that require trimming and the rules necessary to play Berlin Connection. You must own Paris Connection to play this game.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Crossing Oceans: Upgrade Kit for Transatlantic
description:
Crossing Oceans: Upgrade Kit for Transatlantic contains most of what you need to play the 2022 game Crossing Oceans. To complete the game, you will need these components from the 2017 game Transatlantic:

• All wooden pieces: captains, houses, coal
• Banknotes (i.e., the paper money)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Escape Room
description: In this co-opertunistic Age of Steam map, players work collectively to solve four unique puzzles as they race against the clock. Special time-track discs are added to the board each round, chipping away at the players' precious time. There can only be one winner, but if they fail to solve the puzzles before time runs up, everybody loses.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Loans, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Selection Order Bid, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Phase Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Galdor's Grip: 6-Card Knowtorious Expansion
description:
The second 6-card expansion for Galdor's Grip.

Using the clever deck construction feature in Galdor's Grip, players can (randomly) mix and match any number of non-essential cards from the Core Set with cards from an expansion to create new card and deck and interactions! This expansion offers new scoring objectives and ways to manipulate the order of the deck.

Galdor's Grip is a solo fantasy card game played completely in your hands. As you move through the deck, you’ll need to carefully manipulate the order and orientation of the cards to gain more knowledge of your surroundings and avoid hazards until Galdor is in position to neutralize Feragot. The base game is needed to play this expansion.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Expanded Galaxy
description:
Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Expanded Galaxy includes extra components and rules needed for 7-9 player games. This includes extra Technology Tiles, Ship Part Tiles and 2 Start Player Markers. This expansion also includes an Alliances variant, that can be used with 4+ players.

Please note that you'll also need extra species to add more players to the game. Both Seekers & Outcasts species expansions will allow 2 extra players per expansion to the game. The player count cannot be increased above 9 players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Alliances

name: Story Box: Aventures
description:
In this cooperative game:
1. Stack cards on a board while telling a short, crazy, funny, wacky story... all within 2 minutes!
2. Together, take on the challenge of remembering the story in the correct sequence!
And that’s when the magic happens: Surprises and Laughter! Because, with the help of all players, having a good memory has never been easier!

Each card correctly recalled in sequence earns the players 2 points. If a player seek assistance, the group still earns 1 point for each card, encouraging teamwork and collaboration. However, be cautious - an incorrect guess results in the group losing 1 point. Aim to continually improve your collective score from game to game, or to climb higher on the success ladder.

The basic rules remain the same across different versions of Story Box.

But each version offers a Themed Expert Variant:
In Story Box Adventures, the Frenetic Adventure variant requires you to lay down 30 cards during the story phase to score the game. Can you play as fast as that? And can you remember the sequence of cards?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Real-Time, Storytelling

name: Overgrowth
description:
In Overgrowth, players master the art of strategy as they compete to create a clear path of their flowers, from one side of the board to their opponent’s, or gather the most blossoms in the meadow by the game's end. With each move, every decision counts - will you outwit your opponent & claim victory?

At the start of their turn, players move their action selection marker around the board. This is in a clockwise direction, up to 3 spaces - selecting one of the 3 available actions from the 4 on the rondel.

Players will be able to either:


Grow – adding a flower token adjacent to one already placed.
Cast – throwing a flower token 3 spaces away from one already placed.
Spread – placing up to 2 flower tokens horizontally across the board, adjacent to one already placed.
Overgrow – if surrounding your opponent's flower token on two sides, you may replace it with one of your own.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Rondel, Square Grid

name: Aeon's End: Splitter-Geschoss Promo
description:
German version of the Splinter Missile promo. Part of the Spielbox issue 7/2021

Cost 5
Spell
Cast: Deal 4 Damage. Any ally may discard a card in hand. If they do, divide the damage however you choose among the nemesis and any number of minions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Décorum: The Dice Tower Scenario
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Air Pack.

A 2 player scenario where one person will play as Tom and the other Zee.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fantasy Food Truck
description:
What if you had a food truck in a fantasy world? In Fantasy Food Truck you get to live this out! Personalize it by naming your food truck, making a logo, and creating your menu. Level up your staff (Rogue, Artificer, Bard, Wizard, Ranger, and Barbarian) in order to better explore the surrounding area. Discover new customers (Gnomes, Goblins, Merfolk, Dwarves, Elves, and Orcs), defeat dangerous skeletons, tame wild dragons, and find hidden treasures. Earn the most stars to have the best fantasy food truck.

Fantasy Food Truck is a free print and play roll and write. It is all on one page and uses just four dice. Played over twelve rounds, you will advance tracks and also place polyominoes on the map. It can be played solo or up to 100+ players, all players will use the same dice rolls and see who can score the highest from those same rolls.

—description from designer
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte 2014 – Arnd, der Fischer
description:
This 2014 promo card for The Rivals for Catan was given out by Klaus Teuber at SPIEL 2014 in Essen.

It is a unit/hero.
It costs 1 grain and 1 wool and has 1 skill point.
It has an orange "Zeit des Goldes" (Era of Gold) back.

Text of the card:
"Legen Sie Arnd neben 1 Goldfluss-Landschaft. Wird die Zahl des Goldflusses gewürfelt, dürfen Sie, statt 1 Gold zu nehmen, die andere benachbarte Landschaft um eine Stufe hochdrehen."

This translates to:
Place Arnd next to a gold region. If the number of this gold region is rolled, you may, instead of taking 1 gold, take a resource on the other adjacent region.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Baroque: War & Politics in the Holy Roman Empire
description: "Baroque" is a card-driven multi-player wargame in which players use a variety of strategies to control states, build cities and cathedrals, and thereby get elected Holy Roman Emperor. The situation is very loosely based on the political situation in what is now Germany immediately after the Thirty Years War (starting about 1650), the Baroque Era.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Showdown
description:
Showdown in Slingshot Canyon! In the midday heat, the players take on the role of crooks on nimble prairie dog paws on the prowl. And neither carriages nor the vaults guarded by the sheriff are safe from them. Which of the players will manage to scam the most money through cleverly planned moves, good card management and a little luck?

In Showdown players either use their turn to take a new card or play cards from their hand. A card always show 2 out of 5 possible actions. When playing cards players can play a number of cards of their choosing as long as all played cards share the same symbol and that symbol is visible at least 3 times on all cards played.
The active player then activate ALL symbols on the played cards, grouped and in order of their choosing.

The symbols have a variety of possible actions and let you move your bandit to the next spot or send the sherif off to guard the next vault of the bank in the middle of the board. Players can steal from a carrier or from other players by rolling dice and players can even save some of that well earned money so it can't be taken away from them ever again.

But the sheriff of Slingshot Canyon is always vigilant and once he reaches his lookout, players not in hiding or in disguise will lose some precious coins.
As the game progresses the path the sheriff takes gets shorter and shorter and players have to play their hands smart to not lose it all. The player who leaves the Showdown of Slingshot Canyon the richest, wins the game.
mechanics: Take That

name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Hades"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The fifth campaign expansion for Dust Tactics, Operation "Hades" introduces new rules for subterranean warfare, superhuman soldiers, new skills, and richly detailed information about the city and battleground of Zverograd. It also brings you thirty-one tiles, a Zverograd city poster, a map of the Zverograd metro, six new scenarios, and over two dozen objectives to serve as the basis of your own scenarios. Finally, Operation "Hades" marks the arrival of Winter Child, the game's first superhuman soldier.

Operation "Hades" introduces new rules for underground fighting, as well as rules more specifically designated for scenarios fought in Zverograd’s sewers and metro.

During underground combat, troops must cope with dim lighting and confined quarters. There is very little light beneath the city of Zverograd. Units can hear enemies coming, but they are hard to make out in the darkness. As a result, it's not uncommon for soldiers in such tense conditions to fire blindly into the shadows ahead of them when they hear enemies approaching. The darkness of the underground grants a unit increasing levels of cover the farther it is from an attacking unit, and units cannot target foes with four or more spaces between them.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Shane Booster
description: Shane was Rick’s former partner, serving on the Cynthiana Police force. He and Rick’s wife Lori joined a number of other survivors in a makeshift camp, and Shane assumed a leadership role. Rick’s reappearance inflamed Shane’s jealousy, and his emotions clouded his judgement, endangering the group.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Lord Kurivan Expansion
description:
This expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters includes:

1 Highly Detailed Plastic Miniature, Lord Kurivan.
1 Vampire ID Card.
1 Rule Sheet.

LORD KURIVAN
One of the most ancient Vampire Lords, Kurivan was known by many names, the Storm After the Calm, the Executioner of Death, Collector of Skulls. Driven by an insatiable hate and hunger that devours it from within, it can never rest. Where it walked, death was by its side, leaving nothing behind but scorched earth. But Kurivan’s raging power burned quickly and his reign of terror lasted only a few decades.

Can it be an accident that Kurivan has reclaimed leadership of the Night now? Has it sensed an unknown weakness in the Order that it plans to exploit?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Mystery Party in the Box: El Misterio de los Muertos Vivientes
description:
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of unraveling a mystery and simultaneously achieving his or her own objectives. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are fundamental pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything you are told, but you can't win without trusting someone...

Japan, early 21st century. Civilization, as we know it, has succumbed as a result of the spread of a virus that turns its victims into the living dead. The arrival of a stranger in a white coat to a small community of survivors augurs the possibility of developing a vaccine to put an end to the plague, but within hours the stranger turns up dead. Incursions of zombie worshippers dot the country, rumors of a mysterious killer strangling his victims, plague survivors disappearing without explanation... and a strange melody that night after night seems to come from underground. Who, among you all, will delve into the depths of the mystery and perhaps find refuge in this new promised land called Sanctuary?

Playing is very simple, just follow these steps:
1. Hand out a character for each player and introduce yourselves to the rest.
2. Try to uncover the mystery while you find out who your allies might be.
3. Your actions will lead you to one of the many possible endings.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Istanbul: Pegasus Depot & Kebab Shop Mini Expansions
description:
The official double-sided mini expansions for the game Istanbul were initially given away at the pop-up store in Friedberg between June and July 2023.

Note: Both expansions are produced on thick cardboard. The Kebab Shop Mini Expansion was initially available only on card stock.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Forces of Hordes: Minions
description:
Adapt and Survive

Whether fighting for their own agenda or offering assistance to others, minions possess unique skills that can be used to turn the tide of battle. As war continues to embroil these tribal cultures into a desperate fight for survival, new and more dangerous beings emerge from the darkness of the wilds. From bloodthirsty gatormen and savage and unruly farrow to the few brave adventurers who blur the lines between the civilized and wild worlds, generals can find minions to suit any battlefield role.

Whether you field minions as faction reinforcements or as their own army, Forces of HORDES: Minions contains everything you need to deploy these savage tribes in battle, featuring:

• Complete faction rules and profiles for using all current Minion models in HORDES Mk II.
• New troops to bring to the fight, including all-new warlocks and warbeasts.
• An in-depth look at the history and structure of the various minion cultures.
• A painting and modeling guide to help you ready your forces for battle.
• Minion Theme Force lists and rules, which allow you to create armies based on specialized tribes found in the HORDES world.

Let Loose the Minions of War!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Gloom of Kilforth: Promo Pack 1
description:
First offered during the Call of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game Kickstarter,
this pack consists of Gloom of Kilforth: Tears of Kilforth Promo Cards (Encounter: Badlands (T1); Encounter: Mountain (T2); Encounter: Forest (T3)) and Shadows of Kilforth: Shadows of Pay Promo Cards a.k.a. Kilforth's Pay (Encounter: Ally (SEP1); Encounter: Badlands (SEP2); Encounter: Plains (SEP3)).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Top of the Stretch
description:
Horse racing simulation that allows historical races to be replayed, or fantasy races to be run. Base game comes with real-life horses that competed in the US in 2009-10. Game comes with a quick play version that generates race results in about five minutes, and a longer version that allows the player to watch the race unfold segment by segment. The longer version takes about 15 minutes to play.

In both the quick play and full play versions, various ratings assigned to real life horses are consulted/compared/combined, along with charts and dice rolls to generate race results.

The game is distributed as a downloadable pdf from the publisher's website. Expansions include the 1937 racing season and 100 all-time great horses.

Designed by Lon Whitehead.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Schutztruppe: Heia Safari 1914-1918
description:
Schutztruppe, Heia Safari, 1914-18 delivers an intriguing and detailed look at the East African Guerrilla war, 1914-1918. This is a moderate complexity wargame with detailed naval and supply rules, and a map and order of battle representing the authoritative treatment of the campaign. The overall game presentation is enhanced with a mounted game map and larger 9/16" counters.

Heia, heia Safari! was a call which for four years echoed throughout East Africa. With this call the officers of the Schutztruppe in German East Africa rallied and encouraged their askari in the defense of their country during the First World War. This small force, whose strength never exceeded 3,000 white and 12,000 black soldiers (askari), was opposed by some 300,000 men (150,000 at any one time), comprising British, Indian, Rhodesian, Nigerian, Gold Coast, South African, Belgian and Portuguese troops. Led by Major-General Paul von Lettow-Vorbeck, the Schutztruppe fought within its own home territory for the first three years of the war. During the final year von Lettow-Vorbeck transferred his resistance to Portuguese East Africa and trekked south to within 60 km of Quelimane. He reappeared in Northern Rhodesia in November, 1918, and that is where news of the general armistice that ended the war reached him.

With more than 20 published designs including many on relatively obscure topics, Dennis Bishop delivers a compelling game experience and intriguing look at the East African Guerrilla war, 1914-1918. Forces represent the German, British, South African, Portuguese, and Belgian combatants. Special rules provide a game that is highly-playable yet rich in historical detail featuring weather effects, supply and supply depots, replacements, provisional reinforcements, rail movement, naval transport, naval battle, amphibious assault, aircraft, blockade runners, garrisons, German retreat movement, Allied ambush, infiltration movement, land and naval reaction, artillery bombardment, and more.

Product Information:

Complexity: 6 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 8 out of 10 (no hidden units)
Time Scale: 1 month per turn
Map Scale: 30 miles per hex
Unit Scale: Divisions
Players: one to two, best with two
Playing Time: 3-4 hours

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Paupers' Ladder: One Lonely Pauper
description:
One Lonely Pauper is a set of solo rules for Paupers' Ladder. It sees you take your Pauper and Bird companion on a Brighthelm adventure in one of these three scenarios:

Garolium's Tournament: This is the standard Paupers' Ladder game, rewritten to be played solo. Learn 3 Virtues and take your place as ruler of the realm before one of your competitors beats you to it.

The Saltash Necromancer: Freshly risen from the grave, this sorcerer has swamped  Brighthelm's cities with his undead army. Defeat them then hunt him down to his subterranean lair, but don't forget to arm yourself with the only weapon known to stop him - the mythical spirit blade.

The Fiery Siege: Dragons have attacked your home city. Stranded on the other side of Brighthelm, you must visit the arcane libraries to learn the dragonfire recipe, then make your way into your city unseen to take on the dragons from within.
mechanics: Action/Event, Tile Placement

name: Naval Thunder:  Battleship Row
description:
Publisher's ad copy:
"Naval Thunder: Battleship Row brings the majestic battleships and powerful carriers of World War 2 to your tabletop! Features an easy to learn surface combat system with seamlessly integrated aircraft and submarine rules. Naval Thunder: Battleship Row allows you customize the level of detail and pace of play to your personal preference using dozens of modular options.

"Naval Thunder provides countless hours of enjoyment while you focus on commanding your fleet, instead of wading through rules! Combat is fast, exciting, fun, AND historically accurate based on hundreds of hours of research."
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: DuploLine
description:
DuploLine is 4-in-a-row game that includes two different types of pieces (discs and rings). The goal for each player is to make a line of either four (or more) discs or rings of their own color. DuploLine is a very tactical game derived from the designer’s more strategic DuploHex. Although both games use the same types of pieces and similar rules, the different goals and the small variations in the “adding” and “moving” mechanisms make DuploLine and DuploHex two completely separate games.

MATERIAL

- A hexagonal board with four hexagons per side
- 18 white discs and 18 black discs
- 18 white rings and 18 black rings
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Dwar7s Spring: Enchanted Forest
description: The Enchanted Forest Expansion adds content to both Dwar7s Winter & Dwar7s Spring by adding buildings, new monsters, and giving the players options to upgrade their dwarfs.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Escape: Queenie Box
description:
All Queenies that were released after the Escape Big Box 2nd Edition in one convenient box!

11 – The Cursed Gems
12 – The Slide
13 – The Map
14 – The Wishing Well
15 – New Quests
16 – New Traps


With this and the Big Box, players will have everything that is available for Escape.

The Escape Queenie Box is also a great addition for players who only own the base game and want new modules to add to their adventures.

Queenie 11: The Cursed Gems is already included in the Big Box, but is such a popular Queenie that we wanted to include it for all players to enjoy.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Rad Zone
description:
Rad Zone is a roll and write, print and play, solo game set in a harsh future where you manage a group of survivors. They live in a Rad Bunker and strive to keep their home stocked with food, water, medical supplies, fuel, equipment and raw materials. They must go on dangerous missions, salvage these much-needed items from nearby locations and at the same time avoid raiders and outlaws that roam the land in their radiation induced crazy. On top of this they must be quick to avoid taking a dangerous dose of radiation.

The world faces a terrible apocalypse. Without warning the sun’s radiation spiked to alarming levels and under this relentless and deadly barrage humanity succumbed. People fell ill, millions died, populations moved underground into fortified Rad Bunkers, all the time the sun pushing the people deeper into the darkness. Many plants and animals perished, and society collapsed. Food and clean water were rationed until people began to starve, and martial law was replaced by irradiated outlaws and bandits roaming the surface in their lead lined vehicles.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Symbol
description:
This abstract battle simulation game is played on a 7x7 grid divided into three areas and nine regions. Players use green, blue, white, red, and black pieces symbolizing the Aristotelian elements (earth, water, air, fire) and the element of "death" to control the board’s regions and attempt to kill their opponent’s leader piece.

The game has a number of different themes available, ranging from modern combat to space conflict, science fiction, fantasy, classical civilization, and medieval war.

It plays a lot like chess with more freedom to select and customize a starting army and an empty board which fills as the players develop their strategy and use their leader's power to reinforce the battle with more units.

Each player chooses 15 pieces of whichever five main unit colors in whatever numbers they prefer as their army, plus one leader piece.

Each unit has different rules for movement and powers, and as the players take turns vying for positional control and attempting to kill enemy pieces, they can also combine their pieces into stacks, conferring multiple powers or more optional movements to the stack of pieces. On a player’s turn she can use the power of any one of her pieces on the board (which generally involve movement, pushing and killing enemy units, or adding new units to the board). She could also use the powers of multiple pieces if those pieces occupied the same space on the board and formed a stack.

Knowing when to stack and unstack pieces and clever tactical use of the powers of the pieces are key to winning the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroquest: A Growl of Thunder
description:
A Solitaire Quest for a Barbarian.

Description from the book:
This is a HeroQuest adventure for which you will require the HeroQuest board game. You will need a Gamesmaster and just one player. Rules are the same as for any HeroQuest game, but the adventure has one difference: it is only for a Barbarian.

Additional note:
This Solo Adventure was published in the book: The Tyrant's Tomb.
The book has 3 parts:
- Story to read
- Solo Adventure for Heroquest Boardgame
- Gamebook Soloadventure
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Role Playing

name: BattleTech: Rhonda's Irregulars
description:
From the back cover:

"In 3007, Cranston Snord's Irregulars emerged from the winnings of a poker game. Under the command of Cranston Snord, an officer disgraced and discharged from Wolf's Dragoons, the Irregulars gained a reputation for unorthodox tactics and a fetish for collecting lost artifacts and treasures. Now, 43 years later, Cranston has given his daughter Rhonda active command of the Irregulars. Under her leadership, the Irregulars have grown in size and reputation.

The Federated Commonwealth command used the Irregulars against House Marik with satisfying results, and they looked the other way when the Irregulars went collecting. Now, the battered Federated Commonwealth wants the Irregulars to conduct raids into Clan-held territory. The Irregulars are willing to take on the Clans, but they have another objective in mind; a Star League naval base believed to be deep inside Clan-held territory.

Rhonda's Irregulars is a BattleTech scenario pack chronicling the Irregulars' history from Cranston's discharge from Wolf's Dragoons, to their actions in the Fourth Succession War, to their battles, including Operation Merlin, the Irregulars' foray into Clan territory. Also included are new 'Mechs and vehicles used by the Irregulars, unit rosters, and personnel files."

This BattleTech scenario pack follows on from the BattleTech: Cranston Snord's Irregulars scenario pack, updating the unit roster and history. It also provides 14 assorted scenarios and rules for two new BattleMechs and a new vehicle from the Star League era.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Post Captain
description:
Post Captain is a solitaire PNP game of sailing, sea chases, and espionage during the Napoleonic Wars. You take on the role of a young captain who has just been given command of his first ship. The game's missions revolve around the the tangled web of political intrigue surrounding Napoleon's plan to invade England.

The game play focuses on navigation, 1 on 1 sea battles, and assaults by landing parties. The dramatic chases of naval literature are reproduced using an abstract system that represents the relative speed and position of each ship. Each turn the ship that has the highest maneuverability is considered to have the "wind gauge" and gets to move (closer or farther away) and/or attack. The captains navigational and crew assignments choices define his ships maneuverability each turn.

The primary game play mechanic revolves around the orders you give to your crew. You assign crew to different positions on the ship in anticipation of where you think the wind or the enemy will be. The game is divided into two segments. A "Mission" segment where you navigate on a large map attempting to reach objectives on time and a "Chase" segment where ships engage each other.

The goal of the system is to simplify naval combat to focus on dramatic storytelling rather than focusing on charts, modifiers, counters, and complex rules. All conflict resolution is handled by drawing colored cubes from a cup. This will tell if a test was successful and in combat it also tells what part of the ship is damaged. As a solitaire game the goal is to achieve enough mission objectives to earn renown in order to increase your rank and upgrade your crew.
categories: Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Storytelling, Worker Placement

name: Batman Miniature Game: Suicide Squad Game Box
description:
We're bad guys, it's what we do...

This fantastic new 2 player box set from Knight Models allows you to assemble a team of some of the most dangerous villains in the DC universe, and take the fight to the streets of the Batman miniatures Game. Play as Harley Quinn, Deadshot, Captain Boomerang, El Diablo, Killer Croc, Katana and Slipknot, or use the Jared Leto Joker and his crew of psychos and misfits.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: San Agustin 1768 / Bahama 1783
description:
Description from the publisher:

The San Agustín was a 74–gun ship of the line built at the royal shipyard in Guarnizo (Santander) in 1768 by Francisco Gautier. After fighting during the American War of Independence and in the Battle of Cape St. Vincent (1780), she took part of the Napoleonic wars, where she fought at the Battle of Algeciras in 1801 and the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805. In Trafalgar, under the command of Felipe Jado and Cagigal with 711 men aboard, she was surrounded by several ships of Nelson’s squadron. They fought for hours, but after the third approach, she was after being dismasted and with 180 dead and 200 wounded, the British offered terms to surrender. The ship was burned on October 29.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish 74-gun ship-of-the-line class “Bahama 1780.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Elite: Dangerous Battle Cards
description:
Fight epic space battles across the Elite: Dangerous galaxy. Battle in asteroid belts to gain cover against enemy attacks, explore planets to gain advantage over your foe, or send a fleet of transports to construct an unstoppable capital ship. Create an armada of spaceships, fighters, warships – even entire space stations. Use special abilities to outflank your enemy, upgrade your vessels with enhanced equipment or play action cards to save yours ships or foil your opponent.

—description from the publisher

The Starter Pack contains two decks of 30 cards each along with the basic mission cards needed to play any game of ED Battle Cards. All the cards are non-randomised (as they are in every set). For the Starter Pack one deck has mostly Federation aligned ships and the other mostly Imperial.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #19 – Australia #2
description:
Warfighter WWII Pacific - Expansion #19 MORE Australian Gear! Hostiles! - - This expansion adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

Cards included are:

11x Australia Soldier Cards
9x Weapon Cards
1x Equipment Cards
10x Skill Cards
4x Action Cards
11x Australia Hostile - Elite Cards
11x Australia Hostile - Frontline Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: District Commander Maracas: Virtualia 2019
description:
Brian Train's District Commander is a series of operational games on counterinsurgency situations. The players alternate activation of groups of units (stacks) to perform discrete operations (missions) through the expenditure of Task Points (TP). Some missions are Tactical Missions - straightforward military tasks such as performing patrols, ambushing or attacking enemy forces, or moving from one place to another - and these may be performed multiple times by a stack during a turn. Other missions emphasize the "non-tactical" end of the campaign, establishing friendly influence, control, and infrastructure in an area, reducing the enemy's claim to the same, and recruiting or training troops. These missions take more time to perform and so unlike the tactical missions may be the only mission performed by the stack during the turn.

Missions are resolved by play of secretly-held Chance Chits, each with ratings that are better or worse for certain types of operations. Chits are played simultaneously and the ratings compared, modified by units, assets, and the current board state to determine the outcome. Using the right chit at the right time - knowing when to save a good chit for later and when to use it, and trying to determine if your opponent is going all-in or holding back - will require steely judgment in an atmosphere of doubt and deception.

All this is done in pursuit of objectives handed down to you by your superiors (i.e., chosen randomly) and kept secret from your opponent - objectives that may even change over the course of the game. Within this framework, the two sides - Government and Insurgent - play very differently, with the Insurgent player, in particular, depending on bluff and deception to achieve their goals. A large number of variant rules allow you to turn the game into a sandbox for exploring counterinsurgency doctrine and practice.

This first volume is District Commander Maracas. It takes as its subject counterinsurgency operations in a megacity - the urban battlefield of the future, and the cutting edge of modern doctrine. The sudden departure from power of Jesus Shaves, charismatic leader of Virtualia, has created a power vacuum in the streets of Maracas, capital city with a population of over 3 million people. The Virtualian Liberation Movement is exploiting this situation by organizing areas of the city against established authority, sabotaging civic services, and staging attacks on symbolic objective points. The local security force commander must contend with not only the urban guerrillas of the VLM but also private neighborhood armies and criminal gangs running amuck.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Events, Hand Management, Movement Points, Simulation

name: BattleTech: Battle of Tukayyid
description:
On 1 May 3052, over twenty Galaxies from seven Clans clashed with twelve Armies of Comstar's Com Guards. For twenty-one days, one of the largest campaigns in BattleMech warfare unfolded to decide the fate of the Inner Sphere.

The Battle of Tukayyid brings players back to this gargantuan conflict, allowing them to relive one of BattleTech's most pivotal moments. It builds off of the Chaos Campaign: Succession Wars framework to unleash a massive experience players will enjoy across dozens of games. Each of the seven campaigns within includes the following: a short fiction entry and write-up of the battle, including a map of the regions; the specific Combatants involved, along with insignia; and details to allow players to play out each campaign on their tabletop. Finally, a technical readout section showcases 'Mech variants that first appeared during this conflict.

This Chaos Campaign puts you as the hero -- Aidan Pryde, Anastatius Focht, and others -- of the battle. Do you have what it takes to lead the Smoke Jaguars to victory, or will you repeat the failure of the Diamond Sharks? Or can you find a way to defeat the indomitable Clan Wolf? You will decide.

For use with: Clan Invasion box set, MapPack: Battle of Tukayyid, and compatible with Total Warfare and Alpha Strike.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tsukuyumi: Event Horizon
description:
Event Horizon brings new action cards and strong starting advantages to Tsukuyumi - Full Moon Down.
It is compatible with all factions, but can't be played with Tsukuyumi - Rise of the Moon Princess or the 2-Player-Expansion.
mechanics: Command Cards

name: Space Lane Trader
description:
In Space Lane Trader, you are playing a character in control of a cargo ship, trying to make a fortune in the newly opened up shipping trade. You buy and sell goods transporting them between planets within the Terran Federation, preferably to where demand and prices are high. The main objective of the game is to earn money (credits) faster than your competitors and return to show off your success.

During the course of the game, you can fit your ship with upgrades that will make it go faster, attack harder and defend better – all with the goal to ensure that you manage to beat your competitors to the goal. You can also buy new ships with better capabilities, that can carry more goods for you, go faster or fit more upgrades.
Your character will develop during the game – from the inexperienced person starting play at Terra station in the Solar system, to a grizzled space ship captain with much improved skills. You develop your character by spending Experience Points (XP), that are earned by drawing Event cards as the game progresses.

The most obvious way of earning money is buying goods, transporting it to another planet and selling it there. Another way however, is attacking your competitors and take what should have been yours anyway. Winning combat against another player will allow you to either steal cargo from your opponent or take loot in the form of Debris cards. Debris cards can either give you valuable salvage that can be sold on planets, or the best equipment in the game that will improve your ship beyond the capabilities of your competitors.

Not all parts of space are safe. Planets away from the most busy parts of space are characterized by a wild west mentality and the Terran Federation security forces don´t have the capacity to uphold law and order everywhere. This is reflected by two different security levels in the game – green and yellow. Green security level planets are safer, and although bad things can happen, the negative consequences are not so extensive. On security level yellow planets however, the dangers are higher but also the rewards.
categories: Economic, Fighting, Industry / Manufacturing, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Contracts, Dice Rolling, Market, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – Illusory Might Rivals Deck
description:
An expansion for Warhammer Underworlds, compatible with the Rivals format, which uses pre-built card decks so that you can get stuck into the game within minutes. Features 32 new universal cards which can be played with your Warband of choice or used to enhance your existing decks.

Contents:
12 Universal Objective Cards
10 Universal Gambit Cards
10 Universal Upgrade Cards

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Warhammer Underworlds Core Set is required to play.

NOTE: The card back graphics in this set do not match those of all the previous games released in the Warhammer: Underworld series. You will not be able to mix and match cards from other previous sets with this one to deck build a unique team unless you sleeve the cards with opaque card sleeves.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Masterminds: Heist Society
description:
In Masterminds: Heist Society you are the shot-caller, assembling a team of operatives to take down the toughest modern-day heists!

We all love a good heist movie; Oceans 11, Baby Driver, Inside Man, and TV shows like Leverage bring us the thrill and suspense of assembling a team of specialists that combine their skills toward a common goal. Collecting the prize knowing they have pulled off the impossible. This game for 2-5 players aims to recreate the tension and thrill of planning and executing high-stakes heists, with cards and actions inspired by these movies and shows, as you and your fellow players take on the role of Masterminds.

Combining drafting, dice-rolling, and a strategic press-your-luck style of mission completion, Masterminds - Heist Society will test your risk/reward intuition as you play. Players can take it safe & slow to skip the die rolling and guarantee a win, but another player may swoop in and grab the prize out from under you with a more reckless luck-oriented plan. Either way, the prize goes to the first team to complete each heist’s combination of challenges.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: G.I. JOE Mission Critical: Retro Snake Eyes
description:
A blast from the past!

Recruit this classic character to join in the battle!

Retro Snake Eyes has a different, unique ability compared to the Snake Eyes included in the base game.

Text says: Legendary Commando
Once per battle, when any hero rolls 2 or more O results during an attack, you may deal 3 damage to an enemy card of your choice,

Requires G.I. Joe Mission Critical to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances – At the Ready
description:
The Disney's Sorcerer's Arena Epic Alliances – At the Ready expansion brings three new characters into the area: Robin Hood, Mrs. Potts, and Mulan, each with new attacks and abilities true to their characters. You can improve positions with Mrs. Potts, pull fast ones with Robin Hood, and aid allies with Mulan.

Take your combat skills in Disney Sorcerer’s Arena: Epic Alliances to all new levels with this game-changing expansion pack! Robin Hood, Mrs. Potts, and Mulan bring new attacks and abilities true to their characters that will provide selfless support in the Arena’s already epic battles. Improve positions with Mrs. Potts, pull fast ones with Robin Hood, and aid allies with Mulan. Disney Sorcerer’s Arena: Epic Alliances is the ultimate PvP tabletop game for Disney and Pixar fans and gamers where players can build teams out of Disney and Pixar heroes and villains and compete in an expandable, learn-as-you-go battle arena game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Move Through Deck, Variable Set-up

name: Acorns
description:
As autumn’s first cool breeze rustles through the tree branches, the squirrels begin their preparations for winter. Working together in pairs, they stash some acorns away in their trees, while eating others that will sprout too soon. The best-prepared Squirrels will be the strongest at the start of spring, ready to prosper in the new year.

Acorns is a fixed-partnership, deck-shedding climbing game. Teams work together to be the first to shed their shared deck of cards.

The rules also include a variant for two players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Gutter Bowl
description:
Gutter Bowl is an exciting expansion to Blood Bowl that takes the action off the professional pitch – and into the streets and sewers of the Old World! You'll coach a team of enthusiastic – if inexperienced – players as they settle their differences in brutal street sports. What Gutter Bowl lacks in showmanship, sponsorships, and sporting competence compared to its big brother, Blood Bowl, it more than makes up for in violence and near-complete disregard for the rules!

Join the fast-paced tactical fantasy football game in a new urban setting, as your amateur players weave between obstacles, beat up opponents, and score those all-important touchdowns. This expansion includes a double-sided Gutter Bowl pitch – one side depicting a crowded marketplace packed with stalls, the other depicting a foul sewer – as well as a pair of matching double-sided dugouts. There's also rulebook featuring the gritty backstreets history of Gutter Bowl, plus new rules for playing games and leagues on (and underneath) the mean streets of the Old World.

This set contains:

1x 36-page Blood Bowl: Gutter Bowl rulebook
1x Double-sided fold-out Gutter Bowl pitch
2x Matching double-sided dugouts


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Graffiti Rush
description:
Get ready to fill the streets of the city with color!

You only have one minute to place all your tiles and form your graffiti mural... In each round the score changes, will you get the best combination or will you look for the prize for speed?

In each round players will have to place, the fast as they can, their tiles according to a given shape, but also looking for the combinations of tiles which gives them the most value of points, either by connecting colors or different motives. All of that in less of one minute because the quicker player will also have bonus points.

The game is played several rounds, each of them changing the shape of tile placement and the point value of colors and motives combination. At the end the player with more points accumulated will win.

A game for quick hands and quick minds.

-description from artist
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Panda Spin
description:
In Panda Spin, each player attempts to be the first to rid their hand of cards, collecting bamboo in the process to keep their pandas well fed.

In more detail, Panda Spin is a climbing game played with a special deck of "double-headed" cards. All cards start with the orange animals toward the top. Each player receives a random wind card — each of which has a unique playing condition — and a hand of eleven cards, with the remaining cards placed in a deck.

During the game, players lay down cards to tricks as singles, in sets, in runs, or in formations (two consecutive pairs, two consecutive triples, etc.) If you're the first player in a trick, lead what you wish other than a bomb, that is, four or more cards of the same value. In turn, players must play a higher matching set of cards, e.g. a higher three-of-a-kind on a three-of-a-kind, or pass, after which they can no longer play in a trick. (A bomb cannot be lead, but can be played on any card combination.)

When you pass, if you've played cards and all of those cards have orange animals at the top, flip the cards so that the blue animals are at top. Each time you flip a card, you change its value depending on its suit: e.g., the water 4 becomes a pair of Qs, the wood 6 becomes a A+bamboo (and each time you play a card with bamboo, you take a bamboo token from the reserve), the earth 8 becomes a Q+panda (with you stealing a bamboo from an opponent for each panda you play), the fire 3 becomes a 10+fire, with the fire being a value of your choice when played.

If you pass and the cards you've played have at least one blue animal, you discard all of those played cards. The winner of the trick always discards all of their played cards, then they lead to the next trick. When you play a wind card — the south wind, for example, beats a run or formation with 3+ different numbers in it — you draw two cards from the deck; subsequent players need only beat the card combination played prior to your wind. If you play a wind, you always discard all cards you played to the trick.

When a player runs out of cards — that is, they "show out" — they score bamboo equal to how many cards are held by the player with the largest hand. When all but one player have shown out, the round ends, then you shuffle all the cards (including the winds) and deal everyone a new hand. A player immediately wins the game when they have at least twenty bamboo — but they must score their 20th bamboo by showing out; playing wood and panda cards scores you no bamboo when you have nineteen bamboo.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Panzer Grenadier: Kokoda Trail
description:
Kokoda Trail is a 64-page book supplement to the Panzer Grenadier series, focused on the fierce fighting that took place in the Owen Stanley Mountains in 1942. Designer Dave Cheever has crafted 30 new scenarios based on these battles, taking place on two new mapboards with artwork by acclaimed wargame artist Guy Riessen. There are three background articles: Australia's Armies, Japan's Special Naval Landing Forces, and War on New Guinea. The former two include unit organization diagrams.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Afrika Korps: The Desert War – Platoon Level Combat in World War II: A Panzer Grenadier Game and Guadalcanal: Semper Fi Series to enjoy all of the scenarios.

Additionally, one scenario requires U.S. Army pieces which can be drawn from Battle of the Bulge: Platoon Level Combat in World War II – A Panzer Grenadier Game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Sakura Arms: Kikou Kakumei
description:
Expansion for sakura arms dueling card game, this expansion adds 2 new machine/invention themed megami:
Kururu(クルル) and thallya(サリヤ).
Kururu is the megami of innovation and madness. She does not care what sacrifices it takes to complete her machines. Her mechanic requires you to have played cards(not discard) in order to complete the required components(the card type determines what components it counts as). She is the hardest megami to learn , and will remain that way according to the designer.
Thallya is a megami who was formerly a human from another land/country. She rides a motorcycle and fights with a "sword-whip". Her mechanics revolve around her "fuel", an extra resource that many of your cards require to use, or can make use of. She also has the ability to gain unique basic actions via transforming(utilizing her S4 special card)While she has a high skill cap she is easier to approach than Kururu.
This expansion adds more difficult mechanics than prior expansions, according to the publisher it will likely remain the most mechanically difficult expansion.

Sakura Arms is a Japanese dueling living card game made for 2 players, in which players build 10 card decks from a limited pool in order to reduce the opponents life to zero.
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Relative Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Valiant Wars: Champion's Expansion Pack 1
description: Contains a cloth bag with 44 wooden token upgrades and 30 additional champion cards to add to the market with new abilities which help you push your luck or hinder your opponents in the quest to claim the Valiant Throne.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Fruits
description:
Fruits is a game in which we must combine memory and agility to eat the best fruits in the galaxy. At the beginning you will not know the location of the best fruits, but the actions of the dice will provide valuable information that you must remember during the course of the game.

In each turn we will roll the custom die and we will have to perform the action indicated by the die, we will eat the fruit of another player, show one of our fruits, be the fastest to put our hand on the central card, ... at the end of the game we will count the points of the fruits we have eaten and whoever else has will win the game.

Fruits is intended for family audiences, offering games for 2 to 6 players. It is recommended for aliens at least 8 years old, and the game lasts the same as eating a fruit! About 15 minutes savoring it well.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Fruits es un juego en el que debemos combinar memoria y agilidad para comer las mejores frutas de la galaxia. Al principio no sabrás la ubicación de las mejores frutas, pero las acciones del dado aportarán información muy valiosa que debes recordar durante el transcurso de la partida.

En cada turno tiraremos el dado personalizado y tendremos que realizar la acción que indique el dado , ya se comernos la fruta de otro jugador, enseñar una de nuestras frutas, ser el mas rápido en pone nuestra mano sobre la carta central, .... al fina de la partida contaremos los puntos de las frutas que nos hemos comido y quien mas tenga ganara la partida

Fruits está destinado a público familiar, ofrece partidas de 2 a 6 jugadores. Está recomendado para aliens de al menos 8 años, ¡y el juego dura lo mismo que comerse una fruta! Unos 15 minutos saboreándola bien.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: High Elves Reinforcements
description: The embodiment of High Elven martial prowess, the Celestial Guard are an implacable foe. Along with mounted archers, these sublime warriors make a formidable addition to your High Elf army.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Classic BattleTech: Map Pack – Solaris VII
description:
Welcome to the Gaming World

Check your myomers; calibrate your actuators; fine-tune your gyro; load-out the newest prototype weapons - and never forget to check with your image consultant, all while keeping your stable manager happy. On Solaris VII war is a sport and your career can die quicker than your 'Mech. Whether your stable manager is out to get you, the mafia is on your tail, or your next opponent has a piece of new technology you've never heard of before, on Solaris VII the stakes are always high and the rewards of success higher . . . provided you can seize them.

Map Pack: Solaris VII provides players with information on the gaming world and the stables that run it. Additionally, a slew of new Level 3 weapons and equipment tailor-made for the close-in rough-and-tumble fighting of Solaris VII duels are included. Also provided are ten previously published Solaris VII maps, now compiled together and reprinted for the first time and including rules for using these maps in standard Classic BattleTech play.

Solaris VII box set:

•Boreal Reach (Davion Arena)
•The Factory (Marik Arena)
•Ishiyama (Kurita Arena)
•The Jungle (Liao Arena)
•Steiner Coliseum (Steiner Arena)

Solaris - The Reaches:

•Hartford Gardens (Xolara)
•King of the Mountain (Xolara)
•The Scrapyard (Burgton)
•The Pool (Bracken Swamp)
•The Mud Pit (Roland Fields)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Finito: Gra Twoich Końcówek
description:
There are three categories in each round of the game:
- words
- citations
- pictures

The player who starts the game is the leader. The leader changes after each category. He drafts a card from a right category pile. Then he reads out loud the word, part of citation or shows the picture to the other players. After that each player write down on a piece of paper his ending. In the same time the leader searches for the correct answer and also writes it down on a piece of paper. The leader takes all answers and shuffles them. Then he reads out loud all of the answers. After that the players (apart from the leader) bet simultaneously an answer that they consider correct.

The players can bet 1, 2 or 3 coins. The players who bet the correct answer get their coins x2. If someone has bet a wrong answer he loses the bet money. If someone has bet your answer you takes the money he bet.

The game finishes after 4th round or when someone will get 25 coins. The player with the biggest amount of coins wins the game.
categories: Educational, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Blitz Bowl: Skaven Team
description:
Blitz Bowl is a fast paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges and score the most Points! The Skaven Team expansion provides everything necessary for use with Blitz Bowl, including cards, bases and a full sprue with Player figures, Coin, Score Marker and Balls.

There are 6 Skaven figures in brown plastic, all with unique sculpts:

1x Thrower
1x Blitzer
1x Gutter Runner
3x Lineman

One card is provided for each type; assembly instructions included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kiss Me, Hardy: Wargames Rules for the Combat at Sea During the Time of Nelson
description: Napoleonic naval miniature wargame rules intended for 1/1200 scale ships but usable for other scales. Turn sequence is card driven and the rules place the player at approximately Admiral level and thus the rules are intended to replicate decision making at that level (i.e. no need to worry about sail settings or ammunition types). Hence the rules are simple and quick.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Hotshots: ATV Promo
description:
ATV promo given out during Fireside Crash and Burn Tour 2017.
ATV allows firefighters to move 3 spaces and take one additional firefighter with them.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Battles of Black Cavalry: 10 Cavalry Brigade/1 Armoured Division from Poland to Wilhelmshaven – Hill 262: Chambois 19-21st August 1944
description:
Another game in the Great Battles of Small Units system and the second in the series of Battles of the Black Cavalry.

A great battle is taking place in Normandy. The Polish 1st Armored Division crosses German positions on the Dives river and in a truly cavalry style, moves towards the town of Chambois and the Hill 262 - Mont Ormel. In this way, the Poles blocked the only escape route for German troops locked in the so-called Falaise Pocket.

The game Hill 262 - Chambois, 19 - 21 August 1944 presents the Allied fights during closing and defending the Falaise Pocket. The main hero is the 1st Armored Division of general Stanisław Maczek. In addition, there are American and Canadian units.
There are 6 scenarios in the game. 4 of them are short clashes to familiarize yourself with the procedures of the system "Great Battles of Small Units". The main subject is the defense of the Allies and German attempts to get out of the pocket. The chaotic organization of the German army in this battle is shown in a simple way. At the beginning of the game a German player chooses battle groups that he will try to move out of the board. The Allied player does not know the opponent's plans. Only during the game it turns out which units appear in the game. Thanks to that every gameplay is different and the game provides a lot of emotions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Harry Potter: Death Eaters Rising – Dobby the House Elf
description:
This card was handed out at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

Special ability (triggered by 1 [Bravery] symbol): Add a [Damage] to Dobby and a [Damage] to a Death Eater.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: 1868: Wyoming
description: While an 18xx game at heart, this game is designed to reflect both Wyoming’s core railroad history, and the effects of the coal and oil industry on its towns and cities. The gameplay is driven by the railroads which formed the territory and later the state. The boom-and-bust cycle directly impacts the towns and cities of the state and therefore the revenue of the railroads. Coal and Oil Companies in this game do not necessarily represent coal or oil discoveries, but instead represent investment for development in the area – indirect drivers of revenue. The map is reflective of the immense emptiness and its widely varied and rugged terrain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Hungry for Humans
description:
In Hungry for Humans, you have a monster friend who really, really wants to eat you. But if you feed it the best human food we have to offer, you will curb its human hunger and help it become the most powerful monster in the wild. Luckily, you’ve discovered the scenic hills of West Virginia - the one place in the world where the food is delicious enough, the people are friendly enough, and the landscape is majestic enough to take the edge off any monster’s human hunger. Here, your monster will take part in a weekend of feasting on the world’s best cuisine. But be careful, your fellow humans may try to sabotage your monster’s next meal and leave you to become a human corn dog.

Each round the humans will submit dishes to a meal that the hungriest monster will eat. The hungriest monster is decided by the Hunger Level tiles which the humans will secretly choose for their monster before each meal is revealed.
