The meal will be revealed and the humans will then play Monster Power cards to sabotage other monsters or help their own. The Hunger Level tiles will then be revealed and the hungriest monster will eat the meal and add the total to its Power Level. If a monster eats too fast and exceeds level 20 it becomes too powerful and explodes. If it doesn’t eat the right stuff and goes below level 1, it becomes hangry and eats its human. The most powerful monster standing after 15 meals will be the winner!
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Kitchen Rush: Upgraded Security
description:
Part of Artipia's A Fair, a Robbery and a Promo Pack Kickstarter Campaign.

Card info:
At the end of each Action phase, get 2 Coins.
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Worker Placement

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Deadpool & Bob, Agent of Hydra
description:
Welcome to the Deadpool character pack, brought to you by me: the amazing Deadpool! Once terminal cancer patient Wade Wilson, I, the aforementioned Wade Wilson, was transformed into the incredible superpowered hero Deadpool! Thanks to the nerds at the Weapon X program, I was granted an off-the-charts healing factor which allows me to recover from even the most gruesome “for the love of all that’s holy, look away Timmy!” injuries. I’m also basically a ninja–expert marksman, a master in multiple martial arts (including the deadliest of all, Karate), and I speak, like, nine languages. But my greatest superpower of all is my dazzling wit and immeasurable charm. Though teams like the X-Men and Avengers would literally kill to have someone like me on their roster, I, the aforementioned Wade Wilson, a.k.a. Deadpool, remain los lobos–a lone wolf who hunts the moonlight desert in search of the only meal that will satisfy my endless hunger–justice! Also, they haven’t been returning any of my calls or emails…

A cowardly young man, Bob was persuaded to join the criminal organization Hydra by his wife, who accused him of not being able to hold down a steady job. The thought of a stable career with a dental plan also appealed to Bob, though he was ultimately disappointed to find out that Hydra does not, in fact, offer full dental like A.I.M. Bob’s life was forever changed when he met Deadpool during the Merc with a Mouth’s assault on his outpost. Deadpool convinced Bob to assist him with his mission and the two became lifelong partners. These days the H on Bob’s chest no longer stands for Hydra but Hero!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mini Express: Expansion Map Pack 1 & Map Pack 2
description:
ONE box TWO expansions FOUR maps!

With the Mini Express Map Pack 1 & 2 Expansions, your total map count is now up to six! We invited local designers from the United Kingdom, Taiwan, Japan, and Spain to enhance the Mini Express experience. Each new map brings new landscapes and special rules to explore, and several mini-expansion rule modules that can be used on any map.

EXCLUSIVE Wooden Components!

This Map Pack Collectors Box is a must-have for any Mini Express enthusiast! Enhance your game with beautiful wooden pieces designed to enhance your gaming experience. They can be used in place of the cardboard tiles, or as additional supplements to increase your table presence and upgrade your gaming experience!
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding
publishers: BoardBros, Delirium Games, Moaideas Game Design

name: Cascadia: Rolling Rivers
description:
Cascadia: Rolling is a series of puzzly flip-and-roll-and-write games featuring the habitats and wildlife of the Pacific Northwest! Simultaneously roll dice, collect wildlife, and complete habitat cards to fill in different environments in Cascadia. Use special actions to manipulate your dice, and dynamic completion cards to unlock powerful combos!

There are two versions of Cascadia: Rolling. Each version features the following unique content - get both versions to play 1-8 players on 8 different maps!:

A unique Central Special Die that changes the way each round plays out.

4 unique Environment Sheets, based on a different region of Cascadia, each with its own special gameplay elements.

30 Unique Habitat Cards with breathtaking art by Beth Sobel.

8 Unique Advanced Completion cards for unique ways to combo discounts and bonuses each round!

A unique mini-expansion that introduces completely new gameplay elements like end game scoring bonuses and competitive objectives to ramp up the competition!

Roll your dice, collect wildlife and Nature Tokens, complete Habitat Cards, and fill in the puzzle on your personal Environment Sheet to create the most harmonious ecosystem in Cascadia! Although the core rules are simple, each unique Environment Sheet has its own twist so no two games of Cascadia: Rolling will play out the same!

Cascadia: Rolling Rivers features unique content specific to the riverine environments of Cascadia!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, American West, Animals, Dice, Environmental, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Line Drawing, Market, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up
publishers: Alderac Entertainment Group, Flatout Games, Lucky Duck Games, White Goblin Games

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Eten Expansion
description:
This expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters can be added to any Hunt and includes:

1 Highly Detailed Plastic Miniature.
1 Vampire ID Card.
10 Elder Influence Cards.
1 Rule Sheet.

Nete was a white witch, healing with herbs and bringing villagers together with love potions. Every formula was carefully recorded in her Book of Life. She lived just outside the hamlet, near the graveyard. She could easily harvest her ingredients in the fields and woodlands and at night, she secretly tended the graves, keeping them clean and beautiful. Especially that of her dead husband, who passed too young at 18.
The villagers were no fools. They accepted her broken-hearted obsession and knew her spells were just quackery. Back then, people took care of their own. Still, sometimes the herbs helped with toothache and someone had to tend the graves. It wasn’t all charity.

When the Night swept through, she was the first to be turned.
The boiling corruption coursing through her body has inverted Nete. Now a powerful Elder with the full power of Influence, Eten reads backwards from her Book of Blood as she repels and harms Hunters in her vicinity.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Lord Marku Expansion
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters includes:

1 Highly Detailed Plastic Miniature, Lord Marku.
1 Vampire ID Card.
1 Rule Sheet.

LORD MARKU
Stepping out of the shadows, Marku has now shown itself as the true Lord of the Night. Although Marku’s complete history is unknown, the Order’s library has tales of a giant bat ravaging Eastern European villages. Later stories tell of an Elder Bat leading a powerful Hungarian Vampire enclave.

The Order believes this new bat-faced fiend is that same Elder, fed and corrupted by the evil it has spread across the centuries.

Does the Order have the strength to destroy this feral beast that rules the Night?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Judge Dredd Miniatures Game: Rulebook
description:
Judge Dredd is a skirmish tabletop miniatures game for two or more players set in the Judge Dredd universe created by legendary comic creators John Wagner and Carlos Ezquerra. In it, Street Judges patrol the towering City Blocks and crammed streets of the vast megalopolis Mega-City One, a city full of criminals, gangs, crazies, and murderers. Only the uncompromising resolve of the Judges stands in the way to total lawlessness.

In Judge Dredd, players take control of a small team of Judges or Perps as they fight for justice or survival in the mean streets of Mega-City One and beyond.

This book contains all the rules you need to play Judge Dredd, including scenarios, weapon rules, and profile lists to create your own patrol of Judges and criminal gangs for them to sentence.

The Judge Dredd rulebook contains everything you need to know about playing the game and includes rules for fighting within buildings and using vehicles. As well as a number of scenarios, there are rules for developing your chosen faction in a series of linked games.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Breizh 1341
description:
April the 30th, year 1341, Duke Jean III of Brittany dies childless. His niece, Jeanne de Penthièvre, the wife of Charles de Blois, and Jean de Montfort, husband of Jeanne de Flanders and half-brother of Jean III, claim the ducal crown of Brittany. In less than an hour, battle to know who will become the next Duke of Brittany!

Breizh 1341 is a card-driven game between two players, one taking the lead of the Franco-Bretons of Charles de Blois and the other controlling the Anglo-Bretons of Jean de Montfort. The game is played in a series of turns, during which each side carries out military and diplomatic actions akin to those which were common in the 14th century. Historical figures also influence the course of the game. Nobles must be rallied to support your claim, troops recruited and subsequently led into battle or sent to besiege castles. After years of confrontation, the player who controls the most territories, castles and supporters will become the new Duke of Brittany!

Components:
1 map
76 event cards
40 wooden cubes (20 red and 20 blue)
40 wooden cylinders (20 red and 20 blue)
42 counters (markers)
1 dice
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Multi-Use Cards, Turn Order: Auction

name: Solos en Casa
description:
What do pets do when they are alone at home? Take on the role of Floppy, Valentina, Donatella, Sir Alfred or Pippao Emilio, and participate in a frantic race to get the great loot kept in the fridge.

Each player will be a pet and with the help of the dice, opening and closing doors, and trap cards (banana peel and glue) should hinder the rivals' race to reach the first one. In addition the letters of "noise", will create crazy events that can help or don't help to one or more players.

The one who arrives from the door of the house will arrive first at the refrigerator located in the kitchen, win the game.

A very fun race for the whole family and with lots of interaction.

—description from the designer

¿Qué hacen las mascotas cuando están solas en casa?...Conviértete en Floppy, Valentina, Donnatella, Dir Alfred, Pippao Emilio, y participa en una frenética carrera para alcanzar el gran botín guardado en la nevera.

Cada jugador será una mascota y con ayuda del dado, abriendo y cerrando puertas, y cartas de trampas (cáscara de plátano y pegamento) debe entorpecer la carrera de sus rivales para llegar el primero. Además las cartas de "ruido", crearán locos acontecimientos que pueden favorecer o entorpecer a uno o varios jugadores.

Ganará aquel que desde la puerta de la casa llegue el primero a la nevera situada en la cocina.

Una carrera muy divertida para toda la familia y con mucha interacción.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Tea Party
description:
There's a big Tea Party in the forest and everyone has been invited! No one wants to miss the event, but they can't agree where to sit at the tables. Who wants to eat cake sitting next to the Skunk? Is the Wolf more attentive to the Sheep than to the cakes? What mischief is the Fox up to? Together you will have to help them organise a smooth event while keeping an eye on your own goals.

The players will have to place the different animals at the tables, trying to take advantage of the characteristics of each one of them to complete their objective cards and thus obtain as many points as possible.

On their turn, players take an animal token from a bag and places it on one of the tea tables. This triggers an effect that the player will have to resolve. In addition, players can also resolve scoring cards from their hands on their turns if they have managed to fulfill the requirement for one.

The game ends when there are no possible placements left or when the scoring cards deck runs out. The winner is the player with the most victory points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Corvette Command
description:
Corvette Command is a strategic level solo narrative generating game giving you the chance to experience the worst that the Atlantic can throw at you while taking on the German U-boats. Your crew starts out raw and with basic skills which they get the opportunity to improve over the course of the campaign. Your mission is to protect the convoy from attack and success is measured by the scale of the losses incurred rather than by how many U-boats are sunk. If vital supplies are lost then this can impact on how quickly new technology becomes available to you such as radar and HF/DF detection.

It is May 1941 and the Battle of the Atlantic is reaching a critical point. The Royal Canadian Navy has extended its convoy cover eastwards and the Royal Navy has pushed their cover west so that convoys are now escorted the whole way across the Atlantic. For the purposes of game play only these two forces have been combined and you command a single Flower Class Corvette all the way across the Atlantic. Although the “Escort Gap” has been closed the “Air Gap” remains. The escorts are still waiting for the arrival of ship borne radar and spotting surfaced U-Boats and keeping station on convoys in the dark and poor visibility is still reliant on the lookouts. Ship to ship communications is also via signal lamps and flags and occasionally by loud hailer. The game ends on 31st May 1943.

This is a free print and play game that can be played in a small footprint with optional advanced rules that enable you to play a quick set up one-off game or a two player game and introduce greater level of detail. If you enjoyed Nicholas Monsarrat’s book or film “The Cruel Sea” then don your sea going gear and head out into the Atlantic.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Metis
description:
[For more information and to play online visit www.allumbra.com]

Metis is a pure strategy game in which you guide your Priests in exchanging power with each other to ultimately wrest control of your opponent’s Temple of Metis.

Your Priests all have varying degrees of power. Those with greater power can make sweeping movements greatly altering the course of the struggle. Lesser Priests, while more limited in might, are able to move more freely.

Movement

A piece can move horizontally, vertically or diagonally exactly the number of spaces as the value currently on the die. After, you move, transfer power with the pieces you jumped (see below).

Landing on Pieces: You may land on a piece (yours or your opponent’s) only if your piece has a higher value than the one it is landing on. The piece that you land on is destroyed. The capturing piece gains +1 power.

Power Transfer

As pieces move over one another, they exchange power. You give (1) power from your moving piece to each of your own pieces that you jump. Your piece takes (1) power from each enemy piece it passes over.

Underpowered and Overpowered Pieces: During movement, if a piece falls below (1) power, it is has become underpowered and is removed from the board. Likewise, if a piece gains more than (6) power, it has become overpowered and is removed from the board.

Winning

There are two possible ways to win Metis.

1. Occupy seats in your opponents Temple of Metis. There are two areas in each players temple: The inner chamber (darker) and the outer chamber (lighter). Occupying a seat in the inner chamber is worth 2 occupation points. occupying a seat in the outer chamber is worth 1 occupation point. You must hold 8 occupation points to win the game.

2. Destroy opponent’s pieces until she has three or less (making the above goal impossible for your opponent).
mechanics: Area Movement

name: The Blop Game
description: Mr. Blop's head contains a variety of colored balls. Each color belongs to a different player. When Blop's tongue is pressed, a ball pops out of his hat and players try to catch it, if it is of their color. The object of the game is for a player to collect four balls of his color. The one white ball is wild and counts as any color. The one black ball allows its catcher to penalize an opponent and put back one of their caught balls.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Pantheon
description:
from site:

"The greatest builders of ancient Rome are competing for the favor of the Emperor. Score points by building the biggest, tallest and widest buildings before the building stops. Cleverly out-build the others and all of Rome will be at your feet!"
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Flip Flop Go
description: This is another variant of the late 19th century game of Reversi (aka Othello). Trap other pieces between your own to capture them but be aware that the opponent may do the same. Pieces will change sides (colors) dozens of times. Points are scored every time a chip is flipped, as opposed to OTHELLO where it is only at the end points are scored. Each player also has a STOP chip and two DOUBLE chips. The STOP chip is undetectable when played and only shows itself when the opponent attempts to flip it. The DOUBLE chips always show and it doubles the points scored in that row when it gets flipped. If there are two DOUBLE chips in a row being flipped the score is quadrupled. There are handy thumb wheel scoring devices for each player attached to the game’s board as well.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Speed Circuit: Turnier Kurs
description:
The Speed Circuit Turnier Kurs was issued by "Das Spiel" in Hamburg and took the idea from the 1979 released edition "Speed Circuit Tournament Tracks".

The "Turnier Kurs" has also 2 tracks, a qualifying and a tournament track. Main differences to the original are a longer straight line and less curves on the qualifying track and a remarkable extension of the tournament track.

Expands:

Speed Circuit
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Aerodrome II
description:
Aerodrome II is a miniatures game of aerial combat during World War II. Players take roles as pilots in fighters and bombers. Each player controls a 1/100 or 1/144 airplane mounted on antennas allowing planes to be at differing altitudes. The planes move over hexes on a table dueling with other players to shoot each other down.

As with Aerodrome, pilots pilot three moves at a time. There are many more maneuvers that these planes can do as compared to the World War I version. Movements occur simultaneously and pilots may fire on any plane down the hex row that his plane is pointing. Firepower differences between aircraft are simulated by rolling different sided die for determining hits.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Woody Woodpecker's Crazy Mixed-Up Color Factory Game
description:
Game includes Woody Woodpecker, A Color Factory Wheel, A Color Factory Platform, 48 paint chips and a spinner. From the cover; "Help poor confused Woody straighten up his crazy mixed up color factory."

Ages 5-10
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: CrystalicuM: Kryształowa Gra Karciana
description:
CrystalicuM - Krzysztalowa Gra Karciana (Polish for Crystal Card Game, abbreviated KGK) also known as Crystalicum - Wojna Cieni (War of Shadows) is a Polish CCG, set in a 'fantasy / space opera / steampunk' universe (think Spelljammer) and with anime/manga like art. The universe is also developed in a Polish role-playing game of the same name.

Story: In the Known Universe there are many secret conflicts, wars and alliances. Secret brotherhoods fight each other, and for them, interstellar powers are only a tokens in the eternal game. The fate of the Universe and its unaware inhabitants rests upon you.

Expansions:

Pod pelnymi zaglami (Under full sails, 2005)
Silniejsze od Miecza (Stronger than Sword, 2006)


Plans for 2nd edition have been announced early in 2007.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Panzer Grenadier: War on the Equator
description:
After over a century of border disputes with Ecuador, the Peruvian Army began a massive build up for a final reckoning. With modern tanks from Czechoslovakia and modern artillery and planes from Italy, South America's first unit of paratroopers and a battalion of marines, Peru unleashed its blitzkrieg in July 1941. The war lasted for seven weeks, ending with a crushing Peruvian victory as Ecuador was forced to hand over half of the territory claimed by the Quito government.

War on the Equator is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier system based on the battles waged between Peru and Ecuador in 1941. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front and Road to Berlin. There are six scenarios, each based on an actual battle and featuring tank assaults, parachute landings, amphibious assaults, horsed cavalry and river gunboat operations.

War on the Equator is sold exclusively via PDF download. The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor is the scenario book printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game's components.

Expands:

Road to Berlin: Platoon Level Combat in World War II – A Panzer Grenadier Game
Eastern Front: A Panzer Grenadier Game
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Mítosz
description: In this Hungarian ccg the cards represent mythological characters, creatures, artifacts, deities, monsters, and so on. Every player chooses a chief god at the beginning, which determines the strength and weaknesses of the deck.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Network and Route Building, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Chess Mixer
description:
DESCRIPTION:
Chess has been around for hundreds of years as a pure strategy game. Try your hand at THREE chess expansions to challenge you even further. Play one, two, or all three at the same time! Mix and match however you'd like.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Checkmate your opponent's king, just like normal chess

GAME PLAY:
CHESS N LADDERS:
Add ladders to the chess board to create additional movement and attack vectors. Let the carnage commence.

QUANTUM CHESS:
Brings the 4th dimension to the chess game. Move chess pieces temporarily off the board as they travel in time and then return to wreak havoc on the battlefield.

BOMBER PAWN:
Pawns have always been the lowly piece, but no more! Push your pawn forward, and watch them explode your enemies. Don't let it backfire.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Cardboard Baseball
description: Baseball simulation game that recreates player performance based on simple stats found on everyday baseball cards. Game uses a standard deck of cards for quick play resolution. The player simply flips a card, refers to a specific pitcher stat as dictated by the chart and if the pitcher fails that check goes on to do the same for the batter. The game advertises itself as not one trying to replicate pinpoint statistical accuracy but attempts to make baseball cards come to life.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dust Tactics: USMC Fire Squad – "Devil Dogs"
description: For years the Marine Corps' doctrine has been to overwhelm enemy positions by using superior firepower while the rest of the troops, like Assault Squads, close in on the target. Devil Dogs are a staple of the USMC: they concentrate enough guns to annihilate several times their number.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Elder Sign: The Dark God Promo Card
description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 17-18 October 2014.

Consists of The Dark God, a new Ancient One.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Find It, Say It
description:
Βρες το Πες το (Find It, Say It) is a party game similar to Taboo.

You have to describe a word to your teammates without using some words written on your card in a specific time. If successful you gain the card and you start a new one if there is still time. The team with the most cards wins at the end of the game.

There are rules for 2 players as well.
mechanics: Team-Based Game

name: Match Quilt
description: Match Quilt is a card game where players choose quilt blocks to arrange in their sampler quilt to make the best final product. Blocks earn points for matching various aspects of neighboring cards, like color and difficulty level. Final scoring also rewards an even distribution of colors and patterns. The advanced mode brings in special card effects like one-time actions and ongoing abilities to make choices even more interesting for the quilters. Make it sew!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Classic Legion of Doom Promo Cards
description:
This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Black Manta: Deep Sea Deviant (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League)
Lex Luthor: Legion of Doom
Scarecrow: Legion of Doom


Black Manta and Lex Luthor use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League, Scarecrow uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Dungeon Bebop
description:
Dungeon Bebop is a game built around solo play (but can be played with up to 3 friends). A rogue-like dungeon crawl, in Dungeon Bebop you'll explore up to 15 dungeon rooms, avoid traps, fight monsters, and get loot. Your goal is to reach the 15th room where you will find the Amulet of Eleht and win the game!

Game Play:
You start out with 15 Dungeon Room cards, face down, and one to four Hero Cards (your party). You encounter each room by flipping each Room card over. The room card itself describes the encounter - perhaps you need to avoid a trap; perhaps you'll find unguarded loot; or perhaps you'll have to fight a monster!

Monsters appear from a separate Monster deck. Combat is simple: roll a d20 (provided) -- if it meets or beats the target monster's Armor Class, then it's a hit. But beware, if you roll a 1-5, the Monster hits you instead. Combat resolution is handled by a single die roll -- Don't forget to loot the corpse!

On the final room your find your prize, the Amulet of Eleht, and you win the game!

Dungeon Bebop contains 54 Room cards, 54 Monster cards, 36 Treasure cards, and 4 Hero Cards.

Yes, you can play solo!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fireteam Zero: Escalation Pack
description:
Add variety to your Fireteam Zero missions.

Contains:


V for Victory - Hero Deck Upgrades
Fighting Zeroes - Hero Deck Upgrades
Lonely Guns - Hero Deck Upgrades
Sleepless in Shadows - Monster Twists
Spawn of the Infernal - Monster Twists
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Panzer Grenadier: Iron Curtain – National People's Army
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

National People's Army adds the East Germans to Panzer Grenadier, with their kasernierten ("garrisoned") police, the predecessor of the East German Army. Armed initially with the Third Reich's castoff weaponry - Czech, Polish and Yugoslav rifles and machine guns - as tensions rose in 1950 they received new arms (some Soviet, some from German stocks) including Soviet-made tanks, self-propelled artillery and armored cars.

There are 24 new East German pieces included: scorchless, sootless and laser-cut. And you even get three scenarios for Iron Curtain - Patton's Nightmare.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: シン・関ヶ原 (New: Sekigahara)
description:
A game covering the Sekigahara campaign all over Japan.

The game uses the system of Few acres of Snow.
Each player starts the game with his own card deck worth 10VPs. Each turn, he can purchase new cards worth his current VPs.
Most clans starts the game in neutral status. Players need to purchase the cards representing them. They also mobilize, move and attack with cards.
The game lasts 8 turns. Victory is decided by controlling VP areas.

Unit scale: ?
Game period: Tensho 10 - Tensho 17
Counters: 198
Map: A2 (42 x 59.4 cm)
Cards: 32


Published in Game Journal #64.
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Classic Avengers Promo Cards
description:
With a distinctive retro art style, this set features 3 Dice Masters cards of original Avengers - Ant-Man, Captain America, and Iron Man! Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


Iron Man: Pro-Reg (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War)
Ant-Man: Classic Avenger
Captain America: Classic Avenger


All three cards use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

description: The travel destination "Essen" will be available in Essen.

description:
Originally available to subscribers of Bellwether Games' newsletter in a limited quantity.

This tile covers the entire Small Species Challenge Section but those trophy tokens are still used.

During the game, you do not earn trophies for completing the Small species challenge. Instead, whenever you catch your third pike, take the topmost trophy from the Pike Challenge stack
