name: Deadzone: Nameless Faction Starter
description:
Mysterious and utterly alien, the Nameless are a bizarre menagerie of tentacles, claws and talons. They have recently turned hostile and begun to invade GCPS space, attacking outposts with their powerful technology and strange abilities.
Contents

This set contains everything you need get started with the Nameless in Deadzone, including:

1 Resin Psychotroid
2 Plastic Riflemen
2 Plastic Assassins
2 Plastic Gunslingers
2 Plastic Inkers
2 Plastic Scuttlers
4 Resin Needle Drones
1 Resin Caratid
2 Plastic Ogres
Transparent Plastic Flying Bases
25mm and 40mm Round Bases
Mantic Points

Requires the Deadzone 2nd edition rulebook and Deadzone: Outbreak supplement to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien Artifacts: Santi Fleet Faction Promo
description:
Take control of a new faction called the Santi Fleet in which the operate of the ship is the ship! Increase your options with with the Alien Artifacts: Factions Promo.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Galopp in den Tod
description: Murder Mystery game themed around the famous Gold Cup in the Ascot racecourse in the year 1972
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Dark Ages: II Edition – Britannia & France
description:
Dark Ages Britannia and France reimplements Dark Ages Britannia and expands it with 6 new battles focused on the French army.

Game mechanics have been improved and revised for more intuitive gaming. Game maps have been completely redesigned with impressive artwork to match the new game tiles.
Units don't use blocks anymore, but fancy banners partnered by some wooden cubes to simulate troops. This gives the game a more modern look and a strong visual impact, allowing bigger battles in comparison with the previous version of the base game.

This base + expansion box includes the following scenarios:

BRITANNIA:
Fulford, Stamford Bridge, Hastings, Stirling Bridge, Falkirk, Bannockburn (day 1 and 2).

FRANCE:
Bouvines, Courtrai, Mons-en-Pevele, Crecy, Agincourt, Vernuil

—description from the designer.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Magic: The Gathering – Selesnya Guilds of Ravnica Guild Kit
description:
Each Guild Kit features a 60-card pre-constructed theme deck flavored after one of the featured guilds, combining cards from every Ravnica set released so far. The reprints are not Standard legal.

Contents:
1 Ready-to-play Green/White 60-card deck
1 Spindown life counter
1 Official guild pin
1 Guild symbol sticker
1 Insert with mission instructions
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Take That

name: Hannibal ad Portas
description:
Hannibal ad Portas is the first title of the One Page Games series: it’s a quick historical game where you play the role of Hannibal on his march from Spain to Italy, where he will meet the Roman Army at Cannae (216BC).

One Page Games (1PG) have been designed with the objective of being “light” games in terms of:

Time
Table space
Cost


I’ve found it more and more difficult to find the time to study a full-featured game while often I’ve got a 30 minutes break in the daily routine: 1PG have been designed to fill this small interval. Rules are easy and short enough to provide a quick but interesting gaming session: from this perspective 1PG are great for a flight since they perfectly fit on the small space of a plane seat.

Each 1PG must follow two design rules:

All the components for the game can be placed on a single A4 sheet of paper (no counter, no dice).
The same deck of 18 cards is used by all the games to provide randomness without the need of using dice.


In addition, you will only need a pencil and a rubber.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wig Masters
description:
Wig Masters is a game for 2-4 players in which
players take on the roles of wig merchants competing in the high stakes world of powdered wig sales.
Wear your various fancy wigs to influence the ever changing wig market whilst buying and selling fancy wigs. Players must buy wigs when they are cheap and sell them when they are fashionable to make the most money and win.
The game is a streamlined stock market game in which players will buy low and sell high from the market to earn money.
Each Round consists of four phases;

Players choose a wig to wear for the Round that will determine their turn order and special ability.
Market demand is determined.
Players sell wigs to the market.
Players buy wigs from the market.


Simple rules, deep strategy, brisk playtime.
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stock Holding

name: Warfighter: Modern PMC Expansion #48 – Easy Money
description:
Warfighter Modern - PMC Expansion - #48 High Profile adds 56 cards to your Warfighter Modern - PMC Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Iris
description:
Iris is a two player abstract strategy game that is played on a "hexhex" board (a hexagonal shaped board made with hexagonal cells). An Iris board has rainbow colored perimeter cells and gray interior cells. Boards of sizes 5-8 cells per side are recommended. (Size 5 is recommended for beginners.) Player 1 plays with black stones and Player 2 plays with white stones.

On the very first turn, Player 1 plays a SINGLE black stone to any gray cell. Thereafter, starting with Player 2 on his/her first turn, each player plays TWO stones per turn, subject to the following restrictions:

1) If the first stone of a turn is played on a colored perimeter cell, then the second stone MUST be played on the corresponding same-colored cell on the opposite side of the hexhex board. (In the case of a corner cell, the corresponding same-colored cell is the opposite corner cell.)

2) If the first stone of a turn is played on a gray interior cell, then the second stone MUST be played on any empty non-adjacent gray cell. (If all remaining empty gray cells are adjacent to the first stone, then the second stone is forfeited.)

When the board is full or when both players consecutively pass, the game ends and players score their groups of stones. A group’s score is equal to the number of colored cells that it occupies. The player with the highest scoring group wins. If scores are tied, then players ignore their highest scoring group, and compare the highest scoring of their remaining groups. If still tied, then players compare their next highest scoring groups, etc., until the tie is broken. (Despite there being an even number of colored cells, for subtle reasons having to do with board geometry, it turns out that draws are impossible.)

(A note on the game's name: "Iris" was the Greek goddess of the rainbow.)



Honors


Iris was a finalist in the Best Combinatorial 2-Player Game Contest of 2019







-description from designer
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Exploit Zero: Tsim Sha Tsui Expansion
description:
The Tsim Sha Tsui Expansion is a supplement for Exploit Zero - Cyberpunk Espionage and Mayhem. Please note this is not a stand-alone game. You need the Exploit Zero core rules to use it.

This supplement introduces new weapons, new gear, and new threats, as well as clarifications and optional variations to the base game. It also contains a five mission mini-campaign to help players incorporate these new elements into their sessions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Front Line No Komrades: Kameradenschweine
description: Front Line No Komrades: Kameradenschweine is an expansion for Front Line No Komrades.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Panzer Grenadier (Modern): 1967 – Sword of Israel: Four-Five Commando
description:
The 32nd issue returns to Panzer Grenadier (Modern): 1967 Sword of Israel, with the Royal Marines helicoptering into the Gaza Strip to commit mayhem. It’s based on actual excuses offered by Egyptian officers for their defeat in the Six-Day War: that British commandos intervened in the fighting, helping the Israelis eject the Egyptian garrison. British Royal Marines did see action in South Yemen in 1967, and were the last units to withdraw in November of that year. But they did not fight in Sinai.

The variant includes 24 die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces for 45 Commando (properly rendered “Four-Five,” not “Forty-fifth,” in RN parlance). You get eight new scenarios of Royal Marine action, fighting the Egyptians and fighting the Israelis, too.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Blade Rondo: Frost Veil
description:
Blade Rondo: Frost Veil is a stand-alone expansion for Blade Rondo. It can be played on its own, using the same rules as the original game, or can be combined with the base game as an expansion.

Rules and cards for playing solo are also included, including some new Solo-play mechanics unique to this expansion.

Blade Rondo is a minimalist, non-collectable card game for two players where each player selects just seven cards per match.

This expansion adds a mechanic for Freezing cards, allowing their effect to be delayed to subsequent turns to add additional strategic depth.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Academy: The Forbidden Mountain
description:
Are you ready to deal with both ice and fire on this formidable excursion? The Forbidden Mountain is teeming with unprecedented dangers, against which neither your mukluks nor your sunglasses will afford enough protection.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time

name: Village Pillage: Surf & Turf
description: Village Pillage Surf & Turf contains a copy of the Surf expansion and the Turf expansion together in one shrinkwrapped package.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fired Up: The Monster Expansion
description:
The second expansion for Fired Up! features 4 new fighters, chosen by our Kickstarter backers!
4 unique monsters are entering the arena, each with its own ability capable of changing everything in the game. You can now try to influence Fenrir, the lava breathing werewolf, Hoppy, the 2 headed clown, Grantelith the Void Seeker and the illustrator of the game itself, The Mico.
Included are 10 more Highlight cards that can influence the whole game.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dice in the Darkness
description:
Your dog has been taken captive deep into the dungeon by a mysterious creature. Fight your way through the ten rooms to save your dog and defeat the monster that is stealing joy from so many.

Dice in the Darkness is an episodic roll-and-write adventure played over ten rooms. You choose a character, Wizard, Warrior, or Rogue, and play that character through this ten room dungeon, upgrading and unlocking new abilities, with each room being a unique, one page roll-and-write experience.

It will be a free play-along-adventure, with each new room premiering via Twitch each week for ten weeks. Grab your pen, paper, and dice and survive the dungeon to save your beloved dog!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Legacy Game, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: トゥルーマリンショー3 (True Marine Show 3)
description:
In this final installment to the trilogy, Marine has arrived in the USA. Use your best Marine-glish to collect characters from Azur Lane, Touhou Project, and hololive one last time. This set features hololive English -Myth- characters as a powerful new category called EX cards.

Play sailors from your hand to gain Vtuber Points (VP) in order to purchase more powerful sailors from the market and improve your deck. The game ends at the end of the round when a player reaches 20 or more VP. Whoever has the most VP is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Mythology, Nautical, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: New Phone, Who Dis?: First Expansion Pack
description:
This expansion pack is full of ridiculous new Inbox + Reply Cards to add to New Phone, Who Dis? Core Game.

Players rotate drawing a sent (or “inbox”) card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest “reply” card. Once everyone has played their chosen reply card, the rotating judge awards a point to the funniest one. The player with the most points at the end of the round takes the crown.

Includes 45 Inbox cards and 135 reply cards to be added to the main game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge

name: Rogue Trooper: Lone Trooper
description: Official solitaire rules for Rogue Trooper from White Dwarf magazine, issue 93.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Lose a Turn, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Il Gioco è Tratto
description:
The game is drawn is a collection of pen&paper games, playable on a small erasable board and pencil format. Each product in the line has a different theme, and includes 10 games.

The game is drawn - strategy - is the first in the collection and includes 10 strategy games:

SQU, by Nestor Romeral Andres
Do and Undo, by Marcello Bertocchi
Tumbleweed, by Mike Zapawa
Spiderlings, by 4brains4games
Password, by Hjalmar Hach
Stampede, by Walter Joris
Yavalath, by LUDI and Cameron Browne
Cartesio, by Silvano Sorrentino
Quartieri, by Dieter Stein
9tka, by Adam Kaluza
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Starship Shuffle
description:
Welcome to Starbase, Texas. Workers are crafting the behemoth known as Starship. You and your friends can now join this historic moment by cooperatively building the largest, most powerful rocket system to ever exist. Only your teammates can see your rocket components - will you risk an accident in the production yard? Then try to launch and steer clear of a Rapid Unscheduled Disassembly!

The game starts with the Build Phase. Each player is dealt a starting hand of Rocket Cards facing AWAY from them. Players take turns playing one unseen card from their hand onto the field, trying to match it with the Starship's blueprints. Alternatively, a player can choose to give a hint to a teammate since players can see their teammate's hands. Players must used memory tactics to manage their turn's action with overall team strategy. Successful plays of Rocket Cards reward players with Development Cards which can be used to increase the rocket's chance of a successful launch.

If the players successfully build the Starship in time, they move to the Launch Phase. The launch consists of different stages that must be successfully passed. To pass each launch stage players take turns randomly drawing from a special hand of cards that is determined by the Development Cards acquired during the Build Phase.

The game is won if players successfully launch and land their rockets during the Launch Phase. The game is lost if the rocket explodes during launch, or if too many construction accidents happen during the Build Phase.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Memory, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action/Event, Connections, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory, Ownership, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Stacking and Balancing, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: NIN
description:
The world of Nin places you as a Ninja master vying to control more castles than your opponents.

To aid you in this quest, your clan has mustered their nine best Ninjas - each with their own unique ability.

However, the winds whisper about how the other clans have also
mustered their best Ninjas to meet you in the field of battle. Therefore,strategic placement and impeccable timing is essential to outmaneuver your opponents.

In this game players take turns to play / reveal one of their Ninja cards as an attempt to control castles. When all players have passed, the game ends and check who is controlling each castle. The player who controls the most castles wins the game.

The game includes 2 game variants, team variant and advanced variant. The Team variant allows players to play in teams (but must be played with 4 players) while the advanced variant gives players more depth by adding a new action to the game, Delay.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Take That

name: G.R.I.M. INC.
description:
You are the latest employee of the afterlife’s biggest employer G.R.I.M. INC (Grim Reaper's Institute of Murder, Incorporated). It is your job, along with your colleagues, to come up with new and creative ways of disposing of those still living - all mortals have an expiration date after all. Your boss is, of course, the Grim Reaper - however they are far too busy to give their time to a lackey like you. You will instead report to a Line Manager who will assess the value of your pitches of demise, and recognition cards will be given to the employee who impresses them the most, maybe even bonuses!

You and your colleagues will take it in turns to become the Line Manager, a very prestigious position indeed!
From here you will pick from our fatal cards to decide which unfortunate soul will be next to depart this earth. The other employees will then pick up their implement cards, and use this to dispatch this soul in the setting revealed.

Get your elevator pitches ready and be prepared to impress against a one minute sand timer in order to become employee of the month in this exciting new deadly game! Can you come up with a murderous plot? Or be forced to think on your feet?

Could you dispose of a chicken farmer on a volcano with a whisk? Or a medium on a cruise ship with a lightbulb?
How can you exterminate a patronising life coach, at that place where he goes to forget his family, with a sweaty sock at your disposal?
The manager picks their favourite pitch and awards a card of recognition.

The game ends when an employee has received 3 cards of recognition, has become employee of the month, and has won the game!

Disappointing the line manager could leave you receiving disciplinary card. That's gonna make life harder to get those recognition cards!

This is an exciting new opportunity and we can't wait to share our death with all of you!

And remember, it's good to be G.R.I.M.!
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Open Drafting, Order Counters, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Blackout
description:
When Rob Evers gets a big promotion at work, a celebration is in order. After a wild night out on the town, Rob wakes up in a dark alley with no memory of his actions and the disturbing sense that he might have been involved in something. Only he can't remember what. With a sinking feeling in his gut, he checks his pockets and finds a several strange items along with a series of voice messages on his phone. When he calls his friends, they even tell him that he left the bar with a woman. Rob has no memory of the night at all and is worried about what he might have done. Retrace Rob's actions from the night in question and determine all of the things he did during his Blackout!

Difficulty Rating – 7/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for September 2021.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Champs de bataille
description:
This new edition takes us from the death of Alexander in 323 BC and the war of his successors — the Diadochi — which will last fifty years, to the last battles in Italy and Spain of the Second Punic War in 206 before BC, via the expedition of Pyrrhus, king of Epirus in Italy between 280 and 275 BC.

Two great systems of weapons clash then, the Macedonian phalanx and the elephants against the legions of the Roman Republic, but the battle of Cynoscephalae will not take place until 197 BC and the phalanx is not yet obsolete.

Champs de Bataille is a board game largely inspired by an English rule for miniatures called De Bellis Multitudinis published by the Wargames Research Group in the early 1990s, four booklets of army lists ranging from 3000 BC to 1500 AD accompany this rule.

The general classification of troops allows not only armies to compete in historical battles, but also non-historical adversaries thanks to its budgeting system, providing practically endless what ifs.
The adaptation for board game makes it possible to play many battles of antiquity on a small surface and without figurines with on average between 20 to 30 counters on each side.
Overlays to be cut are also provided to vary the battlefield. No two games of Champs de Bataille will be the same.

Through eight lists that will allow you to experiment with many army combinations and four historical scenarios(*), this module will give you the opportunity to replay many battles with a relatively simple system.

(*) Paraitacene (317), Gaza (312), Ausculum (279), Ilipa (206).

—description from the publisher (edited)
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Betwixt and Between: Forces of Nature
description:
So, you’ve decided to return… and this time you come.. somewhat prepared. With artifacts lending you powers... But there’s also new challenges ahead. Traces of faery dust around the land, and new places rearranging the world… Whirlwinds, sacred trees, moon paths... and not to forget, new powerful master spells to learn.... Are you sure you’re ready?

The Forces of Nature expansion for Betwixt and Between includes new powerful artifacts giving each Mystic a magic boost at the start of the game and a special ability to use throughout the game.

The expansion also includes more Exploration Cards with new adventurous places to visit with new actions for your Mystic to put to use to create epic turns!

There are also new challenging master spells to learn for big amount of points, rewarding being smart and creative when building your Magic Weave. 

Our Mystics will also find magical Faery Dust sprinkled around the game board, presenting a brand new resource to collect and score points from in different ways! 

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Kamigawa: Neon Dynasty
description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering takes place in the world of Kamigawa, approximately 1200 years after the end of the Kami War. Technology has developed significantly in that time, and the art now has a neon cyberpunk aesthetic inspired by modern-day Japan. There are giant mechs, laser katanas, cyber ninjas, and more.

The set contains 302 cards: 117 commons, 88 uncommons, 59 rares, 18 mythic rares, and 20 basic lands (10 of which are in a unique full-art Ukiyo-e style inspired by traditional Japanese woodcuts). It is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: Provisions 1849
description:
THEME: By the summer of 1849, the California Gold Rush was in full swing. In this fast-moving game, you and your fellow players own competing General Stores in a boomtown where new gold was just discovered. You must battle it out selling specific supplies to the gold prospectors flooding into town. But first you must either buy the goods from local suppliers or trade with a devious gang of vigilantes when supplies become too scarce. And of course, you must move quickly to make your fortune; because in just 6 months, the gold will run out in this town and the prospectors will move on to another!

GAME PLAY: The game is played over 6 Rounds – one for each month from July through December. Each Round has 2 Phases: Production Phase and Buy/Sell/Trade Phase.

During the Production Phase, each of the 8 Suppliers produce Goods (or has Goods stolen by the Vigilantes!). Production is random based on the Production Cards that are chosen each round, so some goods may quickly become scarce!

During the Buy/Sell/Trade Phase, players either buy Goods from the Suppliers, sell the Goods needed by a Prospector to make a sale and claim the Prospector Card, or trade Goods with the Vigilantes.

Some claimed Prospector Cards include a Contract Goods bonus which can be used to make future sales – making this an “engine-building” game!

Play continues for 6 rounds (representing 6 months) with special rules at the end of September when the Vigilantes flee and drop their stolen goods for players to grab, and during the final month of December when the gold has run out and prospectors are stocking up quickly to move on to the next boomtown.

GOAL OF THE GAME: Win the game by collecting the most Provision Points from completed sales to the Prospectors, as well as Bonus Points from individual Bonus objectives achieved at the end of the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Investment, Random Production, Take That

name: Palmela
description:
The image of the friar-knight has in its way shaped the history of the Palmela castle throughout the centuries. The monks who inhabited said castle lived periods in which a call-to-arms would make knights out of them. In this game, this duality is present in the split value of cards and the twofold way they can be played: either facing up or down.

Each round, players will play character cards. Simultaneously, they will try to guess the sum of the score of all currently played character cards. The goal is to find out whether the friar’s value or the knight’s value is equal or greater than the history value of the castle card being contested in the current round.

The game is over when the 12 rounds are finished and the players count the points in the Castles cards. The winner is the player with the most victory points.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management

name: Horns of the Buffalo
description:
Anglo-Zulu War game battle collection with twelve different scenarios. The combat system is a version of other games by Bill Molyneaux’s games Bloody Mohawk, Savage Wilderness. The game box will include Isandlwana, Rorkes Drift and other exciting scenarios.
The scenario list is as follows: Sihayo’s Kraal, Isandlwana, Rorke’s Drift, iNyezane River, Intombi Drift, Ulundi, Ulundi Ambush, Hlobane, Kambula, Buller’s Pursuit, Gingindlovu, Prince Imperial.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Zoo King: Jaguar & Bongo Promo cards
description:
Two additional cards to add to your Animal market deck to increase variety in your games:
the Jaguar and the Bongo.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Events, Market, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Assault on Doomrock: Ultimative Ausgabe – Spezialwürfel
description:
These custom dice mitigate randomness and provide special effects.

Every ability provides a specific type fo dice to make your level-up decisions more nuanced.


It was available separately for the German edition of the game.
It was included in the English edition of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Mind MGMT: Penny and Arjet Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack B of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:

Setup: Toss card and give to the side that is face up.

Science. The active Rogue Agent chooses either the row or column they are currently in. The Recruiter must say the actual number of locations they have visited in the chosen row or column. The Recruiter takes this card and flips it to the Magic side.

Magic. The Recruiter removes 1 Step token from the board. The rogue agents then take this card and flip it the Science side.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: CrowD Games, Off the Page Games

name: Bad Company: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Set of four new upgrade cards of the designers and artist:

Elif "Old Dog" Svenson
Kenneth "The Kid" Minde
Kristian "The Doc" Ostby
Gjermund "Pencils" Bohne
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Vagrantsong: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Three new Junk Cards to add to the Junk Deck.

Tie-Dye Die Tie - After any vagrant in the same train car suffers a wound or breaks a junk card (other than this one), any character gains 1 humanity

Toy Tower - When this junk breaks, all vagrants may either gain 2 humanity or rummage 1

Loud Lid - Other vagrants may increase the range of their skills that target this vagrant by 2
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nabis, le dernier Spartiate 195 av. J.-C.
description:
VaeVictis #167: Nabis, le dernier Spartiate 195 av. I.-C.

Nabis, le dernier Spartiate is the second wargame of the "Au Fil de l'Épée" Antiquity series, after "Alexandre contre la Perse".

In 195 BC, the king of Sparta Nabis sees his diplomatic maneuvers collapse. The powerful Roman legions of the proconsul Titus Quinctius Flamininus invade Laconia, accompanied by troops of the Achaean League. Refugee in Sparta with his motley army, Nabis fights a last combat to try to save his city. The game proposes to replay this battle which begins with a confrontation on the open ground and extends into street fighting, where all tactical stratagems, including the arson of the city, are good for repelling the Romans.

Can you save Sparta's independence or will you plant the Eagle of Rome in the heart of the city of Lycurgus?

One turn: 30 min.
1 SP = 200 men
Map: one hex. = 200 m
Complexity: 6/10
Solo play: 7/10
Duration of a game: about 2 hours
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Dungeon Degenerates: Wetlands Interludes
description:
A booster pack containing 21 new cards for use with Dungeon Degenerates. This was introduced as a new pack during the Fifth Edition Kickstarter.

This pack features Wetlands cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mutagen
description:
It is the 1920s and new groundbreaking elements are revolutionising the biostructure of our world.

Mutagen is a customisable worker placement game set in a 1920s biopunk universe. Each player has a blue, a yellow, and a red worker. Each time a player places a worker, they will activate that location's action, plus an additional action determined by the worker's colour.

Players can unlock the full potential of biological upgrades, by infusing their workers with biological upgrades that will grant them a decisive edge over their opponents.

Each worker location has been forever transformed by vast bio-enhanced changes. Collect elements from the floating cities and use them in various ways. Trade them for objective cards, establish dominance over particular elements through strategic investments, or harness their energy to upgrade your airship. With each move, you accumulate points, driving you closer to victory at different stages of the game.

The player who has best harnessed the newfound powers of this biopunk universe, and used them to collect the most amount of points after four years (rounds) will win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Tiwanaku: 20 Scenario Discs
description:
20 NEW Scenario discs for Tiwanaku.
These are long scenarios only (45 spaces).
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Kursk: Burning Tigers – Storm Division
description:
Several times a year, when we feel like it, the Golden Journal brings Gold Club members some fun extras for their Avalanche Press games. Our new-model Golden Journal features a “real” booklet, just like a small magazine, and a small set of die-cut, silky-smooth playing pieces.

In January 1943, the German Army began to re-organize the shattered 78th Infantry Division on a new pattern, one based heavily on the experience of German and Italian units in North Africa. This new-model Storm Division would rely on more automatic weapons and fewer soldiers, with heavier allotments of support weapons and anti-tank guns, too. Infantry organizations – squads, platoons, companies and battalions – would be radically re-organized around this concept as well. The new organization would have its first test at Kursk.
Golden Journal No. 49: Storm Division provides you with 24 new pieces adding Storm Platoons and additional support weapons to Kursk: Burning Tigers. You can use them in Burning Tigers (where the Storm Division appears in three scenarios) and in the five new scenarios included in the Journal.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Escape Room Tycoon
description:
Escape Room Tycoon beckons you into the captivating world of escape room management, where every decision you make shapes your destiny.

In this thrilling medium-weight euro game, you don the hat of an aspiring escape room entrepreneur. Your mission? To craft, curate, and conquer the escape room scene. The game unfolds over four intense rounds, each mirroring a distinct business season. Your expertise, represented by cubes, is your currency for action. Spend it wisely to construct ingenious rooms, adorn your venue with exclusive enhancements, host unforgettable events like graduations and birthday parties, hire talented Game Masters, run promotional campaigns, and strive for the most glowing reviews. But beware, as the rounds progress, the cost of your ambitions escalates. Keep a vigilant eye on your rivals' strategies while advancing your own to secure your place at the pinnacle.

Escape Room Tycoon is the world's first board game that immerses you in the riveting realm of escape room management. It's your chance to become the ultimate escape room mogul.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Endangered: American Red Wolf Scenario
description:
The march of humankind’s progress threatens the survival of the American Red Wolf. It's up to you and your team to save them!

Work with your fellow conservationists to save American Red Wolves, challenging negative stereotypes, and gaining the support of landowners.

Historically, thousands of American red wolves were found throughout the southeastern United States. Today, only a small population exists in the wilds of North Carolina, making them the most endangered wolf in the world. Their fragile population has grown through a carefully managed breeding program. In 1987, they were reintroduced in Alligator River National Wildlife Refuge. As of 2023, red wolves are still released there, though their population area now expands outside the refuge. Because a large portion of their recovery area encompasses privately owned land, local support is critical for coexistence.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Dice, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Dossiers Criminels: Les Fantômes de Brandonsbury
description:
A collaborative game made in France!
Two tourists are found dead in their room at the Gothic Tales, an allegedly haunted hotel in the small British village of Brandonsbury. Stir up the past to uncover the truth.

Features
Comprehensive criminal case file
Escape game mechanics
A collaborative game made in France
Includes eyewitness accounts, forensic analysis, press articles, crime scene photos, audio content...

INCARNEZ UN DETECTIVE : Le Gothic Thales, hôtel tristement célèbre du village de Brandonsbury, est le théâtre d’un nouvel évènement mystérieux. Rétablissez la chronologie des événements, dressez la liste des suspects et enquêtez afin de faire la lumière sur cette affaire.
UN DOSSIER CRIMINEL COMPLET : Contient des témoignages, des exemplaires des journaux, un plan du village , et une multitude d’autres documents…
DES MÉCANIQUES D’ESCAPE GAME : Résolvez des énigmes pour déverrouiller 4 enveloppes contenant des preuves supplémentaires.
DETECTIVE 2.0 : Un accès à internet est nécessaire afin d’accéder à un blog, pirater des identifiants et consulter un site web. Aussi, plusieurs niveaux d’indices sont disponibles sur le site afin que vous ne restiez pas bloqué.
UN JEU COLLABORATIF MADE IN FRANCE : 1-6 joueurs, à partir de 14 ans, 1h30 - 2 heures de jeu
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Mint Privateers
description:
Engage in maritime warefare, deliver goods, and rid the sea of pirates. Or become a pirate and plunder the riches for yourself. In Mint Privateers, players must earn enough fame to win.

Players can earn fame by sailing around the Caribbean to capture or sink ships, raid merchants, deliver in demand goods, buy ships, deposit gold at their home port, or complete objectives on story cards. In order to perform these actions, players will need to assign their crew dice properly. It is also important to upgrade your ship or complete scuttlebutt cards which reward you with game changing effects.

The nature of Mint Privateers being a sandbox game allows players to play the way they want to. Players can play like a merchant by dodging pirate ships and delivering goods to ports that need them. Or players can play more like a pirate and attack nation ships and merchant tokens. Or perhaps players start off playing like a merchant and turn to piracy midgame. Players even have opportunities to be pardon for their crimes of piracy to return to a merchant lifestyle of play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Barcelona: Sagrada Familia Tiles
description:
During setup, replace all level 4 Sagrada Família tiles with the 4 Tiles from this promo. They work the same as the regular level 4 Sagrada Família tiles, but instead of the regular bonuses, they have certain actions depicted on them. Those actions must be resolved immediately after acquiring a Sagrada Família tile, just like the regular bonuses. In case you were to obtain one of the Promo tiles, because of someone placing Citizens on your Intersection, that player’s turn must be suspended, and you must resolve the bonus action first.

Description of all the possible bonus actions is listed below:

Perform a regular Build a Public Service action with a discount of 1 coin. You get all the benefits from that tile in the same way as if you bought that tile using an action. Remember that you are not allowed to possess more than 1 Public Service of the same type.
Perform a regular Tram action with a discount of 1 cloth.
Perform a regular Take a Modernism Project action with a discount of 1 coin.
Perform a regular Improve a Modernism Project action with a discount of 1 cloth.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Emperor Jellix Promo
description:
Emperor Jellix is a promotional character for Krosmaster: Arena.

"High Licktion
Four Kings and an Emperor? The Jellix monarchy really is quite complex…"

This promo figure has the ability to summon any three Jelly tokens from the different varieties of Jelly characters from Season 5 "Wild Realms".
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Proliferation
description:
Proliferation: The Game of Nuclear Strategy is a tabletop card game designed for 2 to 9 players. Build your country’s economy, conduct secret missions, and sabotage adversaries all while stockpiling nuclear weapons to ensure that your country is the most powerful on Earth - or at least the last one standing.

Choose your player country - Play as one of the following nuclear powers: China, France, India, Israel, North Korea, Pakistan, Russia, the UK, or the USA. Each starts with base economic resources, five lives, and unique abilities.

Expand your economy - Purchase Infrastructure Cards to increase your Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and strengthen your economic position.

Engage in diplomacy - Make deals and forge bonds with other countries by engaging in Trade Agreements and employing Alliances.

Sabotage adversaries - Play Mission Cards to dismantle your opponent's nuclear arsenal, ruin their economy, and foil their plans. Deploy Peacekeepers to maintain the balance of power.

Attempt to Consolidate Power - There are two ways to win. Claim victory by meeting all of your country's Consolidation Conditions, or...

Survive all out nuclear war - Build your arsenal of Nukes, use a Defense System to protect against enemy attacks, and withstand the consequences of nuclear winter. Lose all of your lives and you are eliminated from the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Shoju's Duty
description:
Duty above all else. This is the creed of the Scorpion, and it has served them well. Slowly gathering power over the decades, the Emerald Empire's most deceptive clan found themselves in the spotlight of Otosan Uchi. Now, as the Empire is thrown into chaos, it falls to the ever-loyal Scorpion Clan to hold Rokugan together, and once more put themselves in the spotlight.

Shoju's Duty is the final Dynasty Pack in the "Inheritance" cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, bringing the cycle to a dramatic conclusion with its focus on disguised characters and lending new weight to the Bushi and Courtier traits. Combined with a new version of the Scorpion Clan Champion, this will be a pack not to be missed!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hellespont (411/410 AV. J.-C.)
description:
Hellespont (411-410 BC) is the inserted game of VaeVictis magazine #139 and 4th game in the VaeVictis series The Peloponnesian War. It focuses on the victorious campaigns of Alcibiades against the Spartan Mindarus.

In three great battles, Cynossema, Abydos and Cyzicus, the Athenian fleet takes back control of the straits and Alcibiades proclaims his status as saviour.

Hellespont is characteristic of an particularly equally balanced situation and ratio of power, even if the Athenian commanders have more experience than their rivals. The operations are principally naval and give the Persian army the opportunity to intervene directly. Hellespont uses the great mechanisms of the series with some adjustments necessary for its specific scale”.

Game scale : One strength point (SP) represents, according to the type of units, 1 trireme, 100 cavaliers, 150 hoplites, 200 peltasts and acontistes (light infantry) or 250 archers and rebels.
One game turn represents one months of real time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Les Maréchaux V: Moreau 1800
description:
The Marshals V is a complete game from the series The Marshals. It covers the campaigns of spring and autumn 1800 that took place in Germany from the crossing of the Rhine to the banks of the Inn. General Moreau, whose successes would later be overshadowed by those of Napoleon in Italy and the improbable victory of Marengo, is at the heart of this initiative. In six months, he manages to force back Kray’s and then the Archduke John’s Austrians from France’s doorstep to the confines of Bavaria with the culminating decisive battle at Hohenlinden.
The three first scenarios describe Moreau’s entrance into the campaign with the hazardous crossing of the Rhine, the gruelling march through the Black Forest, the concentration of the three army corps from Sainte Suzanne, Saint Cyr and the army reserve coinciding with the flank assault from Lecourbe’s corps, the counterattack of the Austrians under Kray, and the undecided battles of Engen, Molßkirch and Biberach. The French must demonstrate their resourcefulness as Napoleon grows impatient and demands reinforcements from Moreau to support his offensive in Italy. Time is running out; advance in the direction of Ulm before the order arrives for the troops to depart toward the south.
The three scenarios that follow relate the events in Bavaria that lead up to the clash at Hohenlinden in deplorable weather. The Archduke John, propelled by his ardour, decides to assault the French at Munich while the latter marched toward them. This battle of encounter is decisive, contrary to the battles of the spring. With this victory, Moreau succeeds in bringing to an end this war with Austria.
With this new volume, the series The Marshals continues to evolve. The experience of playing numerous games as well as the requests of fans of the series led to minor adaptations integrated into the general rules as well as the addition of new optional rules. Will you fare as well as General Moreau and succeed in competing with Napoleon’s rising star?

The game includes :
• A recto-verso 59x41 cm map board
• 216 recto-verso, pre-cut counters and markers
• A rule book and six scenarios
• A game help in colour

Units: divisions, 1 SS = 1000 fantassins, 500 cavaliers or 1 artillery battery
10 kilometres between two zones
Turns represent one day
Complexity: 6 out of 10
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: Harmonies: 4 Nature's Spirit pawns and 1 exclusive Nature's Spirit card
description:
Special promotional set containing a completely new nature spirit in the form of a T-Rex and 4 transparent nature spirit pawns that can be used to replace those from the basic version of the game.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Wargamer's Guide to Midway
description:
The Wargamer's Guide to Midway collection of what Avalon Hill considered to be its best articles and variants. Several analysis and tactical articles appear. Two of the scenario expansions from the General are reprinted. The 36 pages thick guide contains the following items:

The Midway Thesis, page 3-7, by H. Totten & D. Greenwood. An in depth article on the mechanics and tactics of Midway. Serious analysis of play and probability on the battle board.
Midway Re-worked, page 7, by V. Madeja. A small suggestion changing operations on the search board.
One Ship Invasion Fleet?, page 8, by C.B. Pelto. Replaces the Atago “invasion ship” with transports, and their escorts.
Midway, Bismark Style, page 8, by P. Harlem. Surface battle resolution based on the 1962 version of Bismark
Chicken Yamamoto, page 9, by L. Clarck. Adds the Aleutians task force for use in the main battle. Includes destroyers (for those who use them), and a redress of the invasion fleet.
What Next?: Destroyers at Midway, page 9, by S. Marston. Adds destroyer rules. Destroyers appear in divisions, similar to those Jutland.
Gross Injustice to Submarines, page 10, by R. Gutenkust. Replaces the B-17 rule with submarines. (At least submarines got hits.) Assumes original invasion ship rule.
Midway and the British Home Fleet, page 11-12, by R.D. Thurston. Rules for British ships in Midway and other variants of the Midway system. Amusing introductory text.
Mass or Maneuver? American Plans for Midway, page 12, by M. Gray. Explorers search board considerations from the American point of view.
The rest of the Alphabet, page 13, by L. Berger. Follow-up of 'Mass or Maneuver?", strategy as seen by the Japanese commander.
Back to Nuts and Bolts, page 14-15, by H. Totten. Reflections on search board play, strategy and tactics.
Midway – Unstereotyped, page 15-16, by M. Saviet. A few suggestions for Midway detail and play balance (but greatly muddies the waters, detractong from Midway's clear, simple rules).
Midway – Equilibrated, page 17, by C.G. Nelson. More play balance variants in retort of Mark Saviet's Midway-Unstereotyped.
Midway – Series Replay, page 18-21, by M. Uhl & D. Greenwood. A series replay by Mike Uhl and Don Greenwood, using full tournament and optional rules, as well as the official rule changes which appeared in the Wargamers Guide (this guide).
Leyte Gulf, page 22-27, by R.D. Harmon. A scenario based on the desperate operation by the Japanese Navy. Introduces kamikazes for use against the massive American fleet.
Pacific Theatre via Midway, page 28-33, by A. Moon. A rewrite of the Coral Sea variant with four new scenarios. Cleans up minor problems from the version in the General.
The Battle for Australia, page 34, by R. Sarti. A hypothetical scenario using nearly all the ships from main game and the Pacific Theatre via Midway.
Official Rules Changes & Optional Rule, page 36.
Midway - Questions and Answers, page 36.
Midway - Articles Appearing in The General, page 36.

Counters:
page 26: Leyte Gulf variant

Gameboards:
page 27: Leyte Gulf variant
page 33: Coral Sea variant board

Hit Record Sheets:
page 29: Coral Sea variant - Coral Sea scenario
page 30: Coral Sea variant - Eastern Solomons scenario
page 31: Coral Sea variant - Santa Cruz scenario
page 32: Coral Sea variant - Guadalcanal scenario
page 35: Midway Hit Record sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation
